name: The President
description:
A roll & move style game based on the US Presidential election process.

Players move around a large board attempting to win a party nomination, then gain newspaper, TV and radio promotions, then finally win a "majority" of states which is defined as 15 or 20 states depending on the number of players (there are no electoral votes in this game).

Most of the play centres on the use of a "percentage" die which is a six sided die with 20%, 30%, 40%, 70%, 80% and 90% printed on it. Nominations and states are won by rolling more than 50% on this die with no other modifiers (i.e. there is always a 50-50 chance of winning or losing a given contest). Every time the die is rolled, the player must stake money to do so, and if a loss occurs the money is lost to the bank or opponent when challenging for an already-owned state.

Players have a supply of map markers equal to the number of states they must win (15 or 20) and must leave one of these as a deposit with the bank if they take out a loan; therefore it is impossible to win with loans outstanding but as loans are repaid with interest it is necessary to defeat opponents who challenge for your states and therefore end up paying you the money they stake.

Interestingly the game defines the Aleutian Islands as one of the "states" to be won, in addition to the 50 usual states (the District of Columbia is not treated as a state, unlike many similar games).
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Q!nto
description: Think five. Five colors, five shapes, five minutes to learn. In Q!nto you add tiles from your 5 tile hand to the grid in a single line. All lines must contain tiles in which the colors are either all the same OR all different, AND the shapes are also either all the same or all different. There are also shape-specific Wild tiles which can represent any color, and color-specific Wild tiles which can represent any shape. In addition, there are 2 Q!nto tiles which can represent any shape in any color. Instead of adding tiles to the grid, a player may use his/her turn to swap tiles from his/her hand for already played Wild tiles, as long as they work in that position. Q!nto can be played a few different ways. In Q!nto Classic, players keep score. Q!nto Plus allows players to count valid diagonal lines of 3 or more tiles. In Q!nto Light, the tiles are divided evenly among the players who then race to get rid of all their tiles.

name: Letterbingo
description: Letterbingo is a simple word game. Players roll 6 dice at once with 1 letter on every side. During a certain time span each player writes down as many words as possible which can be formed by the letters of the dice results. The Hoppe logo can be used as any letter. The player who has formed most words wins the game. Alternatively players can agree to grant 1 point to the player who calls the first correct word after the dice roll. Then play until the first player has reached 10 points. That player wins the game then.

name: WWI: The Tug of War
description:
In WWI: The Tug of War, two players compete in a very light, fast-playing game of dice-rolling and battle, as all the major countries involved in “The Great War” are slowly and inexorably tugged into the conflict. Game turns quickly become combat events, with the outcome in doubt and usually dependent on the entrance of the United States into the fray, ending a long and bitter back-and-forth stalemate.

The active player always rolls two red dice. He/she will roll one or more four white dice along with the two red dice after he has cards with at least three dice icons, rounded down, in front of him. At the start of the game each player has a card with a half-die in front of him. He or she will therefore need to get cards into the war with two-and-a-half more dice icons to be able to roll a total of three dice (two red and one white).

If the red dice total matches the entry number of one of your nation’s cards it enters the war and its dice icon(s) will be available to you on your next turn. To score a hit (i.e., win a battle), you must roll a 5 or 6 on a white die. If you do, move the token one space toward you on the Tug of War track. Move the token to your "Win" space and you win the game.

Sometimes you'll have to choose between the red and white dice result, and when one player can roll all six dice, the end of game sequence will trigger.

Not my best work. I wish I could get BGG to remove it.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, World War I

name: Big Time Hoops
description:
Big Time Hoops is a fast-playing, card-based simulation of professional basketball for two players. To recreate the flow of the game and remove "housekeeping" altogether, the game eschews individual cards for basketball players and focuses exclusively on the major action elements of the sport.

In general, you'll hold a hand of three cards, most of which will be offensive in nature. You'll play one of them, choosing to pass the ball or drive to the basket; each card will result in a shot attempt with a varying degree of success. Then you'll roll a die. If the shot fails, the card states which side gets the rebound. (Yes, three-point shots are in the game.)

Your opponent can play a defensive card, and when used wisely he'll steal a pass, block a shot or foul your shooter.

Simulating realistic scoring requires a delicate balance in a sport where each team averages 100 points per game. Rest assured that you'll find it here, as the number of two-pointers, three-pointers and foul shots will be very close to their actual real-life averages each and every game.

Playable in an hour, Big Time Hoops will provide all the fun and excitement of real pro basketball -- without the high ticket prices!

name: scheiße
description:
scheiße is a card game, played with a standard 32-card French deck.

Starting the first round with one card, the second with to cards and so on up to 7 cards each player. Then it goes down to one card again.
After examining your cards you state the number of tricks you will win. The number of statet tricks is not allowed to be equal to the number of cards dealt to each player. So at least one player has to be wrong.

Each round each player puts down one card.
Colour order is Clubs -> Spades -> Hearts -> Diamonds. If you have the starting colour of a round, you have to play it. Otherwise you're free to play whichever colour you want.

In turns with just one card per player, you have to place your card, such that everybody else can see it, and state if you make the trick, according to the other cards you see.

You will recieve 10 points if you statet your number of tricks correctly and 2 additionaly points for each trick, otherwise you will loose 2 points.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Dr. Fizzy's Fabulous Floats
description:
Part of the "Smell-o-rama!" collection.

Quench your thirst for fun with Dr. Fizzy’s Fabulous Floats.

A cola-scented game filled to the brim with fast moves and keen sight. It’s a soda-licious, refreshingly fun card game for everyone. Open the game and mmm-mmm, the cola scent brings everyone to the table.

Quickly gather the ingredients to build your ice cream float - a frosty mug, ice cream, soda and a spoon or straw. Now sit back and…

Yuck! Goat soap and mashed potato - instead of ice cream and soda?

You were a little too quick with the ingredients you picked, and now you’re the one in a fizz! Start again and think to sweeten your drink. Make three fabulous floats and win.

Kids and adults alike savor the fun game features - The Float, The Flip, Slap a Card, and Slap a Cap. (Even better, reasoning is a required ingredient.) Dr. Fizzy’s Fabulous Floats is deliciously good fun for the whole family.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Obsession for Murder
description:
You and the other players are patrons at a strange and bizarre open market. You are all are here to indulge in your obsessions, whether they be artifacts, guns, or art. Vendors display their wares of various shapes, sizes, and legality. You wander up and down the aisles, searching for that which strikes your fancy. Suddenly, you hear a scream, and see the body. Somebody has been murdered! There is a killer on the loose, and they will stop at nothing to get their hands on what they want.

In Obsession for Murder, players have secret identities that determine what types of Items that player wants to collect. One of these identities is The Murderer, who tries to eliminate the other players and be the only player left. The other players, while attempting to collect their chosen items, can also accuse each other of being The Murderer. If they are correct, they win. If they are wrong, the accused is lynched, and play continues until the Murderer wins or is correctly accused.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wolverine
description:
Publisher's Description:
Defeat Sabretooth! One evening, while Jubilee thinks she is alone in the X-Mansion, she hears strange noises coming from the surrounding woods. She sets out alone to investigate, even though she knows it might be dangerous. Fortunately for here, Wolverine is secretly keeping an eye on her. Sabretooth's scent is in the air. . .

Wolverine was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is a roll-and-move game where players use two tokens, representing Wolverine and Jubilee, along a track. Each player in turn "rolls" the electronic die and moves one or the other token along the track, following any instructions on the space where they land. Spaces may move players forward or back or cause them to lose or gain a turn. Since players have two tokens, a small element of strategy is introduced in deciding which token is more advantageous to move with each roll. First player to reach the finish with both tokens wins.

name: Gundam Force Starter Set 1
description: Once a land of peace, Neotopia is now a world filled with danger where only those with the courage to be victorious will prosper. The SD collectible card game gives you the chance to command an army of Superior Defenders to conquer these dangers in an epic struggle for planetary supremacy! Armed with a deck of cards, each player's objective is to win battles among SD Gundams and advance their fleet of battleships into enemy territory, ultimately conquering their opponents base.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Where's Wally? Memory Card Game
description:
Where's Wally is a bright and colourful memory card game featuring the elusive Wally, Wenda, Woof and Wizard Whitebeard. The aim of the game is to collect the most matching pairs by remembering where the cards are located once turned upside down but watch out for the mischievous Odlow, he's out to mess things up! Place all the cards facing down on a table or floor so that no card is touching another. The youngest player goes first by turning over 2 cards at random. If they match identically, ie 2 satchels, that player takes them and may then turn over 2 more cards. If the pairs don't match, they are turned face down again and the next player continues in the same way. If any player turns over an ODLAW card that player must shout ODLAW!, take the ODLAW card, then shuffle all the remaining cards in play so that no one can remember the position of any cards. The player who collects the most matching pairs wins!

This memory game contains 54 Jumbo cards with easy rules for even the youngest of players. The game helps children with memory skills and learning how to take turns, along with developing the ability to play together. The game is for 1 or more players and suitable for children 3 years and up.

name: Key to the Front Door
description: Key to the Front Door is an educational game aimed primarily at school children to help teach money management. Players take turns rolling dice and moving around a board in Monopoly fashion. The board spaces allow players to purchase "needs" or "wants", to add funds to savings, to splurge on a vacation, to buy or sell at garage sales, or to spend or earn money in a variety of other ways. The winner is either the first player to furnish his apartment with all his "needs" or the last player to go broke.

name: Glory That Was Greece, Volume 1: The Battles of Leuctra and Mantineia
description:
The Glory that was Greece is a series of games depicting several battles from the ancient world. The games are introductory in level and complexity, designed for fun and competitive play, while also depicting the history of the battles. This first volume in the series depicts the battles of Leuctra and Mantineia.

After the Peloponnesian War, Sparta was the uncontested military leader of the Greek poleis. For almost three decades the Spartans were considered nearly invincible in an open field battle due to the strength and tactical organization of their hoplites.

Beginning in 378 BC a coalition of cities from the northern part of Greece, led by Athens and Thebes, began to challenge Spartan power and for a short period of time, under the leadership of two great generals, Pelopidas and Epaminondas, the small city of Thebes achieved a lasting place in ancient history, making the acropolis of their city (called Cadmea and for a long time subject to the control of a Spartan garrison) a sort of paladin of freedom against Lacedaemonian power.

The game’s battles of volume 1 in the series, Leuctra and Mantineia, depict the rise and fall of this short "empire", serving as an eulogy to one of the greatest military leaders of all time, Epaminondas.

name: Kajunga
description:
Welcome to Kajunga, An adventuress game which combines fast decision making, clever resource management and bold risk taking! In this game you are the survivors on a lost island, racing down on a path full of surprises on your way to the rescue boat and Black-Beards legendary treasure.
Mystery, adventure and team play in a rich tropical atmosphere for the young and young at heart.

How To Play?
The aim of the game is to be the ﬁrst to reach the treasure / boat at the end of the track. Each player picks a character to play with and rolls the dice. He then moves according to the number on the dice. The player can change the number of moves by using his money coins. The player must perform the action dictated by the square he landed on.

After the ﬁrst two rounds of the game the black pirate joins in. He is the one who owns the treasure. During the game he chases all the players, sending them back on their tracks and laying traps. The player can try to defend himself against the pirates by using the objects he can collect on the track.

The game includes many surprises and unpredictable twists. Most of the moves are determined by the players who hold in their hand diamonds, gold coins, gold keys. Also traps and deals with other opponents can easily change the course of the game.

name: Q's Race to the Top
description:
Find out what parents and kids around the country are raving about! In this interactive board game, children help Q race to the top of his tree house while answering questions and performing fun actions. Practice social skills and better behavior with questions designed to promote feeling identification and communication, manners, creative thinking, balance and coordination.


YOU cards asks kids questions about themselves and start great conversations.



Q Cards allow kids to advise the monkey on what he should do in various social scenarios, thereby letting them practice good manners, coping skills, and adopting a positive attitude.



DO cards consist of fun (and sometimes silly!) physical challenges to improve balance and coordination, laying the foundation for emotional and mental self-control.


The player rolls the dice and chooses a card in order to advance up the board First. one who makes it to the top the fastest, wins.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: his & hers
description: A trivia game where a team of men play against a team of women. A spinner shows whether the current team will answer a "his", "hers", or "his & hers" question, or do a "his & hers" challenge. A team correctly answering a question about the opposite sex, get more points than for questions about their own. Challenges have both teams competing to see who can list more items for the category given.

name: The Nebula From Hell
description:
The Nebula From Hell is a party game for people who enjoy laughing at and being laughed at by others. It is meant to be played with crazy, sarcastic people who enjoy making fun of other people. This game has it all. Nebulas, dragons, canoes, bombs, wizards, stars, action cards, bonus cards, physical challenges, and boats. What more could you want from a game?

This game actually hates you. Most games try to entertain you. This game wants to crush your skull. Just when you think you're winning, you'll be sucked into the Nebula and spit out with nothing. Game over. Go home, loser.

Who is this game for? For those who prey on the weak and laugh and jeer as they kick them while they're down. If you have any emotional response at all in life, this game probably isn't for you.

Easy to play. Hard to win. On your turn, drawn an action card. Read it out loud. Do what it says. That's it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: West Indies (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Skeleton in the Cupboard
description:
Watch the skeleton bones appear as you race against the ghost to uncover hidden treasures. A haunting game of suspense for all ages. The object of the game is to collect as many treasure items as possible before the skeleton is completed in the centre of the board.

Players roll two dice (one red and one white) and move around the house collecting cards from each cupboard in the different rooms. The face down cards can be treasures of varying values or special power cards or one of the eight parts of the skeleton.

In addition to the moving their own pawn (according to the number on the red die) players also move the ghost (according to the white die). With the ghost they can attempt to steal cards from the other players!

The winner is the player with the most treasure points when all eight skeleton pieces have been fitted together.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Math Dice Chase
description: One part hot potato, one part math — Math Dice Chase tests your ability to quickly do mental math. Game players must sit in a circle. Two players each roll a pair of dice, then multiply the two numbers shown on the dice. Hurry to roll the dice, call out your answer, and pass the dice before you get caught with a second pair in front of you! Once you get caught with two pairs of dice, you are eliminated. The final two players enter a modified round of play, and the person who can multiply the quickest wins.

name: Tip Tower
description:
This is a Jenga clone with a die. It consists of plastic bricks in three colors which are stacked up in rows of three, each row containing all three colors.

The active player rolls a die. According to the result s/he now must:
- pull out one brick in a specific color and stack it onto the top of the tower
- pull out a brick of any color and stack it on top of the tower
- pull out two bricks of any color and stack them on top of the tower
- Lose a turn.

When the tower falls over, the last player to have placed a brick before who didn't topple it is the winner.

name: Journey on the Amazon Game
description:
How wonderful it will be to take a journey down the Amazon with your friends Bromley (parrot fish) and Coltica (parrot). You will learn about the actual animals that live in the Amazon. Along the way, see special places such as Bromley's Flower Garden, the Spectacled Caiman Lodge, Pygmy Owl Singing Classes and the Kapok Hop Dance Camp.

Objective:
Be the first player to move your game peice on the path through the Amazon to the coast.

To play, first you have to construct the gameboard, which is basically a large, 12-piece floor jigsaw puzzle that measures 20" x 30" when put together. Once the board is constructed, it displays a winding path through the jungle or Amazon. Over a dozen animals specific to the region featured are included several times on the game spaces that make up the path. A deck of cards featuring the animals is included and players take turns drawing cards and moving to the animal shown. The first player to reach the end of the path, wins!

Extra cards add even more fun to the game like certain animals that make you move back spaces, short cut cards, quick sand (lose turn) cards, Piranha cards (switch places with another player), and more.

The instruction booklet includes a bit of info on each animal on the board and cards, so kids can even learn a bit while playing this game. Cards include labels of the animal names in both English and Spanish. For 2-6 players.

name: Monopoly: Arizona edition
description: The dramatic landscape, extraordinary ancient artifacts, unusual wildlife and phenomenal wonders of nature form the backdrop of "The Grand Canyon State". The Monopoly Brand proudly introduces a game for everyone who treasures America's 48th state.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: RobotiCS strategic card game
description:
You've come to the arena stunning with its dominance over the city. There is no building, which would overshadow it. From the battlefield to the ceiling it is crowded with spectators dressed in the color of the programmer clans. The inner ring is simple. Floor filled with sand, the only apparent thing is the ellipse, which always turns on the power shield protecting the spectators. There are usually fighting two teams in such battlefield, at least one robot at each side led by a programmer. Will you become one of those famous programmers who shout commands to their robots and fight for the title? Build your deck so you can use your strategy toward winning in tournaments of RobotiCS.

RobotiCS strategic deck-building card game offers to every player an opportunity to become a Programmer of majestic robots which are fighting with each other in a battle duels. Every player starts with the same starting deck and develops it and its strategy during the game (= deck-building system).

RobotiCS card game is about strategic combat of α-Robots supported by their Programmers. α-Robots are loosing their hit and shield points, whilst Programmers are receiving exhaustion counters. During the game players are combining their powerful abilities. But α-Robots can carry only one piece of each equipment, therefore players need to purchase β-Robots. The game can be influenced by Action and Reaction Program cards with immediate effects. There are being arisen many strategies during the games such as discard, healing, multiplication of β-Robots, agro, etc. 203 cards guarantee always countless different combinations.

RobotiCS card game is optimized for 2 players. But families or friends could play it also in a group of 3 or 4 players. Easy understandable structure of game play is based on building the strategy of the deck during the game. It enables the player to react to the tactical actions of his/her opponent. It is not needed to purchase additional booster packs to construct decks before play (strongest advantage in comparison to trading card games). All strategic potential of the game is in one box. The game offers many different tactical situations to solve, free-time fun with friends and possibility to meet people during organized play events.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Goosebumps Web of Mystery Gigantik Game
description:
Enter if you dare! There is a mystery to be solved. Someone has stolen ans hidden one of the Mystery Goosebumps Disks. Become one of your favorite Goosebumps characters and try to solve which of the Mystery Goosebumps Disks is missing and you win the game. Beware you're in for a scare!

Mix up all 20 disks, choose a Goosebumps Mystery Disk and place the 19 remaining (number side facing down) in center of playmat. Place chosen Goosebumps Mystery Disk in the box (number side facing down) and close the lid.
Each player gets a checklist sheet from checklist pad to check off the Goosebumps Mystery Disks they have collected. The first player to correctly guess which Goosebumps Mystery Disk is hidden inside the box wins.
You take a Goosebumps Mystery Disk when you land on Spider Spaces. You'll put a check mark next to that Goosebumps Mystery Disk on your checklist.
There are also Switch List Spaces, Tombstone Spaces and R.I.P. Spaces. Tombstone spaces are safe, nothing happens. Some might have roll again on them. R.I.P. Spaces on it, you lose a turn. Switch List Spaces, the player switches their checklist with player of their choice and marks down the Mystery Disks they've already collected.
categories: Children's Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Kito
description:
A promotional card game from a Belgian utility to promote saving energy.

Players in turn draw a card an than play a card to save energy, stop other people from doing so, or to get rid of cards that hinder them.

Game play is similar to Mille Bornes

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Death Star
description:
From the box: "The Death Star was the Empire's ultimate weapon: a moon-sized space station with the ability to destroy an entire planet. But the Emperor and Imperial officers like Grand Moff Tarkin underestimated the tenacity of the Rebel Alliance, who refused to bow to this technological terror."

Star Wars: Box Busters is a series of small plastic dioramas. The dioramas fold into a small plastic cube known as a Battle Cube. Each player needs their own Battle Cube to play.

The basic game uses a simple battle-dice mechanic. Advanced rules incorporate a Battle Cube's unique special abilities.

The Death Star Battle Cube is a "super cube" that is twice as large as the other Battle Cubes. It also comes with four special attacks (instead of the normal three). The diorama portrays TIE fighters, an X-Wing, a Y-Wing and the Millennium Falcon battling around the Death Star.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Slammy
description:
Slammy is a party game from Tactic. Every player has a hammer with suction cups, that can be used to pick up cards with. There will be a number of face-up cards on the board. Then turn one more card from the deck. Then all players should try to pick all the cards with the same symbol from the board with there hammer. After the deck of cards is gone, the player with most cards is the winner.

Similar to: Hit the Hat

name: London IQ: The Trivia Game For Londoners
description: This one-of-a-kind game offers diehard Londoners the chance to prove their insider status while exploring the city in a whole new way. Multiple-choice questions quiz players’ knowledge of London’s historic nooks and crannies, hotspots, and favorite pastimes. Correct answers are awarded IQ points, and the team with the highest IQ wins! From the Tower to the Tube, Annabel’s to Ye Olde Cheshire Cheese, London IQ promises hours of fun and makes a great gift for any resident or fan of this beloved world capital.

name: Yoidore Medusa
description:
User summary
酔いどれメデューサ (Yoidore Medusa) means "Drunken Medusa" in English. Artwork in the game comes from public domain works.

In the game of Drunken Medusa, players are assigned a role card as a Medusa or a Medusa Hunter, but they may not look at their own role card; only other players can see it.

You hold your card in front of your forehead so that everyone except yourself can see your identity, and look down the table. Then the game begins. You may look at any other players' role card, but once you happened to see a Medusa card, you must leave the game with a dying scream.

The game ends in 20 or 30 seconds, depending on the number of players. At the end of the game, surviving players may discuss, then vote a player who they think to be a Medusa. The Medusa Hunters win if the most voted player is a Medusa, otherwise the Medusas win.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーにはメデューサカードまたは、メデューサを退治しにきたハンターカードのどちらかが1枚配られます。しかし自分のカードを見ることは出来ません。ゲーム中、自分のカードを他の人に向けて遊びます（インディアンポーカー形式）。ゲームはリアルタイムで進行し、他の人のカードを自由に見ることが出来ますが、メデューサカードを視認してしまうと石化してそのプレイヤーは即座に脱落します。30秒のプレイ時間後、全員カードを伏せて、生き残ったプレイヤーの一斉投票を行います。最多票を集めた人が処刑されます。処刑された人がメデューサであればハンター達の勝利、逆にハンターが処刑されればメデューサ達の勝利です。

name: Qube: 70's – Hipahtava 70-luku
description:
Trivia game about the 1970s. Has 500 different questions in 5 categories and is small enough to carry with you when traveling.

Players are dealt a handful of category cards, and on their turn they may play one of them and try to answer a question from that category. If they answer correctly, they may discard that card; otherwise, it's returned to their hand. The first one to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

name: Grandma's Geographical Game
description:
This is one of the seven "Grandma's" games issued by Milton Bradley in the early 1900s. This one, as the title suggests, is a geographical quiz. It consists of 119 plain cards each with a single numbered question, and a booklet with directions and all the answers.

Players are given at least six cards each, and take turns flipping over a single one of their cards. If that player cannot answer the question, he passes it to his left, and each player in turn has the opportunity to answer. Whichever player answers correctly keeps the card, and the player with the most cards wins.

While the box is undated, Alex G. Malloy dates it to 1910 (American Games, 1999, p. 35, #1081), and the questions confirm the period: Cuba is shown as an independent nation, while the largest Empire in the world is still Russia, with its capital at Petrograd. Interestingly for an American game, 11 of the questions (almost 1/10) deal with what is now Canada.

name: Eduskuntapeli
description:
Eduskuntapeli is roll and move game from the sixties, where your want your party members to be elected to Finnish parliament (Eduskunta).

On your turn you roll the die and move one of your party members in the game board. Some areas in the game board are electoral districts, where you collect random amount of votes (1000-4000). 10000 votes gets you candidate to be elected to parliament. When you have gathered at least 10000 votes for your current candidate, you can move him/her to parliament. Then you can start moving and collecting votes for your next party member. Every player has 16 candidates.

Of course there are some squares where you have to pick up a random event card. Event cards might give you votes or get your party member to be elected as a minister or get the whole government to be moved to some parliamentary committee.

Other way to get your party member to government is to move one of your already elected members of parliament to government squares on the board. You want you MP's into government because then you get extra votes.
Game ends when one player gets all his/her party members elected to parliament. Winner is the player with most votes, when the game ends.

name: Artworld: The Card Game
description: Welcome to the Artworld: The Card Game! Artworld is playable as art critic who rates art, and art collectors who buy art through auction and sell the art to the critic for money and points. To win, the art collectors must excel in reading the critic's taste and predicting what kind of art the critic would like, and what kind of art the critic would dislike. It is also possible for art collectors to make a set of artworks (3, 5 or 7 cards) that have same traits, in order to get points. First collector who reaches 10 million dollars or 5 points wins the game.

name: Animal Snacks
description:
The hungry animals have gathered around for snack time! It's up to you to feed these animals and quiet their rumbling tummies. The active player rolls the die and moves the corresponding animals from one player to the next until they roll a snack. Then all players get to feed their animals! The first player to feed all of their snack to the animals wins the game.

Pure luck game to teach the youngest players on following rules, matching (colors and animal pieces) and taking turns.

name: Skylanders Action Game
description:
Work together as Skylanders and visit the four islands to collect Battle Dice for your final battle against the evil Kaos!
Each player controls one of the four characters, but you face the island challenges together.
Collect as many dice as you can by successfully completing the challenges, and you'll stand a better chance of defeating Kaos.
If you come out on top after the Final Battle, you all win the game together.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: In the Hole
description:
The game consists of four plastic coated two sided course maps on which there is a table to record the results, 4 pens for this purpose and a special board in which are set ten spinners. Each spinner is marked for the purpose it is to be used e.g. "Tee Shot", "Putting", "Greenside Bunker" etc. and each is at the centre of a number of possible results.
Starting with the appropriate Tee Shot spinner, one spins it, notes the result, which tells one where one has got to and what situation one is in, thus defining which spinner is to be used next. This continues until one finishes the hole when the result is recorded and so one, hole after hole.
The winner is as in golf.

name: Johtolanka
description:
There has been a robbery! Search the board to find where in Helsinki the robber has hidden the stolen hands of the railway station clock. Get to know the attractions of the Finnish Capital and their location while learning how to read map and coordinates.

This game consists of 24 different cases to investigate. On their turn, the players roll two dice to determine the coordinates and move their pawn on the board accordingly. Each location on board has one of four different symbols which determines the action the player is allowed to perform to collect clues about the location of the stolen item. The game ends when one of the players guesses the location of the item correctly.

name: Win-Win
description:
A small cooperative card game for two players. The objective of the game for two players is to win exactly same amount of treasure (with different card sets) at the end of the game by bidding with their cards. they should discuss a strategy prior to the game, and should not discuss that in the process.

The game was released as a gift to customers of Gémklub, a Hungarian board game publisher and reseller/shop as a commemoration of the 30th anniversary of its existence.

name: Giraf'Fun
description:
In Giraf'Fun players try to eat as many fruits with their giraffe until it's full and its neck is long. But watch out, or your giraffe has to go to the toilet and lose some of the fruits. The one who first makes it home with a full belly and a long neck wins.

Players take turn rolling the die and moving their giraffe. When they move onto a berry they can eat it. But if you roll toilet paper your giraffe has to go to the toilet and loose one of his berries again. Once a giraffe is full he must go to his own home. The one who first reaches his house wins the game.

name: Dikke Lul 10 Bier
description:
Guessing and bluffing game.
Players gets sets of cards numbered 1 to 5. First player is the bartender. Every player puts down a card blind. Bartender tries to guess how many beers are pictured on the cards on the table. Next player says higher, lower or equal. On higher the player calling that calls a higher number and play continues with the player next to him. On lower and equal cards are turn over and total is checked. If total is right caller gets a coin otherwise he looses one. Then a new round starts. After five rounds players pick up there used cards again. Rounds continue until one player reaches 4 coins. He wins. If played with real coins het gets all the coins in play to buy a beer.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Feuerwehrmann Sam: Wasser marsch!
description: In Feuerwehrmann Sam: Wasser marsch!, based on the television character "Feuerwehrmann Sam", players need to mend the broken firehose in order to save the inhabitants of Pontypandy. To do this, though, they need to find the matching parts that lie hidden underneath the firetruck Jupiter, and whoever finds the most matches wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mitt sagospel
description:
The game can be played in a couple of different ways. 1) Draw tiles with illustrations from wellknown tales and songs from the bag and combine to your very own story or song, told in the same order as the tiles you draw. Best story wins. 2) Memory version: find the cards belonging to each tale or song, sort them in the correct order and tell it/sing it.

Ett spel för alla som gillar sagor och att fantisera! Dra bildkorten med illustrationer från välkända sagor och visböcker ur sagopåsen och fantisera sen ihop en ny saga. Sagan ska berättas i den ordning som bilderna plockas fram. Spännande, tokigt eller roligt, spelaren med bästa minnet och fantasi vinner. Innehåller 3 olika spelvarianter.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Set Collection, Singing

name: The Krilling Field
description:
Description from the publisher:

In the Krilling Field, up to four players compete against each other to become heir to the Blubbulous Throne and ruler of the ocean. It's a card game played on a randomized map, where the object is to discover defensive outposts and fortify them against the onslaught of the Deep Krillord.

Protecting your home is a wonderful thing to do with friends, but King Blubbulous only has one throne to give to a heroic whale, so you might as well sabotage your fellow whales along the way. There are over 60 abilities and organisms to aid you in your quest, from swordfish assassins to deep-ocean ectoplasm. Or, if being a hero isn't your style, aid the Krillord in usurping the Blubbulous throne and bring terror to the Krilling Field in his evil name.

The Krilling Field takes between thirty minutes and one hour to play, and every game has completely rearranged terrain, with players altering the shape, size, and order of the playing field at will. While it is possible (but unlikely) to exhaust the multitude of unique locations in a single game, it takes most players between five and ten playthroughs to discover every card.

The Krilling Field includes:

Five Player Whales
Twelve Blubbulous Pearls
Eight Non-Player Ocean Denizens
Fifty-six Munition Cards
Thirty-six Ocean Cards
Thirty Deeps Cards
One Ocean Indicator Card
One Rule Book
categories: Animals, Card Game, Exploration, Humor, Nautical

name: King John
description:
King John is having a party with lots of guests. Unfortunately he's terrible at remembering the faces of those guests, so he needs your help.

In the game King John, four cards are revealed at the table each round, with each card showing some combination of characters. The active player shows these cards to all, then hides them and rolls dice to determine whether the other players are searching for a particular character or the character who appears most (or least) often on the cards.

name: Battle of the Sexes: Additional New Cards
description: 650 additional new cards to the basic game.

name: Geopolitics Boardgame
description:
Description from the publisher:

Geopolitics Boardgame is a game of geopolitical dispute where the newly emerging World Order Cold War and bipolarity, presents a scenario of unimultipolarity, in which a single superpower interacts with significant regional powers (which tend to oppose the main power), and With numerous secondary powers (which, in general, align with the Superpower and oppose the regional power of its geographical area). The significant strength of some regional powers, concerned with the US struggle for global hegemony, has been hampering this purpose.

One of the players will represent the USA and the other regional powers (Russia, China, United Kingdom or Germany and Brazil), each with its own advantages and peculiarities, that will fight for the balanced world, each one trying to conquer to challenge the unimultippality through the war , Trade, politics, diplomacy and technological progression.

After extensive research in the military area, 50 technological advances of 5 different types (infrastructure, naval, air, land and missile) were incorporated.

With a double board, magnificent meeples of military units (army, special forces, APC, tank, artillery, corvette, destroyer, frigate, cruiser, submarine, transport ship, helicopter, fighter, bomber, tactical air transport, SAM, industrial complex ) Plus tokens including cruise missile and nuclear missile, hundreds of cards, custom dice, sideboards, playmates.

Geopolitics Boardgame has a structure of game in rounds with 3 phases:

I) In the Strategy Phase, players choose one of the 8 strategy cards (leadership, diplomacy, politics, production, commercial, war, technology, geopolitics), each of which has an initiative value that determines the order of the game. Each card has a primary skill that will be used exclusively by the player who chooses the card and a secondary skill that can be used by other players at the necessary costs.

II) In the Action Phase, players will be able to use the chosen strategy card, activate territories on the board to move troops and diplomatic leaders to raise influence and resources, build military units, recruit and / or fund weapons and militants from rebel and terrorist groups, To celebrate political-military alliances, to attack opponents, to conclude trade agreements, to propose voting of treaties in international organizations, to research technological advances and to use action letters.

III) In the Status phase players can qualify for 1 geopolitical goals per round, including pipeline control, technological development, military and diplomatic goals.

Win the game that finishes first 10 goals.

The "designer notes" in the rule book humbly recognize the inspiration of such games as Twilight Imperium, Twillight Struggle, Imperial 2030 and Supremacy.
categories: Economic, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Negotiation, Political, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Pippi
description: Collect puzzle pieces to you Pippi-puzzle. When you land on your color, grab a puzzle piece. You can also get pieces by making your best funny face, sing a Pippi song, or pantomiming animals. But beware

name: Burst Out Laughing Gas
description: Each card in a deck displays three pairs of phrases. The final word or words of the first phrase of a pair is/are the same as the first word or words of the second phrase of the pair. Within a time limit, a player tries to get his teammates to guess all six phrases and all three "combolutions" of two phrases on the card. Collect a token for each guessed combolution. The first team to twenty tokens wins.

name: Wer wird Bibel-Quizionär?
description: Its a game about the bible. There are a lot of questions from the New and the old Testament. Who is the first on the aim?

name: Mosquito Madness
description:
Mosquito Madness is a bug-slapping matching game. Players frantically race to find the nine mosquitoes pictured on their card. The goal is to be the first to collect all your mosquitoes.

There are 72 mosquito discs for all players to see. Each player has a collecting board for the mosquitoes they need to find. Once all players turn over their collecting board, the madness begins as they frantically race to find their matching mosquitoes and slap the disc before another player grabs that mosquito.

The game is typically played in 5 rounds before declaring a winner.

name: King of Thieves
description:
Welcome to King of Thieves, a non-collectible bluffing card game of tomb robbing in which competing thieves gamble their reputation to steal treasure from heavily guarded tombs!

Aim of the Game
In King of Thieves players represent enterprising tomb-robbers battling to be crowned king of all the thieves! Thieves gamble their reputation with every expedition into the dangerous tombs that litter the land of Al-Shirkuh, but this gamble is worth the risk as great riches can be found. However, every thief must be wary as every tomb has a guardian to protect its riches; either a dangerous creature, or a fiendish trap to snare the unwary!

How do you win?
The game ends when one player has managed to collect 10 Treasure tokens from plundering tombs. If all tombs have been plundered the game ends and the player with the most Treasure tokens wins. If there is a tie for Treasure tokens then the player with the most Treasure and Reputation wins the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Pirate's Life (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
Description from the designer:

This set adds a total of 12 new cards. They were designed when Dark Ages was released and intended to add a few new concepts, to add upon well-established concepts (example: rewarding variety like Menagerie) and to add cards that encouraged more interaction between players (see Ravisher for example).

Many of these cards are playable on their own but shine when paired with certain cards and become impressive combo pieces.

This set is meant to be played mixed with any of the official Dominion expansions.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Fingering
description: In this game you get a card with 5 rings depicted. The rings are initially upside-down on the playing field. Now it's up to you to find your own rings. To do this, spin the arrow and look at the rings on the playing field. Pay attention when it's your opponents turn, so that you'll see where your rings are!

name: Lilla Jönssonligan
description:
Description from the publisher:

Steal as many collectible cards (called filmisar) as possible from the cornflakes factory in Wall-Entuna. If you're lucky, you'll manage to get into the factory four times in one turn.

Each collectible card are worth a certain amount of points. In order for the points to be valid, you must get the card to your home base.

When the whistle blows, the player with the most points wins.







Lilla Jönssonligan was created by Brio, and Tonefilm. Released the same year as the movie Lilla Jönssonligan in Sweden in 1996.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Matching Card Game
description:
The Matching Card Game is a card game designed for children.

The card deck consists of 27 picture cards. The cards are divided up by 9 scenes of 3 different cards each. The 3 cards of each scene form a larger picture scene.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect all 3 cards of a scene.

At the start of the game, each player is dealt 3 cards, and the remaining pile becomes the stock. The dealer draws a card from the stock, and then passes one of their cards to the left, so they are only left with 3 cards. The next player then chooses a card to discard to the next player, etc. The last player discards their card to a discard pile, and then the dealer starts the next round by drawing the top card from the stock again.

Play continues until a player collects all 3 cards from a scene, and displays it on the table, winning the game.

This game closely resembles a Children's Card game called My Ship Sails played with a traditional deck(s) of cards, but players try to match suits in that game instead of picture scenes.

This game was included in a 6 pack of Children's Card Games by Bicycle Playing Cards.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: マゴス (Magos)
description:
User summary
マゴス (Magos) is a dice game for one or two people. Battle each other with magic and defeat your opponent.

Each player is a wizard. Choose 5 spells and beat down the opponent's wizard. When it comes to your turn, use 1 to 4 dice and assign and use spells.

The game includes four 6-sided dice, cubes for Hit Points and Mana, and 33 illustrated spell cards. The game is also offered in a Print & Play (PnP) version and online.

name: Caballeros y Castillos
description:
"This game simulates on a board the continuous territorial wars that devastated Europe during the Middle Ages, seasoned with a little magic. In the game you must wisely manage your resources (gold, wood, iron) so that you can form armies and equip them in the armouries and stables that you will have to build.

If you do it well, you will conquer new territories with new resources. Castles, Wizards, Archers and Knights are also part of the game; use them with a good strategy and remember that there can only be one King, so...."

—description from the publisher

Each player controls a capital and starts the game with 2 infantry units, 1 archer, 1 garrison counter and 1 armoury.

The game lasts a maximum of 24 turns.

In his turn, each player can do the following actions in any order he wants:


Collect production from all their territories
Acquire constructions
Purchase units
Move your units around the board


Combat is resolved using custom six-sided dice.

To win you have to conquer a number of capitals or territories depending on the number of players. If all 24 turns are exhausted and no player has won, then the winner will be the player with the most territories and capitals.

name: Tactical Playing Cards
description:
A deck of 108 "Tactical Playing Cards" (or T-cards) to use when playing an ASL scenario.

Each player receives at game start a number of cards from the deck and may play them whenever he sees fit during a scenario. Each card has an effect printed on it, just apply what is written on the card and discard the card. The total number of cards in the deck is sufficiently large to ensure that no hand will be similar to another. The rules underpinning T-cards' use are as concise as possible.
categories: Fan Expansion, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: K3 dans studio
description:
Do you dream about being a little K3 danser, joining Marthe, Klaasje and Hanne on stage? It's a lot harder then it seems! You have to learn a lot of dance moves! Do you want to try out? Try to get on the stage first and show of your moves, show that you know all the routings. Learn the dancemoves on the cards on the rotating stage and try to do them in sequence without faults but look out, the further you get the more moves you need to learn.And just when you think you mastered the routing someone might switch up the moves. Welcome to the K3 dance studio.

A roll and move, take that, memory dance game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Les Légendaires: Le jeu – L'antre du gardien
description:
Boardgame adapted from the very popular French comic "Les Légendaires".

Run a extraordinary adventure with magic and fantasy.
Being one of their favorite character (Danaël, Jadina, Gryf, Shimy or Razzia), the players will have to cooperate in order to solve the challenges given by the Guardian and save Alysia's World.
—description from the publisher (translated)

Vivez une extraordinaire aventure grâce à ce jeu de plateau mêlant la magie et le fantastique ! En incarnant Danaël, Jadina, Gryf, Shimy ou Razzia, chaque joueur doit collaborer avec les autres pour résoudre les défis lancés par le Gardien et sauver le monde d'Alysia.
—description from the publisher (French)

name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Chaos vs Tech
description:
Welcome to world of Dark Legacy. A world ruled by the ruthless battle mage by the name of the Kaiser. The planet of Titan is at war. The Kaiser is bringing the world to its knees. This is a war where anything is possible and anyone can become a legend. It is here where your journey begins.

Dark Legacy is a unique strategy game that mixes the best elements of campaign-style adventure games and tactical customizable card games and wraps them all up into an in-depth sci-fi/fantasy story. In Dark Legacy, players are no longer bystanders of the battle, they get to be part of it as a war general within one of six different factions. With the unique and various weapons, armor, and relics, that a player can equip themselves with, players can become whomever they imagine themselves to be.

In Dark Legacy, it is the players objective to destroy their opponents and their armies, by building a deck of magic spells that no one can withstand, rolling the d20 in their favor and strategically summoning their army to be the strongest. Just like in a real battle you will have to anticipate the probability of the unexpected. Don't make choices too hastily for they may be the demise of your army and yourself.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Forests: Fairy Tales (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Adds tiles featuring elements from a number of fan-made expansions based on children's fairy tales.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Cambridge
description:
Description from the designer:

Cambridge is a 2 player abstract territory control strategy game.

In Cambridge, players play opposing generals exploring a new environment, deploying units into villages and strongholds, and then finally conquering their opponent in a battle of wits and strategy.

Cambridge was a 2018 9-Card Nanogame Contest entry - Cambridge contest entry WIP thread.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Under Cover
description:
Under Cover is a light-hearted game of spy-collecting -- a set collection game, with a theme of intrigue. Manage your resources, in order to build your spy network. The more spies you have in the field, the higher your score. Put the most spies into active duty to win the game! Build your team of spies, informants, sleeper cells, whistle-blowers, and double-agents to infiltrate enemy targets. Steal agents from your opponents, call upon underworld contacts. Do what you must to ensure your forces are stronger than your enemy's.

As a set collecting game, the obvious goal of Under Cover is to gather the largest sets of cards -- larger sets of cards laid down scores more points. But, each card also has a special ability, which allows you to do special actions, such as drawing more cards, stealing from opponents' sets, forcing your opponent to draw cards (to put them over the hand limit), or taking cards from the "Veterans Pile" (the set of cards that have already been spent for their special abilities). On your turn, you may draw cards, then you'll decide how you want to act. You can lay down cards to score points, discard cards to make room in your hand, or play special ability cards. All of the cards are special ability cards. Under Cover even requires special ability cards to pick up a set from the table, so you can add to it.

Each game begins with a simple shuffling of the deck. That's all the setup required, so the 15-30 minute play time is entirely playing. The cleanup at the end of the game is just as simple: put the cards back in the box. The Solo mode of the game is just as simple as the multiple-player mode, but it becomes more of a puzzle game -- instead of trying to get more points than the other player(s), you have to score large enough sets in ALL the color groups. That is impossible without using the abilities on the cards in a tactical manner.

Under Cover has strategic choices to make, but it's a quick game that sets up in moments, and can be put away in seconds. It can be taught in five minutes, but can be played over and over -- with a quick shuffle, you're back in the game. It works as a great filler, or a fun game to play with your kids.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Memory Game
description:
Memory magic total have five series, Fruit, Journey to west, Ocean, Animals, Vehicles. Shuffle all chips backside face up evenly, then each player take turns to try to flip over two chips, if two images do not match, flip back and it's turn for next player. If they do match, you win the two chips . The player who gets most chips wins.

Each series has cute illustrations with english name for the child when doing memory training, parents can help them pick some favorite things such as animals, fruits, or vehicle, expand some common vocabulary pronuciation in English.

Let's enjoy Memory Magic!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Dicey Waters
description:
Avast ye lubbers and gather round, lend an ear... Dicey Waters be a dice rolling game of Pirate Shenanigans with a push your luck element, Mates!

Become the captain of a fine vessel of salty seadogs in treacherous pirate waters. Roll dice according to ye crew size, to gain booty, plunder the hoard of other pirate captains and deliver a broadside to ye rivals.

This Print and Play game uses only 2 sheets of parchment to print, plus dice...arrr matey ye'll be needin' plenty o' dice!

This game requires...
1 sheet of player cards (the first sheet, cap'n)
4 standard 6 sided dice per player
11 custom dice (stickers on the second sheet, matey)
Nerves of steel.

—description from the designer

name: Suomalainen Pesis taktiikkapeli
description:
Suomalainen Pesis taktiikkapeli (translates as: Finnish Baseball tactical game) came out in 1977. This two player game "simulates" Finnish national sport Pesäpallo (Baseball) which was developed in 1910's from American Baseball and old Finnish ball and bat sport called Kuningaspallo (King Ball).

This boardgame is a two player game and uses card based "rock-paper-scissors" -system to simulate the various situations and decisions in the field. Player of Fielding team and player of Batting team have their own cards to choose. The cards (usually three different) player can use depend on the situation on the field (ie. how many runners are on the field etc.).

Depending which action (card) batting team player chooses and which one fielding team player chooses determines the outcome of that particular throw of the ball. Both cards are revealed simultaneously. Batting player might have get called "out" or the players on the field might have been called "out" or batting player succeeded to advance from base to another or even managed to score a run.

—user summary

Rules stipulate that the game can be played by either two players or two teams of players, but since the tasks of individual team members are not defined any further than that in the rules, this is essentially just a 2-player game.

Box front carries an endorsement by the then executive director of the Finnish Baseball League, Markku Pullinen.

Patent pending no. 772736

name: Murder à la carte: Pyramids of Giza
description:
Egypt 1924. Two years ago the tomb of Tutankhamun was uncovered and caused a worldwide sensation. Now an even more remarkable discovery has been made with the opening of the tomb of king Men-her-Ra by Sir John Willard and Felix Bleibner.

But within days, Tragedy has truck, Sir John dies suddenly of heart failure and two weeks later Blebibner too is dead, struck down by blood poisoning. When the latter's nephew, Rupert Bleibner, commits suicide in New York, the rumors of a curse reach hysteria.

Hercule Poirot summons the surviving members of the expedition to Cairo, where he will uncover the truth. Are these three deaths connected? Are there supernatural forces at work? Or is one of his dinner guests a murder.

—description from the publisher

name: ラビングペンギン (Loving Penguin)
description:
User summary
ラビングペンギン (Loving Penguin) is a card game from Japan. The theme is competing penguins giving presents, and it uses the 'butting' mechanic. Butting is the Japanese term for when equal values cancel out and the next player down wins a contest.

ペンギンたちのプレゼント争奪戦をテーマにしたバッティングゲームです。
publishers: Colorful Spiele (カラフルシュピーレ)

name: Die Unglaubliche Geschichte, wie die Mücke zum Elefanten wurde
description: Naughty, self-ironic and wonderfully simple: Who has not ever wondered how the hell a tiny mosquito can turn into a giant elephant? An anatomical miracle? Magic? An amazingly plausible answer is Ina Hattenhauer with her cheeky illustrations. Almost at the flip of a dime, she transforms the insect into a pachyderm. An unusually bold and super-easy card game. Bring big and small to the game table. Simple card game for in between. With funny and cheeky illustrations. Here's how it works: Each player gets 7 cards in his hand. In turn, the players discard the cards. But beware: you can only take one equal or higher card. If you can not, draw a card. Who has no more cards in the end, wins.

name: Super Dungeon: Hanzo
description:
This hero brings potent new abilities to a player's experience in the entire Super Dungeon line. Hanzo may be used to supplement any warband's strengths or to lead a group of adventurers through the dungeons!

Hanzo has been called many things over his long and storied life...master, teacher, monster, and traitor. Still, the Moon Princess has refused to denounce her "wayward hunting hawk." Some say this is for previous unknown services, others because he still serves the Moon Court.

—description from the publisher

name: Civ Dice
description:
Civ Dice is an interactive fast-playing Civilization style dice game for 2-4 players - playtime 30-60 minutes.

The object of the game is to train Armies, recruit Spies, elect Leaders, acquire Land, discover Technology, build Cities and Wonders - all with the goal of being the first to score 7 points.

In the game you select dice from a common pool together with your personal die, re-roll and/or manipulate the die face values and use them to pay for your builds, thereby growing your empire's abilities and scoring victory points.

—description from the designer

name: Sielujen sympatiaa
description:
A fun party game about everything you thought that you and your friends thinks in the same way.

One of the players reads the question from the card. Team members have 30 seconds to try to guess what the partners will answer and write the same answer separately.

The group that received the most correct answers can move the button forward on the board.

The winner is the team that reaches 30 points before the others.
categories: Humor, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Hispánica: La Conquista de la Historia de España
description:
In Hispánica, The Conquest of the History of Spain, there are battles, conquests, betrayals, pacts, knowledge tests and many more emotions. Share your passion for history, have fun and learn with more than 220 characters and historical facts that, from prehistory to the Constitution of 1978, will be parading during the game.
Is a game of strategy and knowledge that brings together characters and historical facts and offers players the possibility of conquering Spain.

With 128 characters, 64 relevant events and more than a thousand historical references, Hispanica intends to give a turn of the screw to historical games to bring them closer to those interested in History and the gamers. It is a game designed to learn from scratch or reaffirm previous knowledge of History.

—description from the designer

name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Early Launch Kit
description:
5x Copies of Robinson Crusoe
1x Demo Copy of Robinson Crusoe
2x new Scenario "Poachers"
8x Fifth Character "Sailor"
8x Spyglass
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Medito
description:
Medito contains a collection of two player games: Kono, Citadel
(= Asalto) , Bar and Pass.
There are 4 different boards, a dice and red and blue playing pieces.

name: Clever Spielen: Das kleine Einmaleins
description:
"2, 4, 6 ... -Who knows the multiplication table and puts on fast and correctly?"

This game is about laying out the little multiplayer in the right order and placing all your cards first.
To do this, the 100 cards are shuffled and 6 cards are distributed to each player. The remaining cards are used face down as a draw pile. Whoever is the first to open a series from the small multiplication table with one of his cards, begins. Now the players have to complete (or start) in turn this (or another) row by laying their cards suitably. If a player does not have a matching card, he must draw a card from the draw pile and possibly can use it. Then it's the turn of the next player.

—user summary

name: Nació Popular
description: This game includes four variants, ranging from a rock-paper-scissors game using cards to a classic memory game. At the end of each game, a "hugs die" is thrown, and the winner gives a type of hug according to the die result.

name: HexaGol
description:
A football game for 2 players, where each hexagon is a player of a team. The objective of the game is to score goals using your cunning and strategy.

This is a fast-paced game, pocket-sized, ideal in any occasion and playable in almost any environment.

The game contains 20 hexagons, 10 for each team in blue and red, and 1 wooden token representing the ball. Each character has special abilities, conditioning the way they move, or the way they are allowed to move the ball.

Some characters are able to move the ball long distances, others may jump above other players, there's even the option to climb on top of other players.. Come on ref! That's got to be a foul!


Es un juego de futbol para dos personas donde cada hexágono es un jugador del equipo. El objetivo es hacerle goles a tu contrincante con estrategias a corto plazo.

El juego es rapido, y pequeño (tamaño bolsillo) ideal para llevarlo a cualquier tipo de ocasión y jugar en espacios muy reducidos.

El juego consta de 20 Hexágonos, 10 del equipo azul y 10 del equipo rojo, y una ficha de madera que representará la pelota. Cada uno de los personajes tiene habilidades distintas, ya sea en la forma que se mueve el personaje (ósea el hexágono) o la forma en que mueven la pelota (la ficha).

Algunos tendrán la posibilidad de lanzar la pelota a distancia, otros saltar por encima de los demás jugadores, e incluso hay uno que tiene la opción de subirse encima de los otros jugadores para quitarles la pelota - "Eso es full referí!!".
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Yeti or Not!
description:
Become a true scholar of crypto-count-ology!

Gnomes, mermaids, dragons, the Loch Ness monster, and more... Yeti has invited all of his friends over for a game of hide and seek - And he wants you to join in on the fun.

But beware... It's going to take a keen eye and a quick mind to keep up with this crowd of notoriously unfindable friends...

Lay out the 8 double-sided Find Boards in a 3 x 3 grid around the scoring board and then place the 9 numbered Yetis onto the scoring board.

Ready to put your seeking skills to the test? - Flip over one of the Unfindables cards and - Quick! - Everyone must search fast to figure out how many times that Unfindable is repeated throughout all 8 of the Find Boards.

Once you find an answer, move fast to snatch up the matching Yeti. Whoever grabs the correct Yeti first wins a point. Whoever has the most points after all the cards have been played wins the game!

Easy to learn yet challenging for the whole family - Yeti or Not, you're in for an intense adventure.

—description from the publisher

name: Kabura: The Card Game
description:
Kabura The Card Game is a strategic collectible card game. It is played by two players and the goal of the game is to discard all of your cards as fast as possible, while not letting your opponent to discard his. Use special abilities and spell cards, take advantage of the game's rules, manipulate your opponent, summon mystical beasts, demons, and cute strawberries, and use logical thinking to take control of the game and defeat your opponent.

Kabura The Card Game merges the digital version and physical version of the game into one so that players won't have to choose between playing online or with friends IRL. They will now be able to do both... and you guessed it... with the same deck of cards. While playing KABURA you will no longer need two versions of your deck, the deck you have online will be the same deck you have in your hands.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Deduction, Number, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Quizzen und Buzzern: Allgemeinwissen
description:
Who knows the right answer? Who's the first to push the buzzer? This Quiz-Game tests your general knowledge.

Here's how it works:
A player reads out the question. The other players try to give the correct answer. Who knows the answer, hits the buzzer and answers. The person who has answered most questions correctly, wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Quizzen und Buzzern: Popquiz
description:
Who knows the right answer and is quick-witted? Who's the first to push the buzzer? This quiz-game tests your knowledge about pop music.

Here's how it works:
A player reads out the question. The other players try to give the correct answer. The person who knows the answer, hits the buzzer and answers. The one who has answered most questions correctly, wins.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Imagebooks Publishers bv, moses. Verlag GmbH

name: Science Ninja Cowboy
description:
Science Ninja Cowboy is an action-packed card game where you and your friends face off in a no-holds-barred battle to the death!

Each player starts with five cards in their hand, and five cards face down in front of them as lives. You take turns drawing and playing cards, and battle through each round until the only player left with lives wins the game.

You can attack each other’s lives with a plethora of weapons, protect your own with hidden counters, and place each other in random life-threatening situations until only one of you is left standing.
Tension builds each round as alliances form, revenge is taken, and players move one step closer to their inevitable victory or demise!

—description from the designer

name: Den Store Danmarksquiz
description:
A trivia game about Denmark. You decide if you want few or many choices, or no choices, getting more points for harder options.

—user summary

name: Royal Order
description:
The Royal Order takes place in an alternate past where the struggle of the People and the Crown are at odds for dominance. You our either aligned with one or the other, you may sabotage a round just for the greater good of your alliance. Players will have to make choices to be deceptive or recognized, not all players will be on the same side or have the same end goal.

HOW TO PLAY...

Each player is dealt one Alliance Card which will be kept secret for a total of five rounds
Each player is the given three Support Cards, lose support, lose the game
Each player is then dealt two Order Cards and the game begins
A player has three options on their turn:
1. Take one Support Card from the tabletop, this cannot be challenged at any time
2. Initiate Imprisonment at the cost of eight Support Cards, eliminating another player
3. Use the action of an Order Card, which is then replaced and shuffled into the deck

THE KING
can gain two support each turn
THE QUEEN
can block the artist
THE HEIR
can use four support to imprison another player
THE BARONESS
can inherit all support cards from an eliminated player
THE BANKER
can block the heir
THE ARTIST
can steal one support from another player

Each of the six different Order Cards has an appropriate action, you can take this action upon your turn or deceive your opponents into thinking you have a card you do not. Get caught in a lie and you are imprisoned placing one of your Order Cards face up in front of you, not to be replaced. Once both your Order Cards are face up, you are imprisoned and out of the game. The winner of the game is the last one standing or has the most Support Cards once all have been acquired, the winner keeps a Support Card to show their victory. After five rounds the Alliance Cards are revealed--the winner is the group with the most wins.
—description from the designer
mechanics: Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: King's Keys deck
description:
The King’s Keys deck takes a new look at playing cards. While standard decks are 4x13 (4 suits and 13 ranks), the King’s Keys deck uses a 4x4x4 logic. Each card in the 64 card deck has a Number (1, 2, 3, or 4), an Item (Key, Axe, Shield or Coin) and a Kingdom Color (Yellow Sun, Red Mountains, Green Forest or Blue Ocean).
The deck plays a variety of games for players at all skill levels. Some rules are included with the deck but most are on the website. Players are also encouraged to try inventing new games of their own.

name: Arcade Inc
description:
A card game where in the players attempt to build the most successful arcade by building new machines and drawing in people from the community. they can also sabotage the other players machines by placing them out of order.

On the players turn they can either play a machine/upgrade into their arcade. Or they can place a meeple from the community onto an existing machine/upgrade.

Out of order/repaired cards can be played at anytime to effect machines in play.

When the first player has 6 machines in their arcade the game is over and a meeple count determines the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

name: Hotel 13
description: Six youngsters, a hotel and a confidential room 13. An exciting search full drama, love, humor... and dark secrets. In this exciting play you proceed on the search for the mystery of room 13... In the different rooms of the hotel her tracks collect in the form of black and white little cube stones which help you to master your cube duties in room 13. Who masters all duties as a first, wins.

name: Butts Up
description:
Move your feet to get a seat!

It’s a fun, active game! Fess up (or brag!) about things you’ve done, stuff you like and things you wish! All players but one sit in a chair, while one player stands in the middle and reads one of the prompts from the device, such as “Butts Up if you have gone zip lining.” If that applies to you, get up and race to another chair someone has vacated! The player left without a chair is the new one in the middle! When a person becomes the middleman, they take a rubber ring (included). When all rings have been handed out, the game ends and the person with the fewest rings wins.

There are two game modes in the electronic device: finished phrases and open-ended ones you can fill in! For 3 or more players.

—description from the publisher

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex – Adeptus Custodes
description:
The Adeptus Custodes are the Emperor’s personal guard. For ten thousand years they have stood sentinel over the Master of Mankind and defended the gates of his palace. Yet now the Emperor’s blades are unsheathed. Biochemically fashioned from infancy to function as supreme tacticians, combatants and bodyguards, they are death incarnate to those who oppose the Emperor’s will. Each Custodian is sublimely skilled, their talents and abilities to the Space Marines what those transhuman warriors are to unaugmented Imperial soldiery. The Ten Thousand walk the stars in numbers not seen since the Great Crusade, and woe betide those who stand in their way.

Codex: Adeptus Custodes contains a wealth of background and rules – the definitive book for Adeptus Custodes collectors. Within this 80-page hardback, you’ll find:

- Brotherhood of the Demigods: the history of the Adeptus Custodes, from their formation as the Legio Custodes to their increased visibility and wider role in the campaign against Chaos since the Great Rift;
- Detailed descriptions of their deployment during the Horus Heresy, the civil war ten thousand years ago that tore the Imperium in twain, along with details of their role protecting the Emperor’s Golden Throne;
- Shadows and Alchemy: the process by which Adeptus Custodes are created. along with details of their defence of Terra including an overview of the palace itself;
- Rise of the Primarch: an overview of the Gathering Storm, a series of events that saw the Ultramarines Primarch Roboute Guilliman restored to glory and the Adeptus Custodes being sent to aid the Indomitus Crusade;
- A Host of Heroes: the composition of the Adeptus Custodes, and the manner in which they organise themselves for war – far more loosely than other Imperial organisations, but easily as effective;
- Uniforms and Heraldry: examples for 5 shield companies – the Shadowkeepers, the Aquilan Shield, the Dread Host, the Solar Watch and the Emissaries Imperatus;
- The Solar Fastness: while once the invasion of Terra was unthinkable, since the Great Rift things have changed. This section describes the Adeptus Custodes’ defence of the Sol System;
- The Tale of Ten Thousand: a timeline of major events in the Adeptus Custodes’ history;
