- Background and details on each character and unit available to an Adeptus Custodes army;
- A showcase of beautifully painted Citadel miniatures, with example armies featuring everything from individual images of models to battle scenes on terrain.

Rules

Everything you need to get an Adeptus Custodes army primed for games of Warhammer 40,000 is in here:

- 13 datasheets providing rules for every Adeptus Custodes unit and miniature;
- Army abilities reflecting the Adeptus Custodes’ methods of war on the tabletop;
- Armoury of the Adeptus Custodes: wargear both ranged and close-combat for use by the Adeptus Custodes;
- Points values for all miniatures, weapons and wargear for use in Matched Play games;
- Auric Mortalis: rules for Battle-forged armies, including:
- 27 unique Stratagems;
- 6 unique Warlord Traits;
- Relics of Terra: 13 weapons and artefacts available only to Adeptus Custodes;
- 6 unique Tactical Objectives.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Polska: Gra z Historią
description: Family game that mixes travel across Poland with historical events from Poland's history. Players use dice to move on the map or to play cards and the goal is to advance you player marker through significant events and to reach present times.

name: Die Höhle der Löwen
description:
The board game for the German TV show

We are looking for the best innovators and investors - because projects not only have to be assessed, they also have to be sold well! Alternately, the players take on the roles of the candidates and the lions. If it is your turn as a candidate, introduce one of the 50 included projects and try to convince the lions of your business idea. He also has a secret mission to perform that can earn him a bonus. Special events make every deal unique. As soon as the project has been presented, it is the lions' turn.

As in the show, there is now a lot of discussion and haggling, because everyone wants to make the best deals. While the lions want to win as many shares as possible, the candidate is careful to the contrary. Once all the lions have submitted their offers or have spoken the magic words "I'm out!", The candidate has to choose one of the offers or reject all. Now it becomes clear whether the project has been successful. so the shares he gets will decide the winning and the losing. If the candidate has given too many shares, he can also make losses! As soon as each player has the role of the candidate, the game ends and the player with the most money wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Roskis: Soptunnan
description:
Players must open the lid of the garbage can, put in the garbage and try not to let the flies escape. The Garbage can vibrates and throws out those light flies. Game is over when all the flies have escaped. Winner is the one who let least numbers of flies escape.

—user summary

Not to be confused with the Lautapelit.fi Finnish edition of Mountain 53, which came out the same year with the same name.

name: Richard Scarry's Hurray for Huckle!: Liikenne/Trafik/Trafikk
description:
Children's game set in the world of (but with no art by) Richard Scarry. The game board is made up of city block tiles with sidewalk spaces, arranged in a circle and separated by zebra crossings. Players move along the sidewalks and race to complete a lap around the board, observing the results of the spinner and the location of a car to determine when zebra crossings can be passed; the spinner also dictates when the car can be moved.

The titles on the front of the Nordice edition are respectively Finnish, Swedish and Danish/Norwegian.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Best 11 Board Game: Juventus
description:
The first official Juventus football box game!
Buy players, deploy them, challenge whoever you want, manage your team.
The goal of the game is to complete the formation of 11 players, your BEST11.
Play your event cards, surprise your opponents, hire the manager, complete the stage and achieve victory.


Il primo gioco in scatola tutto calcistico ufficiale della Juventus!
Compra i giocatori, schierali, sfida chi vuoi tu, gestisci il tuo team.
Obiettivo del gioco è completare la formazione di 11 giocatori, i tuoi BEST11.
Gioca le tue carte avvenimento, sorprendi i tuoi avversari, ingaggia l'allenatore, completa lo stadio e otterrai la vittoria.

name: Mysteries Of Alchemy
description:
Mysteries of Alchemy is an At Home Mystery. Think of it like an escape room you can do at home! In this game you're searching for hidden clues and puzzles in beautifully created notes from an alchemists' apprentice.

The notes are sent to you by James, the butler of late Bram van Amstel. One of the first professional treasure hunters from the previous century. Try to unravel the puzzles and clues to find the treasure! You can play alone or with friends. You might be really surprised when you finally find the treasure and see what it is.

—description from the publisher

name: Trivia Box: We Love 90s
description:
It's time for some nostalgic, retro fun with the We Love the 90s Trivia Game! Players have to guess whether statements like "Beavis and Butthead launched on VH1 in 1993" are true or false. The person with the most points once all rounds have finished is declared the winner.

Comes with 100's of trivia questions and 20 picture cards.

name: DC HeroClix: Icons Booster Pack
description:
This booster pack contains 4 randomly selected game figures out of 60 in the DC HeroClix: Icons set.

There are two different box art variants with the same random contents.

—user summary
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Risky Deals
description:
The aim of the game is for the players to increase their wealth in the game. The initial money received from the bank, can be invested in stock or one of the 4 companies, with the aim of turning a profit. The winner is the player that had the highest profit throughout.

There are three types of stock in which the players can invest. The three types can be differentiated through the level of Risk/Reward.

There are 4 companies which can be bought by the players. The owners of the companies will earn income from the other players or the bank.

The game is played with two dice. The result of every throw determines the wins and losses. The gains and losses are decided by the value of the dice and the P&L board.

How the P&L board works.

If for example your dice score is 5, you will receive from the bank 600 dollars for each orange share you own, pay to the bank 400 dollars for each green share you own and receive 1000 dollars for each blue share you own. Also you will have to play 2500 dollars to the owner of West Diamond Mining.

If your dice score is 6,7 or 8, beside the gains or losses on the shares you own you also receive from the bank 2500 dollars for each company you own and must invest in a High Risk Deal anything between 2000 dollars and your total worth.

After deciding the amount to be invested in the risky deal you will roll again the dice and If your score is 7 or higher you win twice the amount invested. If the score is lower than 7 you lose half of the invested money.

Risky Deals are very important in the game as it often change the leaders and set the game winners. A player that goes ALL IN in a Risky Deal can triple his or her worth, while only risking to lose half of it.

The players may decide how many rounds a game will last. A 10 rounds game with 4 players lasts about 80 minutes.

—description from the designer

name: Sekskantet Domino
description: Dominoes with tri-coloured hexagonal tiles.

name: Burping Bobby
description: Bobby loves stinky food! Feed him, but watch out – you never know when he’s going to BUUUURRRRP! Real lights and steam will burst from his mouth when he burps! The player with the most points after Bobby burps wins.

name: Parma Calcio Manager
description:
Parma Calcio Manager is a game in which players, in the role of coaches, face off in a series of football matches.

It is the official board game of the Parma Calcio 1913 team

Create your team during the Transfer Market then challenge your opponents: will you play defensively or will you risk everything to find the Goal?
Climb the leaderboard by beating your opponents and managing the unexpected.
Will you be able to win the Championship?

name: Inte för en MILJON
description:
Guess right about how much money the other players want to do stunts of varying degrees of scaryness. You are the winner if you are the one who can best predict what your friends are willing to do!

The active player takes a stunt card and reads aloud "Which is the smallest amount of money I would ..." and then the text on the card. Then the active player chooses one of his player cards, which has the values for free, for a thousand kronor, for ten thousand kronor, for a hundred thousand kronor, for a million kronor or not for a million! Other players should now try to figure out the active player's choice. Everyone who matches the active player's choice will receive a 100,000 note. Then it goes on to the next player who reads a stunt card. The first player to collect 1,000,000 wins.

An example of a question might be "... for a month tell every single person I meet that I'm not from this world?"

name: Moods of the Mad King
description:
Moods of the Mad King: Revised Edition is a micro-game for 2 to 4 players, where the players assume the role of a playwright in the court of The Mad King! The Mad King demands a play to suit his current feelings, but with his ever-changing moods and propensity for beheadings, all the playwrights are stealing secrets from each other and scrambling to gather information from those close to the king in order to create the perfect play!

When playing Moods of the Mad King, each Playwright will try to collect matching sets of genres. The King has 4 Moods, each corresponding to a different genre: Brooding (Drama), Joyous (Comedy), Lamenting (Tragedy), and Devoted (Romance).

You will try to collect Acts of matching genres to complete a set. The more your set matches, the more points you get, and more your set matches the King’s Mood at the end of the game, the more points you get!

Moods of the Mad King: Revised Edition brings major updates to the core game and includes the Muses expansion.

-description from publisher

name: Stubborn as a Mule
description: The 24 'Mule' cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table to form a track. Players roll the dice and move their Pawns along the track. The card you land on is turned over and the instructions followed. The object is to be the first player to reach the last card of the track by an exact count.

name: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990: 4th Edition
description:
Fully revised 4th Edition of COLD WAR3!

Includes:

Rules for combined arms using artillery, armour, mechanised, aircraft and support troops (such as engineers and medical personnel).
Rules for the electronic battlefield, nuclear, biological & chemical battlefield.
Recovering and repairing 'knocked out' vehicles; building bridges, defenses, trenches and repairing defenses.
Fighting in buildings, built up areas and in a contaminated environment.
Rules for paratroopers, reconnaissance elements, assaults and close-combat (even assaulting tanks if you are so inclined).
Rules for conducting air support missions, air-to-air combat, air-to-ground attacks, helicopter operations, anti-aircraft artillery and missiles.
Rules are also included for morale and their effect on our little model soldiers. Wounds and recovery of those (using medics if you've paid for them!)
Rules for various armours such as Chobham, Dorchester, ERA bricks, BAR armour and all manner of nasties thsat can defeat those armours including 2nd generation (Top-Attack.Tandem Warhead) ATGM's such as Improved TOW II and the Russian Svir missiles.
This new version includes the following New TO&E's:
A complete BAOR (British Army of the Rhine)/NORTHTAG battlegroup for the 14th/20th Royal Hussars and Royal Green Jackets; including Chieftain Mk.V Tanks, Fv432 APC, Abbot and M-109 Self-Propelled Guns, RAMC Medical Teams, 9th/12th Lancers Reccee Teams (in Scorpion AFV), Swingfire ATGM, Blowpipe and Rapier SAM and 661st Squadron Army Air Corps in Lynx HELARM and the Royal Air Force with shiny Harrier GR.III and Lightning Ground Attack Aircraft.
Soviet Forces: 3rd Shock Armies 10th Guards Armoured Divisions: with T80u and T-64bv tanks, BMP-1 and BMP-2 APC's, BTR-70's and of course a whole plethora of artillery such as the BM-21, BM-27, 2s1 and 2s3 artillery, anti-aircraft artillery such as the Tunguska, ZSU-23-4 and the ZSU-23-2 AA guns, the Soviet Air Force flying Su-25 Frogfoots and even Mil-Mi-8 Hip attack helicopters!



Also includes all new color photographs and illustrations.

-description from publisher

name: Den galna kapplöpningen
description:
Paraphrasing from the Swedish rules:
"What is the aim of the game?
To get your horse over the finish line. But, where is the finish line? Well, it can either be the start or the end line.
The direction can change during the race, so the horse in the back could all the sudden be in the lead.
Does it seem mad? Mmm, that's why it is named: The Mad race."

You use a dice, but there are marks on the boards... with extra instructions. There's also a "roulette" for added surprises.
Easy to play, easy to follow... no strategy: it's all about luck and laughter.

name: Pictionary Manía Junior
description:
Pictionary Manía Junior is a fast-paced game for the kids in which a player must draw an object while doing another fun activity and his teammates must guess what does the picture mean.

Game Mechanics:
The drawing and the colors of the category cards indicate: (1) The way in which the artist will try to let the playmates guess the word or concept drawn, and (2) Which word on the card is to be drawn.

Category description:

Normal game option.
The world upside down: draw the object turned upside down.
Opposite hand: draw with your opposite hand.
Eyes that do not see: draw with the eyes covered.
Musical drawings: while you draw, you must hum a song.
On the limp: lift one of the two legs while you draw.


In addition, there are the "Everyone plays" special event boxes.

End of the game:
The game ends when a team reaches the "Winner's Circle" in the center of the board and manages to complete 3 of the 5 category tiles it contains.

—user summary (English)

Pictionary Mania Junior es un trepidante juego para niños en el que un jugador debe dibujar un objeto mientras hace algo divertido y sus compañeros tienen que intentar adivinar lo que significa el dibujo.

Mecánica de juego:
Los dibujos y colores de las tarjetas de categoría indican: (1) La manera cómo el dibujante tratará de que sus compañeros de juego adivinen la palabra o concepto dibujado, y (2) Qué palabra de la tarjeta toca dibujar.

Descripción de categorías:

Opción de juego normal.
El mundo al revés: dibujar el objeto al revés (por ejemplo, una casa con el tejado abajo y el suelo arriba).
Mano contraria: dibujar con la mano contraria.
Ojos que no ven: dibujar con los objetos cerrados.
Dibujos musicales: mientras dibujas, debes tararear una canción.
A la pata coja: levanta una de las dos piernas mientras dibujas.


Además, existen las casillas especiales de "Todos juegan".

Fin de la partida:
El juego finaliza cuando uno de los equipos llega al "Círculo del Ganador" en el centro del tablero y consigue completar 3 de las 5 fichas de categoría que contiene.

—user summary

name: KFC's 4 op een rij
description:
The game contains card in two colors, each color has 4 creatures printed on them, the same creatures for each color. Both colors have 24 cards, each creature has 6 cards in both colors. There are 48 players card, 6 advanced assignments cards and 1 rule card, making a total of 55 cards.

Players pick one of either color (blue or red) and take all cards in that color and shuffle them up. They then take turns playing a card, adding it to the set, either horizontally or vertically, but not diagonally. Their goal is to make a set of 4 cards, either horizontally, vertically or diagonally, of their own color. The type of monster is not important, only that it's your color. This can also be played to get 4 in a row, with the rules unchanged otherwise.

There is an advanced version of the game, this uses the 6 advanced assignment cards, where you have to place your monsters in a specific shape to win. This also includes a "X * monster" card, which means you only win if you get 4 monster (or 5 in the 5-in-a-row variant) in the same row.

This game resembles a paper version of a 4/5-in-a-row type Tic-Tac-Toe game.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

name: BuzzFeed 2000's Ultimate Trivia Game
description:
So you think you know the 2000s?! Play over 400 pop culture trivia questions crammed with phat pictures, sweet trivia, and various game challenges. Relive the hot fashions, dope trends, sick movies, TV, & music! Divide into teams and face challenges like Double or Nothing, Head-To-Head Battles, Drawing, Clue Giving, Image Cards, and more! So, turn on your perfect away message and show everyone your mad 2000s skillz- because it’s never too soon to go back to the start of the new millennium.

—description from the publisher

name: Aurora
description:
The Struggle for Dominance over Space Sector Control.

At start players receive game money which is used to buy buildings represented by tokens and soldiers standees. Before battle in turn sequence starts players can use start money to make their beginning camp and units.

Players also received a mission which by completing it brings player more money for purchasing more soldiers and more buildings.
Every building and every soldier have their own special abilities and unique movement and fire power and range. On players turn, any time during a turn player may buy new units as well as new buildings.

Buildings may be place anywhere on board but units must be placed in headquarters. Forget to say that during setup headquarters must be built. It is suggested to protect HQ with building and units also during setup.

Player then on same turn may activate any and all soldiers standee with up to two actions like move, fire or special actions.
Also any time mission conditions are met, reveal it, take reward and draw new mission card (keep it secret from other player).
Game and triggers in two ways. First by defeating enemy HQ and surviving player takes win. Second way is when one player no longer have money to buy new units and have no units/soldiers in play. That player lose.



Borba za prevlast nad kontrolom sektora svemira.
mechanics: Line of Sight, Movement Template, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Munch adventure
description:
Eat munch, make a figurine and be the first to explore the universe and win.

Board with spaces from start to finish. In turns players roll die and move with their figure by the rolled number. All spaces triggers affect and follow instruction what to do next.
First player to reach finish is winner.

Also company behind game introduce idea to use their Munch cookie.
"Open a pack, grab a Munch, use stretch foil to make your unique figure and win. Winner takes rest of cookies from the pack as reward."



"Pojedi munch, napravi figuricu i prvi istraži svemir i pobedi".
Opis dizajnera.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Tajni agent Izzy
description:
Izzy's task is to keep order and peace in the city and keep his true love Laura from the evil rat Grim De Vit and his helper, the dog Hector, who manage to kidnap her again. The two have help from their naughty followers, the crow Cana and the alligator Gagaligator. Izzy is helped by: the boss, who tells him the news about the movement of the villains, the doe Aida, who loves opera singing, and the canary Ogi, who is there to help with the magic ball".

Game inspired by TV video game of the same name run from 2002 to 2009. Using a board with road from start to finish where one of our agents in game save hostage from villain.
Game use two type of dice. One is for movement from 1 to 5 and special symbol which triggers use of second die.
Second die have depicted vehicles or magical item which allows agents to use special shortcut useable only for that kind of vehicle/item.
First one to reach finish is the winner i.e. their agent defeat a villain and rescue hostage. That is game end.



Задатак Изија је да води рачуна о реду и миру у граду и чува своју љубав Лору, од злог пацова Грим Де Вита и његовог помоћника, пса Хектора, који изнова успевају да је киднапују. Њих двојица имају помоћ од стране својих неваљалих следбеника, вране Цане и алигатора Гагалигатора. Изију помоћ пружају: шеф, који му саопштава вести о кретању негативаца, мишица Аида, која воли оперско певање и канаринац Оги, који је ту да помогне са чаробним клупком.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Events, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: 18 Milwaukee
description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, 18 Milwaukee is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1846 game system, this variant features beer delivery to enhance your routes, and the ability to create new cities where none previously existed - no early route is safe! You’ll need a copy of 1846 to play this game.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Spel-tajm
description:
In Spel-tajm players are traversing the game board trying to find the golden reflex rolling a die to move across the different paths and landing on spots with a token.

When flipping the tokens, players can't know what they will find, ranging from good to bad items. Only one of the tokens will show the golden reflex.

If you can find the golden reflex, and carrying it back to the start without anyone stealing the reflex you win the game.

Spel-tajm is basically a copy of Den försvunna diamanten (Afrikan tähti) with minor gameplay changes.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Startropolis: Second Edition
description:
Startropolis: Second Edition is a family friendly, modular 3-D space station building game where you not only get to build a space station in 3D, but try and earn the most money. Each turn, players buy modules and connect them to the existing space station. This creates revenue, and allows them to purchase more modules. The player with the most credits at game end wins.

The main rule changes from the first edition are that the end game now has a second income phase to make purchases in the final rounds more compelling. The module track rules changed to have players discard and redraw a new module if 3 duplicates are already in there. The module decks and factions had some clarifications and errata applied to them to help clear some things up.

You are the alien CEO of a galactic corporation and your masters have given you seed money to invest in the new joint space station. What will you purchase? A solar power monopoly? Luxury habitats? Will you outperform your competition, and prove your dominance?

This second edition of Startropolis includes all new art from Brian Patterson.
mechanics: Market, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Lasuf Futbol
description:
A soccer-themed card game:

On their turn, each player must play a soccer player cards with the colors red, yellow, green and blue. As soon as he draws a goal of a color, he must play that card and defend it with soccer player cards of the same color.

His rivals must use the color cards to try to score a goal in a same color goal. The player who receives three goals in his goal is eliminated, the last one left in play is the winner.

It has several cards more related to the real sport, which are applied to offer variations and a minimum of strategy.

name: Go, Gorilla!
description:
Go Gorilla! is a balance game that promotes motor skills. Build a palm tree and place the monkey without the palm tree collapsing or being knocked over by the gorilla. There are 3 different game modes available: cooperative, against each other, or as a free game.


Go Gorilla! ist ein Balance-Spiel welches die motorischen Fähigkeiten fördert. Baue eine Palme und platziere den Affen, ohne dass die Palme einstürzt oder vom Gorilla umgeworfen wird. Es sind 3 verschiedene Spielmodi verfügbar: gemeinsam, gegeneinander oder als freies Spiel.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Los Teros: Vuelo Rasante
description:
The teros will use the weapons that nature's design gave them to take care of their nest exposed to the most voracious predators (hawks, gulls, owls, snakes, weasels, cats and dogs).

A card war... with Teros! Los Teros: Vuelo Rasante is a card game for 2 players in which one player will be the Teros, and the other the Predators. The objective of the teros is to take care of their nests and their territory, and that of the predators to reach the eggs. That is why, throughout 3 game difficulty modes (easy, normal and expert), the one who places the best card and wins a majority of battles may be the winner of the game.

On their turns, players simultaneously show a card. The player with the highest card wins.

The game ends when all cards have been played and the person with the highest number of tricks wins the game.

name: Sloth in my Broth
description:
Sloth in my Broth is a fast-paced, action packed skill game from Anker Play Products.

Objective:
There is a Sloth sleeping in your noodles that you want to keep out of your bowl.

Set Up:
Lay the spaghetti noodle pieces across the top of the bowl in a criss-cross fashion.

Rules:
Players take turns carefully removing noodles without letting the Sloth fall into your broth!

Spin the spinner and remove the number of noodles shown. Once you touch a noodle that is the noodle you must remove.
Players may only use one hand to remove the noodles from the bowl.


To Win:
The player that drops the Sloth in the Broth get desqualified [sic]. Set up again and keep playing. Last player to stay in the game WINS!

—description from the publisher

name: Mit År10: Quizzen om 10'erne
description:
A quiz game with a stack of cards each with six questions about the 2010's.

At the beginning of the game, the players decide how many points to play to.

On a player's turn, he rolls the die and the player to his left asks him the corresponding question. If he answers correctly, he gets the card as a point. If his answer is wrong, the other players may hit the bell to answer the question and get the card and the point if correct.

The game ends when a player has the agreed number of points.

name: Freaky Farkle Dice Game
description:
HOW TO PLAY: You've got six regular dice to roll, scoring points for various combinations. But a special freaky die makes it much more fun! If you're hot, keep rolling and racking up points. But if you roll without scoring, you Farkle and lose your accumulated points.

SHARKLE OR SPARKLE: A special freaky die makes it much more fun! If you roll a Sharkle, you get to take a bite out of opponents’ points. And if you Sparkle, double your points for that turn! Will you go big, or will you go bust? Roll & risk and freakin’ find out!

HOW TO WIN: Score your points for various combinations. Highest score wins.

FREAKY DICE: Set of Freaky Farkle dice & instructions.

name: Oganika: Diamonds
description:
An intense and challenging puzzling experience for use with the Oganika tile set.

36 linked cards slowly develop a deep understanding into the potential underlying geometry of a diamond shaped module. The puzzles become more and more difficult and complex, leading the puzzler slowly to towards a concluding 3D net which may or may not be possible.
publishers: Blood Moon Games Ltd, NewRoads Gaming

name: Gira Torino
description:
Gira Torino is the game that will drag everyone around the city to identify with the various foreign tourists eager to discover places and activities and collect as many experiences as possible to achieve the final victory.

Move around Turin using cards available with electric bikes and scooters, buses, trams, taxis or subways trying to visit all the places indicated in your Destination cards and complete the tourist routes that link them using your card in the best way, from those dedicated to food and culture to the tour of the buildings and the squares that have been the backdrop to famous films.

The best set and collection of experience give more points to win.
Each completed stage will give you points, new goals and some news (write at the bottom of cards) about the city of Turin that you didn't know yet.

name: The Game of Twiddleums
description:
Players move multiple colored counters from a base on one side of a hexagonal grid to another across numbered spaces, moving only on consecutive numbers. (For instance a counter on 4 can only move onto a 3 or 5 space.) They can be blocked by other players' counters.

An advanced variant allows players to either capture their opponents' counters or send them back to their start positions.

name: Služebníci Temnoty
description:
Hide in the skin of the wicked and start the exciting game! Each player embodies an evil in this colorful game, and their goal is to get treasures from the city and return to the Land of Darkness. You have to be skillful as the Superheroes will try to stop everyone in their mission and no one may even return to the Land of Darkness!

You must place the tiles in a field. After that you will roll whit the dice. If the the villian land on a same colored hero than his background, then lose 1 hp. 3 hit and out of the round! Nothing happens, if not the same color as the background. Thera are mistery tiles, that can be go back two place, move 1 back or front, or changge two different tiles! The winner is who get the treasure back the beggining or the last one standing player wins!

name: The Color Scheme
description:
The Color Scheme is a game of memory, maneuvers and manipulations.

In this 2-player game each player attempts to be the first to decipher a color code that was created by their opponent. A sharp focus is essential for each successful move. Players have to try and not be distracted by the shifting of cubes. Each opponent is scheming to outwit the other. The winning player will have to stay one step ahead to win!

Elegantly designed with a real wood game board and player pieces, the game also includes a drawstring bag == all stored within a magnetic flap-front box.

—description from the publisher

name: Henchman
description:
A light, fast-playing card game for 2-6 players featuring player interaction, some backstabbing, and a healthy dose of humor. Picture the office meets Sword & Sorcery. Work for an Evil Overlord—a tyrannical, ruthless, megalomaniacal villain bent on world domination. launch an epic competition of subterfuge, deceit, and backstabbing to prove who is most worthy to become the next Henchman!

A modified deck builder with the entire deck building mechanic occurring at the beginning of the game. Players choose from the 6 minion characters each with their own advantages and natural skills.
The game begins with the Minion Working Phase which is divided in rounds. Each round is split into a series of steps for each minion to complete: assign tasks, initialize time, demonstrate skills, complete tasks and refresh hands to earn points, skills and reputation. One player acts as the MIC (Minion in Charge) and uses the task deck to indicate status. This is the time to demonstrate delegation and negotiation skills to curry favor with the Evil Overlord (EO).

The MIC draws a number of tasks equal to the number of minions under their delegation. The MIC then hands out these tasks to minions as they see fit for them to complete, managing time. Any tasks not completed will an increase to the Evil Overlord Annoyance tracker (the EO has no tolerance for minions who cannot complete simple tasks!) Any tasks the MIC chooses not to complete will cost them time and points as will any failed tasks by minions. Be careful your minions could choose to strategize against you to become the next MIC. Minions complete tasks to demonstrate skills, gain abilities, points and reputation in attempt to take over as the next MIC to get their chance to please the EO and become the henchman.

The game ends if there are not enough tasks to assign to minions including reshuffled tasks. The minion that has gained the most reputation points earns the respect of the Evil Overlord and is declared the Henchman and the winner of the game.

name: Hush: Woven Bog
description:
July 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Woven Bog
Character card: Lavinia Perrie
Nocturnal Creature card: Gregorio The Unseen
Spirit card: Goblin Spirit

name: UNO Hello Kitty & Friends
description:
UNO Hello Kitty & Friends card game features cards with beloved Hello Kitty characters and a special rule to enhance gameplay. You want to match a card in your hand with the current card shown on top of the deck, and you’ll score points for the cards your opponents are left holding.

In UNO Hello Kitty & Friends, there’s also a special rule card: the Badtz-Maru card! Badtz-Maru is a mischievous penguin who makes the player with the fewest cards draw four more. And if there’s a tie for the fewest cards, both players draw four cards!
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Race, Take That

name: Hush: Dread Creek
description:
August 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Dread Creek
Character card: Gotra
Nocturnal Creature card: Tilia Hearthair
Spirit card: Slime Spirit
Structures card: Mill / Portal

name: #CultureTags
description:
If you can guess what this means, IDKAIDC, then you just played #CultureTags!

#CultureTags is the type of party game that can be as short or long as you want it to be! The categories may include Twitter, Instagram, Church, Family and Friends, etc. There is plenty of gameplay for many types of people, which is perfect for the party crowd! Attempt to guess as many cards as possible!

To begin the game, the first team will flip the timer. The describer will then take a stack of cards from the box and immediately begin. They will begin by stating the category and showing the team the culture tag. They must then give hints without saying any of the words on the card. When the card is answered correctly, it gets placed to the side and a new card is drawn. If the team cannot guess the card, they will pass and place it separately from the cards that are guessed correctly.

When the timer comes to an end, the rest of the cards are placed in the box. The passed cards are left on the table. The cards that the team were able to correctly guessed are placed off to the side, and the team earns one point for each card that is correctly guessed.

The next team will then go through the same process, but they may choose to answer the passed cards or cards from the box. If they are able to guess the passed cards, they score two points per card. Gameplay continues like this until the players decide that the game is over.

The game comes to an end when the players decide to be finished playing. The team with the most points win the game!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Action Timer, Communication Limits, Deduction, Real-Time, Targeted Clues

name: Lavirint Aleksandra Velikog
description:
Armed with machetes, four archaeologists follow ancient writings in search of the tomb of Alexander the Great in the jungles of India.
by Beoplast

The board is divided into spaces. Players draw tiles that are marked with letters. To place the tiles on the board they must form words by building a path to the tomb.
They then roll a dies to gain movement points and move along the constructed path. But beware, the paths will cross with the path of the opponent.
So that everyone can use everyone's road. The first player to reach the tomb and return to their starting position is the winner.

name: Cugomanija
description: From 2 to 8 players agree in advance on the measure (glass, sips, etc.) as well as which drink is in the game. The number of laps is also agreed. Players take turns rolling the dice and moving around the board for the number they get. The first player to get back to the start wins the round. The winner is the player who wins the most rounds. First of all, the goal of the game is fun.

name: Werwölfe: Schnupperpack
description: This is a demo/introductory edition of Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition. Includes 5 villagers, 2 werewolves, 1 Seer and 1 Old Hag.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Herding Cats Dice Game
description:
Herding Cats Dice Game is a game of rolling dice to gather tokens from the banker, with a push your luck element similar to Farkle. These tokens may be exchanged for cats when certain colour combinations are met

A Steal dice result allows you to steal a cat from another player, both advancing your position and reducing the number of cats they have. The winner is the first player to accumulate 65 cats.

name: Barrel of Laughs: Set the Scene
description:
Watch a masterpiece take shape. Use the miniature props to act out anything from simple actions to famous movies and TV shows. Each team has one minute per round to get through as many performances as possible in order to win points. The team with the most points at the end wins.

—description from the publisher

name: 天魔楼大戦 (Temmaro)
description:
The heavenly world and the demon world were once one human world, called Earth.

Realizing the limitations of the Earth, humans abandoned their homeland and built a giant habitat satellite "Noah" in satellite orbit and moved there.

However, there were those who were left behind on earth.

Thousands of years later, the people on earth called Noah the "Heavenly Realm," while the people of Noah called the earth the "Demon Realm.

Players are in charge of either the Heavenly Realm or the Demon Realm, and choose four types from six unique units to form their own army.

Each unit grows and becomes more advanced in battle, and its abilities change as well.

Each unit is commanded using "stance tiles," which look like mahjong tiles, to determine its stance, such as attack, defense, or balanced.

The reading of these "stance tiles" creates a heated psychological battle!

The player must deploy his/her army on the map, making full use of item cards with different effects in the Heavenly Realm and the Demon Realm,

The player who destroys the enemy's stronghold, the "Tower," wins.

name: Mish Mash: Celebrity Edition
description:
This version of Mish Mash is the Celebrity Edition.

Unscramble the words to identify a celebrity. The first player to answer correctly wins the card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: "I would f*ck Hitler"
description: An explicit expansion deck. From outrageous world records to melting eyeballs, this deck brings you 200 exclusive cards that you won't find anywhere else and can be played stand-alone or with the main deck.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Say What? Card Game
description:
These frantic phonetics will make you babble along as you try to sound out the sentences without melting your brain or twisting your tongue. Do you have what it takes to unscramble the babble?

—description from the back of the box

name: Monopoly: Pixar Edition
description:
Monopoly fans can explore locations from movies such as Disney and Pixar's Up, The Incredibles, Toy Story, Finding Nemo, and more.
Monopoly tokens including Hector's guitar from Coco, the Boot from Wall-E, Carl's House from Up, the Pizza Planet Truck from Toy Story, and the iconic Pixar Ball, and Lamp.
Players can collect rent as they add Cozy Cone motels and Al's Toy Barns to owned property sets.

name: Solve The Case
description:
Solve the Case is the ultimate escape room experience packaged in a portable suitcase! With five unique plays to choose from, you’ll be challenged to solve puzzles and clues using 3D support. Each play comes with a set of cards that will guide you through the game, challenging you to think outside the case! You’ll be immersed in a world of mystery and intrigue as you work your way through each level, using your problem-solving skills to reach each outcome.

--description from publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Cards Against Humanity: Pop Culture Bundle
description: The Pop Culture Pack comes with six different themed packs vaguely related to pop culture that you forgot to buy when they came out, plus ten brand new cards that we desperately crammed in at the last second. Includes the new Culture Wars Pack, 90s Nostalgia Pack, 2000s Nostalgia Pack, Scary Pack, Photo Card Pack 3, and Climate Catastrophe Pack. This is an expansion. Requires Cards Against Humanity core game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Rabusie
description:
Rabusie ("Robbers") is a card game in which you play the role of treasure hunters competing to find valuable items in the heart of a forgotten jungle. The game is intended for 2-6 players over 7 years of age, and the average playing time is 20 minutes.

By playing appropriate cards, robbers try to keep the treasures they have collected so far, steal loot from their opponents, and take over those that have not been tried yet and are still in the common pool. Each loot here is equally valuable! In the end, the only thing that will count among robbers is the number of treasures looted. The players' goal is to collect as many cards as possible, because each of them gives 1 point at the end of the game.

name: La Pecora Nera
description:
An irreverent game with lots of black humor to laugh in company.

The game contains many cards and scorecards.

The black humor and minimal design make it the perfect game for carefree evenings with friends with a bit of self-irony.

Liven up the evening with ironic, embarrassing and irreverent questions to really get to know your friends.

—description from the publisher

name: Fruit Ninja: Slice of Life Game
description:
From the Manufacturer
Fruit Ninja: Slice of Life Game - Based on the top-selling Apple iOS and Android app, the Fruit Ninja Slide of Life action game turns the fun of the digital app into fast and frenetic physical play. Both kids and adults alike love the app's addictive action of chopping and slicing flying fruit while avoiding the bombs, and now they can do it for real on either the table top or the floor. With two toy ninja swords, 20 physical fruit and bomb pieces, and 40 Fruit Ninja mission cards, this exciting skill and action game allows players to race to physically slash and splatter fruit pieces like true ninja warriors. Fruit Ninja Slice of Life is a two-player game in which the object of the game is to be the first player to complete each fruit mission card and earn the accompanying points. The player with the most points wins and is dubbed the ultimate Fruit Ninja.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Video Game Theme

name: The Ten Commandments
description:
Recreate the Ten Commandments with your friends! Each player has a set of goals for the final version of the Ten Commandments, and they debate and vote among themselves to get the Commandments that they want in the final ten.

Part of the Top Ten series. See also Top Ten: The Bill of Rights.

name: Brown Bear - Panda Bear, What Do You See?
description:
A memory game loosely based on Eric Carle's Brown Bear, Brown Bear, What Do You See? and Panda Bear, Panda Bear, What Do You See? series of children's books.

2-4 players are either brown or panda bears; the pandas are looking for a set of endangered animals, while the browns are looking for a set of more mundane wildlife (albeit a bit weird, such as the blue horse). Each turn a player flips one tile from a center pool. If it fills an opening in their predefined set, they keep it and take one (and only one) more turn. If not, they turn it back over. First player to fill their whole set wins.

The two turn limit makes this more suited to very young children than traditional memory games, as there's never too many recently-flipped tiles to track. Most of the time there's either zero or one, since rejected animals are usually quickly picked up by the next player in line.

Claims that the game helps with sequencing skills are based on the endgame, when the winning player calls out each of their animals in order, aping the book series' style. (The animals can be picked up in any order.)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Novel-based

name: Omega Expedition
description:
Embark on an epic adventure of truly biblical proportions when you descend deep into the foreboding recesses of the labyrinth in search of holy artifacts. Surmount obstacles and deadly pitfalls and survive encounters with fierce creatures and supernatural beings bent upon denying you access to the holy artifacts. Witness history unfolding before your eyes as you find, and recover, holy relics thought to be lost to the ages.

Game is designed for multiple modes of play:

Single Player Mode
Multi-Player Mode (2-3 Individual Players)
Team Mode (up to 4 players per team)

Bonus Game: Quest for the Holy Treasure
Bonus Game: Mystery of the Number Seven

name: Campaigns of the Civil War: Vicksburg and Chancellorsville
description:
Campaigns of the Civil War: Vicksburg and Chancellorsville is a wargame that simulates two critical events of the American Civil War through a game system with a map divided into strategic squares.

While this game is designed especially for solitaire play, it can accommodate a second player.

Individual counters represents divisions, brigades, leaders, ironclads, transports and a handful of companies and battalions deployed in probing operations.

A Combat Results Table (CRT) and a six-sided die is used to resolve combat. An 8-page rulebook and 17"x22" double-sided map are also used.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Bible Blurt: The Card Game
description: Don’t think long and hard think fast and fun! It’s time to play Bible Blurt - The Card Game! Find out if your brain can keep up with your mouth and if your mouth can keep up with your brain! The words are taken from the NIV of the Bible and the play of the game is lightning quick. Relax and enjoy all the funny things people blurt! Ages 8 and up, 3 to 5 Players. 312 Bible Blurt definitions on 52 cards

name: Min drömhäst
description:
A children's game where you will compete in a show jumping.

At first you have to find four different equipment-tiles placed face down. After that you roll a die and move your plastic horse around the course with obstacles. According to what you roll different things will happen: After a roll of 1 you must move your horse one step back and take a marker (after three markers you're out of the game). If you would jump over a obstacle after you have rolled a 2, 3 or 4 you have to take the top card from the deck and according to the card's colour different things will happen: If it's green you have passed the jump, if it's yellow you have knocked down the obstacle and get a yellow fault-marker and if it's red your horse has refused to jump and you have to stop and take a red fault-marker. A roll of 5 or 6 makes you just jump over the obstacle without taking a card. The fastest horse with least faults is the winner.

The game is played in the box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Nanawa: Verdun in the Chaco War, July 1933
description:
(from the Firefight Games website)

Nawana was a turning point battle. It was here, a Bolivian Army led by German General Kundt, armed with new weapons (tanks, flame-throwers, fighter-bombers) assaulted the Paraguayan defenses not from Paraguay's capitol. Kundt had been led to believe the defenses were weak, that the tanks would break through and that once Nanawa fell, the road would be open to Paraguay’s capital. This was in fact true, however, that was the only thing which was true. The Paraguayan forces had been issued special antitank ammo and built well defended trenches with mines. Their lines were not weak and numerically almost as strong as the Bolivian! The Paraguayans had proved themselves many times during this war as a very dangerous foe even when outnumbered. After three days of fighting and a combined body count of over 4000 men with little real gain, the Bolivians halted.

Components:
1 11x17 inch map
280 counters,
Player aids

Scale:
Company-level
1 hex=250 yards
1 turn=8 hours

name: Thomas the Tank Engine & Friends ABC Game
description: This is a children's matching game to learn the alphabet. Each left piece is a letter and the right piece is an Engine whose name starts with that letter.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains, Word Game

name: Viisasten Kokous
description:
"Star moments of life, with the wisest in the realm"

"The Meeting of the Wise" is clearly based on the long-standing (1945-1995) radio trivia program Viisasten Kerho ("The Club of the Wise"); most of the designers were members at one point or another, and the main authors Otila and Lindfors were it's two last chairmen. Otila especially, an economist and Member of European Parliament, was known as a kind of "Mr. Trivia" of Finland in the 1980's-1990's when he produced and hosted several popular TV trivia shows and participated as a competitor himself in trivia events held by others.

This is a trivia game for single players or teams. There are 5 categories of questions, 2500 questions in total. The game enjoys a reputation of being overly difficult as far as trivia games go; something that the designers would probably have enjoyed playing among themselves, but frustratingly challenging to the average trivia player.

The game was published in two versions; the initial version came in a beige box, but later a revised edition in a red box, based on player feedback, was published; it introduced a d6 and some rules addenda. A companion game, Viisasten kivi was published probably around the same time, aimed at a younger audience and therefore being a bit more casual, and having a difficulty level more in line with trivia games in general.

name: Contágio Cardgame
description:
ENGLISH:
A deadly virus escaped from a maximum security laboratory in Brasilia, spreading like a plague. The Angra dos Reis Nuclear Power Plant exploded, radiation spreading radiation across the country. An indian ancient curse was awakened in the north. Nazi scientists, refugees from the Second World War, unleashed his experiments with animated corpses in strategic locations.

The undead dominated Brazil and there is nothing anyone can do to change that. Now, leading a group of survivors, you must explore ruined cities in search for supplies, defend yourself from hordes of bloodthirsty undeads, and confront rival groups of survivors.

Or, in the latter case, throw it all away, become an undead and go hunting brains around ...









Contágio is a complete competitive cardgame made ​​for 2-4 players.

PORTUGUÊS:
Um terrível vírus mortal escapou de um laboratório de segurança máxima de Brasília, disseminando-se como uma praga. A Usina Nuclear de Angra dos Reis explodiu, espalhando radiação por todo o país. Uma antiga maldição indígena foi despertada por conflitos agrários no norte. Cientistas nazistas, refugiados da Segunda Guerra Mundial, soltaram seus experimentos com cadáveres animados em locais estratégicos.

Os mortos-vivos dominaram o Brasil e não há nada que ninguém possa fazer para mudar isso. Agora, liderando um grupo de sobreviventes, você deverá vasculhar cidades em ruínas em busca de suprimentos, defender-se das hordas sanguinárias de mortos-vivos e confrontar grupos rivais de sobreviventes.

Ou, em último caso, jogar tudo para o alto, tornar-se um morto-vivo e sair caçando cérebros por aí…









Contágio é um jogo competitivo de cartas feito para partidas de 2 a 4 jogadores. Ele não é um jogo colecionável, isto é, ele não depende da compra constante de novas cartas para se jogar.

name: Crap Trumps
description:
The anti Top Trumps game:

A Card game based on the world's worst cars gives points for the most rust, longest stopping distance, slowest windscreen wipers and general "crap factor".

name: Flug um die Welt mit Lufthansa
description:
The Game of Travel

Travel the world with Lufthansa. Whether you plan your course strategically or react spontaneously to the game, your challenge is to defeat both your opponents and chance. Buying the right to fly to an airport is the key within the game because such rights, like in real life, are rare.

What is in the box (German):

1 Spielbrett
1 Würfel
100 Spielmarken in 5 Farben
42 Ortsnamen-Karten
70 Markierungsstäbchen
5 Flugzeuge
10 Sonderflug-Karten
32 Linienflug-Karten
18 Überraschungs-Karten
Spielgeld

This is essentially a 1d6 Roll-and-move game where card-driven routes are assigned. Routes are assigned by 1st drawing from the 10 Sonderflug Charters) cards and, when they are exhausted, from the 32 Linienflug (Scheduled) cards. Each connected city uses 1 'movement point'. When the move ends on a city the player pays a 'Landing Fee'. Most fees are 500 but a scattering of 10, 15, and 20 are purchased by the additional payment of the landing fee (a la Monopoly properties). Multiples of these will eventually allow doubling or tripling of fees for the other players. The only need for reading German is for the 18 Uberraschungs (Surprise) cards. Plays continues until all but 1 player is bankrupt.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Beggar My Neighbour
description: Each player starts with a face-down deck of cards. In turn each player places their top card in the middle of the table. When a "Put" card is played, the next player has to put down the number of cards required. If they play a "Put" card, then their turn ends and the next player goes. If no "Put" card turns up in the cards put down, the player who laid the last "Put" card gets all the cards from the centre of the table. A player who runs out of cards is out of the game. The last player left in the game is the winner.
publishers: Arrow Games Ltd, Djeco, Falcon Games (I), Michael Stanfield, W. H. Cornelius Ltd., Waddingtons

name: The Hardy Boys Mystery Game: The Secret of Thunder Mountain
description:
Family game (Ages 7 - 14) for 2-4 players. Players race to solve their part of the mystery (Who? What? When? or Where?).

From the box:

In search of stolen gems, the Hardy Boys traveled to Thunder Mountain on their motorcycles. There they found pieces of evidence that helped them solve the robbery. Now you must gather your own pieces of evidence in order to win this game.

It's exciting. Which player will be the first to discover WHO?, WHAT?, WHERE?, or WHEN?

It's fast. Your playing piece is a motorcycle. With it you travel around the board trying to gather the pieces of evidence that you need.

It's a game that involves some strategy. Being a detective tests your concentration and memory.

Join the Hardy Boys in a new adventure. See if you, too, are able to solve the MYSTERY OF THUNDER MOUNTAIN.

name: Huis Clos
description: A deduction game in which you can role play a little bit. All players are guests in an old mansion, but one is actually a murderer, and the other players have to determine who that is. It is slightly related to games such as Werewolf/Mafia or Bang!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Role Playing, Voting

name: The News Game
description:
Read all about it! In this era of fake news, can you tell the truth from the lie? Play The News Game and test your powers of deduction, along with your friends, and play this super-fun, laugh-out-loud game.

One person reads out the headline followed by the story and you have to guess whether its real or fake news!

This game contains 100 'true or false' question cards and also comes with full gameplay instructions. A great game for your next dinner party, The News Game is a fabulous gift for lovers of quizzes and current affairs.

—description from the publisher

name: Fishin'-opoly
description:
from the publishers:

THE GAME THAT WILL REEL YOU IN, HOOK, LINE AND SINKER!
Gone Fishin’ – when grouped together, two of the most beautiful words in the English language! Fishin’-opoly allows players to buy, sell and trade their favorite fish and gear with family and friends. Players choose their tokens and advance to Cast. It’s all fun and games until someone lands on SNAG, gets all hung up, and is out of the game for three turns! While playing, flip over the deeds and learn some fun fishin’ facts. And you know what they say, “A bad day of fishin’ is still better than a good day at work!”
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dragons' Den Board Game
description:
Based on the Television show of the same name. There are many international versions of the show, including The Shark Tank, in the United States.

From the CBC website:

You are a Dragon. You are going to hear about some amazing ideas; some are great successes and some are embarrassing flops! With over 300 inventions from Victorian times to the present, can you sort out the brilliant from the bonkers? Are you in or out?

The goal of the Dragons' Den Board Game is simple - make as much money as you can! You start with $500,000 and three Dragon cards. In each round of the game, you and your fellow Dragons hear about six inventions. You must decide if each invention is a Goldmine, a Success or a Flop, and make an investment on the appropriate square on the board. You double your money if you're right; you lose your money if you're wrong, and you can outsmart and out-deal the other Dragons along the way.

The game includes: a table-top size full colour game board, 340 invention cards, 18 Dragon cards, 2 markers, and a big bundle of Dragon dollars.

- Family game suitable for ages 8+
- 2-6 Players
publishers: CBC (Canadian Broadcast Corp), Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: Nochnoj Dozor
description:
This Russian card game is based on the novel and the film (2004) with the same name, also known as Night Watch.

The series is continued with Dnevnoj Dozor (Day Watch) with another mechanics.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Galactic Takeover
description:
The game is a 3x3 Dots and Boxes game.

Players take turns building landing pads for their spaceships. Place four walls to build a pad and then land your spaceship. The player with the most spaceships wins.
Game comes with 9 double-sided (red/purple) spaceships, 24 walls, 1 play-and-store case, 1 rule and strategy tips booklet.

name: Medabots Trading Card Game
description: The Medabots Trading Card Game, based on the children's television cartoon of the same name, allows two players to compete by placing Medabots on a Battle Sheet and fighting it out. Whenever a Medabot is destroyed, players pay a cost in Hit Points. The player who causes his opponent to lose all his HP is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kang Le Qi
description:
This is a traditional Chinese variant of Snakes and Ladders. Like Snakes and Ladders, it takes place on a square board with a boustrouphedron track, and players roll a die to move their piece from start to finish. The distinguishing features of this distinct subgenre are that the board is set in a playground with many children playing on a see-saw, a slide, a Ferris wheel, a merry-go-round, and so on. Some squares will have instructions that will move the player forward, backward or cause a missed turn.

Like other traditional Chinese games of this ilk, it is made by different companies and comes in small boxes with a folded paper board - in this case, the board is often fairly colourful. More modern versions include cartoon character themes (e.g. Doraemon Kang Le Qi, Snoopy Kang Le Qi).

name: Lucky Seven
description:
Lucky Seven ... fast and fun competitive solitaire played with 7 coasters.

Solitaire is (usually) played by one but this game may be played by any number and is therefore oxymoronic!
If more than one player, best played with a set of 7 coasters each.

The object is to turn all 7 coasters number side up and accrue the highest score.

Shuffle 'em and deal 'em number side down … then, turn over any coaster and leave it in place … from here on it is all pure luck as the number on the coaster turned, determines the position (always reading from left to right) of the next coaster to turn … and so on.

However, if the number on a coaster turned denotes the position of one already turned, that player is bust!

At round's end, shuffle 'em and start again ... even if playing solo.

The rules are included among the images.

name: Astromagie
description:
In the card game of astrological magic players hold six cards and on their turn may play up to 3
or refuse by discarding one and replenishing from the stock. Cards come in 4 types: signs,
elements, planets and aspects, and are played to a row of 6 under strict rules. When every
player has refused to play a card, the last player to have played scores. He adds up the
number of matches he has in columns 1-3 and multiplies by the planet number in column 4
to receive points on paper. Then the row is cleared and this player starts a new tableau.

name: Mary Hartman Mary Hartman
description: Be the first player to complete two Mary Hartman episodes.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Science Fusion, the Elements of the Scienauts
description: Science-fusion: the elements of the scienauts battle card game characterizes the elements into interesting personas of the element that they portray. These detailed characters then interact in the card game in may ways using real information from known scientific facts.

name: Mäklare
description:
The game where you buy land and build houses.

Under construction you will get paid for how many walls of your house you have managed to build. You can build a gas station, a train station, stores and so on... The player that isn't bankrupt at the end will win this game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dostihy a sázky II
description:
Game for fans of game Horse race. New game system is focused on stake and it brings a lot of excitement. To get highest profit is the main goal of this game. Because game board is substitue by special dice you can play everywhere especially during your horse race.

Box contains:
22 cards of horses
6 cards of tables
26 cards of chance
1 dice with points
1 dice with symbols
set of banknotes
CZ and SK instructions
categories: Card Game, Dice, Economic, Negotiation, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Marathon Race
description:
"The Marathon Race" is a roll-and-move race game with a 167-space track based on the marathon course at the 1908 Olympics, with locations from Windsor Castle to White City Stadium.

Players landing on the "INN" spaces are compelled to divert on to the far longer alternative tracks that may ultimately place them at the head of the race. (Perhaps coincidentally, this presages a similar idea in Parker Bros. Pachisi variant, "Pollyanna," five years later.) There is also a "Snakes and Ladders"-style mechanic in which "STILE" spaces send players forward and "LOSE" spaces send them (sometimes very dramatically) back.

The first player to land on 167 exactly, without overshooting, wins; players then "line up" in order to receive the (imaginary) trophy.

(This information is extrapolated from Brian Love's 1978 book "Play the Game." Please modify with any expanded description or corrections that can be provided by the owner of a physical copy of the game.)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar Spin & Seek ABC Game
description:
From the back of the box:
In Eric Carle's ABC Game, players spin the spinner and search for letter cards that match their space. The letters and corresponding animal cards are inspired by Eric Carle's ABC book.

This game introduces children to the alphabet by teaching them the difference between big and little letters. Children also reinforce counting skills as they move around the board. It's easy to learn and fun to play for both children and adults.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tschau Knacki
description:
A board game using combinations of cards, players try to get their man over the wall and allow him to get away
while being pursued by the keeper.

name: Disciples II: Blades of War
description:
The Disciples II: Blades of War cardgame is the card game that was included in the Collectors Edition of Disciples 2: Dark Prophecy.

This is a strategic card game set in the Disciples 2 universe that doesn't require a computer!

Two to four players take turns controlling cities and resources, attacking their opponents with hired leaders and units, and eventually clearing the map of their enemies.

Online Play

CCG Workshop (no longer available)

name: Pippi Långstrump
description:
Welcome to Villa Villekulla (Pippi Longstocking's house)! Pippi has arranged an exciting treasure hunt for you and your opponents. The person to first find five different items in the garden, and return to Villa Villekulla wins the game.

It's a pretty simple game, based on one of the short-stories about Pippi, in which she invites Anika and Tommy over for her birthday, with treasure hunt, in which the guests ends up with the presents.

Players take turns to roll a die, and move along on the paths in the garden. There are several different paths through the garden, connecting the house and the five areas with treasures. Each area has treasures in a different color, and each player has to collect one treasure from each area, but in addition each treasure has to be different. You do not need to roll the exact amount to end on an area, as you can choose to stop once you reach an area. In addition there are spaces in which you have to draw a card, which will help or hinder you in your quest.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Novel-based
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Larry Burkett's Money Matters
description:
Players roll and move around the board, collecting income and paying off bills. Each player has 14 envelopes, each representing various categories of expenses, and whoever pays them all off first by placing the correct amount of money in each envelope, wins.

From the rule book:

"Stewardship means taking care of our possessions, knowing that everything we have actually belongs to God. A key goal of this game is to teach that it is not how much money people have but their stewardship that is important. Players learn that (1) they can reach their financial goals by budgeting their money carefully and (2) it pays to be generous."

name: B.S.
description:
B.S. is a trivia game that asks players to distinguish the truth from the total B.S. "Is 'Batonophobia' the fear of cheerleaders?" "Do mice cry tears like humans?"

It is a combination of poker and of straight trivia. Players must determine which of 3 random facts is B.S. and they bet on their answers using poker-style betting chips.

Players can also draw "Total B.S." cards, which ask you to shout of out B.S when you think you know which of 5 statements read in a row is B.S.!

The winner of B.S. is the player with the most chips at the end of the game.

name: Star Trek Game
description:
Action and adventure in outer space! Be the first player to complete your Star Trek mission and return the U.S.S. Enterprise to the starting space!

Players choose one of four pathways through the game, themed to four Star Trek characters (Capt. James Kirk, Mr. Spock, Uhura and "Bones" McCoy) -- they must make it all the way to the end of the track and then back to their start space to win the game. There are two spinners, one for Warp speed and one for Impulse engines.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Pigpen
description:
Put your overalls on and prepare for some family fun of the swine kind.

Pig-Pen is a quick fire family strategy game where each player does their best to capture pigs in pens. Grab your hand and play cards building your pen to capture the pigs. However, be careful, as your opponent will be looking to ruin your hard work and steal your pigs!

In a game of Pig-Pen, players are dealt a hand of five cards, with these cards they are going to build pens to capture pigs. A stack of Pigs, depending on the number of players, is the timer for the game. Once these pigs are gone the game is over. On their turn players replenish their hands back to five cards, then they are allowed to play two cards and finally they may discard any number of cards they choose. The choices they have are to either build their pen(s) or attack their opponent(s.) Pens are made six cards: Four Pen cards, a Feed card to entice the pig and finally a Gate card. Players can attack their opponents with attack cards that destroy Pen cards or Unlock Gates. Even when a Pig is captured, it still isn't safe as players can attempt to steal it with Attack cards. Players ultimate goal is to have the best point Pigs in their Pens at games end.

Pig-Pen also features three levels of play. A simple children's level, an intermediate level with some number comparisons. And the always fun Secret Bacon Pack, where no Pig is safe from destruction of the bacon kind.

name: Dawn of the Dice
description:
A dice games in which you try to stay ahead of the zombie hordes.

Each turn, you throw the dice that are left in the middle of the table. Any zombies you throw can be allocated to opponents, while other results let you kill off zombies. Any used dice go to the middle of the table (including killed zombies), only explosions are removed from the game.
As soon as there are no dice left in the middle, the game ends and the player chased by the most zombies loses the game.

name: Steeple-Chase
description: Part of the Vintage Game Series, a series of very simple games inspired by games from the end of the 1800s. The game includes two pegs, a dice and a tin box with rules and steeplechase platform.

name: The Administrative Waltz
description:
Components:

Board
8 x Playing Pieces
1 x Letter Bag containing 98 letter tiles
4 x Scorecards
54 x Progress Cards
52 x Reference Cards
65 x Manipulator cards
44 x Bonus Cards

The player's aim is to reach the pinnacle of their pyramid first. To do this, they have to perform The Administrative Waltz, by progressing through the various qualifying zones, positions and levels, and manipulating his opponents to retard their progress.
This performance simulates the bureaucratic rise to success, which is dependent on no one particular attribute, being achieved through a five-point plan which comprises...
-Qualifications (formal educational qualifications)
- Progressions (promotion - sometimes through merit, other times through luck)
- References (opinions from superiors/colleagues)
- Manipulations (tactical play and actions to advance oneself to the detriment of others)
- Bonuses (Incentives and fringe benefits)

There are two versions of play for "The Administrative Waltz"- a lengthier and a shorter version.
The game The Administrative Waltz is a game inspired by a satirical book of the same name. (The Administrative Waltz- G. Stringer & M. Wallace- 1976)
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Den ofrivillige spelaren
description: Every player begins with 1 million. The goal is to have as much money before the time (24 "in game" hour) is out. In the game there is 4 small games you can bet money at - poker, horses, roulette and keno (a sort of lotto).

name: Taxi Challenge New York
description: Taxi Challenge! Who is the fastest cab driver and who gets $100 first during a work shift. Face difference challenges during your shift and you may get a big reward for a job well done. Its own excitement to the game comes with occurrence cards and tactical cards. Roll a die and move your pawn to nearest taxi bollard to find your next customer.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Herocults
description:
In this fantasy game, one of the players take the role of the master, whose task is to prepare the game distributing several flagstones (which triggers different events when a hero stumbles upon them) and placing and later controlling the evil characters through the different halls and corridors of the board. The other players receive a "route card", which details the path their hero must follow through the game. The first to complete his route wins the game.

An obvious HeroQuest knock-off with a different interesting combat mechanics.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Party Game
description: Political Party Game, that is. Players compete to earn votes in a roll and move, draw a card game. Answer quiz questions, make 60 second speeches, climb the ladder of success or slide down the greasy pole. Cash your votes into rosettes in your party color which you place on a map of Britain, most rosettes wins. The packaging is themed with photos of Paul Eddington, who played a politician in a very popular UK satirical TV show, but this has nothing to do with the game.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political, Trivia

name: The Beat Inflation Strategy Game
description:
Arguably one of The Avalon Hill Game Co's least successful designs, Beat Inflation has players buying and selling two different types of assets (real and paper), trying to make a profit as inflation rises and falls.

Players buy an asset at high risk, medium risk or low risk... and wait until the time is right to sell it for the biggest profit. Starting with $100,000 in loans, the first player to make $1,000,000 is the winner.

name: The Princess Bride: Prepare to Die! Again!!
description:
A party game in which players fill in the famous phrase "Hello. My name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die."' with ridiculous names and activities.

You might say to yourself, "but wait, this game already exists!" and you would nearly be right ... but actually wrong.

Prepare to Die! Again!! is the exact same game as Prepare to Die, but with different cards.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Hold'em-opoly
description: Love poker and real estate trading games? Play both, together! Buy property, pay rent or trade in for a casino. When a player lands on the "Play Hold'Em" space, everybody plays a hand of the popular poker game! Play it safe...or go "all in." There's "no limit" to the fun!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Editrice Giochi, Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Mini Cootie
description:
From the instruction booklet:

Object
Be the first player to complete a Cootie character.

Contents
-Instruction booklet
-1 large 6-sided die
-6 cardboard Cootie heads
-6 cardboard Cootie bodies
-6 cardboard Cootie tails

Setup
Put all of the Cootie parts in a pile in the center of the playing surface.

Gameplay
1. Youngest player goes first. Roll the die.

If you roll a Cootie part, take that part from the pile and place it in front of you. If you already have that part, do nothing and pass the die to the next player.

If you roll a picture with 3 Cootie parts you can choose any one of those parts.
If you roll a red "X" you must put one of your parts back in the pile.

If you roll a picture of the die you can take another turn.

2. Pass the die to the next player to the left and follow the same game play.

Note: You can mix different color Cootie parts or keep all the parts the same color.

Winning
The first player to complete his Cootie wins the game. For a longer game, play 3 rounds. The player who wins the most rounds wins that game.

Restorage
Save your package because after you play the game you can put all the parts back in the bag and reseal it.

name: Biker Mice from Mars: Take Back the City
description:
Based on the cartoon series of the same name, Biker Mice From Mars: Take Back the City is a board game in which players take on the roles of the biker mice heroes. The city has been overrun by criminals and the heroes are duty-bound to clear it up.

The players take turns to play. They use a spinner to determine the number of spaces they can move on the board. Interspersed on the board are locations where the criminals have been randomly placed face-down (except for the boss, Lawrence Limburger, who is placed openly in his headquarters) and where they can draw Plutarkian Pothole cards, which grant positive or negative effects. By moving their tokens onto criminals, the player engages them in battle, which is resolved by again using the spinner. If victorious, the player takes (captures) the criminal's disc into his or her possession.

The game ends when all criminals have been captured. The players score the criminals they have captured (different points for the 6 types of criminals in the game). The one with the highest points wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dora the Explorer
description: Very simple children's game from Colorforms. Children play one of four characters from the Nick Jr. television show of the same name. The characters travel around the board and encounter obstacles and the players must choose which Colorform will help the character get past the obstacle.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pelle Haleløs' baggårdsjagt
description:
The players each control one of four cats, Pelle, Maja, Mons or Bill & Bull (the last two are twins and only got one piece to represent them, therefore they count as one.)

The cats try to run from one side of a backyard to the other without being captured by the nasty dog Berntsson. Fortunately there are a few 'safe' zones along the way, where they will be out of reach of the dog.

The game is available in Danish and Swedish.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WWF Taktinen Luontopeli
description:
"WWF Tactical Nature Game" or "WWF Tactical Animal Game"
