Players represent some of the large mammals found in the Finnish nature and each player participates in the game with all six animals pictured (wolf, lynx, elk, bear, wolverine and rabbit). From the starting area, paths of circles lead to a picture of each animal. Three dice are included in the game; two regular 6-sided dice and one special 6-sided "track" die with a track of each animal pictured. Each player also gets 10 counters per animal representing a track of that animal.

Each turn a player can either use the regular dice or the track die; using the track die, she can place one of her own track counters on an animal's path or alternatively remove another player's track counter from a path. Using the regular dice she can advance one of her playing pieces, but only on an exact result that lands her piece on one of her own previously placed track counters. The players must thus place their own track counters as "stepping stones" before advancing on a path, while sabotaging other players' game by removing their counters. They can freely use any animal each turn.

The first player to reach ANY of the pictured animals (with an exact roll) on the board wins.

Re-implemented by Jännittävät jäljet!

2 Finnish marks (about 0.60€ in 2020) from the sale of each copy were donated to WWF Finland fund.

name: Clichebles
description:
The board consists of a track of colored squares. When a player lands on a square, a moderator or another player picks a card and reads the cliche clue corresponding to the color of the square. There are six types of clues and different rules guiding all six types. Quick cliches are short and one word is left blank. Scrambled cliches are phrases that are scrambled such as "out on a limb" can be read "limb out on a". There are also question cliches ("What do you blow?" which is "your stack."), and there is backward cliches which are simply read backwards.

If the player guesses the cliche, he or she moves forward in hopes of reaching the end of the track.

name: Posti on kaikkialla
description:
Posti on kaikkialla is a promotive game published by the Finnish postal service - Posti.

Your object is to transfer letters, postal parcels and such to chosen squares on the board representing the map of Finland and its postal zones. Players throw dice to see how long distance and to which direction (straight or diagonal) they can move.

Whoever manages to deliver all his/her shipments first wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1789: Le Jeu de la Révolution Francaise
description:
Game of the French Revolution

On a map of Paris in 1789, up to 6 Players have to obtain "certificats de civisme" by moving their character in the city (rolling a die) and taking part in historical events (gaining points - assignats - by answering questions on special locations). Once they have collected enough assignats they can retrieve the certificates in key Parisian Revolutionary locations:
l'Hotel de Ville - city Hall
la Bastille
les Tuileries
le Pantheon
le Champ de Mars.
Other events (spaces on the map / special cards) can alter the moves of the players or even let them win or lose the precious certificates.
The winner is the first player to obtain 5 certificates

By some of the same designers as La Révolution Francaise (Azure Wish)

name: Stadion: yleisurheilupeli
description:
Stadion is a track and field sports game featuring 14 running, 4 jumping and 4 throwing events. Basically all the events are played by spinning a pointer and then determining the result from the appropriate look-up table: how many spaces to proceed, how long the jump attempt was, how many hundredth of a second to add etc. The usual sports event rules are applied as well, e.g. there are three attempts for each height in high jump.

Similar to: Kansojen Kisat

name: Monopoly: Argentina
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the country of Argentina.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Frog Prince
description:
Aim of the game: The prince has been turned into a frog. Can you return him to his natural state by collecting kisses and the golden ball, and placing him on the right lily pad?

How it is played:

The central piece of the game is a clear plastic cylinder that has a disk inside. The disk shows the prince on one side, and a frog on the other. It is turned over via a magnetic mechanism: If the cylinder is put on the castle tile, it shows the frog. If it is put on the correct lily pad, the tile is turned over again and the prince reappears.

Players take turn spinning a spinner. The spinner has three different areas: One shows one "kiss" symbol (a pair of lips), the second shows two kisses, and the third one the golden ball. If the spinner points toward one of the kiss symbols, the active player gets the corresponding number of kiss tokens. If it points toward the golden ball, the active player gets the ball token (there is only one ball token, and it constantly changes its owner according to the spinner's results). A player can try rescuing the prince as soon as he/she has collected 3 kisses and the golden ball. To rescue the prince, the cylinder has to be put on the correct lily pad. But only one of the lily pads will make the prince reappear. If the player chooses the wrong lily pad, he/she loses their kiss tokens and has to start collecting new ones. If it is correct and the frog turns into a prince, that player wins the game.

name: Trimm-Dich-Spiel
description:
Be the first to get from start to goal with 3 game-pieces by rolling dice, hit special areas and do exercises that are drawn from a deck of exercise-cards along the way.

Every player gets 3 pieces in the same colour that are placed on the matching start-fields. The youngest player starts the game, roll a die and move one piece at a time. When you reach an exercise- spot, draw a card an do what it says. Then draw a "grading" card to see the verdict on your "performance" and get a bonus or a set back. Along the route there are also arrows that you want to hit/not hit in order to get to goal faster.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Humor, Party Game, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A game where an enclosed short young lady, a perfect class representative, a slightly elder classy maid, a normal high school girl with the aura of a hamster, among others, try to win an unlucky-looking girl-faced butler with a debt ... [truncated]
description:
１億６千万円ぐらいの借金をかかえた不幸そうな女顔の執事を、ひきこもりぎみのチビなお嬢様や、完璧超人の生徒会長やら、年上の優秀なメイドさん、ハムスターなオーラーの普通の女子高生たちで奪い合うゲーム。女装もあるよ ("A game where an enclosed short young lady, a perfect class representative, a slightly elder classy maid, a normal high school girl with the aura of a hamster, among others, try to win an unlucky-looking girl-faced butler with a debt of about 160 million yen. There's cross-dressing, too") is a simple "pull the joker" style card game.

A card deck consisting of some seven or eight different types of cards. There is an even number of cards except for the "butler" card. All cards are dealt, and players take turns drawing one card at random from the previous player. If any pair is formed, it's discarded and the special effect of that card (if any) happens. If a player runs out of cards, he's out. The player with the last "butler" card left in hand wins.

—user summary

Note: The title is actually a bit longer than the BGG entry allows. It should end with "debt of about 160 million yen. There's crossdressing, too" but it is of minor importance.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Party Game

name: Rule of Alchemist
description:
In Rule of Alchemist each player is an alchemist trying to complete magic scrolls.

Each scroll needs different color combinations of five jewels to be completed. Players have jewels hidden behind paper fences and at the end of each turn check if they have completed a scroll.

Each turn players may use their job skill (if they didn't use it the turn before) and must exchange two jewels with the public pool.

A round ends when there is only one card left in the scroll deck for the round.

Scrolls award coins, at the end of the third round, the player who has more coins wins the game.

name: Zelph on the Shelf Edition (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
Cards Against Humanity Zelph On The Shelf Edition is a fan-made version of Cards Against Humanity that is designed for ex-Mormon players. Like the regular game, a player selects a black card with fill in the blank text and each player selects one of their white cards to try and find the funniest result. The person playing the black card chooses the funniest response.

This game pokes fun at Mormonism and Mormon Apologetics. The name Zelph refers to a skeleton found by Joseph Smith in Illinois that was uncovered in a Native American mound. He claimed the bones belonged to a warrior named Zelph who had fought in the battles described in the Book of Mormon.

The game can be played independently or integrated with Cards Against Humanity. Like the original game, the humor is very adult in nature and is recommended for mature players. For faithful Mormons, the game is probably especially offensive.
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play, Religious

name: Królestwo
description:
In the game you are a king or queen on the road to the Kingdom of Heaven. You need to collect the 5 pieces of the Armor of Faith and shed your sins to enter the Castle.

Using roll & move, each player makes his way through the outer kingdom, where they can either purchase pieces of Armor by paying collected Light or gain them in random encounters (card draws). Equipped with the five pieces of armor (that bestow special abilities) they can cross to the inner kingdom, where they must shed themselves through sin or gain the power of Love, through a new series of adventures with morale choices.

The game is meant to teach Christian values to primary school children.
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Porn!
description:
From the publisher:

"Porn! is an easy-to-learn strategy card game where you and the other players compete to own the most porn movies. As you build your stash, you also try to prevent other players from building larger collections. You can steal movies by correctly answering a porn trivia question, triple your holdings with the Porn Mogul Card, and earn extra turns by filming a movie. Running out of cards closes the round, but watch out for the Arson! card that can destroy it all."

name: Spider-Man 3: The Ultimate Game
description:
Disguised as Spider-man, you try to be the first to climb to the top of the skyscraper. With a little luck and spider-sense, you can avid dangers and win the exciting race!

Contents:

39 window tile
1 finish tile
4 Spider-man card board playing pieces
1 counter


13 rows with 3 double sided tiles each - and a finish tile - form a skyscraper with 14 floors. You move your Spider-man onto a tile and turn it up side to reveal the action you have to perform - move up or down, miss a turn or jump over a floor.
The first player who reaches the 14th floor, wins.

For Ages 6 and up
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Roll for Gold
description: In this exciting game the players try to get their hands on Blackbeard’s treasure. The action die tells the player in turn which dice to roll: your own or another player’s. The aim is to be the player with the highest score when Blackbeard’s ghost appears and shows where the loot is buried – this player gets a piece of the treasure. Collect the most guineas to win!

name: Crossroads Inn: The Innkeeper's Creed
description:
Crossroads Inn. The Innkeepers' Creed is a fantasy engine-building strategy board game where you embody one of 4 competitive innkeepers, struggling to grow their taverns and attract customers from all over the world.

In the meantime, the medieval kingdom of Yorevale has monarchs die in mysterious circumstances and their illegitimate heirs competing with each other for influence and power.

YOU pursue fame, fortune and renown with your own inn - and perhaps, will have your eyes on the royal crown, too!

BUILD YOUR INN FROM SCRATCH!

Have you ever wondered what goes behind the scenes at a medieval inn in a fantasy world setting? Look no further!

Furnish, hire staff, and cook exquisite meals to satisfy guests from various social groups. Anticipate and block the actions of your rival Players, fellow innkeepers - in the end, there can only be one winner to rule them all!

HOW TO PLAY
⭐ Build Your Inn
⭐ Gain Reputation
⭐ Compete against other Innkeepers

There is plenty of room for good innkeepers in the Kingdom, but only one can rule them all! Compete for fame, fortune, and renown with your own inn - and perhaps, you will have your eyes on the royal crown, too!
categories: Economic, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Income, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Fairy Tale Assassin League: Snow White?  Not Anymore
description:
Fairy Tale Assassin League is a storytelling card game that asks the question: "What happens when Snow White goes to Las Vegas and turns bad?" There are no more happily ever afters.

The game starts with players choosing a fairy tale character; one will be the villain, the remainder good. Each character starts in one of six locations (restaurant, parking lot, theater, stage, kitchen and back alley). The first act of the game is to come up with reasons why the bad guy has to go down. The bad guy starts by bragging about how bad they are. The heroes then say how they have been personally hurt by him. Players can jump in with suggestions for other people’s stories.

The rest of the game is about bringing the villain down (and maybe to justice). The bad guy starts the game. Players take turns to add to the story, assisted by a tableau of scene cards (representing some key point in a revenge story plot) and action cards that can be played from hand. Another player’s version of events can be challenged by playing an action card. Challenges are resolved by rolling dice, with the winner gaining the card their opponent used. All cards are worth victory points.

The aim of the game is to score the most victory points while also telling an interesting story.

Multiple FTAL decks are available, and they can be combined for a larger scale game.

name: Afrikan tähti korttipeli
description:
Afrikan tähti korttipeli is a card game using the theme and artwork of the popular Finnish board game Afrikan tähti (Star of Africa).

It is a simple trick-taking game for 2-5 players, using the numbering and suits of a standard deck plus some special cards. There is also a Solitaire playing option.

name: Animorphs
description:
(From back of box for Set 2: Rachel and Marco)

You've read the hot book series. You've watched the hit TV show on Nickelodeon. Now it's time for YOU to put an end to the Yeerk invasion. IN this 2 player set, one player uses Rachel's deck and the other player plays Marco's deck. With each turn, you decide whether to move or morph. You Team up with other Animorphs to spy on the enemy. You score points only when your strength and smarts are greater than the Yeerks'. The first player to earn 24 points wins the game and... saves the earth from the evil Yeerks... but only for 24 hours.

(Although seemingly marketed as a CCG (back in the days when the first 'C' stood for 'customizable') , the game consisted of two 2-player sets, each a self contained game. There were no boosters.)
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Motala Strom
description:
Motala Strom is a unique 1-dimensional abstract strategy game where one tries to capture all of the opposing pieces, or having your very last piece standing in your home base. The board consists simply of 9 spaces. The game is named after a river in Sweden.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Safetyville
description:
Playing the Safetyville Board Game is a great way to spend time with your children while teaching them important safety information. You too will learn some valuable safety information to help protect your children while they become more safety aware. Be the first player to get to school and become a Safety Graduate for the Day. Keep playing until everyone gets to school. Every player is a winner.

You advance by spinning for the color you will move to if you answer a safety question correctly. There are different skill levels on each card.

The game is approved by the VCA (Vanished Children's Alliance).

name: Laskemme yhdessä
description:
Laskemme yhdessä (We count together)

In this fun game you'll learn elementary mathematics and numbers 1-100 in 4 different languages: Finnish, Swedish, English and German. The game can be also used as a "number dictionary".

name: Snap
description: The Snap deck consists of 60 cards in 4 color suits. The cards are numbered front and back from 1 to 15. The game is played in two phases. In the "cool phase," players draw and discard cards in turn order, with the stipulation that the discarded card must be higher in value than the one drawn. This continues until one player is satisfied with the mix achieved in his/her 7-card hand and calls "Snap." At that point, the "hot phase" begins, with players slapping cards at will - although one at a time - on the discard pile. When two cards with with matching color are placed one over the other, that suit becomes the winning suit. Players then score points for cards of that color in their hand. Players also score for all other cards of any color with numbers matching their winning-suit cards remaining in other players' hands (except for cards valued 10 and above). It is suggested to play as many rounds as players in the game, with the player achieving the most points overall winning.

name: Jolle VM
description: Boat racing game where you make four laps on a sailing course. The three best placements counts as your total. During the race the players will try to answer questions on different sailing terms, flags and so on. A correct answer will give you an advantage in the race.

name: Spökungarna
description:
A simple childrens' memory game themed around ghosts in a haunted house, also useful for learning colors
Each player has a player mat with an image of a haunted house.
Players take turns rolling a colored dice and placing the appropriately colored ghost in their house.

name: Star Wars: Anakins Podrace
description:
The pilots sit in their cockpits, the engines are started and the tension immeasurably rise. Anakin Skywalker is in the podrace of his life! Help Anakin to win this dangerous race.
You use your Jedi Reflexes to copy as fast as possible the current order of the Podracer from the covered panels. Whoever accomplishes this first ends the round and receives 6 points. Other players also gain points depending on how many they could get correct.

Who collects most points in 5 racing rounds, wins!


From german rules:

WORUM GEHT’S?
Die Piloten sitzen in ihren Cockpits, die Triebwerke sind gestartet und die Spannung steigt ins Unermessliche.
Gleich beginnt für Anakin Skywalker das Podrace seines Lebens!
Helft Anakin, dieses gefährliche Rennen zu gewinnen.
Stellt eure Jedi-Reflexe unter Beweis und versucht, möglichst schnell die aktuelle Reihenfolge der Podracer aus den verdeckten Plättchen nachzubilden.
Wer das als Erster schafft, beendet für alle die Runde und erhält 6 Punkte.
Die anderen gehen aber auch nicht leer aus je nachdem, wie viele Plättchen sie bis zu diesem Zeitpunkt in der richtigen Reihenfolge stapeln konnten, gibt es auch für sie Punkte.
Wer in 5 spannenden Runden die meisten Punkte sammelt, gewinnt!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Game of One, Two, Three
description:
To play One, Two, Three, all cards are dealt to players. Counters are equally divided up amongst the players too.

The cards are in sets of three consisting of certain themes. The player who goes first plays a card by placing it in front of him and by reading what it says. The person next to him plays a match to the set, if possible. If he hasn’t a match, he pays a counter to the player who led the card, and the turn passes. The player who plays the ‘third’ card of the set takes the trick, but not before saying a little verse.

If a player holds all three cards, he begins with the first, lets the game go round once to collect counters, and then plays his two cards and takes the trick. Tricks count as one, and twenty win the game. Then at the end of the game, the counters are tallied, and the questions begin!

name: The Goldilocks and the Three Bears Game
description: Another simple children's game in the same vein as Candy Land. It's a race around the board. Spin the spinner and move your pawn to the next matching symbol on the trail. If you land on someone else, they have to move back to the previous space with the same symbol. Continue until someone wins.

name: Slogan
description:
A trivia game about German commercials. The players have to guess/know, which company advertised its products with the slogan in order to get victory points.

The active player chooses one of the two slogans on the current card and asks the player to his left after betting up to 3 chips from his own supply. If the asked player is able to answer correctly he get the chips and moves as many fields on the board as he has just gained. If the question is not answered correctly the player who asked the question may keep his chips and move accordingly.

When a player is not able to answer a question he may call for a chance card ("Spießer Alfons"-Card) or ask for a hint.

Whoever has the most chips at the end of the game is the winner.
publishers: Diset S. A., Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: When Good Neighbors...Go Bad...
description:
The object of When Good Neighbors Go Bad is to aggravate all of your neighbors sufficiently that they sell their houses an move out of the neighborhood. Game play proceeds with the players going to work, making purchases (with the intent of inflaming their nosy neighbors), and engaging in anti-social activities.

Each person is assigned a specific neighbor-type and each has a special ability:
The Po' White Trash - can burn any item they possess at the end of the turn (the more smell the more aggravation).
The Yuppies - can call the cops once each turn on any other player for no apparent reason.
The Old Farts - are able to make any single item illegal at the end of their turn.
The Danged Furiners - can barbecue the neighbors pets.
The Psycho Neighbors - can shoot up to four items anywhere on the board.
The Eco-Nazis - do not require a vehicle to move around the board.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Crosse
description: A sort of reverse checkers game where you attempt to have all of your pieces jumped by the opponent. In the middle of the board sits the Crosse which you must go around. Covering the corners of the Crosse allows you to remove your entire back row and go again. Moves are forward and backward 1 to 3 spaces determined by a dice roll.

name: Turtle In Turtle Out
description: A memory game for small children (Ages 3 - 6). After spinning a disk to determine if the turtle is In or Out, the player decides the color of the shell (s)he is looking for. If correct, the winner gets a token returned, the turtle back upside down and the next player gets to try. There is also a shuffle circle which can be swapped with any of the face down turtles.

name: Jurassic Jeopardy
description:
A game of Stats and Strategy. Players are dealt a deck of cards. Each card is a different dinosaur with five different stats.
The game starts to the player to the left of the dealer. The players whose turn it is play there top card and reads off a stat from it. Each other player then shows their top card and reads off the corresponding stat. The player with the highest value stat then collects all the other cards and places them at the bottom of their deck.
The game then proceeds by moving counter-clockwise with the next player revealing their top card and announcing a stat. Game continues until there are only two players left. At which cards are discarded rather than collected.

name: About Faces
description:
From the publisher’s web site:

"In this hilarious game the players try to imagine what other people and animals are like, judging merely by their faces. The first rounds are played with comical men’s faces, after that come the women’s faces and finally the animal faces. On each round one player acts as the judge and reads aloud one description card, which may state something hilarious like ‘the one who swears a lot’. Each player chooses from 5 faces the one that best matches the description they just heard. The winning choice is the face chosen by the judge, and the winners on each round get to move their playing pieces forward. The first player to reach the goal wins this totally crazy and extremely entertaining game!"

name: Suit Up
description: Similar to CoCoCo's kid's game Face-it, Suit Up has 36 card tiles that players place on a 6-by-6 grid. Play one tile at a time from a hand of 4. Try to connect tiles of the same suit to collect the most chips from the opponent on your right. The whole game fits in a handy 7 x 5 1/2 inch travel bag that's included.

name: bolo' bolo: Eine Welt ohne Geld
description:
From the back of the box, roughly translated:

At last a game with a future we can pursue: a new world with new qualities. A world without daily work routines, traffic jams, bureaucracy, deforestation, and hunger problems. A world with more exchanges, more experiences, and more human interaction. Better improvements can not be hoped for: more money and more consumption, yet more renunciation. Improvements today which are more friendly to life will produce more cultural riches, and more exchanges between all. This is all with a minimal burden on the environment and a maximum amount of self-determination. Put an end to the monopoly!

You choose a new homeland, a new Bolo. Every Bolo has a special way of life and is nearby. The organization of your chosen community needs you to bring it goods. You obtain distinct items during the course of the game. Any surplus produced in your own Bolo is trade able with other players. Every exchange offers a new experience. Also, every visit to another Bolo brings new knowledge.

Which Bolo should be judged to be first? Last can quickly become first, as when someone has attained a new innovation, it can quickly be shared with the rest of the collective through visits and the cultural exchanges that result!

---

bolo' bolo is game designer / Anarchist P.M.'s second foray into political board games, with his first being the cult tile laying favourite Demono. bolo' bolo is based upon the book of the same name which lays out P.M.'s ideal society based upon sub-communities, each autonomous, with an economy fueled by trade.

Game components are in both German and French, and are rather archaic with the 'cards' being coloured paper with black ink style drawings, absolutely nothing like Demono's more lush visuals.

The basic idea of the title is that each player represents one of the "bolos" on the board, each of which specialises in the production of certain things, and which needs certain others, which is accomplished via trade.

name: Byråkrat
description: Racing game with bluffing mechanics, where you don´t win if you win the race. Instead you aim to move as little as possible and try to be the last person remaining on the game board.

name: Monopoly: Edição Sporting
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a Monopoly edition dedicated to one of the best Portuguese football (soccer) teams.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dragon Wars
description:
Dragon Wars is a card game included in the RPG aid, Dragonlance Saga Fate Deck. While the main purpose of the Fate Deck is to play an RPG using the Saga system, the deck includes rules for a stand-alone card game, Dragon Wars. The RPG rules included in the game are credited to Steven Brown, Steve Miller, and Ed Stark, but no designer is mentioned for Dragon Wars.

The deck consists of 82 cards: eight suits numbered 1-9 and one suit (dragons) numbered 1-10. To play, the dragons are removed from the deck and shuffled. Every player gets one dragon. The remaining 72 cards are shuffled and six are dealt to each player.

Three of the suits are attacking suits, three are defending suits, and two suits may be used for either. On your turn, you attack a dragon of your choice (but not your own!) by playing attack cards. The owner responds by playing defense cards. The attacker may continue the attack if he has more of the same suit he started with. If he does, the defender may defend with any defensive suit. Once the attacker calls a halt, subtract defense cards from attack cards. If the number is positive, the dragon takes that many hits. (Each dragon has a number of hit points equal to the number on the card.) Dead dragons are placed in the attacking player's victory point pile, and the defender draws a new dragon to defend, if there are any left.

Rules are provided for "despoilers" - players whose last dragon is removed after the dragon deck has run out. (In a ten-player game, that's always!) The game ends one round after there is only one dragon left in play: everyone else has one turn to try to defeat it. The numbers on the dragon cards are VP.

name: The Balkans 1999
description:
From the website:

"NATO air strikes have failed to stop the mass killings in Kosovo or force the Milosovic government to sue for peace. NATO and US forces feel that the only way to stop the "ethnic cleansing" in Kosovo is to launch a ground campaign against Serbian forces to not only liberate Kosovo, but to bring about regime change in the Milosovic government. Meanwhile in the east, Russia refuses to sit idle while an old ally is attacked by outsiders and begins to bring "volunteer forces" into the area. Who will win this showdown in the Balkans?"

For this, you'll be provided with the game's mapsheets, rules, charts, etc., while you will utilize the components from Axis & Allies or related games.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
description:
After the animated series "Captain Planet". Gaia wakes up and sees planet earth in trouble. Captain planet and his five teammates from all continents try to work against some eco-villains who pollute the planet. Gaia gives the players magical rings and they identify with one of five elements and powers.
The figures now move around the different environments like mountains, towns etc. cleaning up the pollution (litter, smog, ...) by appropriate Earth Saver cards.
Sometimes Captain Planet helps doubling their efforts, but the Eco-villains also create more pollution, so the players try to put them to jail ...

Sometimes co-operative game for children from 6 to 12 years.
publishers: Parker Brothers, Parker Spiele, Remoundo, University Games

name: The War to End All Wars: The Great War in Africa
description:
This is an expansion to The War to End All Wars: Box Set Edition that can be played as a stand-alone game or combined with the base game. The game comes with a 17" x 22" map of central and southern Africa, an 11" x 17" black & white map of South America, a 16 page Rule & Scenario booklet, a score pad with 30 nation sheets, 1D10, around 120 plastic unit stands, card stock land & sea units for:
-- British Colonies & Empire
-- French Colonies & Empire
-- German Colonies & Empire
-- Belgian Congo
-- Portuguese Colonies
-- Argentina
-- Brazil
-- Neutrals
-- Ports, Ind. Complexes, Trenches, & Misc.
-- Generals, Resource Chits, Incorp. Markers

Expands:

The War to End All Wars: Box Set Edition

name: Dark Realm of Dracula
description:
A family level game set on a floor plan of Dracula's Castle.
Players play one of two sides. Dracula and his minions, Renfield and a generic vampire, are trying to lure a young maiden all the way to Dracula's coffin hidden in the dungeon within his castle.
The castle visitors, the maiden, boyfriend and doctor, are trying to protect the maiden and eventually kill Dracula with a stake at his hidden coffin. The visitors mainly have to collect cards at the card deck spaces that provide stakes, defensive crosses, and keys to access the secret hallways and dungeon.

name: Mindrubble
description:
Mindrubble is a combination of abstract gaming and trivia games. That is: to make a move on the board, you have to answer a trivia question first. The game has 400 question cards in 3 categories: numbers, cities, people. Furthermore there is a board with a 8x8 grid, containing symbols of the 3 categories and 64 chips, grey on one side, black on the other.

Before starting the game 2 gray and 2 black chips are placed in the middle of the board. If you have 4 players, you'll play in 2 teams. On your turn you place a chip in your color on the board next to one of your opponent. Your goal is to capture your opponents chips.

How is that done? First you try to close your opponents chips in. For that you need to have your chips on both sides of your opponents. This can be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. Then you try and capture the chip(s) by answering a question. When answered correct, the opponents chip(s) are turned over. When answered incorrect, nothing happens and your opponent takes his/her turn.

The game ends when the board is full or when no player can place a chip or when all chips are one color. The player with the most chips up, wins.

name: Op naar de Top
description:
Op Naar de Top / Fol escalade is based on the Spider Wars. But this version is focused more on luck and risk taking. This is a game about mountain climbing. The game is mainly aimed at a very young target group. Each player has a mountain climber, the objective is to reach the top first.

Players climb on the different sides of mountain and try to reach on top first while pushing down opponent.

A wheel indicates which hole you can fill with hand or foot of Your climber. Its smart to cling to the rock by at least three supports, but you can take risks if you are foolish. During that time, your opponent climbs the other side. It can use one of your shots, which is not dramatic ... unless it was your last shot!

The player who reach first top of the moauntain is the winner.

name: Casper the Friendly Ghost Game
description:
"WHEN CASPER LIGHTS UP, YOU WIN A CHIP"

From the box:

A game of chance based on the popular, lovable Casper character. Players compete to win chips by making Casper light up. All parts glow in the dark. Requires one AA-type battery.

Each player is given a 'spooky stone' (a piece of molded plastic with four symmetrically positioned holes); Casper and the chips are placed in the center of the playing area. A turn simply comprises placing Casper on any other player's spooky stone. If he lights up, the player wins a chip. The player may elect to stop and keep the chip won, or risk it and try Casper on a different player's spooky stone. This may be repeated a third and final time, but if Casper fails to light up at any stage the player's turn is over and all chips won that turn are returned to the center pile.

The first player to win four chips wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Action Games and Toys Ltd, Irwin Toy Ltd., Schaper

name: Bä bä vita lamm
description:
Swedish children´s game. The 36 wooden tiles each show either the front or the back of a lamb on a colored background, so that the tiles match up into 18 lambs with a red background, a green background etc. Players roll the die and turn up tiles. When two tiles match the player may take that lamb. There are black lambs to mess things up. If the die shows the picture of a lamb, the first player to sound like a lamb may take one lamb from any player. The player with the most lambs is the winner.

Contents:

36 wooden tiles
Die
Rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: '84 L.A. Games
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Unofficial Monopoly clone (with a circular board) using locations related to the 1984 Olympics.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Conni feiert Geburtstag
description:
Conni is having a birthday and all of her friends are invited. Come to the party with them!

Her mother has baked a delicious cake. Everyone wants a piece of it, but only those that have a place at the table with Conni can get a piece of cake.

The clock is set and it begins! This game requires observation and quick reactions.

Contents:

A real clock with bell
5 wooden dice
1 sticker
30 Birthday guests
6 plates
1 Birthday table
1 Little-hippo chip
Instructions



Conni hat Geburtstag und alle ihre Freunde sind eingeladen. Feiert mit !

Ihre Mama hate einen leckeren Kuchen gebacken. Alle wollen etwas davon haben, doch nur, wer einen Platz am Tisch mit Conni ergattert, bekommt ein Stück vom Kuchen ab.

Die Zeit-Uhr wird gestellt und los geht`s ! Bei diesem Spiel sind genaues Schauen und eine schnelle Reaktion gefragt !

Inhalt:

1 echte Zeituhr mit Kuchendruck
5 Holzwürfel
1 Aufkleberbogen
30 Geburtstagsgäste
6 Krümel-Teller
1 Geburtstagstisch
1 Seepferdchen-Chip
1 Anleitung

name: International Grand Prix Magnetic Road Race Game
description:
"Completely self-contained... just remove cover and PLAY. Magnetic cars stick to special game board." - From front of box

Spin and move racing game with magnetic cars that stick to the track.

name: Barbapapas kurragömma
description:
Everyone starts at Barbapapas house in the center of the board and gets a card with an animal on it.
The object of the game is to find the Barbapapa figure that has been transformed into the animal on your card, and then return to the house in the center of the board. The nine different Barbapapa figures are placed on the board with the card faces down.
Movement consists of rolling a die and moving. There are spaces on the board that will cause the playing piece to be moved to another space when it is landed upon.
The game is aimed at children, from about 5 years of age. It is very simple, but an easy to learn entry game.
publishers: Alga, K. Hjelm Förlag AB, Oy Fenno-Alga Ab

name: Ben 10: Aliens vs. Villains
description:
From the box:

'Use the powers of thge Omnitrix to defeat Vilgax and other intergalactic villains!'

Let the challenges begin as you travel along the game board until you land on a villain. Can you become the alien you need to be to defeat it? Use the Omnitrix card and you'll see what alien you are. If it has the power number you need, the battle begins! If you're victorious you take the villain. The first player to defeat four villains wins...but watch out! If one of your opponents gets a malfunction card, they may use it against you later in the game to make you lose a turn.

Contents:
Game board
Omnitrix card
34 alien/malfunction cards
18 villain cards
4 movers
4 mover stands
2 dice
label sheet
instructions

For 2-4 players, ages 7 and up.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction

name: Beatrix Potter's Rummy
description:
This is a very simple rummy type game for young children.

The deck consists of 44 cards. 14 sets of 3 identical cards each, plus 2 signpost cards to be used as wilds. Deal 6 cards to each player with a draw deck in the middle. Turn over the top card to form the discard pile. Each player's turn consists of drawing 1 card and discarding a card. A player will always have only 6 cards either in hand or in matching sets laid down in front of him. When players have formed sets in their hands by drawing and discarding, they may lay them down face up. The first player to have 2 full sets in front of him is the winner of the hand.
publishers: Frederick Warne, Gibson Game Company, Gibsons, Pepys (Castell Brothers)

name: Meistarinn
description: A trivia game based on the tv show Meistarinn (The Maestro). In the tv show, two participants are pitted against each other trying to win the grand prize. The game is for 2-4 players but uses similar rules as the tv show.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: 123 Rooster's Off to See the World Game
description:
Inspired by Eric Carle's Rooster's Off to See the World book, children join the rooster and his friends on a fun-filled adventure learning the meaning of numbers. This game introduces players to number recognition and counting in a fun and simple way.

Once young players are comfortable with counting animals, the double sided game board introduces them to simple addition and subtraction.

Contents include Game Board, 60 Animal/Number Tiles, 4 Sun/Moon Tiles, Spinner & Instructions. For 2 to 4 players, ages 3 & up.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Novel-based, Number

name: Pitch Machine
description:
The National Broadcasting System is in dire straights for this season. They’ve got an entire schedule that’s totally empty. No shows, no demographics, and that means no money. 2 to 4 players are all executives and creating shows is as easy as finding gimmicks to already-crafted genres and tying that into a demographic. Just like the CW.

The goal of the game is to create the highest-scoring television shows on the lineup before anyone other player does. Television shows consist of three types of cards: Genres, Gimmicks and Demographics. There are also Wrench cards that can shake up the schedule, shake up hands and keep the game lively and interesting.
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Modern Architecture Game
description:
Do you know who came up with tower-to-park urbanism? Who designed the first skyscraper? Who wrote Delirious New York? The Modern Architecture Game, designed by Amsterdam-based NEXTarchitects, lets players test their architectural knowledge, competing for the right to wear Le Corbusier’s iconic round-rimmed glasses.

Containing almost a 1000 questions, the Modern Architecture Game provides the base for an evening full of insights in the world's most famous architects, buildings and trends of the Western architecture, all through the roll of a dice. The goal is simple: To reach the heart of the board before anyone else. This is done by moving your way through questions of six different categories: Visuals, Architect, Project, Style, Influence and Quote.

The Modern Architecture Game is the second edition of the architecture game. The first edition was launched on 30 August 1999. It was the first project collaboration involving the four partners at NEXT architects and was distributed in the private environment of Delft University of Technology.

Ten years later, we've produced a revised version of the game, analytically unravelled and improved. This edition is an international version, in the sense that it is produced in English, but also that the questions range right across the breadth of modern world history.

This means that many of the questions about the Netherlands that were abundant in the first version have been dropped, unless they were significant in relation to world-wide developments. By introducing these changes, we have endeavoured to make the game suitable for an extremely broad and international group of architecture enthusiasts.

Test your knowledge of the greatest architects, their famous buildings and legendary quotes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Joker of Spades
description:
A Joker was sent to prison because he called the queen fat. He's had a week to think about it, and he's decided to try to break out. The game uses the Aces and Faces to create the board. Aces represent traps, while Kings, Queens, and Jacks represent guards. The goal of the game is to find the Ace of Spades, a powerful and intricate trap like none other. It's the only exit from the dungeons the Joker can take if he wants to live out the rest of his life in freedom.

The game is played by a simple layout of cards in a 4 by 4 square. The joker starts in the bottom left corner, and moves one card at a time. Each card represents a room, each room contains a guard or trap. Using the number cards in your hand to match the values on each trap or guard's room, you can deal with each room accordingly. The goal is to find the Ace of spades among the rooms and disarm the trap it represents.

name: Mysterious Creatures
description: Mysterious Creatures was created to engage player's curiosity in the mysteries of nature that exist across the world. The game takes each player on an adventure/race across the globe in search of their creature's evidence cards. The first player to collect all 3 evidence cards and make it back to their creature's country of origin wins! Along the way players will learn geography, country flags and multiple creatures such as Big Foot.

name: Monopoly: Olympic Games Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Olympic Games 2012 in London, United Kingdom, equipped with special tokens.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Baa Baa
description:
A simple colour matching game with spinner-based play by Orchard Toys.

Each player takes a field board with six coloured spots on it. Players then take it in turns to spin. If a colour matching a spot on their board comes up, they take a sheep stand-up wearing that colour and place it on the appropriate spot on their board.

The player who fills their board with six sheep first is the winner.

There is a wildcard spot on the spinner, allowing players to choose the colour themselves.

From the back of the box:
"Can you be the first to collect all of your sheep?
Gather your flock in this fun colour matching game for young players!"

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Hoth
description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Monster High: Horror Scopes Game
description:
Monster High Horror-Scopes Game: Be the winning player who gets to read her Horror-Scope card aloud to all the players.

Draw a Situation Card and read it aloud. All players mark how they would answer the question: "A, B or C" on their pegboard (for Row 1). Players compare answers. The next player repeats this process and players mark their answers in Row 2, continuing until 5 cards have been read and answered.

Now the first player rolls the oracle die to see what the oracle's answer to question 1 is. If you match, you keep your peg, if not the peg is removed. Each answer is checked against the oracle die. Then the players add up their pegs. The player who is the most "Clairvoyantly-correct" is rewarded with a special Horror-scope. Slip it in the Ghost Decoder and the message magically appears. Fun game for slumber parties with the ghouls!
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Med näbbar och klor
description:
Swedish educational game for children. Literal translation: "With beaks and claws".

Simple trivia game focused on the natural sciences, with a hand management element thrown in as a twist.

Players play movement cards from their hands with the object of being the first to reach the finish line. When you run out of cards, or simply don't want to move further, you may take a trivia challenge in order to get more movement cards. The type of question or "mission" is determined by the space that the player currently occupies.

name: New Sakura
description:
New Sakura is a card game in the shape of a cherry blossom based on the cherry blossoms that represent Japan. You can play three game rules with one product.

Playing rules 1 is a game for two people.
The player who plays the highest cards, gains the played cards. Gained cards are lined up as your flower.
You play 3 times, until no one has cards left. The dealer role shifts, and a new round begins. The flowers are kept between rounds.
After the fourth round, the player with the most flowers wins.
Enjoy the bargains created by the relationship between the cards known to your opponent and the cards you face down.

Playing rules 2 is a game for 2 to 6 people
You will create a flower with 5 petals, each with a number 1–4.
When everyone has used up their hand, the player with the lowest difference between their petal number total and their center number chip, is the winner.
You play three deals, and the player who has won the most times wins.
Please aim at your numbers while trying to get in the way who guesses what numbers all players have in the same conditions

Playing rules 3 is a game for 3 to 6 people
On a turn, you can play one card to the table to start a new bloom (with up to three blooms being in play at once), add one or more matching cards to an existing bloom (with no more than five cards in the bloom), play a special card, or (if you can't play anything) discard one card, then draw one. If you place the fifth card in a bloom, remove those cards, then play one standard card to start a new bloom.

The first player to empty their hand of cards wins!

In the advanced game, continue play until two players have emptied their hands, with the first player scoring 2 points and the second player 1 point. Play multiple rounds, and the player who first has 5 points wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Coral Relief
description:
This is one of the games featured in Dice & Ink: A Roll & Write Anthology, and exists as part of that compilation.

In Coral Relief, seed and grow coral, attract diverse species to your reef for bonuses and abilities, and control outbreaks of the destructive Crown-of-Thorns Starfish! This is a pattern building game with the added bonus of being able to grow your pattern!

On your turn:

Roll the dice for everyone to use: and decide how the dice are used in your reef:
Two dice develop your reef; die results of 1-4 seed or grow coral to the next stage and results of 5-6 open up special powers.
The final die determines where the crown-of-thorns starfish strikes.
Seems pretty simple right? Not so fast! To attract different species with their own powers, you need to build patterns of coral. Will you be able to attract the right species for the powers you want, will you gain the rare diversity bonus, or will the crown-of-thorns starfish get the best of your reef?

Coral Relief requires three standard six-sided dice in three different colors. Components include one player sheet per player, and one shared diversity sheet per game.

—description from the publisher

name: Magical Unicorn: Adventure Bones Game
description:
You’ll love Magical Unicorn Adventure Bones, a game of chance where any player can win. Fun for the whole family, it features two levels of play!

Magical Unicorn Adventure Bones – it’s the game you’ll want to take with you wherever you go!

THIS GAME INCLUDES:
11 BONE-SHAPED DICE WITH 6 UNIQUE PIPS
40 UNICORN DISKS TO COLLECT
STANDARD & ADVANCED RULES

ADVENTURE BONES ORIGIN STORY
Back in prehistoric times, there was little to do other than hunt dinosaurs or invent the wheel. One evening, a caveman sat near his newly-discovered fire, snacking on a Microraptor. Spitting out one of the tiny bones, he laughed as it rolled and bounced along the ground, thoroughly entertained. Thus, the idea of Adventure Bones was conceived. Evolving throughout the ages, it is now a game enjoyed by all!

name: The Hiawathas
description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, The Hiawathas is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1830 game system, this variant allows you to draw track instead of placing track tiles. You’ll need a copy of 1830 to play this game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Connections, Line Drawing, Market, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Inns & Taverns
description:
2 players (or 4 players playing as partners) each start out with 6 bidding chips, numbered 1 to 6. You and the player to your left simultaneously reveal their chips. The player whose turn it is then gets to move his pawn a number of spaces, either forward or backward (his choice) equal to the difference between the two bids. If it's a tie, the player can't move.

The board is a 25-space track of famous English Inns & Taverns. The game starts with each space having a corresponding coaster with the Inn name on it. If you move onto a space with a coaster still on it, you take the coaster. Then the next player goes, bidding against the player to his left. As the bidding goes round and round, eventually each player has used all 6 of his bid-chips. They then take them all back into their hand, and start fresh. First player to get to space 25 then gets to take all the remaining coasters still on the board.

The player (or partnership) with the most coasters wins the game.

name: WWE Smackdown CCG
description:
This collectible card game includes 120 cards. The cards depict WWE Smackdown and Raw champions, with the athlete characteristics, finishing moves, etc. On the back of every athlete card there are his wrestling abilities such as Strength, Agility, Technique, Hit points.
Other cards depict the wrestling moves(i.e. Ray Mysterio's 619) and various hits to use in the match.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Real Dumb Laws
description: Can you guess which dumb law is the real dumb law? Based on the book 101 Real Dumb Laws, this board game will bring you laughs and amazement as you uncover real laws from all across the country! At the start of each round, players are read the beginning of a law and given four choices -- only one of which is correct. Think you know the answer? If you're right, you get to move ahead on the game board. Get it wrong and any player can take a risk and try to answer correctly. You'll be surprised, amazed and sometimes just bewildered at the dumb laws that really exist.

name: Trivial Pursuit: Chocolate Edition
description: Trivial Pursuit - Chocolate Edition is a very simple implementation of the traditional Trivial Pursuit game. The game proceeds in turns taken in clockwise order. On your turn, the player to your right will ask you the questions. The question cards in this case are actually chocolate bites in paper wrap (on which the questions are written). The player who knows the answer to both questions on one card / bite gets it (and presumably digests it, as well). If an answer was wrong, the card is returned into the box. The player with the most correct answers in the end of the game is the winner, and is awarded the golden prize (which is made of chocolate, of course).

name: Lay it or Break it
description:
Get into this crazy race where you try to save eggs from the frying pan and take them back to the safety of their nest. Two players, at the same time, will try to move the eggs without breaking them. Use the Chicken Magnets to carefully lift the eggs and take them back to the nest. The player with the most unbroken eggs will be the winner!

Players each clip the magnet, dangling by a string, to their belt/waistband, like a tail. They squat and pick up an egg from the pile in the frying pan. Then, carefully, they walk/waddle over to their "nest", and gently, without using their hands, use the nest to separate the egg from the magnet. If the egg drops, it will break apart, and the yolk will spill out. Players compete to rescue the most eggs.

name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
description:
Enter the world of fairy tales.

Players move across the board which tells the story of Snow White. The first to make it to the end wins.

This is a very simple game that small children will be able to understand and enjoy.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mini Don't Break the Ice
description:
From the instruction booklet:

Object
The player to collect the most fish before the ice is broken wins the game.

Contents
-4 tiles with 2 fish on them
-12 tiles with 1 fish on them
-1 penguin tile
-1 broken ice tile
-1 Skating Bear pawn with stand
-Instruction booklet

Setup
1. Remove one 1-fish tile and one 2-fish tile from the game. Shuffle the remaining 16 tiles and arrange them picture side down in a 4x4 grid.
2. Place the Skating Bear next to the tile grid.

Gameplay
1. Youngest player goes first. Place the Skating Bear on any tile.
2. Lift up the bear and turn over the tile. If you see a picture of one or two fish on the tile place it in front of you.
3. Place the Skating Bear in the empty space for the next player to move.
4. Play continues to the left following the same game play.

Turning over the Penguin tile
If you turn over the penguin you must give up one of your fish tiles. Take the tile and put it aside out of play. Your turn is over.

Turning over the Broken Ice tile
If at any time during the game a player turns over the broken ice tile, the game is over. Each player now counts all the fish pictured on their tiles.

Winning
The player with the most fish wins the game. If there is a tie for the most fish then all tied players are winners!

Optional Gameplay
For a quicker game, try a 3x3 tile grid but remember to keep the penguin and broken ice tile in the grid.

Restorage
Save your package because after you play the game you can put all the parts back in the bag and reseal it.

name: Bible Authors
description:
This is a "rummy" type game, with elements of "Go Fish" that involves cards with Bible characters and verses on them. The 44 card deck (11 books with 4 cards each) is shuffled among the players and they ask each other for certain characters or books to complete sets. First published in 1895 but still seems to have versions up through the 20th. century.

There is at least one other version from the same publisher with the same box that has 56 cards, 14 books of 4 cards.

name: Hadronen: Big Bang kaartspel 1
description: Game consists of 54 cards depicting quarks and antiquarks of the various colors. Players are manifestations of the Strong force soon after the onset of the Big Bang with the goal of collecting sets of quarks to form baryons and mesons to score points. Sorry, no leptons in the game! This is an educational game provided by a Dutch high-energy physicist to help players understand the structures of the fundamental building blocks of nature.

name: Sperre
description: Everybody must reach the center of the board with 2 tokens. The players want to stop you by laying barricades in your way.

name: Donny & Marie Osmond TV Show Game
description: In this game for children Ages 7 - 12, players pretend to be television performers on tour. The object of the game is to win the top star award reaching the finish line with at least $10,000.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Influencers in the Wild: The Game
description:
Influencers in the Wild is the social social media game. Do you meet the minimal requirements necessary to entertain the masses? Now you get to find out!

When it comes to your social media following, more is more. So how do you grow? Simple: travel the world, ruin every moment with incessant content creation, and we cannot emphasize this enough, overestimate your own talent. So go ahead, chase those likes like your detox tea sponsorship depends on it, because it does.

All players begin on START and make their way around the board one roll of the die at a time. Gain and lose followers along the way by completing challenges, going viral, and proving your influence by making it to the “big pink wall” in Los Angeles. Just like in real life, the player with the most followers wins! (Sarcasm font).

This game has adult content and was created for ages 17+
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Catch the Leader, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Lose a Turn, Point to Point Movement

name: Spongebob Squarepants Card Game
description: The Krusty Krab is giving out an employee of the month award. To earn that title, you must collect the most customer cards. You need a restaurant and a server first, then you can lay down customer cards with like backgrounds for each set of the former two. Plankton cards can be used to protect or steal customers. When the deck is depleted, the player with the most customer cards wins.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shifty Gear
description: Build a train of gears from your starting corner across to your "winner" gear. Roll the die to select a gear numbered one to six and place it anywhere on the board. The first player that can turn their starting gear and expose the "winner" flag wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Young Reader's Bible Trivia Game
description: Now even young members of your family can put their Bible knowledge to the test with The Young Reader's Bible Trivia Game. Players answer basic Bible questions and collect tokens for each correct answer. On the underside of each token you will find one, two, or three stars. Once all the tokens have been collected, the players count up the number of stars on their tokens. The player with the most stars is the winner.

name: Monopoly: Stuttgart
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Stuttgart, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Olympia
description:
Olympia, the official game of the 1972 Olympics in München, Germany, is a dice rolling racing game. The board depicts the emblem of the München Olympic Games. First person to move two tokens from the periphery to the middle of the board is the winner.

Olympia is part of the Ravensburger Casino Series, a ‘bookshelf’ line of games published in the Seventies.

name: Rise of the Red Army
description:
"The Rise of the Red Army is a territorial strategy game covering the Russian Revolution following World War I. Historical representation of the Bolshevik, Siberian, and Crimean factions, including the Polish invasion of Russia, Japanese occupation, and independence movements from Finland and the Baltic States."

The game comes in a small box, with two large folded (very folded) semi-laminated maps. The components are plastic poker chips with stickers the players affix themselves.

The rules are closely based on Axis and Allies. Each player plays one or more nations, each varying in size and power. There is much greater variation in starting power and capabilities in this game than there is in Axis and Allies. The Bolsheviks control numerous units and a vast swath of territories, while other nations begin with only a handful of each. This imbalance in power is offset by the setting of different victory conditions for each nation. Furthermore, the victory conditions vary depending on how many players are playing and what nations they each control.

Resource collection rules are basically the same as Axis and Allies, (the generic "resources" are equivalent to the "IPC's" from Axis and Allies, i.e. each territory is worth a certain number of resources) with slight variations for some nations. For example, the Northern and Crimean White Russian forces gain extra resources if they keep control of their ports (representing aid from the U.K., U.S., and France), while the Bolsheviks and Ukrainian Anarchists gain extra resources from any of the core Russian areas they control (representing support from the local populace).

Combat rules also follow Axis and Allies, with some extra rules for trenches (which aid defense), bi-planes (very weak in the game), generals (who can add their "combat factors" to any units they share an area with when attacking or defending), etc. Ten-sided dice are used for combat. Certain nations, such as the Bolsheviks, Poles, and Ukrainians, have more effective infantry than others. The handful of Czech infantry controlled by the Siberian White Russians also gain bonuses in combat.

After combat, players must spend resources to "incorporate" the territories they conquer. Only after a territory has been incorporated can the new owner collect resources from it.

The number of territories on the map is enormous. This increases tactical opportunities, but it would seem that this could make resource collection somewhat onerous for some nations. While the Poles begin the game with 31 resources, the Bolsheviks begin with 306! Of course, the Bolsheviks are under attack from nearly every direction, so they need the bonus.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Crossfire Hurricane: The Battle of Long Than – August 1966
description: The 6th Battalion, Royal Australian Regiment was composed mainly of conscript soldiers. The Viet Cong D445 Local Force Battalion had dominance in this area but the Australians were increasing their activity. Most contacts with the Viet Cong were small squads and so Australian doctrine was to carry light loads and attack aggressively. The local Viet Cong commander, Colonel Nguyen Than Hong, aimed to make a large attack on 6th Bn causing a politically unacceptable loss, hoping to cause its withdrawal. The Viet Cong 275 Regiment moved south intending to attack. The VC continually formed assault waves and moved forward but were decimated by artillery fire. The soldiers of D Company showed excellent discipline holding their line and repulsing any VC that got through the artillery barrage. D Company were supported by 24 105mm and 155mm guns from Australian, New Zealand artillery units and the US 2/35 Battalion, which fired deeper into VC positions. Over 3,000 rounds of artillery were fired. The Australian A Battery fired rounds every 15 seconds for three hours. The VC were decimated with over 500 killed and 750 wounded. Australian losses were 18 killed and 24 wounded.

name: Royal
description: This is a boardgame that uses a regular deck of cards. Players have pieces representative of the face cards in the deck. Spot on the board are blank or marked with suits. Pieces are moved by use of cards (double value with suit matching the player). Players can send others' pieces back to their start positions, but not if the pieces are sitting on squares of their own suit.

name: Dame Bleue
description: The card game Dame Bleue lets you plunge into the Celtic age, during gatherings of Gallic tribes in the honor of the fairy. You are going to direct a clan. Your various characters face those of the other players. Characteristic values are of vitality, skill and wisdom, each noted on the cards. To easy understandable rules (standard/expert)are added tactical deepness by magic items, the respect of weakest as well as an unforeseeable and fairy-like dimension is brought into by the magic of the blue Lady cards.

name: Sports Illustrated Trivia Game: Multi-Sport Edition
description: Players attempt to answer sports trivia in 10 different categories: Baseball, Basketball, Football, Golf, Hockey, Motor Sports, Tennis, Olympics, Boxing, and Wild Card. Each trivia card is divided into five levels of difficulty, and the first player to correctly answer 15 questions wins the game.

name: Wedrenspel
description: Wedrenspel is a Dutch vintage game about horse riding, it was released either in the '50s or '60s. The game contains a board with an oval racetrack on it and 6 wooden horses that represent the pawns.

name: Bob the Builder Race Game
description:
This exciting race game is full of the everyday adventures of Bob The Builder and his friends. Fixing, building and rescuing are all in a days work, join him in his adventures to get all his jobs done before he goes home.

As you race around the board you will come across some obstacles which will help and hinder you. The aim of the game is to be the first Bob to get home after finishing all your jobs.

name: Rugby Challenge
description:
This game is simulates a rugby competition involving 2 to 4 players. It is a quick little game, where players are in charge of two rugby teams they must lead to the final.
Players put attacking cards which the opponents must counter before attacking themselves. When an opponent cannot counter and attack, the match is won by the attacking player, and the next match in the competition is played.

name: LEGO/Duplo Little Forest Friends Counting Game
description: Players build stacks of Lego Duplo blocks to reach berries. First one to return to the start space with the required number of blocks, wins. Three ways to play using counting, addition or subtraction.

name: 6 Steps
description:
Contents include: two pencils, two standard dice, one shaker cup, and a pad of score sheets.

The score sheet has a staggered (steps) grid of six rows with the numbers one through 6. The players take turns rolling the dice, and if available, circle a number on their score sheet. For example, if a player rolls a three and a six, they can circle the number 6 on the third row, or the number 3 on the sixth row. If both possibilities have already been selected, they must cross off any available remaining number of their choosing left on their score sheet.

The game ends when all players' score sheets have all numbers either circled or crossed off, all of any single number have been circled, all of any row have been circled, or the one vertical row which contains the numbers 1 to 6 has been completely circled.

The players then total the circled numbers in each row and total each row. Then they add any bonus points they may have received for a complete row, diagonal, or column. The player with the most total points wins.

name: Grand Prix
description: From the back of the gamebox. From British Game Publisher Heritage Games Ltd. A fast moving racing game. Avoid the hazards along the track and be the first past the finish post. Beware of the pitfalls which could send you straight back to start the race again. Family Fun for 2 to 4 players. Game contains Race Track, 4 Racing Cars and dice. The game board features spaces where either good things or bad things can happen to your race car. Those hazards must be overcome in order to win the race.
publishers: Heritage Toy & Game Co. Ltd., Nohro ApS, Retro Range Toys and Games, Søstrene Grene

name: Back to the Future
description:
A simple roll-and-move game themed around the Back to the Future movie. Produced and made available in the UK by Smiths Crisps, a snack food company.

From the front cover:

"Marty McFly, a senior of Hill Valley School was late for class. After that night, however, when he climbed behind the wheel of a nuclear powered time machine car invented by eccentric scientist Dr. Emmett Brown, he wouldn't be late for anything. In fact, he was 30 years too early.

Marty traveled back in time to 1955 just as the town clock was showing 4 minutes past 10 o'clock in the evening. After hiding the car and cautiously walking through his home town, Marty meets up with Lorraine Baines and George McFly - the two teenagers who are later to become his parents.

Not only had Marty traveled to a point in time before the dawn of rock n' roll and Smiths flavoured crisps but he had tampered with history. He now had a number of problems to solve before he could attempt to get back to his own time.

Now, through this exciting board game, specially produced by Smiths, you can imagine you're Marty and follow his adventures - will you be first to get back to the present time?

Please read the rules of the game carefully before starting our on your journey, you don't want to get stuck in 1955 forever!"

name: Brainstorm
description:
Brainstorm is similar to Go-Moku in that it consists of players taking turns placing pieces on the playing field and attempting to get a certain number of their symbol in a row. Unlike Go-Moku, the goal is to get as many strings of three as possible, rather than to be the first to get a string.

Game play begins with the players deciding which of them will play X and which will play O. Then the fifteen X/O dice are rolled, and whichever player's symbol came up more goes first. Players alternate placing the dice with their symbols until either time runs out or there are no more dice left. This does mean that one player may get more turns than the other. This confers a substantial advantage to the first player, which the rules suggest can be balanced out by playing multiple games.

The final layout is scored, generally by counting the number of sets of three for each player, though the board also contains special double- and triple-score squares as well as some squares preprinted with X or O.

The player with the highest score wins.

name: League Championship
description:
League Championship is a game for 2-6 players that simulates an entire season of the English Football League Championship. It dates from the 1970s and has versions endorsed by footballers George Best and Gordon Banks.

During setup, each player is dealt a face-down stack of action cards which will be used during the game, and a miniature silver plastic trophy is placed on prominent display in the centre of the game's circular board.

Players then, in turn, simulate fixtures by rolling a blue die for the home team and a green die for the away team, followed by turning over an action card which modifies the dice rolls in favour of either team. Examples of action cards are "Work out new corner kick - score 2 more goals" and "Recent Cup commitments in Europe weaken team - lose 1 goal in this match". The result of the match is thus determined with players scoring two points for a win, one for a draw and nothing for a loss.

A player's team's progress is tracked by use of two tokens - a small pawn on a score track to show the current points total and a footballer figure on a calendar track to mark the number of fixtures played. At the end of the season, the player whose team has accumulated the most points wins the league championship, and of course the trophy!

name: Full Sysselsättning
description:
Full sysselsättning ("Full employment") is a game about managing a borough / local council and how to handle the tax payer's money in order to best put them into use.

The game consists of a large plastic circular board on which the players get a 6th. The board is separated into squares on which the players can build. By doing so they manage differend aspects of a township, like a political administration in a small town. The game has a path around the edges on which the players move. Those spaces give them different opportunities and makes the players dra cards containing various events, much like the cards in Monopoly. One interesting thing in this game from 1975 is that the players mark their buildings on the plastic board using whiteboard markers. This must have been a rather early use of that in a boardgame.

Includes land development, unemployment issues, building of inustries, malls, water cleaning facilities, summer house areas and family homes. Four different variants of the rules provide different levels of difficulty. There is also squares for "?"-cards which is a variant where the players are meant to construct cards of there own to tweak the game.

name: Escape The Maze
description: Escape The Maze is a tabletop card game for 2-6 players. Players take turns to explore the maze adding to it as they go. The objective of the game is to gain the most points by either discovering bonus point cards within the maze or by reaching the exit before the other players do!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pop for Sight Words
description:
How to Play:
