Place the popcorn box in the middle of the table.

Take a popcorn card out of the box and read it.

If you read the word correctly, keep the card. If you read the word incorrectly, place the card in a separate pile of "un-popped" words to be read later.

If you draw "POP!" card, return all of your cards to the box and move that "POP!" card from play.

Take turns playing until the popcorn box is empty. The player who has the most popcorn cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Good night game
description:
From the publisher:

The game board consists of three parts with each section offering a different task. Comes with unique and adorable animal figurines. The co-op mechanic teaches children about working together. Features a unique story-telling element and contains a set of bedtime stories.

User description:
Players play in one team, spin a spinner and move four little animals to the grandma’s house where they will sleep this night. They have to reach their beds until the night.

Animals have three tasks to accomplish before getting in to the house: take their teddies, find five strawberries and the grandma’s glasses. In the house everybody has to go to sleep in one of four beds.

The spinner shows numbers: 1, 2, 3, 4 and the picture of the sun. If player spin the number, he/she can move towards one of the animals. If the spinner shows the sun, children turn the paper circle with the sun, attached to the grandma’s house.

Players win if all animals are in bed before the circle shows night. If not, all of them lose.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Find It Fast!: Disney Princess
description:
Place card stack face down on table. Turn over two cards onto table. Players race to find the matching Disney Princess character shared by both cards. The first to call the Disney Princess character takes and keeps one card. Turn over the next card. The first to call the match keeps a card. Play continues until one card remains. Player with the most cards wins!

Includes 48 cards & instructions

name: Red Light Green Light 1-2-3
description:
A kids' card game that can be used with younger children to start them on the road to more card games.

The classic schoolyard game is now a fast-action, quick-to-learn card game. Just follow the pattern: Red Light – Green Light – 1 – 2 – 3. Play as many cards on your turn as you can in that order. Can't play a card? Draw one from the deck and play passes to the next driver. Play all your cards first to dodge traffic and win the game!

Consists of a 105 card deck, with 21 copies of each of the 5 cards.

- description from the publisher's website

name: Karl-Alfreds skattsökarspel
description:
Game based on Popeye the sailor. In this game Popeye is searching for a treasure, but Brutus will do anything in his power to stop him.

Players use a spinner to move along paths of connected spaces, aiming to reach treasure islands in order to collect correspondingly coloured chests. A player who has collected a chest of every colour may head for their home space, but landing on a Brutus space means the loss of a chest, and rolling the exact number of spaces is required to return home as well as when collecting the chests.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Looping
description:
LOOPING is a simple card game with the theme of aerobatics. Each card represents the side view of an aircraft completing a maneuver - climbing, diving, looping or some other similar action.

The start card shows an aircraft taking off and to this players add further cards in a sequence with the smoke trails on the cards indicating where two cards can be connected together. The card also indicates the difficulty of the stunt - and the points gained if the maneuver is successfully completed.

Then idea of the game is to attempt to add cards allowing the aircraft to gain and lose altitude undertaking a variety of tricks on the way. Whether the trick is achieved or not is determined by a die roll (throwing higher than a given number shown on some of the cards). Points are earned for a successfully completed maneuver. If you fail any part of the sequence then you score nothing.

The game ends when the aircraft is brought in to land, through the laying of the appropriate card, at a level at the same altitude from which it took off. The winner is the player who scored the most points during the flight.

The game has three variants OVER THE CLOUDS (3-5 players) DARE-DEVILS (2-4 players) and SKY-RIDER (3-6 players)which, though broadly similar, do make the game suitable for differing numbers of players.

name: Speech Breaker
description: Can you overcome the voice-jamming challenge in Speech Breaker? You're reporting live from the scene! Put on the game headset, talk into the game microphone, and get your teammates to guess who/what/where without saying any of the words on the cards. What's the catch? The microphone jams your speech with a built-in delay. As you talk, you hear your delayed voice through the game headset, making it harder to speak clearly. For example, how would you report that "an alien is swinging kettlebells in a glass house" without saying any of those words — and in just 30 seconds — with your speech jammed?

name: Sheffield Shares
description:
A standard Monopoly clone with share holding and price variation, the interest in this game lies in its design and production. Funded entirely by sponsorship from local firms who feature on the board and stocks, lead by the Midland Bank who got their logo on the banknotes, this game was actually produced by Sheffield YMCA with help from the City Council. Sheffield YMCA got the idea from Bergen YMCA, where apparently this style of game was a big hit in Norway, with 200,000 copies sold, the result being that all proceeds from sales went to the charity. The product is very good quality, very professional, with an unusual feature of the game board wrapping around a polystyrene contents box to form the game box like a sleeve, held by Velcro! Very strange, with the cardboard held in hinged sections in strong plastic, but the innovative & modern design works very well and the result is much more interesting than many British games.
Still a Monopoly clone though.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Snooker Dice
description:
Score the most points by potting (pocketing) reds and colored balls in this simulated game of Snooker. In the spirit of Golf Dice (or Galloping Golf), there are five six-sided dice, each a different color, and must be rolled in a certain order.

Like in the game, a RED BALL must first be potted, so the red die is first rolled. If it says "Red Potted", you score a point and may continue on to the black die. "No Pot" means you failed and play goes to the next player. "In Off" gives your opponent four points and control of the dice.

If you made it to the black die, you must now pot a COLORED BALL -- one of the six other balls on the "table", each one a different color. Like the red die, it may say "Pot", "No Pot", or "Foul" (same effect as "In Off"). If it says "Pot", you now roll the white die to see which color was potted.

The white die has a different colored ball on each side. The color that comes up determines how many points you score, as in Snooker. You now return to the red die to continue the game.

When 15 red balls have been potted, it is set aside. The black and white dice are used to pot the six colored balls in order of score. When the final ball (black) is potted, the game is over.

A player who has little chance of catching his opponent may try to cause his opponent to foul by "snookering" him. At any time, a player may roll the blue die instead of the red or black die. If it comes up "No Snooker" or "Foul", his opponent takes control (and gets four points for the foul). Otherwise he must roll the green die and see if he can avoid rolling a "Foul".
publishers: Dice & Games Ltd. London, Marbury Works

name: Noah's Rainbow Race
description:
Noah's Rainbow Race is a child's board game that combines Candyland's card drawing with Chutes and Ladders' movement. Kids take on the roles of one of four animals (a penguin, tiger, lion, or monkey) as they work their way to the top of Noah's ark. If the animal lands on a ladder, they can skip a head a number of spaces. If the animal lands on a rainbow, they slide back a number of spaces.

From the box:

"Noah's Rainbow Game is a fun and easy Bible game for young children to play. Be the first to guide your pair of animals to the top of the ark to visit Noah. Use the ladders to quickly move up to a higher level, but watch out for rainbows that will send you back down to the level below."

I've never knew that rainbows could be so nefarious.
categories: Ancient, Animals, Children's Game, Fantasy, Mythology, Religious
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Kulbank
description:
A dice game involving moving balls on a wooden box to place them into a hole.
Kulbank ("marble bank") is a game for small children which consists of a bright red wooden box with only a small hole open. You lay it down flat on its side on the table. On the top side are six spaces, each labeled both 1-6 and with a color. Space number two is the hole.

Apart from the "bank" itself, the game comes with two six-sided dice (one regular and one with colors matching the spaces on the box) and a number of yellow marbles (about 25).

To play, divide the marbles evenly to all players and put any remainders into the bank. Select one of the dies to play with. Each player then rolls the die. If the space indicated is free he puts a marble there. If there is a marble there he gets to pick it up instead.

The goal of the game is to lose all your marbles. If your children want to play the game too often, this may be accomplished in more than one way.

Children tend to like this game and are able to play it from an early age (as soon as they can recognize colors and sit still long enough). To make the game slightly more educational, use the die with numbers instead. There is absolutely no skill or strategy element, so your age or previous experience with the game has no bearing on who will win. This may be considered a bug or a feature depending on your viewpoint.

name: Razzzia!!
description:
In this mafia game players are different gangsters travelling around the world. The object of the game is to deliver three kills and $100,000 cash to godfather in Palermo.

There are different squares on game board which have their own decks of cards. There are MAFIA-, DOLLAR- INTERPOL- and LAW-cards. Each deck contains different action cards. Two cards are special: Mafia War and Razzzia! Mafia War sets one player to attempt to travel to Palermo while other players try to kill him. Razzzia! makes player to lose all their dirty cash.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Amsterdams Gezelschapsspel
description:
From the back of the bookcase:

You play this new game on the plan of a real town. Entrepreneurs try to get their corporations off the ground. But look out! The competition is deadly. Everybody wants to build his or her empire in the downtown center. Space is at a premium, the battle for the best lot is fierce. Who's going to make the fewest concessions and become the most successful operator around town?

Complete with beautiful playing board, 80 cards, 8 tokens, 3 dies, full set of easy-to-understand rules and background information about the companies.

Accept this challenge and test your business feeling now. Good luck!

Players are competing to be the first to place four sections of their five corporations on the most valuable lots.

A 2d3 roll determines how players move their two tokens along the X and Y axis of the gameboard; the sum of these coordinates determine the lot's value in terms of victory points, and players then have the choice to place one of their corporation tiles. If doubles are thrown, a player must roll a third special die that will grant another turn, a lost turn, or free movement to any site.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement
publishers: David Marketing, Future Toys, Gijs Timmermans v.o.f.

name: Der goldene Kompass: Die Reise
description:
Another Franchise to the movie of the same name, this time in the small BMM-Box.
The players move stacks of character tokens and try to reveal certain characters on the finish line, while avoiding the villain

name: John Lewis Gender Wars
description: A team game where the players are divided into teams by gender. Each team gets a deck of cards with a category printed on it and five answers (words), the deck of cards for each team contains subjects that are stereotypically associated with that gender. The category is read out, the timer is started and the other team writes down up to eight answers on a pad. Once time runs out, the team writing gets one point for every word that was on the card, the other team then gets a card read to them, and after eight rounds the team with the most points win.

name: Pop Music Trivia Travel
description:
The hugely popular Pop music trivia game now available also as a travel version! The game contains 100 question cards – the questions deal with songs, singers/bands, lyrics and competitions both from the days gone by and today.

Unlike the basegame, the travel edition has no board at all; each player is given a page off a pad, which has six 'pyramids' (good for six games) made of 9 circles in the colours of the four question categories - three categories have 2 circles each, while one has 3 circles, and this varies from pyramid to pyramid. In the middle is a white star which is the final game-winning question. Each time a question is answered correctly, one circle of the category in question can be crossed off, and the goal is to fill in one side of the 'pyramid' and then answer the final question correctly. The category is decided directly by a die-roll (5 or 6 means player's choice). Otherwise rules are the same as the basegame.

name: The Cupcake Game
description:
A children's game for 2-4 players. Each player chooses 1 of the 4 recipe cards that (s)he want to bake. Then it's a race to see who can "bake" their cupcakes the fastest! In order to bake their goodies, players must first collect all the ingredients on their recipe card. To get your ingredients, you must flick the spatula spinner and hope it lands where you want (and not the the rotten egg - lose a turn space!)

The game is designed to be a fun way to help kids learn about following multi-step instructions, patience, taking turns, and matching & categorization, as well learning about baking in general!

Plus, the game is made from 90% recycled materials and is printed with soy-based inks!

name: Nomsters
description:
Stop Nomsters from getting candies.

In the game you and your friend(s), stop the Nomsters from getting candies and other goods by throwing bean-bags at them.

name: Screen Test!
description:
From the Publisher:

And… Action! Movie buffs and trivia junkies can put their knowledge to the test with this interactive DVD movie trivia game. You’ll move around the board and answer questions from clips taken from Metro Goldwyn Mayer (MGM) films. Questions fall into the categories of Star Struck (guess the hidden actor) Take Two (what happens next?) Script Test (finish the famous line) Showtime (general movie trivia) Spotlight (specific movie knowledge) Now Showing (identify the movie) Random (a question from any category) and Outtakes (wild cards). All questions are split into Easy, Medium, and Hard, creating a level playing field for all participants. Will you pass the screen test? The object of the game is to be the first to anwser enough questions correctly to go around the board and get to the end.

Comes with 1 Interactive DVD, 1 Difficulty Level Dice, 1 Game Board, 4 Player Tokens (a clapboard, a reel of film, a movie camera, and a film frame) and Rule Sheet.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Frog Soccer
description: Each player controls a frog and attempts to shoot the soccer ball into their colored net across from them. The action is very much like Hungry Hungry Hippos only here you are pushing the balls forward instead of scooping them up.

name: Don't Point the Finger
description:
In Der magische Finger (The Magic Finger), a life-sized green hand crawls around the table. It rotates around the thumb planted in the middle of the table, until it stops and points at a person.
They are given the choice between 'TRUTH' (eg. Have you ever stolen anything; What's the best thing about the person on your left) and 'DARE' (ie. Act like you're cleaning the room; pretend you're 90 years old) If the other players don't think you have done a good enough job, they can make you do the punishment (ie. name 5 composers while everyone else counts to 10). First player to six points wins.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Humor, Party Game
publishers: AS Company, Bizak, Hutter Trade GmbH + Co KG, Megableu, Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Piatnik

name: Masters of the Universe: War and Conquer Giant Card Games
description: There are two games that may be played with the Masters of the Universe giant cards. War - a simple game of flipping cards over and with the higher number winning, and Conquer - a "Masters of the Universe" version of hearts.

name: Space Dice
description:
SPACE DICE is played on board showing a representation of the Solar System arranged in twelve rings each containing 12 segments - a total of 144 spaces in all.

Starting on their birth month (on the third most inner ring) players move their three space ships through the Solar System to the Center of the Galaxy (accessed from sector 144 on the outer ring of the board) via planets, comets, major stars and constellations.

Movement is conducted based on the results of the throw of four dice with at least one double being required to launch each ship from its starting position. Movement is a result of the combination of the four dice roles. For example a roll of 20 (including a double) would allow a space ship to leave July (space 26) and move to Mars (space 46).

The following dice rolls have the following effects:
Throwing four of a kind (a quadruple) wins outright, even on the first throw.
A triple, regardless of the number thrown allows a move of 36 spaces.
A perfect sequence (1234, 2345, 3456) allows a move of 48 spaces.

Some squares contain special instructions that must be followed. These include instructions to throw again or move to another square.

On arrival at sector 144 each space ship there qualifies for three throws of the dice. After each throw the player may pick up or leave down any dice in choosing to go for a quadruple or perfect sequence within those three throws. Each time a quadruple or perfect sequence is thrown one ship may be placed on the space representing the Center of the Galaxy.

The first player to get all three of their ships to the Center of the Galaxy is the winner.

name: Mindbenders
description:
From the box -
First: Read a question
Second: cogitate, digest and discuss
Third: start to pull your hair out, the logical seems illogical, the question seems to have no answer.
Finally: supply an answer or admit defeat
Then: Stare in complete disbelief as the simple answer is read aloud.

Will taunt, tease and torment the way you think!

Contains hundreds of brainteasers, mysteries and puzzles that will BEND your mind!

name: Rekkakuskit
description:
In Rekkakuskit (the truck drivers) each player tries to make their living by running a transportation company. They get paid for delivering consignments but must cover their expenses. The winner is the player that has gained most capital at the end of the game.

In the beginning the players get the starting capital, the operation permit cards and place their pawns in Helsinki also taking the initial freight card. Each freight card shows a destination and a table of fees. The actual fee depends on the zone one's pawn is located and the type of the operation permit.

The game board is a map of Finland divided in three zones: southern, middle and northern Finland. The map shows the largest cities and a set of roads (tracks of squares) between them. There are two types of operation permits and you may buy an extended permit to operate with improved rates.

Moving your truck (pawn) happens by roll-and-move and should one land on a given square an event card is drawn. The major part of events consist of maintenance costs. Once the destination city is reached a new freight card is drawn.

name: The Pillars of the Earth: Medieval Challenge
description:
"Immerse yourself in Ken Follett’s medieval world, which he created for his international bestseller The Pillars of the Earth. Build a model cathedral as the play progresses and answer questions on all facets of Medieval history, as well as a quiz on the book itself (optional).

The graphics are stunning and the gameplay completely engaging.

Contents: 1 Game board, 8 part Cathedral, 220 question cards, 50 William’s Choice cards, 4 playing pieces, 4 scoring tokens, 320 Stipend tokens, 1 die, I set rules."

name: TV Guide's TV Game
description: How much do you really know and remember about your favorite TV shows? Test your knowledge with this challenging question and answer quiz.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Rescue Heroes Pet Rescue Game
description:
-From the Box-

Leapin' ladders! The pet hospital is on fire! Your mission: bring all the pets to the top of the hospital where the helicopter is waiting to take you to safety. No one gets left behind! Become one of the Rescue Heroes Team and use the ladders to leap ahead, and the ropes to slide down to get any pets still in danger. First player to the top invites the whole team along as you fly away to safety. Includes 4 Rescue Heroes characters to move.

name: Bionicle: The Quest Game
description:
The evil Piraka have invaded the island of Voya Nui and are now on the hunt for the powerful Mask of Life. Take up the Toa Inika mission to find the Mask before the Piraka. Traverse the island carefully, and be ready to do battle along the way.

Includes six exclusive collectible Toa Inika game pieces, a double-sided game board, a Protodermis ball launcher with Zamor sphere, a Piraka target, 50 Quest cards, and a die.

name: Dream On
description: Dream On is an exciting new board game that answers the age old question 'What do my dreams really mean?' The game provides over 1000 dream interpretations derived from the works of the world's most prominent dream analysts."
mechanics: Deduction, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Track Movement, Voting
publishers: E & M Games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Camel: The Game
description: Contents include 48 cards, 6 dice, 1 pencil, and 1 score pad. Players roll the dice with the letters C,A,M,E,L on them and try to match them with the cards. Designed to promote the Camel brand of cigarettes.
publishers: R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Co., Western Publishing Company

name: Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants Card Expansion #2: Secrets of The Cataclysm
description:
Second card-pack expansion for the "World of Heroes and Tyrants" board game. Consists of a new character (Liz, starts in Flint, IN 5 FT 7 ST 4 DX 11 HP 50 SB 19, advantage is to start the game with one item), ten Spell cards, ten Item cards, and fifteen Quest cards.

This expansion's designer is uncredited but is presumably Bruce P. Dowrie, designer of the main game.

Expands:

Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Tokyo Crisis
description: In this game, you play detectives trying to do the best job solving crimes. Different crimes have different success level rankings in 3 different categories, with a value attached to solving the crime. You want to solve 1500 points worth of crimes before the other players.

name: Circus Mouse
description:
Players take turns moving the mouse hole frame around the board (one space at a time orthogonally) trying to get to the space that shows the face-up treat tile. Moving to a cheese space allows the player to continue moving. Moving to a cat space ends that player's turn. The player that moves to the correct treat space claims the tile and turns over the next one. The first player to collect four treat tiles wins the game.

Box contents:
- Game board
- Mouse Hole frame
- 18 treat cards
- Instruction card

name: Bushi: Sword vs. Sword
description:
"A Samurai knew only loyal service: death was the reward for failure. The way of the Samurai was a harsh one, but it built men as strong as the semi-legendary weapons they carried until both the man and his creed were forged into a living dream, a dream that has survived the fall of empires and the dusts of history . . . This game is extremely fast. It is felt that it reflects the flow of sword vs. sword combat. The players will soon learn that there is more to the game than attack first. Much can be gained by waiting and counterattacking."

The game portrays a sword duel between two Samurai swordsmen during Japan's Feudal era. The object is to be the first to make a successful attack.

Both players secretly select simultaneous moves (there are 48 different moves including various blocks, cuts, stances, thrusts, etc., with optional rules allowing for feints.) The game is played on two large charts with a series of boxes representing each of the 48 moves a swordsman may make. Each box on the chart shows a player's current move and lists the permissible follow-up moves that may be selected in the next phase. These boxes also display the hit probability for the various attacks. This probability varies based upon the type of attack and the defender's move.

name: Cubes
description:
From the publisher's website:

Shake the 6 colored "cubes" in the shaker cup to get one of many possible combinations of numbers! Your roll determines if you'll add or subtract chips from the pot. Chips are worth points.The player with the highest number of points is the winner! It's FUN...It's FAST...It's CUBES!

Before play begins, each player puts 5 points of chips into the pot. Any player may now start the game. The first player shakes and rolls the cubes from the shaker cup. The player will either add or remove points from the pot depending on the cube combination rolled.

Play moves clockwise to the next player, who repeats the process of shaking cubes and either adding or removing points from the pot.

One game consists of 3 sets.

The first time a player does not have enough points to pay the pot, the set has ended. That player puts all his/her remaining chips into the pot and receives a "0" for a score. All remaining players total their points and write those totals on the scorecard and a new set is started. After the third set is completed, the player with the highest total points of all 3 sets is the winner.

name: UNO: New York City
description:
Special deck featuring photos taken by New Yorkers.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: SKIP EVERYONE card.

name: Camouflage
description: The object of the game, as seen on TV, is to find an object which is Camouflaged under transparent overlays. Money prizes are given to the player who finds the object first. The amount of prize money is larger with 5 overlays, than with some of them removed, so the quicker a player finds the object, the more money he wins. One of the players acts as the Master of Ceremonies. He takes the Camouflage frame out of the box, sets it up, asks the questions, etc. He also pays out prize money for the correct answer.
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Milton Bradley

name: die! Die! DIE! The Family Game of Genocidal Warfare
description:
From the designer:

One thing that has always bothered me was the predominance of wargames that espoused some sort of resolution that fell far short of complete annihilation. So I've done something about that -- "die! Die! DIE! The Family Game of Genocidal Warfare!" is here! "die! Die! DIE!" is The Family Game of Genocidal Warfare. Players build empires and advance their technology in an effort to smash the others into the dust. The board is customizable each game, and almost infinitely expandable. Using mechanics that are basic and elemental, the game proceeds at a breakneck pace to the end, with piles of bodies in every direction. The perfect game for a Sunday night around the dinner table.

The PDF includes a beautifully rendered color version, and a more inexpensively rendered b&w edition (so as to show pity on your printer!).


http://www.teamfrog.com/diediedie.htm

name: The New Fantastic Four Game
description:
Join the New Fantastic Four in their battle with Doctor Doom. Doctor Doom has captured Herbie the Robot and is holding him prisoner in his Research Lab. Make your way through Doctor Doom's domain, rescue Herbie, and be the first to bring him safely home. Be the first player to reach "Mission Complete" to win the game.

The game is for Ages 7 - 12. Contents of the game include 4 player pawns, Research Lab - consisting of wall, conveyor ring, spinner with arrow, and a stand up figure of Herbie the Robot. Set-up and playing instructions are included on the inside of box lid.

name: Operacao Littorio
description: Wargame covering a hypothetical attempted takeover of South America by Brazil. Contains counters, map and rules. This game came in a ziplock bag instead of a box.

name: GOAL: The Realistic Soccer Game
description: The contents consist of 2 teams each of 13 player cards, 28 ref cards, 1 12-sided dice, 1 yellow card that has been cut in to 12 as per the rules, 1 counter used as the ball and a set of rules.

name: Discovering London
description:
From the Manufacturer’s website: You will love finding out about London with this exciting board game. The destination cards will tell you all about the places you visit - some famous, like Tower Bridge, Covent Garden and Lords Cricket Ground, some not so well known and quite surprising. Watch out for the road blocks put down by other players to hold you up and the Chance cards which can help or hinder your progress around the board. All this makes Discovering London a most entertaining family game.

No. of Players 2 - 6 Ages 8 and up

name: Snapple Real Facts Game
description: This game comes with an electronic Snapple bottle. When you shake it, a Real Fact disc comes out. The Real fact is like the kind you'd find under an actual Snapple beverage bottle cap. The disc Fact is missing words which players must act out in a charade like manner while the other team members try to guess the answer. The bottle also acts as a timer.

name: Kahootz: for smarte hjerner
description: A game based on guessing a word or a phrase such as “house” or “hangover”. There is a timer so you have to be quick. A die decides how many words that can be used in describing the word or phrase. The fewer words you use the higher you score.

name: Mind Duel
description:
Mind Duel - Psionic Combat for Two players

In issue #4 of the magazine "VIP of Gaming".

"Mind Duel is a game of psychic combat between two trained telepaths. You attack your opponent's mind and defend your own, with focused bits of psionic energy...By invading your opponent's mind, you may stun your enemy, or pinch a pressure point and cause the loss of those focused bits of psi-power. Your object is to occupy the opponent's conscious mind, whereupon the enemy will black out, never to awaken again."

Game consists of the rules, gameboard and cut-apart counters found in the magazine and 2D6.

The gameboard represents the telepaths' minds and the area of mental struggle between them. Each mind is divided into conscious, subconscious and unconscious levels (the "mental arcs"). The area between the battling minds is divided into a series of wavelength arcs.

Basic Play: 1-Announce your attacking pieces (pieces that will move). 2-Pieces not moving then "decay" (fall back due to lack of support). 3-Move the attacking pieces. 4-"Shift" if you choose and are able. 5-Apply any attack results. Sending a piece into your opponent's mind is an attack. Attacking the Unconscious stuns the opponent for one turn. Attacking the Subconscious permanently eliminates your opponent's furthest advanced piece. Attacking the Conscious defeats the opponent and wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Monopoly: Boston Red Sox 2004 World Series Champions
description: To celebrate the 2004 World Champion Boston Red Sox and the end of the "Curse of the Bambino", this is a Monopoly game for Red Sox fans, young and old. The players and manager are in place of the usual properties. Six collectible pewter tokens feature a Boston baseball cap, ball in glove, pitcher, batter, socks and catcher’s mask.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Corporation
description: The object of this game of international trade is to be the first player to build a corporate headquarters on each continent. Successfully bid for manufacturing companies. Acquire millions in revenue by selling raw materials to other manufacturing companies. Outwit opponents' corporate raids and stock takeover attempts. Build your corporate empire and span the globe.

name: Fotball
description: Fotball is a tactical boardgame for two players (teams), where knowledge of real football can determine the outcome. The game comes with two sets of rules, one for junior players (minimal football knowledge) and one for senior players (with good football knowledge). Each team choses their play system, for example 5-4-1 or 4-4-2, and many of the real football situations and techniques do occur in this game, like dribbling, tackling, throw-ins, offside and yellow and red cards.

name: Springprozession
description: A race with dice. To get your die into the race roll it. Place it on the matching position. Move a die as many spaces as the die shows. If you move over another die it will change its number. First player to reach the finish line wins.

name: Babble
description:
A fast paced, Bible based, outrageously fun game! Babble!™ is an exciting new Bible game with a fresh style of play. Every player draws two cards and start calling out the words on the cards. Wait, did someone else just yell out "cross"? Yes! A match! Both players place their matching cards together. One player grabs a die and rolls it while the other player calls out "odd" or "even". If the guessing player guesses right, that player gets the match! If not, the player rolling the die gets the match. Each match is worth one point. The players then draw a new card and start calling out words again. Its so simple!
The game contains six decks of cards with each deck being a different category. The six Categories are Symbols, Books, Places, People, Animals, and Things found in the Bible. Each card has five words related to that category. After playing through all six decks the player with the most points wins the game!
Babble!™ is a terrific game for a large number of players. It is great to play with friends, family, and church groups!

name: Phwar
description:
From the website :

Phwar (short for Phase War) is an abstract game of war for two or three players. The board is a hexagonal grid of hexagons. Each player owns four negative particles (electrons), four positive particles (positrons) and one neutral particle with zero charge (neutron).

The game is won by the last remaining player. All of a player's particles are removed if they do not have at least one electron, one positron, and one neutron on the board.

Players take turns moving one of their particles in any of the six hexagonal directions. The particle can move any number of cells in an unobstructed line. There is no passing unless a player has no legal moves.

An opponent's particle can be captured by replacement if: the victim is in line of sight of at least two of the current player's particles; and the total charge of all particles in the victim's line of sight cancels out to zero.

The idea is that such systems are unstable, but reach equilibrium after the capture.

It is compulsory to capture an opponent's particle if possible. The capture may be performed by any of the current player's particles in line of sight of the victim. The neutron may participate in a capture but contributes zero to the total charge.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Famous People
description: The game of celebrity impersonations. Act out impersonations (as many as you can in one minute) for your team to guess.

name: Esso Baseball Challenge
description:
Esso Baseball Challenge was a card game published by Imperial Oil (aka Esso in Canada) in 1988. It was a single deck of cards that contained various types of cards that represented calls in baseball (i.e. ground ball, single, home run, wild pitch, etc.).

The players laid out the cards for the bases in the traditional diamond formation and then used runner cards to mark where their team's players were on those bases. Players took turns at bat/pitching. Based on the cards drawn, they moved their players around the bases and scored runs. Essentially, it used the same rules as baseball itself ... but they were simulated using a deck of specialty cards.

The game was distributed at Esso stations in Canada during the summer of 1988 (for about $2). For baseball fanatics, this was a fun diversion.

Contents of the deck:
63 game cards
4 base cards
4 runner cards
1 rules/sample score card
publishers: Imperial Oil Ltd., J.D.K. Sportgames Inc.

name: Bull Craps
description: Place the 2 Bullies in the dice cup and give them a shake. Then shoot the bulls and roll them out. Score points for how the unique bull shaped dice land. Score a Rank Bull or a Bull Dozer....just don't get bucked off!

name: Bible Lotto
description: In Bible Lotto, players are asked questions about bible characters. Whoever has a spot on his lotto card for the bible character in question fills in that spot with the question card. Players try to fill up their lotto cards.

name: Hello Friends
description:
From the SimplyFun website:

Konnichiwa, Hola, Guten Tag, Ni Hao, Bonjour!

Have fun playing a card matching game while learning to say HELLO in six languages. Players take turns laying down cards which match the languages played, or using wilds and goodbyes that have all the languages listed. The first player to play all his or her cards wins the game.

Game contains 54 illustrated playing cards and rules cards.

name: Today I Went to the Market
description:
This is one of the games in the Tiny Tins series by Patch Products.

This is basically a board game version of I Spy. Players look at the board and say "Today I went to the market and saw something . . ." Other players then try to guess what the player saw. If you guess correctly, you get one of the grocery tokens. If no one guesses correctly, then you get a token. The game ends when all of the tokes are gone, with the winner being the player with the most tokens.

name: Ex-Presso
description: Simple Backgammon variant using cups and plates instead of 'ordinary' pieces. Published in the same series as Patron-Ow and In-Sekt-Surprise.

name: Kultapeli
description:
In Kultapeli ("The Gold Game"), 2-6 players represent prospectors in the Finnish Lapland in 1949. The idea of the game is to first make one to three claims, register them at the Bank/Registry Office, then pan for some nuggets of gold and sell them - and any claims that have not run dry yet - to the bank, to reach a sum agreed before the start of the game (eg. 20,000 marks). Each time a player visits the Registry they must also visit the saloon and play a Blackjack-like dice game for at least half of their money. The first player to reach the agreed sum wins. When moving on the map, the players may encounter some events which are usually negative.

The gold nuggets are called according to the old gold prospectors slang: Lifeless, Nit, Louse, Bedbug, Nugget, from smallest to biggest.

name: Voodoo Doll Game
description:
"VOODOO Doll game for boys and girls"

"The mysterious Voodoo doll holds the key
that keeps the witch doctor from leaping free!"

Players take turns pushing pins into the plastic voodoo doll. If a player pushes the pin into the "wrong" booby-trapped hole, the witch doctor bursts out of his hut.

name: Kotsuku
description:
A Sudoku Grid for Word Gamers

Kotsuku is a grid-based game with an added competitive dimension as players vie to be the first to complete a word in the grid. Players take turns placing letters in the grid one letter at a time. Each letter in the alphabet may be used once per game. The object is to be the first person to complete a word of three or more letters. Words may be vertical, horizontal, diagonal either frontward or backwards. Use your letters wisely and be sure not to leave an opening for your opponent!

name: Witch Mountain
description: Players put seven cubes in the shaker cup and then roll the cubes on the table. The Witches, Dragons or Colors facing up are the Witches, Dragons or Colors used to advance the pawns. The Starting color for each player is the color of their pawns and their color forms a trail in a spiral towards the middle of the board, then turns into Witch Mountain. The first player to advance their three pawns to Witch Mountain is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Subsidie
description: Subsidie is a quick card game for 3 to 6 players and the players try to win projects with government grants. In addition several obstacles must be overcome: grants can be lost, somebody else can take over the project, the project can fail due to scandal... The purpose of the play is to apply enough government funds as possible for the realization of projects. The winner is who at the end of the play has applied the largest amount subsidy for realized projects.

name: Dinosaur! Card Games
description:
From the back of the box:

"Features three exciting games with colorful and detailed dinosaur cards. Younger players will enjoy Go Dino!, based on the traditional game "Go Fish". Use your memory and observation skills to play Dino Search. And real dinosaur fans will want to play Dino Challenge, a game that pits dinosaur against dinosaur. 53 fact-filled cards add to the fun!"

The box also says: Ages 5+.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory
publishers: National Geographic Society, Warren Industries, Inc.

name: Monopoly: American Chopper
description:
It’s pedal to the metal as this collector’s edition of the Monopoly game brings you all the tension, tirades, and triumphs - American Chopper style. Celebrate Discovery Channel's most watched series as you go full throttle as you buy, sell and trade the Teutul’s most outrageous custom choppers. From the Black Widow Bike and Comanche Bike to the Jet Bike and POW/MIA Bike, relive the excitement and drama created by Paul Sr., Junior, Mikey and the entire Orange County Choppers crew as they race to complete their one-of-a-kind choppers.

The American Chopper edition of America’s favorite board game comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens including Paul Sr., Paul Jr. Mikey, the Tool Bike Tire, a welder’s mask and the Future Bike. Rules include a 60 minute speed play option for a shorter game with the same amount of fun. "Fire Her Up!"
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fact or Opinion
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to collect 5 package pieces and reach the parking exit.

The student will be able to identify whether a sentence or paragraph is a fact or an opinion."

name: Monopoly: Jersey
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Jersey, a Crown dependency of Britain.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Lancashire
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Lancashire, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Later Mater!
description:
A game similar in play to Perfection, but with a 3D Cars theme.

From the back of the box: "Race to put Mater back together. But don't just 'tool around.' -- You have to be fast to beat the clock. Because when his parts fly, it's time to say goodbye. Later Mater!"

name: Monopoly: Aachen
description: Another one in the Monopoly City themed games, this time focused on Aachen, famous for its rich historical background, and Charlemagne of course.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Estes Express Lines 75th Anniversary
description: This is a version of Monopoly themed on the 75th Anniversary of the Estes Express Lines trucking company.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Murder-Mystery Party Kit
description:
David "Ditch" Digger, the owner of the Summerlot Resort in the Catskills has been killed. Whodunit? Was it his gold-digging wife? The hunky lifeguard? The wacky driver?

Everything needed to throw a murder-mystery party is inside this very small 3"x3" box: six name tag stickers, six 12-page booklets (1 for each character), and a 32-page host guide.

name: Wir fahren gegen Engeland
description:
The game consists of a map of the North Sea, showing the United Kingdom, coasts of Norway, Denmark, Germany, Belgium and France. There are two paths of points that wrap around England and in each part are points of conflict (numbered to match lists supplied in the rules).

Cards with silhouettes of target ships are supplied to match the numbers. The cards include vital data regarding tonnage and size and a number that represents the roll needed to sink the ship. The game also includes 3 plastic submarines and 3 plastic airplanes to represent the players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mormon-Opoly
description:
An LDS variant of Monopoly in which players compete to build churches and do good works.

From the publisher: Mormon-opoly is a creative and exciting LDS game based on the principles and history of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. The goal of this Mormon game is to build as many chapels and stake centers as possible in order to “help build the kingdom of God”. Players can learn about LDS church history and read related scriptures as they move about the board. In addition, the game addresses financial management and community service as well.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Car Racing
description:
A racing game were each player has to playing pieces. One is the mechanic that you move around building your car and finding replacement parts as the game goes on. There are many various parts so each player gets his own custom made car, with different abilities ad weaknesses.

The other piece is a sand timer, that is used to represent your car on the race track. On a players turn, he choses whether he wants to move his mechanic or car, but when then sand has run out in the sand timer, the car is out of gas and you need to move the mechanic to refill the car.

The race track has various hazards and shortcut, that may or may not interfere with your car, depending on what custom parts your car is made up of. You might want to move the mechanic around to find you better car parts, but in the end it is the player who first reaches the finish line with his car who wins.

name: Bankrott de Luxe
description:
(english translation: "Bancruptcy Deluxe")

Similar to Go For Broke. The players start with 1 Million Dollars each, trying to lose all their money as fast as possible with gambling, speculation, betting etc.

Lots of luck elements, like dice and a collection of spinners.
Was published as a game of the Schmidt Spiele-Bar series in book case format.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 100 Keren
description:
In this game that was released as a special game for the opening of the 100th Primafoon shop in the Netherlands, you have to try to make combinations.

In the middle of the board there is place for 25 caps. On your turn you have to try to make color and / or picture combos. The bigger the combo the higher the score. When you take a specific score (minimal a combo of 3) the caps of that combo are taken off of the board, for which there come new caps in place.

The game is played till all 100 caps are used and there are no combos possible on the board anymore. The winner is the person with the highest score.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: UNO: San Antonio Spurs
description: This themed vesion of Uno features the NBA Basketball Team the San Antonio Spurs. This version of Uno includes a special card/rule that does not correlate to any card in regular Uno, the "Dunk" card.

name: Soccer! Card Game
description: The game is a 2 player game consisting of 38 identically-backed cards. 30 cards are of 6 football clubs (Birmingham, Luton, Stoke, Everton, Southampton and Middlesbrough) and 4 penalty, 2 offside and 2 goalkeeper cards. The object is to score goals, to do this both players are dealt 5 cards and then try to collect 3 club crest if the same type in his hand. The hand is built up rummy-style from the deck. A goal attempt is made by playing three cards face up on the table and is scored unless the other player has a goalkeeper or offside card available to play. Playing 5 club crests automatically scores a goal. After a goal the opponent must discard their hand but the scorer can decide on whether to keep the remaining 2 cards or not. The game ends when 10 attempts at goal have been made.

name: Destination Cardiff
description:
A game of taxi driving through Cardiff. It's a rather random process of collecting fares, avoiding fines, and other such mishaps, while visiting many of Cardiff's tourist destinations.

One of many in the "Destination" series.

name: Elementalis: Guardians and Luminaries
description:
The world lies in ruin. Chaotica reins and all the other Elemental sects fight over scraps of power like ravenous beasts over a bit of rotten meat. Once great cities have been razed and people of good measure have been reduced to all sorts of foul activities. Hope has left, and the Flux is in tatters.

Yet, like the phoenix from the ashes comes a new order. As all Elements have their opposite, so has the Sun. Awoken from her long slumber by the past events, the Moon has summoned her most loyal subjects, the Lunar Guardians and Luminaries. These servants have the power to stop Chaotica and help the people of the world rebuild.

The only question now is that are they too late? Has the world fallen so far that it is unable to be saved?

Guardians and Luminaries is a free expansion for Elementalis. This expansion allows the game to handle up to 5 players with two new Mage types to diversify game play.

The Guardians gain their power through pattern, and harness the luminous power of the Moon. Luminaries earn their power similarly, but Ether is more potent to them and their lunar magic.

name: Indianer och Cowboy
description:
This game is for our youngsters. You don't need any strength or luck in this game. The cleverest one will win this game.

You have three hats and are after your opponents hats and want to take them out. The player with the last hat will win this game.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
12 hats (3x4 colors)
1 dice
1 rules

name: Pettson & Findus Kapplöpnings-memo
description:
Pettson arranges a race competition on his farm. Try to find the same picture tile and improve your way to the finish line. First over it is the winner in this game.

This is a children's game with funny pictures from Pettsons world. With a good memory, awareness, being fast and with a little bit of luck is all you need to win this game. Your job is to travel around the board and try to remember were the card is and get some help from mucklorna to get you through this game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly: Augsburg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Augsburg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ox in die Box
description: This isn't a game for lallygags, only speedy recognition and use of the space between the oxen legs will get you through. Or perhaps the dogs, who can get through the legs of the oxen and out the gap. Perhaps you will be the best farmer.

name: Monopoly: Leeds Edition
description:
The legendary board game is finally coming home to Leeds where local firm Waddingtons first began making the game for the UK market in 1936.

Spaces are expected to include Millennium Square, Temple Newsam, Harewood House, Leeds Metropolitan University, the Victoria Quarter, the Royal Armouries, Town Hall, Civic Hall, Kirkgate Market, and Headingley Carnegie Stadium. Thirty-three Leeds landmarks are to occupy the multi-coloured sites.

Note: This game is different than the limited edition which was produced in 1989 with 500 total copies.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Joke Game
description:
1 player pulls a joke card and everyone attempts to write a punch line.

Players with the correct punch-line move forward. Then, all the players vote on the other punch-lines to choose the funniest. That player moves forward 2 spaces.

name: Dwarf Tactic Minigame
description:
This game is for 2 player, each act as the dwarf chief try to defend each castle and at the same time try to eliminate opponent's castle. you start with 10 castle point and resource at Lv 1 (which is 4 resource) and you need at least 2 six sided dice, game is played in turn.

For the rules you can read it on: http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/2008/08/dwarf-tac...
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Wizards and Warriors
description:
Wizards and Warriors is a collection of five fairly simple games all set in a generic fantasy environment. The game was published in a fold-out cardboard folder on which the five different boards are printed. Contained within are the rules booklet and a counter sheet. The boards and components are illustrated by Cathy Wood.

The Wizard's Chamber (2-4 players)
Simple roll-and-move game with set collection.

The Curse of the Tomb (1-2 players)
Basically a race game, where one player controls an adventurer and the other player controls the tomb and deploys hazards.

Escape from the Troll King (2-6 players)
Roll-and-move race. First player to reach the end of a long cave tunnel wins. Monsters pop in and out of caves along the way and act as obstacles.

The Mines of Aslok (2-6 players)
Basic roll-and-move movement, where the first player to escape the Mines with treasure wins. On their way out they need to evade traps and fight demons.

The Vault of Illusion (2-6 players)
More dynamic and complex game, compared to the others. The adventurers move across a multicoloured hex grid at random, dictated by a coloured spinner. The goal is to acquire a magic weapon and then battle one of six different monsters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Ten Commandments
description:
The Ten Commandments is a card game where players match or fulfill instructions on the top card of a face up stack with cards from their hand. There are cards for each of the 10 commandments as well as cards for various commandment groupings and New Testament teachings. The commandment grouping cards require a set of commandment cards to be played. If a player cannot play a card, they draw another. The player that is able to play all of their hand first wins the game.

Game includes 90 game cards as well as 4 other cards that have the instructions for the game as well as other information.

name: Credit Crunch
description:
A game that appeared in The Economist Magazine's Christmas 2008 issue. It is also available a print and play game from The Economist's Web site.

From the Economist:"As though readers haven't suffered enough already this year, we are offering them a chance to be crushed, humiliated, and impoverished all over again.

But we are also offering a shot at redemption. Our Board game pits players against each other and encourages them to pick on the weakest, kick opponents when they are down and generally manifest all the characteristics that bring success in the financial world. WINNER TAKES ALL!"

Players move round by throwing four coins and progressing as many squares as they throw heads. If a player throws four heads, he moves forward four spaces and has another turn; if he throws four tails, he throws again. When a player lands on a + square, he collects money from the bank; equally, when he lands on a minus square, he pays the bank.

The aim is to be the last solvent player. In order to achieve this, players try to eliminate the competition. Risk cards encourage players to pick on each other.

name: Battle of the Sixes
description: Each player gets six dice and begins each round by rolling all of them and matching any sixes with his opponent's sixes. Each player then has the option either to match any of his dice that total six with any of his opponent's dice or to re-roll his unmatched dice. The re-rolling continues until one player has played all his dice, at which point his opponent gets one more roll, and the round ends. Score zero, one, or two points for each match, depending upon the combinations used. Play until one player reaches either sixty or a number whose digits add up to six.

name: Tennis Dice
description:
Tennis dice is a dice game for two players simulating a game of lawn tennis. There are five dice in the game: a yellow Service die, two Rally dice (red for the server, blue for the receiver) and two Scoring 'dice' which are used to keep score.
The server rolls the yellow dice and if the result is 'in' the players roll their Rally die alternately until a point is scored. Scoring is as in lawn tennis.

name: Napoleon's Campaigns: Expansion Set 1
description:
This expansion set is an add-on to either 'The Napoleonic Wars' or 'Napoleon's Italian Campaigns'. It transforms either game into five games, adding the scenarios of Austerlitz, Wagram, Leipzig and Waterloo.

Expansion includes new counters and new order of appearance sheets.

name: Build A House
description: A tile-based game published by The National Trust of Great Britain & Northern Ireland. Players construct period buildings from a pool of 100 tiles.

name: Österreichisches Sammelsurium
description:
To do well at Österreichisches Sammelsurium, you'll not only have to hold your own when guessing the answers to various outlandish and often humorous questions about Austria, but also be able to convincingly make up facts on the fly.

Questions are divided into three catgories: Knowledge, Creative and Estimates.

name: Liba-Játék
description: A fun Hungarian educational game for little kids. Players throw the dice and trot on the board. On the different squares the players have to read instructions and act accordingly. Meanwhile they get money with wich they can spend or save. The theme is based on Hungarian folklore.

name: Agytorna: Játék az IQ-val
description:
In this game players try to answer IQ or trivia questions. There is a special set of questions for small children.

Re-implemented as part of the game Gigász.

name: Rechenlotto
description: Each player has a board with a number of calculations. A number tile is held up. The first player to find a calculation with that result gets the number tile and covers the calculation. The first player to completely cover his or her board is the winner.

name: Sinonimos y antonimos
description:
Question and answer game. A game well suited to enrich culture and vocabulary.

Learn playing at being the first to complete the scoring for that answer questions that appear on the cards, either synonyms or antonyms of the word contained in them.

name: Vitorlázz velünk!
description:
This is a Hungarian game. Players are sailing, headed toward destinations shown on cards. destinations on drawn cards. Players must complete a circuit, but there are some event card that affect areas of the board that influence the travel and route.

1 gameboard
1 dice
6 sailing ship
18 marker (flag)
10 destination-card
10 event-card
1 rule

name: Slam Attax
description:
WWE Slam Attax is a Trading Card Game by Topps Trading Cards. It features WWE Superstars from the Raw, Smackdown and ECW brands along with WWE Divas and WWE Legends. Each Superstar has an Attack and Defense rating out of 100, and a star rating out of 5.

2 players start with 9 randomly selected cards lying face against the ground. These cards are the main roster player. There are two additional cards on the sides of 9 major cards. Both cards are cards Tag Team. The player decides which begins on a playing card with his main roster, and decides whether he wants to attack or defend. He turned the card to reveal Superstar. The opponent must then take a card either defend or attack (depending on the choice of boot drive). The losing card is removed from the game. At any moment a player can choose to spend a card to one of two cards Tag Team. There are also Champion and finishing move cards. These contractors and finishing move cards are superior to the rest of the bridge, but can not be used for cards Championship is equipped with that specific Superstar. Whoever has the most to gain (or face) cards wins the game.

name: Ace
description:
Publisher website: Little magnetic strategy game with as theme: tennis.

Travel pocket game for two players in which the goal is to move your eight playing pieces ("tennis balls") across the court. You either move one piece horizontally or vertically or you jump with one piece over a row of pieces (regardless if these are yours or your opponents or mixed).

name: UNO: Eye-Eye SpongeBob!
description:
Nickelodeon UNO Eye-Eye SpongeBob! Card Game Soak up the fun of UNO SpongeBob style! Game includes one deck of UNO cards with colorful graphics of your Bikini Bottom favorites in a cool SpongeBob tray. One tip of SpongeBob's yellow nose and his spinning eyes direct the play and decide who will sink and who will swim in the game. It's fast-paced fun that will keep the entire family absorbed!

By Pressing SpongeBob's nose, the left eye will indicate who has to perform the action, while the right eye will indicate which action to take. You, someone else, or possibly no one could draw 4 cards, discard 1 card, or draw until a blue/yellow/wild card is drawn.

Publisher's Website + User Summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Greeny
description:
During the game, players have to collect Greenycards. Greenykaarten are energycards such as solar, wind and water. These cards provide a lot of points.
Every turn a player takes a Environment card. The player follows the instruction of the card. If you saved the environment the player can get Greenycards. If not, the player takes Raw material cards, such as waste, coal and oil. These cards provide sentence points.
The player with the most points at the end of the game, wins.

The objective of the game is to teach children how to save the envirement.

name: Suske en Wiske  Avonturenspel
description:
Muffin is being captured by Krimson. Krimson used the time-machine to go back 500 years to a heavily monitored island. The object of the game is to collect 500 'flitsjaren' and 6 character cards to rescue Muffin.

Players roll and move along the board. When a player completes a round, that player collects 100 'flitsjaren'. During the game players win and loose 'flitsjaren'. If a player lands on a space with the image of Muffin, Spike or Suzy, the player gets a character card.
The first player who has collected 6 different character cards and 500 'flitsjaren' wins the game, but only when he or she stands on a space with 'flits'.

The game could be played with the 12 figurines of the Spike and Suzy series. These figurines were available to collect at the Albert Heijn super markets in 2000. The game box doubles as a figurine storage box.

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Die verhexte Tümpelei
description:
Witch Bibi Blocksberg has been naughty, so her witching utensils have been thrown into a pond. The players have to help her to retrieve the items.

Bibi's items (colored chips) are placed on the board (in the pond). The black chips are placed next to the board.

The active player rolls two color dice. If a die shows white, the player loses a turn. If a die shows black, the player takes a black chip. In all other cases, the player can either take two chips in the color that he/she rolled, or all the chips between two chips of the right colors. If there is no more chip of a color rolled, the player has to place one of his/her own chips on the board.

When the last black chip has been taken, the game ends. The player who has retrieved most items is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology

name: Hellam
description:
Can you close the Seven Gates of Hellam Township before all Hell breaks loose?
Evil has broken the Hellstone seal and managed to push it up to the 4th gate. As the current Gatekeeper of the Paladins of Penn York your duty is to stop the relentless advance of Evil and attempt to push the Hellstone back to the Seventh Gate.

Hellam's theme is based on the legend of “The Seven Gates of Hell” that purportedly exist in Hellam Township, Pennsylvania.
Hellam is a fast playing, solo or two player game with a push your luck element. The person playing the Gatekeeper rolls dice in an attempt to close and seal the Seventh Gate while the Evil player pushes back on the stone in an attempt to break open the First Gate and flood our world with darkness.

name: TRU$T
description:
TRU$T, an exciting new board game for two to six players. Buy an entire island! Invest your way to billions! Gain controlling interest in your corporation! Force your partner to sell you out!

TRU$T is a game based on the ownership of corporations. There are 11 corporations in the game, each of which is made up of two to five divisions. A player may own part of all of a corporation. Ownership of all the divisions in a corporation is known as a "trust." In TRU$T, ownership of a corporation is shared when two or more players own division of the same corporation. The owners of such corporations are at the same time both partners and opponents.

TRU$T is played by moving your token around the board from island to island, buying and developing divisions of the corporations, collecting payments and dividends, and paying debts. The game ends when only one player remains who had ownership in any corporation.

name: Welthandel
description:
Goal: Be the richest merchant at that moment, when all players have reached their home port

1. Each player starts with 10 cargo cards and 2.000 money units
2. Make money by choosing a route which allows you to sell your goods as profitable as possible - look for those ports where your cargo is looked for
3. Try to be the first to enter a port, because only the first can pick up new cargo
4. Try to avoid too many difficulties on your way (storm, mist...)
5. Sell as many goods as possible to avoid penalties

If you are the first to reach your homeport you will get a bonus.

name: Space Ludo
description:
From the Publisher's website:
Space Ludo is a space sci fi themed version of Ludo, a traditional race and capture game enjoyed around the world. Ludo is related to Pachisi, Trouble, Sorry! and others. All of them are simplified descendants of the ancient Indian cross and circle game, Pachisi.

Space Ludo offers an addicting blend of luck and strategy. Dice are involved yet crucial choices occur frequently. The rules are simple yet the game is always interesting and pleasant to replay. Such are the hallmarks of a classic and so, Ludo has stood the test of time.

Space Ludo utilizes the standard, widely known Ludo rules. These comprise the foundation of play and will be familiar to long time players. New players are encouraged to play the standard game first.

Space Ludo adds the deathmatch element, wormholes and other optional rules to expand and enhance the game.

The theme of Space Ludo comes from the spaced-out universe of the indie computer games Strange Adventures in Infinite Space (2002) and Weird Worlds: Return to Infinite Space (2005).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Digital Eel, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Caperucita Roja
description:
In the box:
Who will be the first to fill her basket to Grandmother? But be careful with the wolf! A game full of surprises tour based on the famous story of "Little Red Riding Hood".

System:
The goal is to bring grandma flowers, honey and bread. Once inside the cabin with some of the gifts you have to turn the figure of Little Red Riding Hood. Grandma's bed has a mechanism that makes the wolf in granny "wake up" some times when you turn the figure of Little Red Riding Hood and the player must play must start from the beginning.

The way to get to Grandma's is a clue boxes free of obstacles.


De la caja:
¿Quién será el primero en llenar su cestita a la Abuelita? ¡Pero mucho cuidado con el lobo!
Un juego de recorrido lleno de sorpresas basado en el célebre cuento de "La Caperucita Roja".

Sistema de juego:
El objetivo del juego es llevar a la abuelita flores, miel y pan. Una vez dentro de la cabaña con alguno de los regalos, hay que girar la figura de Caperucita Roja. La cama de la abuelita dispone de un mecanismo que hace que el lobo disfrazado de abuelita "despierte" algunas veces en las que se gira la figura de Caperucita y el jugador debe jugador debe empezar desde el principio.

El camino para llegar a la casa de la abuelita es una pista de casillas libre de obstáculos.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Angelina Ballerina Dance With Me Game
description:
It's showtime! Angelina Ballerina is the star of the show and guess who she wants on stage too - YOU! Practice the moves step-by-step - every time you play it's a whole new ballet routine! When it's showtime, turn on the music and take center stage!

Players take turns spinning the spinner, collecting star cards and moving Angelina along the board rehearsing for her recital. When she reaches the It's Showtime! space each player has to try to perform the recital from memory. The player with the most star cards of the same color wins!

name: Euroopa reis
description:
From the publisher:
Game made by a local travel agency to find about more about traveling in Europe.
Game is basic roll and move, with treasure collection and trivia. Each players goal is to travel to a location shown on the card they have. Game comes with a 104 pages rule book which contains info for each country destination.
Be the first to reach destination to win the game.

Game comes in the nice box shaped like a briefcase.

name: Vita di Gesù
description:
Vita di Gesù (aka, "The Life of Jesus") is a trivia game for kids to adults. It provides a new way to learn about Jesus in his time, the story, and the characters surrounding the path of his life. To advance on the board, players have to answer questions and carefully manage the travel budget. The player who reaches the end first is the winner.

Question Categories:

Old Testament
Food & Wine
Jesus in His Time
Geography & Nature
The Story of Jesus
Miracles & Parables

name: The Three Kingdoms
description:
The game represents the Three Kingdom Era in Korea, around the 7th Century AD.

The game consists of three phases: power play and point calculation. Each player places cards on a three by three grid, then uses the results to gain either general, emperor, or cultural pieces to play on the map. Each of the key locations have a point value, and battles are fought if more than one player is on a location.

During the point calculation phase, the player uses the points from the map to increase general or culture points, determined by the type of piece that garnered those points. At the end of the game, the winner is the one with the most general points, but ignoring culture will subtract points from the total score.

name: Funny Faces
description:
The best face wins the game!

In Funny Faces, players take turns drawing a card and making a face that matches the illustration on that card. The other players then race to place their token on the tile on the gameboard that best matches the first player's expression. The player who correctly guesses the match collects the card. First player to collect three cards wins!

name: Cosmic Karma Game
description:
Enter the Earth Realm and immerse yourself in the world of karma! Collect good karma as fast as you can while avoiding bad. Acquire the tools you'll need to develop your skills: torches (intuition), swords (reason), and wands (action). Meditate in the Temple of the Torch and break habits in the Temple of the Sword. Maneuver around the Pit and don't relapse when encountering fear or ego! Strategize. Collect and use Free Will Cards to expand your options.

At the end of a physical lifetime, transition to the Spirit Realm where you reflect the past and plan the future. Re-enter the Earth Realm when and where it's most advantageous. The first player to eliminate all negative karma, collect all master tools, and return to Cosmic Consciousness wins the game.

Playable on many levels:
-As a game of chance and strategy--entertaining and absorbing
-As a metaphysical tool--provokes reflection on a variety of cosmologies
-As a self-help tool--stimulates personal insight
-As a spiritual tool-reveals the role of karma in the soul's journey
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gangs of Lamas
description:
By playing cards on the table each player tries to connect a maximum of lamas and his gang of lama-girls and form the biggest gang at the end of the game.
Each player has one lama as a secret ally to add all this kind of lamas to his final score.

In his turn player draws a card from the deck or from the discard stack. Then he places one card on the table adjacent to any other card.
Also player may do 1 of the 4 available actions: exchange the card, scream, spit or move.

name: À prendre ou à laisser
description:
Emission TF1 game presented by Arthur TO TAKE OR LEAVE based on a simple random choice to win the most money possible.

The game includes 22 boxes and each box has amount of money from 1 cent to 500,000 Euros from the game. Each player chooses one of the boxes he places before him.
The game is played in as many rounds as there are players.
In turn, the player chooses one of the remaining boxes, removing it from the game.

When the player has eliminated three boxes, the bank calls the player to make the proposition: "Take it or leave it." To do this, the player takes a fictional phone and presses a button, lights flash then stop pointing the choice "Silver" or choose "Exchange". If "Silver" appears, opponents offer money in exchange for his box, and if the player accepts, it affects the amount and withdraw from the race (the box is opened and proved its value) refuses the game continues and the next player. If "Exchange" appears, the player decides to share or not to box against that of a competitor or against a box not yet eliminated. Player may cancel the offers and exchenge and continue his play.

If all players have chosen the boxes the player with the biggest amount of money in his boxes is the winner.

name: Squinkies Battle Board Game
description: The object of the game is to capture 4 different Squinkies cards. Cards can be captured by landing on Squinkies spaces, or by winning Dice Battles against other players (when both land on a Dice Battle space), or by winning Squinkies Battle! spaces (by flicking your piece and moving another player's piece off the board). There are 6 different groups of Squinkies: Ninjas, Aliens, Warriors, Sports, Monsters, Skaters. They are on different color backgrounds. Once you have cpatured 4 different Squinkies cards, return to the Skull Cavern Dispenser in the center.

name: Legend of Nara: Battle Bugs
description:
Legend of Nara: Battle Bugs was a line of electronic action figures based on insects inhabiting a ecologically ravaged planet and battling over energy sources.

The game itself pits the mechanical insects in an arena and are guided by a tether attached to the backside of each bug. The objective is to force the opponent out of the arena. There was also sold a separate racing track set where the bugs could be let loose to careen around the track.

Each unit comes with a core similar to a "nano bug" and an interchangeable insect costume. The shapes and weights of the costumes and cores could have an effect on each bugs speed and maneuverability.

Battle bugs were sold individually, in two bug packs and the racing arena track sold separately.

Product also included an MMO and a transforming action figure set.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Electronic, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing

name: My Horse Show
description:
