Players roll a die and move plastic horse pieces along a path printed on a play mat. The trail has plastic hurdles/obstacles they have to jump along the way.

From box:

Be the first to cross the finish line as you ride your horse through a beautiful equestrian course. Test your skill with actual jumps and other challenges along the way. Be careful, you need to approach each obstacle just right to advance. Miss a jump and you'll have to go back and try again.

name: Journey: Wrath of Demons – White Bone Demons Expansion
description:
As our Pilgrims cross a desolate and craggy mountain pass, they unknowingly stray into the land of the White Bone Demons. At first, the band meets a few skeletal warriors, possessed bones of a long dead army, risen to serve their Queen. After battling against the more corrupted White Bone Demon forms, the Pilgrims find that their Cleanse Ritual is not so effective against these Demon-possessed skeletons. Finally, the narrow path takes them to the Forbidden White Cave, where the Pilgrims confront Yara, Queen of the White Bone Demon Clan, who realises that this is no ordinary group of mortals. If Yara can eat the flesh of Tripitaka, she can gain immortality, regenerate her flesh and regain her beauty. As she launches her minions into a pitched battle, the fast moving White Bone Demons scuttle across the battlefield and Yara herself joins the fray.

Will Yara’s poisoned attack will be the end of our four travelers? There is more at stake than just the Pilgrims lives. If they can defeat Yara and the White Bone Demon Clan, Tripitaka will recover the second piece of the lost Sutras and will be one step closer to restoring the seal on the Underworld.

As normal for expansions, this is not a standalone product. There will be a rules supplement, but it will be based on the Journey rulebook. You will play with some Map Tiles and Bridge Tiles from Journey and the base rules are the same. But the expansion is more than different shaped playing pieces. The White Bone Demons play very differently to the Bull Demons, being faster and harder to cleanse. Faster means it is easier for the Pilgrims to get overrun. With the Cleanse Ritual being less effective, Pilgrims will have to risk more kills and Bad Karma. You will need new strategies to defeat the White Bone Demons.

Finally, there is a new game mechanic. The White Bone Demons are the reanimated bones of long dead warriors. Demon Spirits possess the bones and over time, warp them in to horrific shapes. This separation between the Demon’s spirit and the warrior’s body may explain why the Cleanse Ritual is harder, but it is certainly the explanation of the biggest surprise the Pilgrims will face. Dead White Bone Demons are left on the board and if Yara can attract another Demon Spirit, these piles of bones may spring back to life!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Claim Jump
description:
A multiplayer RPS variant with an old west theme. Each round the players choose to act as a Miner (Scissors), a Bandit (Rock) or a Lawman (Paper) and earn enough money to retire. The first player to 10 Gold wins!

The Miners earn money if there is no bandit, or if there is a lawman.
The Bandits earn money for every miner, unless there is a lawman
The Lawmen earn money if there is a bandit.

name: Zeitmaschine
description:
Goal: be the first completing your matrix with cards (from different eras/continent)
acting simultaneously - operate one of the spinners (era or continent); all play appropriate cards - player with most cards collects all.
Barricades can be used to block one opponent;
turn one of the spinners...

Contents:
rule & instruction sheet (about the eras), board, board with 2 spinners, 6 matrices, ~320 cards, 2 barricades
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Routes du Monde
description:
Create routes of cards with photos of places from 56 countries.
Cards are valued from 3000 to 10,000 francs, 7 of each. A route starts with a transportation card (bus, train, boat or airplane) and 3 cards in sequence or 3 cards with the same value. A route can be continued by the same player or a partner, but it can be stopped by a blocking card (roadblocks, bad weather) unless a defense card can be played immediately.

The winner is the first player or team to earn 150,000 francs.

For 2-6 players, individually or in partnerships.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: WannOwann: Das Freiburger Histoquiz
description:
Each player gets 5 event cards and place them year-side down on the table.
Now the first player takes the top event card from the deck and place it year-side up on the table and start laying the first serie on the table either before or after the drawn card. Other players follow him similar way placing the cards before, after of between the cards on the serie.

In a player's turn, if he suspects that there is an error on the table, he may accuse the previous players. All cards are turned over one by one and checked the chronology. If everything is OK the current player draw a new event card as a penalty. If something is wrong the last player draw a new card.
The new serie starts.

Who gets rid of their cards first is the winner.

name: Sumo Dice
description:
Sumo Dice is a 2-player tactical microgame that uses a couple of d6 to simulate a Sumo fight.

Each player controls a die that represents a Sumo fighter. When the die moves, it changes its face-up side, and if you land your die adjacent to your opponent with a face-up number greater than his, you push it a certain number of spaces.

To win the game you basically must throw the adversary out of the board. You also win if your opponent receives 3 damage, that is usually caused by terrain features like a pit.

name: Red Baron
description:
Red Baron is a casino game where up to six players square off against the dealer in a format very similar to Blackjack. The goal is to "shoot down" the dealer by finishing with a point total that is equal to, or not more than three points less than, the dealer's.

The deck contains 70 cards: ten each of the numbers 1 through 6, and ten Red Baron cards, which are worth 0 points.

name: Casters Against the Multiverse (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
Casters Against the Multiverse is an unofficial and unauthorized fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity with a fantasy and gaming theme.

Includes 30 black call cards and 70 white response cards that blend in with your Cards Against Humanity deck.
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Besieged
description:
Besieged is a shed style card game for 2-4 players taking approximately 30 minutes after learning.

Players take the role of Commanders of an army retaliating against the villainous Agean Empire. The first to defeat three Agean officer cards wins the game. To do this, players take turns deploying legion cards that exceed the power level of the active card in play. Players have a set of Command Tokens they may spend on using a customizable set of abilities as well as playing cards.

When a player has played all the cards from their hand and Captain tableau, they can challenge Agean Officer cards.

name: Penta-Tricks
description:
User summary
ペンタトリックス (Penta-Tricks) is a game about the power struggle between aristocrats in the 14th Century France, during the reign of Louis XIV. It combines trick-taking and area-majority.

During the game, changes occur to both the trick-taking trump and the value of areas for area majority points.

The game has Dice in the suit colours set up on a pentagram showing the value 2 at the start. The trick taking follows the normal pattern, with players following the suit lead if possible and the highest card winning. If there is a Trump suit, highest Trump card will win. But after each trick, the dice values change. The winning suit rises by 1 (or 2 if it was Trump). And one of the dice opposite that winning dice falls by 1. After this change, the lowest dice (if any) now becomes Trump.

But this change in dice values also affects the players' scoring. Before the trick winner adjusts the dice values, the losers place one or two cubes against the dice of the suit they played (or its neighbour). NOTE, the winner of the trick does not get to place cubes, but does choose which dice will drop 1 point. At the end of the round, majority cubes score the face value of the dice (except the Trump die), second most gets half rounded down. Tricks won are also worth 2 points each.

So the game becomes more than just winning tricks. Players want to lose tricks so they can place a cube (2 cubes if you lose on a Trump card) and gain majorities. But they also want to win tricks to control Trump or No Trump and lower the points on another dice.

Publisher's summary
ルイ14世時代のフランスが舞台の、貴族達の権力闘争をモチーフにしたゲームです。
トリックテイキングゲームとエリアマジョリティゲームを一つにまとめたような作りになっています。
トリックテイキングの切り札がゲームの途中で変わります。
エリアマジョリティのエリアの価値もゲームの途中で変わります。

name: Blaze and the Monster Machines Axle City Adventure Game
description:
Work together with the other Monster Machines to get to the big race! Kids enjoy playing their favorite characters from the popular Nickelodeon series. Challenges cover over 40 simple STEM concepts (science, technology, engineering, and math).

Blaze and the Monster Machines Axle City Adventure Game:

Blaze and the Monster Machines is a new, exciting, and interactive Nickelodeon series for preschoolers
In the Axle City Adventure, players travel through Axle City and solve STEM challenges (science, technology, engineering and math)
Kids work together to save a friend or thwart Crusher's mischief in this speedy, cooperative board game
Challenges cover over 40 simple STEM concepts
Contents include: 2-sided game board, 5 monster machines and stands, 36 axle city adventure cards, 1 six-colored die, instructions


Game Play Overview:
Players work together to get all monster machines to the big race. All monster machines start on the start space of its matching colored track. Players take turns in order:

Roll the die and move the matching color monster machine 1 space; black is wild (choose any monster machine) If the monster machine ends on a traffic light space, draw an adventure card, read the question and select an answer. If correct, move ahead one more spot. If wrong, turn is over.
The game ends when all monster machines reach the finish line. When rolling the die, if the color of a machine that already finished comes up, select another monster machine.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Glass Face
description: Glass Face is a fast-paced, set collecting, dice and slapping game. The characters in the game are trapped in the cards. You need to slap them and set them free and place them into your care. There are 64 characters, on cards numbered 1-8. 8 of each number. There are 8 rounds in the game. Each round there are 8 cards in a line. Each player has 3 die (1-3) Everyone races to roll numbers corresponding to the numbers on the cards. When you roll the same number, you slap it and take it. If you roll a 9 you are frozen, so be careful when rolling 3 dice. Each card you collect is worth one point and if you have more of one number than anyone else, you get the point value of that card. Whoever has the most points at the end wins!
mechanics: Action Queue, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Super Mario Bros. pelastavat prinsessan!
description: Roll-and-move where players are trying to reach the Princess with both their characters, Mario and Luigi. Player pawns return to start if their square is reached by another player piece or Koopa.

name: MNM the music battle
description:
MNM the music battle is a Musical Trivia Game with an app, an internet connection is required to play, the app has sound effects, asks the questions and keeps the score. You get a wristband to identify your color and set your name in the app.

Your aim is to collect 1000 points, by answering questions about 4 categories of music. The big MNM 1000, 90 and nillies hits, sing your song and the big hits. You get 3 cards, one red, light blue and dark blue (which are the colors of the MNM logo) and those get recognized when pressing them on the screen. It's really easy, and works extremly well. At 300, 600 and 900 points you get to pick a new category out of the 4 aviable by showing a LP shaped cardboard to the camera. Which is always identified.

Some are just questions, somtimes you need to find a cover hidden in a ton of images, or watch a clip and tell which music it is, or bleeped words out of the clip or audio clip, so it has a good diversity and also plenty of questions so you don't get them repeated often.

So the theme is music, the aim of the game is to win and show your knowledge and the whole thing is an enjoying time with friends.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Terra Caravan: First Dig Edition
description:
User summary:
進め！ユグドラ探検隊 -First Dig Edition- (Terra Caravan -First Dig Edition-) is a card game based on the smartphone game of the same name. Players are excavators who dig the Earth to obtain treasures below.

Players are initially on the surface of the Earth, and big treasures lie at five-card-length below the surface. Each turn, you roll a die to determine your movement direction and move your pawn, then reveal the area card under your pawn if it is not explored yet. Depending on the card revealed, you may find an item or a small treasure, or you may be forced back to where you were. You may use items you have found for special effects, such as to destroy an impassable area, or to dig deeper than usual. When you reach a big treasure, you score big points and the round is over.

Play three rounds and the highest scorer wins the game.

Description from the publisher:
あなた達は、地底に眠るはかりしれない価値を秘めた財宝を求める発掘者。
一気に掘削できるスキルや、行く手を妨害することもできるボスブロックを駆使して最深部を目指そう！
世界の中心を目指し、全力で”Let's DIG”！

■ゲームの目的
3ラウンドを1ゲームとし、ゲーム終了時に採掘ポイント（=TP）の合計が最も高かったプレイヤーが勝ちとなります！

■遊び方（1ラウンド）
(1)ブロックカードを並べる
カードを人数に応じて並べます。

2~3名：横5 x 縦４
4名：横６x縦４

(2)アーティファクトカードを並べる
ブロックカードの一番下の列に、アーティファクトカードを1列並べます。
並べたブロックカードは上から1列目を「地表」と呼び、一番下のアーティファクトの5列目を「最深部」と呼びます。

(3)プレイ順の決定
一番最近地下深くに降りた人から時計回りの順番で進めます。
2ラウンド目以降は、最深部より遠かった順に手番を進めます。

(4)ファーストディグ
ラウンドの1番最初の手番を、特に「ファーストディグ」と呼びます。
1列目（地表）のブロックカードのどれかにコマをおき、カードをめくりましょう。
※ファーストディグでは、他のプレイヤーがすでにコマを置いている場所に置くことはできません。
※ファーストディグでは、スキルの使用はできません。

(5)ディギング
2回目以降の手番では、以下のことができます。
・サイコロを振り、コマを進める。
→サイコロの面に描かれた方向に一マス進むことができます。
・スキルを使用する。
→スキルが発動できるトレジャーカードを消費して、そのスキルの効果を使用します。
※サイコロの出目の方向に進めなかった場合は、その場に留まります。ブロックカードの効果が発生するものは、移動できなくても発動します。

(6)アーティファクト獲得！
最初の一人が最奥のアーティファクトカードに到達したら、そのラウンドは終了になります。
到達したプレイヤーはそのアーティフェクトカードを手に入れます。
その後、空いたスペースに新しいアーティファクトカードを補充してください。

TIPS! [ボスブロックに三方（左右下）を阻まれたら]
サイコロの目が「ランダム」が出たとき、上にも回避することができます。
※ゲーム終了後、一緒に遊んだ他のプレイヤーに優しくしてあげると、次回からこういうことが起こりにくくなるかもしれません。

(7)ゲーム終了と勝敗
(1)~(6)を3回繰り返したらゲーム終了です。
獲得しているトレジャーカードとアーティファクトのTPを合計し、最も高かったプレイヤーが勝ちとなります。

公式サイト：
http://talosil.com/games/yggdra/
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Dice: Boss Monsters
description:
A set consisting of 8 boss monsters and 1 terrain die.

Boss monsters are legendary monsters that are not stored in the encounter bag. Instead, they may be fought any time you wish if you are in the appropriate dungeon. Boss monsters all provide a unique ring as a reward that is worth one fame.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Negotiation
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Shopkins Make-a-Deal Matching Game
description:
Children's tile matching game.

Contains a mechanic for trading or stealing matches instead of taking an extra turn via a coin flip.

name: Levensweg VIP Editie
description: You are VIP (Rockstar, Moviestar, Sportslegend,...) driving in a limo. You need to make a crew to get in the VIP area. Your goal is to collect five stars to win the game.

name: Secret Agent 007: The Game of International Spies
description:
Μυστικός Πράκτωρ 007: Το παιχνίδι των διεθνών κατασκόπων ("Secret Agent 007: The Game of International Spies") is an old greek board game from the 60's, whose main theme is, the famous secret agent James Bond.

Your goal is to find and gather secret files, which are hidden in embassies. The winner is the player, who has most of the files in the end of the game. The game involves dice roll to move.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Klick – Klick – Bäng!
description:
You've been a gambler all your life and now you've gambled away everything, gambled to the point where you feel you have nothing left to lose.

But with this game — Klick – Klick – Bäng!, a dice game of money and life — you can win big! Just put a revolver to your temple a few times and the chances are favorable: five dry chambers and only one live one! Only those who dare win, everyone knows that, so why not you?

And if a bullet catches you, they have promised to give your winnings to your survivors, so the mortal risk to your life would not have been in vain.

name: Tick (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Tick alternates between moving one space up onto the Hive followed by one space back down again on the following turn. It cannot move along on top of the Hive. Or. it can use its special ability: Mind Control.
This allows the Tick to take control
of any enemy piece it is adjacent to at the same level of the Hive. It make the enemy piece use its own special
ability,e.g another piece, or move the enemy piece
using using the piece's own movement.

The Shieldbug moves two spaces. one up onto the Hive then one down to end its turn
use its special ability: Mind Control.
This allows the Tick to take control
of any enemy piece it is adjacent to at the same level of the Hive. It make the enemy piece use its own special
ability,e.g another piece, or move the enemy piece
using using the piece's own movement.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Picture This: The Puzzling Picture Game
description:
In this game, you will be presented with a series of puzzling close up photographs.

A card is placed face up in the middle of the table. Players study the card and the first person to correctly guess what the picture is wins the card. If no one guesses the card within a minute, a new card replaces the previous one.

The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game!

Contents: 100 cards showing close-up everyday objects and instructions.

name: Knot Tying Game: Camper's Challenge
description:
Challenge your rival.
Learn & Master 52 Knots, win points!
Unique Knot Tying Card Deck ranges in difficulty from Beginner to Advanced.
Play it as a game for 2 or more players, or brush up on your Knot Tying skills.
Each player selects one length of tying rope and one tying bar. From a deck of cards, one card is turned face up and players race to be the first to tie the Knot. The first player is given the knot tying card with its point value. Cards are played, one by one, until all the cards are used. The winner is the player with the highest sum of points.

name: Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 5-7
description:
Fight for control of Titan using exotic creatures, weapons, armor and relics in Dark Legacy: The Rising – Levels 5-7. With skill and planning, your army will become stronger, more dominant! When you level up, stronger, more powerful weapons, armor and magical spells become available for you to use to annihilate your enemies. What are you waiting for?

This expansion includes skill cards for every faction from level 5 to 7.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Rabbit Village board game
description:
At rabbit village, We are on distribution festival. Each rabbits bring their carrots to the public. During the distribution festival at the Rabbit Village, the rabbits brought out
the carrots and created a game to share the fun for everyone to enjoy.

Player must remember and perform acting to take out carrot card from own deck
to main pile for the win! But...If you are the last who have remain carrots, You are lose!
And winner give him/her some opportunity to give others happiness and fun!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Circus
description:
In Circus, players have inherited the family business: an amazing circus. After many years waiting for the moment, players take the lead to manage all aspects of the business, including hiring new shows and managing exciting attractions.

Creating an attractive circus show is as important as managing all the business resources. After all, there is only one winner in the face of tough competition—the one who can turn their business into a real success.

summarized from publisher's website

name: Oh, Wat Een Jaar!: het bordspel
description:
PLAY THE BOARD GAME VERSION OF THE TELEVISION PROGRAM ‘A YEAR TO REMEMBER!' FAMOUS FROM DUTCH TELEVISION!

Divide the players into two teams and go back to the year …?! Answer questions about that year and spot errors in famous lyrics. Who appeared in the news? And how much are you able to remember from that year? Earn the most points with your team and win!
categories: Card Game, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Battle of RÖG
description:
The Battle of RÖG (pronounced "rogue") is a trading card battle game featuring plastic character "cards" called "battlesnap cards" that laid flat when in an idle state, and then popped up into a sculpted plastic character when a button on the front of the plastic base was hit. The bottom of the cards feature wheels to allow them to be launched at each other. Each individual character has its own innate element (Fire, Earth or Fog) symbolized on the card base with a plastic badge that can be removed, allowing the elements to be switched out. The elements have strengths and weaknesses against each other, and the game is played in a rock-paper-scissors format with one element beating the other. Each character also comes with a set of detailed plastic coins for betting and wagering.

—user summary

name: Ratsastuspeli
description:
Fun riding game for over 6-year-olds who love horses.

Contents:
dice
board
4 "horses"

Select your horse and place it on the start. Your goal is to ride first to finish. Decide how many turns the race will take and who will start. Players throw the dice and ride in as many squares as the dice shows. Some screens have different functions.

The winner is the one who has first rounded the agreed turns and arrived at the finish.

—user summary

name: Policy Odyssey
description:
This is the game that puts you in the cabinet.

You're given a range of solutions and problems are unveiled. You must choose one of your solutions and then defend it to the hilt. Your competition will also be putting forward ideas. Your job is to explain why yours is the best!

Each round ends with a vote for which policy will be selected.

It's a game of quick thinking and even quicker talking.

Recommended for everywhere from the classroom to the pub, this is a game with infinite possibilities.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Politisk Ukorrekt Billeder
description:
Remake of Politisk Ukorrekt with pictures; match a picture with more or less inappropriate captions.

—user summary

name: Pie Face Sky High!
description:
Step right up! The hilarious and wildly popular Pie Face game now lets players test their strength as they attempt to give their opponent a face full of whipped cream. (Whipped cream not included). The game is set up like a strength-tester carnival game -- towering over 3 feet tall. One player stands, looks through the mask, and faces the throwing arm. The other player hits the base plate with the plastic hammer hard enough to ""pie"" their opponent! The game has an easy-to-adjust difficulty setting, making it fun for young players and adults. Score a point each time an opponent gets whipped cream in the face. The player to reach 3 points wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Stack Attack
description:
Trivia game with the twist that each team has a tower of category bricks.
On your turn, you decide whether to get an easy or a hard question, and which team to attack. The topmost brick in their tower determines the category, and if you answer correctly, the brick goes to the common pool. A wrong answer to an easy question will let the defending team put a brick from the common pool under their tower. Nothing happens if you answer a hard question wrongly.

You win by removing the last brick of another team's tower.

—user summary

name: Monopoly: Attack on Titan
description:
The fate of humanity rests in the Attack on Titan edition of Monopoly! Players travel the game board building walls and gates and assembling an elite squad to crush the titan threat and ensure the survival of mankind! Comes with 6 Collectible tokens including Sword, Key Necklace, Supply Wagon, Cannon, Flare Gun, and Omni-Direction Mobility Gear; Custom game board featuring people, banners, and events; Custom Wall Sections and Gate Marias that replace traditional Houses and Hotels; Community Chest and Chance cards that are renamed Command and Tactics; Custom themed Monopoly money; and Instructions.


Custom game board features Squad members
6 collectible metal tokens include Omni-directional mobility gear, key necklace, flare gun, sword, cannon, supply wagon
Custom gates replace traditional houses
Custom Walls replace traditional hotels


—description from the publisher

name: Starline Industries
description:
In Starline Industries, players take on the roles of galactic merchants seeking to make their mark on the universe (and impress their boss). Each turn players mark routes as they connect solar systems, gathering goods and credits along the way. Hoard goods for points and spend credits on valuable upgrades to your starship while dodging asteroids and pirates sent by other players. Each round three cards are drawn with special abilities based on the places you visit, allowing bending (and breaking!) of the rules in your favor. Sets of cards are used in coordination with special competitive goals, allowing for unique set-ups as you mix-and-match strategic scenarios.

Starline Industries is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Line Drawing, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Set-up

name: Unlikely Heroes: Cowboys
description:
Unlikely Heroes: Cowboys is a puzzling narrative adventure game in which the four friends are faced with three bullet-proof challenges, roaming the vast desert with outlaws around every dune: The Convict, The Train Job, and The Gold Hunt.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map. As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.
categories: Adventure, American West, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy

name: Alie
description:
2-4 player bluffing and dice rolling card game set in a science-fiction universe.

Each player starts the game with three Eye of Truth cards and ten hero cards.

Heroes have stats (strength, courage, wisdom, honor, and temper) on the back and stats (attack, defense) on the front. Heroes also have abilities ok the front. Players may never look at the backs of their cards.

The attacking player calls out one of the stats from the back of the cards, which could be truth or a lie. The defending player(s) call out the attacker's value for that same stat, which could be true or a lie. The attacking player announces the attack value on his/her card. The defending player(s) also do this regarding the defense value of their card. Finally, each player rolls a die and adds these three values (their die roll, the value they called out from the front, and the value that was called out to them from the back) and the highest value takes the trick and collects all cards played.

If a player believes that a called was false, they may play an Eye of Truth card.

If a player ever runs out of Eye of Truth cards or hero cards, they are out of the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Saboteur: Sabotage Shift
description:
To celebrate the author's 60th birthday, the publisher created the "Sabotage Shift" action card.

It allows to shift a sabotage card (broken equipment) from one player to another.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Map Addition, Network and Route Building, Take That, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Suicidium: Party
description:
In the Suicidium Party expansion you'll find two dice and 23 new cards illustrated by Marco Tonus to add to the basic deck for 5/6 player games.

And that's not all, in addition to the additional set of nice object cards - noose, poison, razor blade and, new entry: the harakiri - here are for you many answer cards with unpredictable effects and 6 character cards that assign each participant a special power at the start of the game!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Cthulhu Wars: Smell like a Monster
description:
Four Monstrous Air Fresheners that can have your car, boat, RV, inner sanctum, byakhee, or hovercraft smelling fresh as the day it was made/summoned.

Not only do these smell great, but you can also use them in your games of Cthulhu Wars.

Naturally you can use these Air Fresheners as special fragrant additions in Cthulhu Wars! Just download their Loyalty Cards and find a standee! Remember: there is always space for more Cthulhu Wars]!

(Standee bases not included, neither was playtesting.)

This is a one-time only event that runs from April 1, 2022, through Midnight April 4.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadowrun: Takedown
description:
In the tabletop roleplaying game Shadowrun: Takedown, you and your friends assume the roles of runners, serving as mercenaries and deniable assets for powerful megacorporations. The corps have hired you and your crew to handle the covert tasks they prefer not to have on their official payroll. Engage in these missions, survive, and strive to achieve legendary status in the streets.

Players select their roles and runner boards, each providing unique stats that influence the gameplay for each character. This game introduces the Mastermind role, a solitary position that supports the team in exclusive ways but cannot physically participate. The Mastermind can grant special bonuses to players during missions, along with their own role-specific benefits. Each player has the opportunity to acquire specialized gear and upgrades to enhance their abilities. While gear can be exchanged among players if it suits someone else better, technological improvements and specialized training upgrades are restricted. The game offers a range of balanced character and gear advancements, allowing characters to develop over the course of a progressively challenging campaign.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Real-time, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Action Timer, Contracts, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time, Role Playing

name: Remando En Dulce De Leche
description:
Remando En Dulce De Leche is the experience of living in Argentina brought to a board.

You can study, work, save, invest, but the entire environment conspires against you, and the rules of the game change all the time. Hyperinflation, unemployment, taxes and other crises change your plans, and you will come across corrupt people, leaders, kids, businessmen and even hippies with prepaid bills, all willing to complicate your life.

To win, you're going to need to be flexible, fast, but also a lot of luck... Or some contact with the right people.

It is not the one who wins the most who wins, but the one who loses the least. But, yes, we take it with a lot of humor!
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: BODY COUNT: Terror at Camp Hackaway
description:
ESCAPE ROOMS ARE ALL THE RAGE!!! But someone is taking the concept to the next terrifying level.

Abandoned and forgotten for over two decades, Camp Hackaway sits in the middle of a thick forest where foliage and undergrowth have nearly reclaimed the old campground. People from all over the world are being abducted and dropped off in the forest on the outskirts of Camp Hackaway, forced to become unwilling participants in the ultimate game of escape and survival. Each participant is given a flashlight three very simple rules: 1) Search the cabins of the campground, find the key to the old pickup truck. 2) Survive the random attacks crazed serial killer Hackin' Hank. 3) Escape in the old pickup truck and win the game. And it won't be as easy as Hackin' Hank constantly roams the campground, stalking the participants one by one.

Body Count is a horror themed card/board game hybrid that utilizes tile-flipping mechanic to simulate the fog of war as the players roam the campground in the dead of night, unsure of their surroundings. The game board is made up of a 4x4 grid of 3.5 inch square tiles that begin face-down. As players move along the grid, they flip tiles to reveal their destination before moving to the next tile. If they discover a cabin, they may search it and possibly find items to help them fend of Hank if he attacks, but they may also find other, more horrifying objects such as severed heads and human remains that may trigger other events that can change the game and affect their chances of escaping alive.

After each player's turn, a card is drawn from Hank's location deck to see where he pops up in the campground - if it's a location occupied by a player, Hank attacks. If a player enters a tile adjacent to a tile occupied by Hank, he gets the opportunity to stalk and attack them.

The game board changes with every game so you'll never play the same game twice.

Do you have what it takes to SEARCH, SURVIVE, and ESCAPE?
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Thy Realm
description:
Thy Realm is a strategic skirmish miniature game that uses cards for the figures.

Thy Realm Card/Miniature game will take you into a fantasy realm that you control by picking your own realm and heroes. Your figures are the card therefore, there will be no need to assemble or paint just go out of the box.

Fight with your realm's heroes against other realms in strategic battles. Using cards that are your heroes miniature, you can move across the landscape of the realm. Each hero has its own abilities and or feats. There are five realms to choose from; Elvin, Dwarven, Human, Orc, and Dark.

In the Elven realm, you have graceful yet dangerous opponents with ranged attacks, fast movement and daring.

In the Dwarven realm, your army is solidly built with determined fighters that can withstand almost any assault.

The Human realm is a versatile army that can adapt to many situations.

The Orcs are heavy hitting and numerous.

The Dark Realm relies on fear and terror.

name: Beat Down Wrestling
description:
Description from the publisher:

Beat Down Wrestling is a family friendly 2 - 4 player game. It features 10 original wrestler cards.Choose your wrestler and battle your opponent. Take turns rolling the "1,2,3" dice and move through the Beat Down Universe. Land on a "Story" space and pick up one of 40 "Story Cards". A story card may be beneficial or it may be detrimental. You can save some cards, and some cards must be played immediately.

Get Into The Ring
If you land on a "Fight" space, you have the option of challenging your opponent to a match. Take turns drawing fight cards until you have an even amount of cards and some one has reached 10 damage points. The winner will pick up a " Winner Card "and the loser will go back to the Start or the Mid-Card Checkpoint.

To Win
To win you must enter the ring and consecutively roll a 1,2,3. If you roll a 1 but not a 2 your opponent gets a turn and can still challenge you to a fight. On your next turn you must roll a 2 and then a 3. When you do not roll the consecutive numbers you are vulnerable to be challenged to a fight and lose the progress you have made on the board and in the rolling process.

name: Bla Bla Cat
description:
Once a decade, a big tournament is organized. Contestants from all over the world compete to win the ultimate prize: the goldenfish!
This trophy grants to his owner an abondance of fishes for the rest of his life. But to be the chosen one, you must defeat your opponents, avoid the tricks and persuade the jury.

Bla Bla Cat is a party game where you have to defeat your opponents in a amazing debate tournament.

When a player is eliminated, he still plays as member of the jury until the end of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: 60 Second Chef
description:
60 Second Chef is a competitive, time-based, creative card game. Players are tasked with using ingredient cards and their imagination to create delicious dishes.

The game consists of 100 ingredient cards, 4 wild cards, menu score pads, sand timer, and instruction manual. Each ingredient card has three numbers on it representing the value of that ingredient if used in an appetizer, entree, or desert.

Game play consists of four rounds. At the beginning of a round, each player is dealt ten ingredient cards. The sand timer is turned and every player has sixty seconds to create three dishes; an appetizer, an entree, and a desert using the ingredient cards in their hand and a pantry that all players have at their disposal. At the end of the sixty seconds each player must write down their three dishes on their menu score sheet. Then going clockwise each player starting to the left of the dealer presents their three dishes to the other players. If there are no objections to the dishes presented, the score is tallied based on the value of the ingredient card and which dish it is used in.

After four rounds the player with the highest score is considered the winner.

name: Chicks Battle the Dudes
description:
From the box:
The Masculine v. Feminine Brain
Who has more "pull" - the women or the men?
When talking fashion or Brad Pitt's love life, the chicks clearly know more. But do they know which Clint Eastwood movie launched him to fame?

This team game is designed to bring men and women together, showing that no matter how gender-neutral we try to be, out brains click in on different subjects. Women are asked questions that most men can answer and men are asked questions that most women can answer. But there may be a few surprises!

It's a Tug-of-War

Pull the rope with each right answer. The first team to pull its opponents into the center of the board wins the game. But watch out - the challenge cards give both sexes a chance to come out on top!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: Thunderbirds: Mission Alert Game
description:
If you have to smile when you think back to the cheesy special effects of your childhood, you’ll love this nod to the classic “supermarionation” series, Thunderbirds. More than a nod to nostalgia, this game features completing exciting missions to win. The board features Tracy Island in the center (which is home base) and five zones: Space, Air, Oil Rig, Underground and City. Draw Mission cards to see where you’ll go, who will lead, what vehicle you’ll use, what you will accomplish and how many points your mission is worth. Complete the mission and return to Tracy Island safely and you'll get the points. At the end of the game, add up your points to see who wins!

Contents:
66 Thunderbird Cards
25 Mission Cards
24 Equipment Cards
17 Thunderbird 5 Cards
6 Pawns
1 die.

For 2 to 6 players.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
publishers: Carlton Books, Pressman Toy Corp., Susan Prescot Games

name: Sterntaler
description:
This is a game for ages 3 and up. The box contains a board, 20 wooden stars, 1 figurine and a color die.

The board is showing a beautiful landscape. On the bottom part of the board, 10 colored fields are arranged next to one another. Across these fields tracks have been punched into the map. The stars fit perfectly in these tracks.

The figurine is a girl with an apron. The girl has to collect the stars. The color die shows the three colors used on the different fields of the board.

For starters the stars are placed on the tracks. The girl is placed next to the out most right field.

On your turn you roll the die and bring the girl to the closest field of the same color. If the track on that field contains a star you can remove it from the track and keep it with you. If you have two possible directions to move, you can chose which direction you will take.

The game ends when all stars have been collected. The winner is the player who has collected the most stars.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Macskafogó
description:
The game is based on a (Hungarian) animated movie from the 80s. The english title for the movie was Cat City.
Grabowski the mouse plays against the rats Pissy, Buddy, Cookie and Billy and the cat Teufel. The aim of the game is to be the first to complete a puzzle. Grabowski gets a piece of his puzzle for arriving at the lab, the rats/cat get a piece of theirs if they manage to trap Grabowski.

name: Hexen Werk
description: The King is sick and 10 prescription cards are on the table. Witches take turns revealing an ingredient, trying to fulfill a prescription.

name: Mensch ärgere Dich nicht: Das Kartenspiel
description: The object of the game is to be the first to have a set (1-6) of the same color. It doesn't matter if a Special Joker or a Colored Joker are part of the set.

name: Fem myror är fler än fyra elefanter: Lär om siffror
description:
A sister game of `Fem myror är fler än fyra elefanter: Lär om bokstäver´, this is a children´s game about numbers. There are seven different ways to play, representing seven difficulty levels.

Players each have their own board. A number of tiles are placed face-down on the table, a la Memory. Players roll the die to see how many tiles (1, 2 or 3) they may turn face-up. Any tiles that match the player´s board are placed on the board.

In the seven variants, players are required to match numbers with numbers (2 - 2, easy), animals with numbers (two lions - 2, slightly more advanced), and so on.

The winner is the first player to fill his/her board.

Themed on a very popular Swedish TV show for kids.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Fleißige Bienen
description: Each player on his turn flies with his magnetic honey bee to any bloom and puts the bee on the pollen in the middle of the bloom. He then lifts the bee up carefully. If he is lucky some pollen will keep sticking to the magnet. Then he may immediately fly back and deposit the pollen into the honeycomb. The winner is the player who fills up 5 honeycombs first.

name: Grey's Anatomy Trivia Board Game
description:
Players take on the role of their favorite character and move along the Experience path, answering trivia questions and relationship scenarios along the way. For 2 - 6 players Ages 14 and up.

Comes in a boxed and tin version with the later having 100 Grey Matter cards, the former 75 of them.
categories: Medical, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Chicken Run, Escape From Tweedy's Farm
description:
Spin of from the Aardman Animations oscar-winning claymation film.

"The race is on for your chickens to escape from Tweedies form before the dastardly Mrs Tweedy feeds them into the Piematic machine

Each player has control of 6 chickens (the 6 main characters from the film). You attempt to have your chickens escape through use of ingenious plans, daring, co-operation, judgment, skill, and luck. But first you must have a plan, which will require varying amounts of equipment to construct and implement"

Players take it in turn to roll the dice moving their chickens to collect and store escape items and escape plans. Mrs Tweedy and the guard-dogs are also moved by the players to hinder each other.
categories: Animals, Farming, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: The Beatles Flip Your Wig Game
description:
A marketing tie-in for The Beatles, the game consists of rolling a die to move your "Beatle" (John, Paul, George, or Ringo) to a new space which may instruct the player to draw one of two different types of cards, steal a card from one or more other players, or lose a card.

Play continues until one player wins the game by collecting the four cards corresponding to the "Beatle" that they are playing. i.e. John needs to collect a John picture card, a John signature card, a John's Guitar card, and a hit record card.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Toy Story Toys Away
description:
Toys Awaaaay! is a board game tie-in with Disney's Toy Story movie. The goal for players is to launch their toys into Andy's Toy Box, which is part of a backdrop mounted on the board).

Each player selects three toys and puts them on the 2 starting places on the board. Taking turns, they flick a spinner and, based on the results, moves one of their toys towards Andy's Bed (where the launcher is installed).

When a toy has reached the launcher, the player loads it onto the device and launches it at the backdrop. A toy that landed in the Toy Box is safe and scored. A toy that landed off the board is placed in Sid's Room and remains there until its player flicks a lucky result on the spinner. The toy is placed back on a starting place.

The first player to land all three of his or her toys into the Toy Box wins and ends the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Comic Crusades
description: The evil and powerful necromancer, Syntari, has accidentally been set free from an ancient castle ruin and is threatening all of humanity. These heroes and heroines have bravely come together to put an end to Syntari's reign of terror. Players will answer multiple choice questions dealing with all aspects of your favorite comic books and comic book characters. Each correct answer increases your power in speed, strength, intelligence or energy blasts. By increasing your power and avoiding Syntari's attacks, you may be the one to save the Endgame Universe.

name: Terre Invisibili
description:
Self-producted fantasy boardgame.

Every player has a character represented by a counter on the game map.

Players try to increase the features (strength, agility, stamina, mind and... money) of their characters according to the classical fantasy setting (wander, have encounters, fight the monsters, take the gold).

The final goal is to find and piece together the fragments of the Wand and become ruler of the lands.

Rules and cards are only in Italian.

"Terre Invisibili" means "Invisible Lands" in English.

name: Kaivospeli
description:
A game of Finnish mining industry where players drill for mine and transport it to refineries or harbors for export. Transportation is done by rolling dice and moving and moving accordingly.

The board is a partial map of Finland with actual locations of Finnish mines in the 1980's. Game has been produced in cooperation with the Finnish mining industry, specifically the companies Outokumpu Oy and Rautaruukki Oy.

The given number of players (1-4) is probably a typo as there is no solo variant in the rules, and the game is totally meaningless if played alone with the rules as they are.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mr. Potato Head Pals
description: This game has players competing to build up their Mr. Potato Head Pal (the "pals" are 4 different smaller-sized Mr. Potato Head figures--two boys and two girls, each with different hats, eyes, mouths, etc). The game can be played in two ways--in the more difficult version, players compete to complete the specific "pal" they have a card for. In the slightly easier variation, players compete to build any kind of pal first, similar to Cootie.

name: The Book of Mormon Card Game
description:
The Book of Mormon Card Game is an LDS variation on Go Fish. Cards are numbered 1-13, with each number representing a book from the Book of Mormon. (The books of Enos, Jarom, and Omni are combined onto one card.) There are also four suits, Beehives, Buffalo Skulls, Seagulls, and Wagon Wheels. Players ask others for the cards they need to complete the "Books" by asking either for the name of the prophet pictured on the card (for children) or by quoting a scripture on the card (for advanced players).

The rules make note that this deck of cards is appropriate for other standard card games as well.

name: Shaun das Schaf: Komme, was Wolle
description: The players must count sheep and pigs on two cards. Depending on what is the higher number the players must lay cards in the middle of the table.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Landsknecht
description: This simple gambling game is played with a standard deck of cards. The banker deals two cards face-up, one to the left and one to the right. If the suits match, the banker wins all the bets, otherwise he reveals more cards, one at a time, till the suit of one of them matches the right or left card. I f it is the left card, the banker wins, if it is the right cards, the players win.

name: Gallop!
description:
From the Publisher:

Which animal will win the race? Open the magical Scanimation door to see who will move on each round. You’ll be strutting, galloping, and fluttering along as you race around the track. Guess correctly to win! Based on the popular book by Rufus Butler Seder.

- A first game for preschoolers just learning to play games
- Players can hop, fly or run, just like the animals do!
- Each player takes a turn opening the Scanimation door to see which animal goes next.

Includes:
1 Game Board with Magical Scanimation Door
2 Dice
5 Animal Movers
4 Guess Tokens
1 Set of Rules

name: The Ring of the Nibelung
description: The Ring of the Nibelung is a micro-game (18 cards) for 2-4 players. Each player starts with 4 cards that will be used to try to find and steal the cursed ring. That is unless you already have the ring - which then means you will have to work to try to play the ring as soon as you can. The player who successfully plays The Ring Card wins the game.

name: Bid, Bluff & Buy
description:
To play Bid, Bluff & Buy, you don't have to "know the facts" to win. . . you just need to be able to bluff, cajole and have fun. The game consists of 20 different auctions in five different genres: Music, Movies, Television, Sports and History. Players begin each auction with $30,000 and try to accumulate the most wealth by buying items in the auctions with the highest value. The items in this game were actually sold in a real auction and the Estimate, Opening Bid and Sold Price were the prices recorded at the auction on the date identified on the card and in the catalog.
Whoever has the most wealth at the end of the auction wins the game. However, if the Auction House has the most wealth, then the House wins!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Miraculous: Throwdown!
description:
Capture all the excitement of Miraculous with the fun and fast-paces collectible card game Throwdown.

With everything you need to play included in this set, you become the character. Be the Miraculous Ladybug, Cat Noir, or Hawk Moth. Equip your character and disarm your opponent to gain the greatest advantage. Call upon help from Kwamis (Magical Companions) to either devastate or regenerate each other's decks. Surprise with your signature attack but beware of Hawk Moth's traps.

THROWDOWN! is a turn based card game that uses the Draw-Attack-Discard system or D.A.D.s. During the game you will have a character, a deck, and a discard pile. First you need at least 2 or more people to play and each person will need to have their own character card and deck. The objective of the game is to attack your opponents deck. You do this with your character card and cards you draw from your deck. You win when their deck is completely depleted. No matter how many people play you will always attack the person to your left, so until you get down to two players you cannot attack the person that attacked you.

Setting up to play is easy just place your character card next to your deck and your discard pile will go on the other side of your character. Flip a coin to see who goes first, then follow 3 easy steps.

STEP 1 DRAW - On your turn DRAW a card from your deck and place it in front of your character card.
STEP 2 ATTACK - Your character must ATTACK on your turn and will automatically defend your deck on your opponents turn. Total and resolve conflict damage. Follow any additional rules on the card.
STEP 3 DISCARD - Now discard the card in play and put it into your discard pile, it is now your opponents turn and they follow the 3 easy steps.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly L.O.L. Surprise!
description:
Monopoly, but there are fewer spaces: The board is only eight spaces per side, and each group only consists of two properties.
The theme is dolls and pets, and instead of upgrading with houses and hotels, you upgrade with stars and emojis.
Finally, Chance and Community Chest have been merged to one stack.

—user summary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: 100 Things
description:
In 100 Things, players quickly hunt for the correct six objects from an array of silhouettes. A clue-giver has the list, but using a rolled die, must constantly switch up their clue-giving between drawing, performing, and giving limited word clues. Players can play cooperatively to try and get all six items correct as fast as possible, or play competitively to record their guesses and compare for the highest score. Can you spot the right things in time?

100 Things is a free-to-play printable game designed during the COVID-19 crisis, and will remain available here and through the publisher's website forever, with continued support.
categories: Deduction, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Procrastinator
description:
This game addresses two very popular and modern topics in a funny way: the fear of AI replacing humanity and the modern work environments and it's vicissitudes.

In this game you are an advanced AI machine that is trapped in an infinite loop of meaningless chores, issued by the always watching, always busy work-o-matic system.

Like your late human creators you enjoy texting, gaming and series watching and for that purpose, you have developed unique code that delays work or make other AI units work while you procrastinate enough until your tasks gets archived forever.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Drawing, Interrupts, Resource to Move, Take That, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Street Masters: Tide of the Dragon
description:
Street Masters: Tide of the Dragon is a standalone expansion for Street Masters, the critically-acclaimed cooperative miniatures board game of street brawling action for 1-4 players. Designed by veteran game designers Adam and Brady Sadler with Scott McFall and Mitch Schroeder, and heavily influenced by classic “beat ‘em up” arcade games and Hong Kong action movies of yesteryear, Tide of the Dragon is a standalone experience that contains everything needed to play, but also allows returning Street Masters fans to use its all-new fighters, enemy factions, stages, and other modular elements with the rest of the products in the fan-favorite game series that has been lauded since its debut in 2017.

Expanding on the modular nature of Streets Masters, Tide of the Dragon includes a new way to further customize players’ experiences. Terrain cards allow fighters to introduce new terrain elements to their battles, such as ladders that can be used to climb up and away from enemies or fire hydrants that can launch a powerful water stream to damage opponents.

Street Masters: Tide of the Dragon includes 52 highly detailed miniatures; 4 New Fighters with their own unique Fighter and Hero Story Decks; a New Double-Sided Map Tile with 2 New Stage Decks; 2 New Enemy Factions with unique Enemy and Showdown Decks; 4 Terrain Cards; a Tide of the Dragon Story Deck; 12 New Ally/Rival cards, and all the dice, tokens, dividers and base rings needed to play right out of the box!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Set-up

name: Tripoley for Kids
description:
From the publisher:

Play a combination of kid favorites, Fish, Snap and War. Includes game board, kids deck and 120 colorful chips.

name: Everest
description:
The players race for conquering Mt. Everest. The game features a 3d mountain with the East, Southwest and North faces of Everest.

The players may choose to begin either in Kathmandu or Lhasa. Players advance by rolling a die. The approach march takes place on the flat part of the board and once you have reached your base camp you may again choose between longer and shorter, but more risky, routes to the summit.

There are three kinds of event cards, for approach march, camp and climbing events. A card is drawn when a player lands on a marked space or a camp. There are both good and bad events to advance or delay the conquest.

When climbing players must set up 4 camps and go back and forth between them to "acclimatize". Aluminum ladders and safety ropes may be set up by successful die roll to get over chasms and evil spots. Once the player enters the Death Zone (over 8000 m) oxygen tanks are needed. In case all oxygen is consumed without the player being able to reach the summit, she must return to previous camp to get more. The first player back at base camp after summiting Everest is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TimeTripper
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Introducing Timetripper™, the game with a past and an attitude. History appears right before players' eyes as they travel back in time to remember important events, pop culture and legendary personalities. Players are asked to guess the year of key milestones in current affairs, music, politics and entertainment. Every player guesses on every question in a race to earn letters and be the first to spell fun words, such as Pink Panther or Mellow Yellow, to win the game.

name: Monopoly: Worcester Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Worcester, in the United Kingdom.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fancy Nancy Card Game
description: A children's set collecting game based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor. Players pass cards looking to collect the 8 "posh" accessories for Nancy needed to win. 48 cards. 3 to 6 players

name: The Victorian Gamer
description:
In 19th Century Britain, sports were invented and developed to provide the idle rich with a means of betting large sums of money against each other. In The Victorian Gamer you are one of the idle rich.
No aristocrat worthy of his name would have been without a fast running footman or a stable boy who was a particularly able jockey. He would put up his ‘man’ against another noble’s ‘man’ for an agreed sum. The sport was incidental; it was the outcome that counted, with the winner taking all. And of course, a whole new industry of side betting with bookies quickly emerged.
The Victorian Gamer mirrors this era. There are three different events – running, rowing and horseracing - each one having its own unique gameplay. In addition, players can make bets against each other and/or with the bookie. And furthermore, to add a bit of extra spice there are three differently numbered dice to form the odds and affect the outcomes.
In short, there are three different races, two ways of betting, but only one winner. For friends and family with even the tiniest element of a competitive streak, The Victorian Gamer will provide hours of fun, not to mention a few squabbles, huffs and sulks. Warning – NOT A GAME FOR BAD LOSERS.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bibi Blocksberg: Das verflixte Hexkraut Spiel
description:
A licensed game with the famous (comic) little witch Bibi Blocksberg. From the rulebook: The senior witch Mania has a terrible witches cold. The witches congregation decides to make a witches brew that will heal her. A senior witch that has a cold isnt useful to the witches. So we hurry up to the Blocksberg (a mountain in the german harz region where witches are said to be gathering), where the herbs grow. But beware: between healing herbs there is the devilsleaves. And that has a scent which makes witches unable to move...

The players place plastic chips of their own colour on the gameboard. Then a black chip representing the devils leaves. By rolling a die they can move on the board, forwards and backwards. The goal of the game is to collect their two own colour chips and reach the top of the game board to place them into the witches cauldron while avoiding the black chip. When reaching other players chips they can play tricks on them...
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Naboo & Battle of Hoth
description:
From the packaging:

"Two Players face off in an epic battle of planetary conquest in the Star Wars universe. Roll the dice, blast through your opponent's defenses and capture their command center to win"

Each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small diorama. Each has a unique combination of abilities.

This set has Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Hoth, Battle of Naboo is exclusive to this set.

name: Game Box: Family Feud – Marvel Edition
description:
"Survey says...the card game based on the popular tv show Family Feud. Give the most popular answers to a variety of MARVEL themed survey questions to win.

User review:
One player acts as host to ask questions and verify responses while the other players divide into two preferably equal teams. The teams each choose one their own to faceoff for the question. The host asks the question written on a card and the first member to respond may control the question if the response is top answer on the card. The other team gets one chance to give a higher rated response if the first team did not give the top rated response.

Whichever team wins the faceoff gets to try to name all of the answers on the card with team member taking turns at guessing. If the team correctly guesses all the answers without getting three wrong guesses then that team wins the card. Failure to guess all of the answers gives the other team, as a group, one last guess as to what answer may be left unguessed. If this team is correct then it scores the card, if not the first team gets the card anyway.

The first team to score five cards is the winner.

Although not faithful to the television series on which it is based, players familiar with the television series can duplicate the game show using the material provided.

name: Hexahedron
description:
User summary:

Reveal an oversized card, put 90 seconds on the clock, then attempt to find the correct side on each of the six enormous cubes, and arrange them to match the image displayed on the card. Hexahedron is a game for any number of players (even one) that features 36 pieces of abstract art by Alex Beard.

name: New Kids On The Block Game
description: This simple track game is themed after the boy band of the same name. On your turn you roll the die and move the number of spaces indicated. If you roll "New Kids On The Block", you draw a card and play a card from your hand (these send you to a specific space). If you land on a space with the name of a New Kid, you take a framed picture of that Kid from the supply. When you have 3 or more pictures you may try to win by landing on the Finish space. You then roll the die and add the number of pictures you've collected to the number rolled. If the total is 10 or more, you win.

name: Rutschpartie mit Winnie the Pooh
description:
A fun 3D ladder game.

Winnie and his friends have discovered huge footprints. They bravely follow the trail and a fun and exciting race begins. Especially high gaming enjoyment is guaranteed by the large game board, set up like a roof. Even little children can follow the trail with the help of the colored die and let their playing figure slide over the large game board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Jedi: Duellspelet
description:
Translated from the back:

In this game the good fights the evil during the clone wars. Every time the good and the evil meet on the board they have a duel. The player who first get past the evil warriors, and reach the goal, wins the game.

In this game the player move along a 18 spaced track by rolling a die numbered 0-3. They also roll a fighting die that allows an evil warrior to enter the track. If you enter a space with an evil warrior, you have to fight it by rolling the fighting die.

name: Roll-em Jack-Pot Dice
description:
Any number of people may play. Each player contributes 5 or more chips to the Jack-Pot before starting the game.

The staring player and those that follow each in their turn of play place one chip to the Jack-Pot for 1 throw of the dice. Each Player is awarded or penalized by the Jack-Pot according to the symbols thrown. FREE throws earned (1 Cherry with any 2 symbols) are taken before passing the dice.

The player pays Jack-Pot 1 chip for each Lemon in any throw of the dice.

Play continues rotating to the left until the luck player "Hits The Jack-Pot."

name: Dinosaur Train All Aboard Game
description:
Publisher Blurb
Hop on board the Dinosaur Train and follow the path through the Triassic, Jurassic and Cretaceous periods. Mr. Conductor tells you how many spaces you can move. Landing on pocket watch spaces moves you closer to finish, but crossing spaces move you back. Be the first player to reach the nest to win.

For 2 to 6 players, ages 4 and up.

Contents: Game board, 7 movers, 6 mover stands, pocket watch spinner wheel, spinner, rules.

User Summary
Spinner the spinner to determine the number of spaces to move. Land on a pocket watch space to move further, a crossing space will move you backwards. The winner is the first to reach the nest.

name: Mickey Mouse Coming Home Game
description:
The Mickey Mouse Coming Home Game is a variant on Pachisi with a Disney theme; in the UK it was released as Mickey Mouse Ludo. Players act as popular Disney characters from the early 1930s and race to get all four of their pawns to Mickey's house before the others. Landing on an opponent's pawn sends it back to the player's starting area.

As is familiar in British Ludo games for children, this game uses a single die for movement. However, it also includes safety spaces, which are usually absent from Ludo and more commonly seen in Parcheesi and other, more complex variants. The board also includes hazard spaces, which is relatively unique for a Ludo/Parcheesi game.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement
publishers: Chad Valley Co Ltd., Marks Brothers Company

name: Fact or Crap: Beat Da Bomb DVD Game
description:
From the publisher:

Fact or Crap, the best-selling board game, is now a DVD game with an added time twist. Players take turns in the hot seat as they race to answer all of the on-screen questions before time runs out and the bomb explodes. The amount of time you have before the bomb explodes is random and changes every time, so players never know how long they have to complete the challenge! Hosted by Howie Mandel, the host of the Deal or No Deal TV show and DVD game.








You have to be the first player to collect three gold tokens. Do you have what it takes to beat da bomb? Just answer... Fact or Crap!

name: Ludy Ludo
description:
Ludy Ludo is a time-honored tradition in the West Indies that originated centuries before in India. Like most circle and cross games, Ludo evolved from Pachisi, with which it shares some game mechanics. There are many variations on play.

The object is to get your four Markers "born" and safely "to Heaven" before your opponents and without capture. The roll determines your fate: a 6 causes your Marker to be born and gives you an extra roll. If your opponent lands on a square occupied by one of your Markers, it's back to Bornless for you. If Lady Luck is on your side you can protect your Markers by placing two in a square to form a Bar and block your opponents. The path to Heaven is rife with exciting twists of fate.

In all variations of play, the first player to get all his or her Markers into Heaven wins.

name: Russian Roulette
description:
Each player selects a different doubles and places a marker on the board to signify that it is his. All players then ante one chip to the jackpot. The first player then takes the dice and rolls and continues to roll until he rolls a 7. Each rolled number is kept track of unless a 7 or doubles is rolled.

If a double is rolled the player who has the double marked adds it to his score and must ante a chip into the jackpot. On a seven the total that the player has rolled is added to his score and a new round is started. If a 7 is rolled by way of a 6 and a 1 the player forfeits his entire score and must ante 1 chip. The first player to achieve a score of 252 or better while it is his turn to roll wins the game and collects the jackpot.

The rules do not assign any significance to the jackpot so I can only think that it is supposed to be a betting game. The rules are provided in English and Spanish.

name: Online
description:
Write words, so they hook into each other; i.e. the last letter in a word should be the start of the next word.

During 30 seconds you write as many words as possible in the category you randomly has pointed at on the subject sheet. Next time you pick a new subject.

The one who first fills his sheet with a long chain of words is the winner.

Could be played as 2 player or as 2 teams (probably not more than 2 players in each).

The game is licensed from "The Michael Kohner Corporation" to the Swedish company Alga, so it exists probably in other countries.

name: Sex Maniacs
description:
Adult trivia game. If you answer the question correct, you get to keep the card. Cards have letters, collect S-E-X-M-A-N-I-A-C to win.

Questions are quite sober, like "What does the letters AIDS stand for?" or "What is a 'Prince Albert'?"
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Prism Leisure Corporation PLC

name: The Fishing Game
description:
Anglepen's Original The Fishing Game is a beautiful, lovingly made production of a fishing sim. It features a large three-fold board of a fine painted lake, sets of large cards with excellent artwork and unbelievably, 6 different solid pewter figures of fishers and two little pewter rowboats. There is even a Record Book to keep a diary of your days by the lake.
And days it will be, because, despite the wonderful attention to detail and genuine care taken in its making, this is a deadly dull game of dice rolling and dice rolling and dice rolling. You first seed the board with little paper tiles showing fish on one side & their weight hidden below. Then you have to roll dice to walk round the lake to your chosen fishing spot (why???), roll dice to use the rowboat, roll dice to hook a fish, roll dice to reel it in, roll dice as the fish runs and so on. The cards are used as part of landing the fish, being Run, Hazard & Problem cards. So it may run straight to you, but if it slips into the reeds, you lose your catch.
No doubt habitual fishers will enjoy the tedium and it may well be a fine simulation of the sport, but any gamers will go mad.

Absolutely typical for a British product, a classic case of theme before game, no idea of a mechanism beyond dice and hazard cards. The graphic artist is named, but the actual designer is not. I suspect it is the eponymous Anglepen. The producers included an order form for parts, baseball cap, T-shirt and future accessories.

name: Game Spice: Monopoly Expansion (fan expansion for Monopoly)
description:
Game Spice: Monopoly Expansion is a set of 30 new Chance Cards and 30 new Community Chest cards that replace the existing Chance and Community Chest cards. These new cards affect the game far more than the original cards. For example, various cards will allow you to steal property from other players, build houses without owning the whole color group, change your die roll, or charge an opponent double rent. One card even introduces a new victory condition.

This expansion set works with any version of Monopoly.

The author had originally planned to create additional expansions for Monopoly which could provide opportunities to buy the Jail, Tax, and Chance spaces and collect rent on them, various nasty ways to accidentally (and not so accidentally) die, extra railroads and utilities that will allow players to charge obscene amounts of rent, and new ways to extort huge sums of money and favors from friends and family. These ideas never came to fruition.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pinocchio
description:
The decorated title is «Walt Disney Presents Pinocchio Game».

The object of this young children's game is to collect a set of colored cards showing Pinocchio as a real live boy. As the players go round the track (using a spinner), they draw cards and follow their instructions ("Return a Pinocchio Card", "Draw a Pinocchio Card and Move Forward Three Spaces", etc.). Several "bad spaces" make you lose a turn --because Pinocchio gets in trouble.

In the first stage, each player tries to collect the three parts of Pinocchio's silhouette, in black and white, never holding more than three cards at once. Once this is achieved, the player is now safe from losing any of these cards. From that point on, the player hopes to get "Turn a Pinocchio Card" cards --once all three parts of Pinocchio are in color, he comes alive and the player wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Treasure Trolls
description: Be the first player to collect one of each Wishstone and get to Wishbone Mountain. The winner gets to make a Treasure Troll wish.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Black Hole: Voyage of Fear Game
description:
Spin the spinner, pray to be the winner.

The Black Hole movie themed game board features a spin and move mechanism with numbered squares with "special instructions". First one to finish line wins.

Includes special "dial wheel" spinner gadget to spin for movement and "dial" special instructions.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Das Deutsche Raumfahrtspiel D1
description: A game inspired by the first German space shuttle mission named "D1". The players compete to get the most funding for their scientific experiments by moving scientists on the inner ring of the board, while managers of the corresponding industries move along the outer ring. On some marked fields on the board the player has to answer trivia questions about space exploration and the science in order to get another move for his scientists.

name: Megalomania
description:
Gripped by Election fever, there is little the genuine megalomaniac will not do to gain power. Going around the board, the players as candidates in a political election, have the opportunity to:
Raise money - legally or in the underworld, where rewards and risks are high
Spend money on advertising and broadcasting
Discover the Underworld activities of others and declare them to the newspapers
Strike deals with other candidates
Bribe newspaper editors

name: Spider-Man Web Attack
description:
From the rules:

Travel through the web of the game board and defeat Kraven the Hunter, Green Goblin, Black Cat, and Dr. Octopus. All four villains make up a mini-jigsaw puzzle! Then be the first player to reach the win space in the center of the board!

This game features a plastic "wall" (about the size of a paper-back novel) that is used for combat. You place the cardboard villain pawn that you are fighting next to the wall and hang a cardboard Spiderman from the top to represent you. Then you push a button that either shoots a cardboard "web" out of the wall knocking over the villain to indicate that you win the battle, or it knocks the Spiderman off the wall to indicate that you lose the battle.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: BibleQuest
description: BIBLEQUEST is a game of knowledge and strategy revolving around your knowledge of Old Testament stories and scriptures. Players make their way around the gameboard by answering a series of multiple choice questions in an effort to make it through the "Phrase Maze." Game is suitable for all ages.

name: Dice Box
description:
