A simple abstract strategy game using dice and a 5x5 grid board. Each player takes a different colour of dice, and a seed die is rolled and placed in the centre of the board. Then all players roll their dice.

On his turn, a player must place one die if possible, but it need not be his own. A die must be placed so that all orthogonally adjacent dice have a face value either one higher or one lower than it. If no dice can be placed, you reroll your dice as your turn. At the end of the round, when all dice possible have been played, players score based on the total face value of all dice of their colour that are on the board.

name: Deadlock
description:
"An exciting game in which the two players have different forces, resources and goals."

DeadLock The exciting game of combat and valor which captures the mood of medieval conflict, pitting numerical strength against superior mobility. A contemporary version of a game that has been popular since the middle ages."

The player with the 1 large marker is the King. He attempts to work his way through the advancing army of small markers. If he can force his way past them, he wins. The 15 small pieces (knights) win by boxing in the King so that he has no move. The knights move only forward or sideways. The king can move any direction to any non-occupied adjoining space. The king must also make single (and multiple) jumps whenever possible. He captures knights when he jumps them. If the king fails to make a jump the knight player gets a knight back and he places it anywhere he wishes. King wins in stalemates.

name: Hand 2 Hand
description:
The game is played on a printed fabric board depicting two temples and two do-jos. The contents include 2 dice, 12 colored glass gems and a drawstring to tie up board and the contents into a tidy bag.

Each player attempts to move their gems from one corner of the board to the opposite corner. The first player to move all 3 of their gems to the opposite corner wins.

Gems are moved by rolling the dice and moving the indicated number of spaces along the board. Gems can be moved either clockwise or counter-clockwise around the board. If a player’s gem lands on or passes over an opponent’s gem the two players conduct a rock-paper-scissors challenge: the loser has their gem sent back to their starting space.

name: Pigskin Vegas
description: Pigskin Vegas (endorsed by Jimmy the Greek) allows you to bet on real-time football games. You determine how much you're willing to wager an what will happen on the next play. Everything from the simple (First Down/No First Down & Pass Play/Run Play) to the complex (QB sack before the next first down). The odds are on the board so all you need to do is place your chips and find someone else to cover your bet.

name: Make a Face
description:
The caricature of a famous face is placed in a tray and covered with a six-piece jigsaw puzzle. Six cartoon faces have been cut into a top third, a middle third and a bottom third. Each group of thirds is scrambled and placed in a tray. To reveal part of the famous face concealed by a jigsaw piece a player has to remember the location of a complete cartoon face. Identify the famous face and player score for being correct and for each cartoon face assembled. The player with the most cash after three games is the winner.

The game is a faithful recreation of a television series. The box says “first edition” although no subsequent editions were issued.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Trivia

name: D'Ice
description: D'Ice hockey is a game of strategy and chance. The object is to build a professional hockey team through trades and player. Build team bonuses in shooting, passing, skating, checking and goaltending. Put your team to the test with a full schedule of games against other teams in the league, complete with playoffs. Watch out though, the injury bug can strike and you have to be prepared for it. Play just one season, or watch your team develop over several seasons. Players abilities can change over time, and players may demand more cash.

name: NBA-opoly
description:
From the publisher, Late for the Sky:

Here’s a property trading game with an interesting spin… NBA-OPOLY! Collect and trade your favorite teams with all the speed and excitement found in the NBA. It’s family fun that fans will want throughout the season and into the playoffs. NBA-OPOLY makes a great gift for Ages 8 and up
(2-6 players).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Ellery Queen's Operation:  Murder
description: Ellery Queen is faced with the most difficult case in his career. And he is turning to you for help. This you-solve-it video mystery lets you solve the murder. After watching the 30 minute videotape, you'll have to make deductions from all of the evidence, and determine who killed Abby Doorn.

name: Porn Masters: The Board Game
description:
A board game for 2-4 players. Players move around the board buying up porn related businesses and managing hookers in a bid to be the first player to save up enough money to win the game. Porn industry businesses are divided into seven sub groups where players may attain a monopoly and gain make money even faster.

Collect Fate Cards as you go and gain benefits or the ability to play whammy events against other players. And watch out for the cops, else they bust your hookers and shut down your illegally run businesses.

Porn Masters is a light-hearted game and not meant to be taken too seriously. But don't let that fool you, there is still plenty of strategy involved.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Economic, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Auburnopoly
description: This is the Auburn University themed version of Monopoly. Unique properties include Toomer's Corner, Jordan Hare Stadium, and Samford Hall. Houses and Hotels are replaced by Credit Hours and Diplomas.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Twin Cities in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Minneapolis/St. Paul, Minnesota. It has spaces such as the St. Anthony Falls, Fort Snelling, Target Center, HHH Metrodome, Mall of America, Walker Art Center, and the Guthrie Theatre. Cards include local events and staples of life in Minnesota.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Behördendschungel
description:
A Game ( a Funny one ) about German Bureaucracy.
2 – 6 Players are trying to get through an City Hall with
31 Rooms to get their Building or Marriage permission.
But it isn´t that easy and not always legal.

name: Sports Dice: Golf
description: Small travel Golf game. 3 standard dice plus a Special die on a table where players choose the club.

name: Cricket Wicket
description:
From the Publisher:

Before now, it was difficult to play a boardgame on the sport of Cricket because a simple, yet enthusiasm-maintaining way had not been used to score runs and dismiss batters while encompassing most, or all of the possible play scenarios associated with the real sport.

The key is the adaptation of the total real-game essence to a boardgame format through the unique scoring method.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Peanut Butter & Jelly Math
description:
This is an educations kids game to help develop math skills. The goal for each player is to roll the die and moves their game piece around the board. Every time you pass the "Start" space, you earn a sandwich layer. The first player to go around the board four times completes his or her sandwich and winds the game.

Each space on the board contains four math problems. If the player is going around the board for the first time, he/she must solve problem #1 - or the problem next to the first small picture of bread. If he/shee is going around the board for the second time, he/she must solve problem #2 - or the problem next to the small picture of Peanut Butter, and so on.

All the game pieces (including the die) are made of a strong foam material.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Print & Play

name: Honey Nut Cheerios Spelling Bee Game
description:
Honey Nut Cheerios Spelling Bee Game is for ages 7 and up, and is a spelling and trivia game. It includes 150 cards, a spinner (and combination playing surface) and an electronic unit for BuzzBee the mascot.

Licensed by General Mills (the owners of Cheerios breakfast cereal) and published by Briarpatch, this is a kid's "spelling bee" game, with an electronic "host" in the form of "BuzzBee" the Honey Nut Cheerios bee mascot. The BuzzBee playing piece produces "real studio" sound effects, whatever that means.

Some of the cards are prize cards, and the goal is to answer questions correctly, with the winner being the first to collect 10 cards.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Ego Trip
description:
The game that lets you toot your own horn!

The object of the game is to give you an outlet to brag! Everyone starts out as 'Humble'. Score 50 Ego Points and become an 'Egomaniac'..and win the game. Steve Allen plays right beside you, tooting his horn - see if you can top him! 3 or more players. Ages 12 & up. Gammon Games from 1975.

The player who grabs the die and says "Me first!" goes first. Description

name: Chemaction
description: Chemaction is a game of chemical compounds. Scrabble-like tiles have elements on them along with the number of bonds that element may form. Players hold seven tiles and draw back to seven at the end of their turn. Players must play compounds from their hand to the board, building off of an already placed element. Basically, it's Scrabble but laying chemical compounds instead of words. The board is a plain square grid, without any bonus squares. Blank tiles are also included and can represent any element. There's a bonus for using all your tiles in one turn. (The game was published by Borg-Warner Chemicals, so there's also a bonus for playing any of their phosphate compounds.)

name: Fridgeracer
description:
This is one in a series of magnetic games designed to be played on your refrigerator (or file cabinet at work, or any other metallic surface).

This is a racing game complete with pit stops and on track hazards, with magnetic board and 2D cars, as well as a spinner to determine speed.

The game may be played face to face, or over the course of time, utilizing a Your turn square. Take your turn, flip the square so that your opponent's color is on top, signifying that it's his turn, then walk away. When your opponent sees that he's up, he can stop, play out his turn, flip the square, and go on about his business.

This feature justifies the magnetic aspect of the game. It can be set up indefinitely and be played out as quickly or as slowly as you desire. This makes it suitable for home or office play when you don't have time to sit down and play an entire game start to finish.

name: Davy Crockett Indian Scouting Game
description:
If Candy Land had a spinner instead of all those cards...

Spin the spinner, move ahead (or back) to the appropriately colored space on the trail. Some spaces have additional instructions such as "Fight a crocodile go back one space", "Grin down a bear, move to red".
The game board has a classic Disney feel to it. The artwork is very colorful with a lot of detail in the background behind the colored trail. This might keep the adults amused while the race to deliver the message to Army Headquarters keeps the 4 to 8 year old set entertained.

The game has a bit of an identity problem. The game box top names it as "Disneyland's Official Davy Crockett Indian Scouting Game", the box sides, "Walt Disney's Official Davy Crockett Indian Scouting Game", and the spinner card ,"Walt Disney's Davy Crockett's Indian Scout Game".
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Trivial Pursuit Mini Pack: Sports
description: This Mini or Pocket Pack was made for use with the Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Set Game but also featured color coded questions for use with the regular Trivial Pursuit games. This set contains 120 sports themed cards: "From baseball to bullfighting - With an emphasis on recent times."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Sports, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Parker Brothers, Selchow & Righter

name: To Grandmother's House We Go
description: Completely self contained board with magnetic pawns and built in spinner. Children travel around the board trying to get to grandmother's house first.

name: House Rules
description:
The hilarious game that brings families together. This game is a fast paced-team game that provides hours of exciting game play while giving players opportunities to discuss family values, issues, tradition, and tasks in fun, laughter-filled environment. Teams race against the clock to come up with lists of answers to hundreds of statements and questions in 6 family oriented categories

Includes full color game board featuring the rooms and activities found in an ordinary house, 115 situation cards with close to 700 questions in 6 categories, 15 action cards with Bible verses, crazy actions and rewards, 2 playing pieces (plus 2 extra; 1 of each color), 30 second timer, die, and instructions

name: Bro bro breja
description:
Swedish children's game. In the center of the game map lays a castle. The castle is surrounded by three moats. Each moat has a series of bridges that will take you across that moat. In order to cross the moat the player must roll the exact same number as is displayed on the bridge.
The first one to reach the castle wins.

name: Bestseller: Scrittore per Gioco
description:
To win each player must try to complete the plot of a book using 8 cards containing elements from famous books and reach the score of 55 points.
The plot of the books the players write will be different each game, the authors assure that Bestseller allows more than 100.000 different stories

name: Total War
description:
(from Games Research/Design (GR/D) web site:)

Games Research/Design (GR/D) returns Europa to its roots and revisits the best selling Europa title Fire in the East. The new game covers the same time period as the older ones (summer of 1941 to the spring of 1942) but uses a completely new Soviet OB, a new map, and the latest rules for the Europa system.

Total War gives the Axis player the opportunity to see if he can improve on the massive offensive that pocketed and captured millions of Soviet soldiers. Can you take Moscow or Leningrad? Or are you condemned to suffer the Soviet winter short of victory? The Soviet player must build a strategic reserve large enough to stop the advancing Axis forces and throw them out of Russia. The Soviet player is aided by massive reinforcements that allow him to form new defensive lines in an attempt to slow down or stop the Axis armor thrusts.

Total War is a historical game on the German invasion of the Soviet Union, from summer 1941 to spring 1942. It charts the titanic struggle of the largest ground campaign in World War II, from the Axis offensives that brought the Germans to the gates of Moscow to the Soviet winter counteroffensive that hurled them back.

Total War is a two-player game. One side controls the forces of Germany and its allies while the other controls the forces of the Soviet Union. The maps cover Eastern Europe and the western USSR from the Arctic Ocean to the Black Sea, from the plains of Poland to the steppes along the Volga River. Ground units represent corps, divisions, brigades, regiments, and battalions. Air units represent groups of 40 to 120 aircraft. Naval units represent task forces of warships.

Total War is a complete remake and updating of the classic Europa game, Fire in the East. The game’s Soviet order of battle makes extensive use of formerly secret Kremlin information on the Red Army forces that fought the war. The game includes a Soviet order of battle for all of the USSR from 1939 to 1942 and is the more comprehensive game OB ever published on the Red Army in peace and war. The Axis order of battle also is updated, reflecting new research since the publication of Fire in the East. The rules for Total War incorporate the latest rules for the Europa system, with on-demand air power, armor effects, combined arms, and much more, recreating both the German blitzkrieg that captured entire Soviet armies and the Soviet deep operations that nearly splintered the invaders in the depth of the Russian winter."

name: Paws 'N Claws
description:
In Paws 'N Claws, your goal is to work your way from the outermost track of the playing board to the inner areas, eventually entering the judging and placing first in the show. Along the way you must demonstrate your breeding and training by correctly answering questions about dogs and cats.

There are three categories and two levels of questions, which are determined by the roll of the dog and cat dice.

There is also the possibility you will have to bark or meow or make some other noise or gesture by drawing Claw or Paw cards.

The board is a bit tricky but careful observation and maneuvering will solve it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strawberry Shortcake Game Basket
description: A collection of four games in one with a Strawberry Shortcake theme: Memory, Lotto, Dominoes, and Bingo.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory

name: Escape das Estepes
description:
Escape of the Estepes is an introductory system to wargames for people who never had a contact with this type of game. The objective is here to show how strategy games can be fascinating, promote the development of strategical reasoning and the taste for history.

In 1944 Germany already is already withdrawing from the Soviet Union. Diverse elements of the German army, withdrew desperately to form a new line of defense. Many were imprisoned and tried to escape.

FREE wargame in Portuguese in Strategos #0:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/miniaturas.html
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: The Golden Egg
description:
The Golden Egg is a childrens' card game set in a traditional farmyard. Players start with a number of tokens and receive a set of cards face down. On their turn a player turns over the top most card from their deck and performs the action written there. This may involve paying tokens into the pool, receiving tokens from the pool, or paying or receiving tokens from the holders of other cards.
When a player turns up an egg card they pay one token into the pool and take the golden egg card irrespective of whether it is still in the middle or held by another player. When the golden goose is turned up the holder of the golden egg wins the pool.
The game can continue a pre-determined number of rounds or until all bar one player are bankrupt.

name: Megavisa
description: Based on a quiz show that ran in Finnish television in the early 90s.

name: The Land Before Time: Escape from Red Claw Game
description: Based on Cartoon Network’s “The Land Before Time” TV series, this board game allows players to role play as their favorite dinosaur characters: Littlefoot, Ducky, Cera, Chomper and Red Claw. Littlefoot and his friends are trying to get to the Great Valley, but Red Claw tries to keep them back. The first player who reaches the Great Valley wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lim
description:
To understand the game Lim you first have to understand Leeyon's Cube Cards.
The Cube Cards are a new game system that lets the players create a 3D world with 2D cards. Because of its unique 3D aspect, It lends itself for a new kind of games, 3D building card games (3D-BCG).

Lim is played with Leeyon's Letter Cube Cards. The object of Lim is to score the most points after 10 rounds. Points are scored by connecting the Letter Cube Cards together to form words. By connecting them in a smarter way than your opponent, you score higher points!

In every round one player takes the role of the Word Challenger(W.C.). He/She then challenges the Word Defender(W.D.) by calling out a word. The W.D. then has to form the word by using the Letter Cube Cards. After the W.D. is done the W.C. can challenge the defenders play. If the W.C. gets more points he/she can add them to his/her score.

In the next round the W.C. becomes the W.D. and The W.D. becomes the W.C. The game continues like that until the 10th round is reached. The player with the most points wins!

During the round the W.C. keeps score.

name: Vinak
description:
Vinak is an old Mexican word for the 20 day calendar cycle used in the Toltec culture. The 43 cards used in this game are:
- 24 moon calendar cards (6 cards in 4 colours)
- 18 sun calendar cards (numbered from 1-18)
- 1 Vajeb card representing the "serenity of the year"

The game is a trick taking game for 3-4 players. According to the introduction of the rules, it combines elements of Bridge, Tarot and Pinochle.

Each game is started with a bidding round, where the player with the highest bid takes the lead. He must reach 31 of the possible 62 points to win. The 62 points are gathered from single card values as well as from points for whole tricks.

name: Battle of the Sexes Card Game: IQ Test
description:
Forget about measuring your IQ with a traditional test - get your brain working overtime with the Battle IQ Test that requires superior gender and mind-bending abilities!

The winner is the first team to win 3 cards.
50 cards with 144 Questions
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game, Puzzle

name: Allianz
description: The goal of Allianz is to beat all pieces of the other players by jumping over them with your own pieces or to conquer all enemy castles. Everyone plays on one's own but alliances can be formed that prohibit two players from attacking each other during a certain number of turns.

name: Rombo: Il gioco a tutto motore F.1
description:
A simple non roll&move F1 racing game. Use your fuel coin to reach the different gas station on the race track and get more (random cards) fuel.

Content:
- 4 painted metal f1 model 1/55 by Polistil (FERRARI 126 C3, BRABHAM BT 52, RENAULT RE 40, Mc LAREN-MP4).
- 60 fuel coin.
- 18 squared cards, 15 fuel bag (with differt values) and 3 accident.

name: Danger City
description:
Danger City is a speedy card game where you can win in one of two ways: you can side with the Neighbourhood, or with the Robbers. Either have the fewest robbers in your hand and the most points on the table once the final house has been built – or reveal 5 Robbers at once from your hand, and you have won. Danger City takes its inspiration from so-called “Gated Communities” that one may find in plush suburbs of North American (or English?) cities, and the idea that you must either be a very paranoid person to live in one, or have very good reason to want to protect yourself from someone!

We are taken to an idyllic neighbourhood that is in full-blown development – houses are being built, as well as parks, amenities, services and the like. But somewhere things go wrong: a gang of robbers have arrived. The neighbourhood takes decisive action and starts to install surveillance systems, to thwart their enemies. But who will win out?

Basic Rules

Players take turns in building the neighbourhood, by playing Neighbourhood cards from their hand onto the table. Each card has a specific value – a Garage is worth 5 points while a Golf Course is worth 15. Cards circulate round the player from player to player: you draw or play a card and then pass one on face down. Lurking in their midst are a rabble of robbers. Chances are you either want to collect them or get rid of them, but you cannot play them like Neighbourhood cards. If you collect 5 of them, you can reveal them all at once from your hand and win. You have “sided with the robbers!”

Otherwise the game ends when a specific number of House cards have been played – twice the number of players. At that point the game stops and the player with the FEWEST robbers in their hand wins. If there is a tie, then Neighbourhood points come into play – whoever has played down the most points wins.

And that’s pretty much it!

name: Het Babbelpadden-picknick-puzzel spel
description: First children must build the board, which is a puzzle. Then it is a roll-and-move to get your frogs to the picnic in time. Some lily pads ask you to draw a card and follow the instructions.

name: Batalla Aeronaval
description:
This game represents a combat between a squadron of planes and a naval fleet.

The objective is to obtain 2000 points. Every successful shot turns to 50 points.

A disc is in use for determining the radar's length and allows to know the position of the shot.

Content:
- 1 Board
- 10 ships
- 10 planes
- 20 point pieces
- Radar disc

name: Kaikkien aikojen avaruuspeli
description: Kaikkien aikojen avaruuspeli (The Out-Of-This-World Space Game) is a children's roll-and-move game set out in space. Ultimately the game is about set collection - the players are trying to gather together the "points" of stars which have been scattered around the space in storms originating in Neptune. The game is based on "The Out-Of-This-World Space Book", a children's book by the Finnish authors Mauri and Tarja Kunnas.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Firsts and Thirds
description:
Players take control of one of six nations, which is either a First-World nation or a Third-World nation. Every turn, nations collect income, produce resources, and then can trade resources with other nations in order to collect the proper money and resources to expand their infrastructure, or to apply towards solving national problems such as overpopulation, hostile neighbors, aging industry, etc.

The game was developed as an educational tool, and comes with a lesson plan.

name: Little Einstein's Number Match Game
description:
From the Box:

"June, Quincy, Annie and Leo all need your help to make a match! Pick out pieces one by one and try to fit the shape into your card. Was it a match? Yes! Great work. The first player to fill their Little Einstein card is the star of the game!

First, look for a shape that fits into your gameboard. Then flip the piece over to see if you’ve made a match. Match & play along with The Little Einsteins!"

A closer look at the game reveals that players choose a shape that matches an opening in their gameboard. Then they flip the piece to see if they also have the matching number and color. That is, they are matching shapes first, then color and number. Memory comes in to play when they put a piece back down and choose a new one.
categories: Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number, Puzzle
mechanics: Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Hullunkuriset ehdokkaat
description:
Hullunkuriset ehdokkaat is satirical card game about Finlands presidential election in 1982. Art of the cards is made by most famous Finnish political cartoonist Kari.

Game play is based on card game Hullunkuriset perheet, which is just Finnish version of The Game of Authors. The name Hullunkuriset ehdokkaat means funny candidates. There is only 24 cards (four suits of five cards and four extra cards). These suits represent main parties and their candidates. The extra cards are other known political figures of the time.

Game play is very simple. You just draw a card from the next player and she/he does the same and so on. The winner is the player who gets all cards of one suit and he/she has to shout "Pressa!", which means that she/he has elected new president of Finland.

Re-implements:

The Game of Authors

name: Match
description: Players match cards containing words and pictures. An educational game for 1st grade elementary students.

name: Starlo Fishing Forever Australia
description:
From game's website:
"The aim of the game is to travel around Australia, trying to catch at least one of each of the country’s 14 most popular fish. During the trip you will meet with all the trials and tribulations, as well as the excitement, you would encounter during the ‘real’ thing.
You will learn about some of Australia’s most sought after fish, their habitats, and the methods of catching them, while gaining good fishing habits and the right attitude towards maintaining this magical resource, so we can go on ............FISHING FOREVER."

Home Page: http://fishingforevergames.com/

The name "Starlo" in the title is a typically Aussie abbreviation of Steve Starling's name.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Enviro-Quiz
description: ENVIRO-QUIZ is a fascinating, scientifically documented and interactive game, and is very relevant to current concerns about air pollution, climate change, the different threats to the environment and endangered species, the solutions to improve the environment and to protect wild animals. This game is an enjoyable aid towards making children (and adults) more aware of environmental problems, and encouraging them to take action to ensure a viable environment - and a better future for everybody. While ENVIRO-QUIZ is a game of environmental awareness, it is most definitely also a game that is fun and easy to play. Everyone loves question and answer games, whatever the subject. The game is designed in particular for children and adolescents, families and educators. Help with reviewing and validating the information, and with developing the game, was provided by well-known worldwide organizations, including the IUCN - World Conservation Union. The Instruction booklet provides many different ways of playing depending on age, number of players and the time available. It’s a great traveling game.

name: Politi og røver
description:
The players move around the board and find out which robber has been in which house. The player who catches the most robbers wins the game.

Contents:

1 game board
1 police officer
12 robbers
13 plastic feet
12 robbery chits
1 die

name: Little Polar Bear Lotto
description:
Colorful lotto cards, geared for 3-6 years old, 1-4 players, no reading or number skills needed, based on the charming and popular Little Polar Bear books

Object of the game:

To match the pictures on the cards with the pictures on the playing boards.

name: Jackpot
description:
A gamble game for 2 to 6 players where players can bet their chips on different slotmachine symbols (bell, bar, etc.). A simple game with basic components:
6 cards depicting the different symbols
3 dice depicting the same symbols as on the cards
1 dicecup
and some chips
Player who has the most chips after a certain amount of rounds wins.

name: Otthontól az iskoláig
description: In this boardgame the players leave home and go to school They role the dice and on certain spots there is a picture and they have to act according to what the picture tells them to do. Sometimes it means they draw a bonus card and then they can advance their figure as many steps as the number on the bonus card. The winner is who gets to school first.

name: Quer Durch Deutschland
description: Quer durch Deuschland translates literally as ‘Crossways through Germany’, reflecting the theme of the game - a cycling tour around cities and towns in Germany. Players take on the role of cyclists travelling across a board showing a network of prominent cities and towns in Germany. At the start, they are dealt out 5 destination city cards and the top card is revealed to indicate their first destination. Players then roll dice and move their tokens along the roads on the board that connect the cities. At its core, this is a roll-and-move game, where players have to roll two dice - one ordinary pipped six-sider and an action die, which shows symbols that affect play. The action die might give extra pips to speed up your travel, cause a flat tire and force you to miss a turn, allow you to switch destination cards with another player, roll the pipped die again and add to your original roll, and even cause everyone to transfer their whole stack of destination cards to the player on their left. The first player to visit all their destination cities wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trivoli
description:
Trivoli is a compelling and simple game in which the whole family will enjoy! The game offers two magnificent structure excellent game, only to turn around the carousel and you can play another game on a another board. Rotate the carousel turn one level and try to make our own secret character or picture. Beware, however, from establishing a false picture, which you may help another player win! The game teaches 3D and logical thinking in a way that makes the child want to play the game again and again! Winner is the one who get the picture together first or the the other side of the carousel!
The game is played like this: you have a six sided classical dice with three circles on each side. One of those is painted black: the one in the middle, second or the most outside one. And each painted circle is twice on hat dice.
Rolling that dice decides which part of the carousel you can turn.
Then you watch the picture you got at the beginning, and see, if you can create that by turning the rolled circle around the center. If you succeed creating that picture, you get one chip from the center bowl. Get the most of these to win!

name: Disney Princess Ready, Dress, Go!
description:
From the publisher:

Cinderella, Ariel, Snow White, Aurora and Belle are racing to get ready and get to the Ball! Each Princess needs her invitation, her flowers, her crown, her dress and her shoes before she can go to the castle to meet her handsome Prince...

Players use a colored spinner to move their Princess along a colored path where some squares indicate one of the items the players are collecting. Items are represented by puzzle pieces that, when collected and assemble, form a picture of each of the 5 Disney Princesses in the game. When a player has collected all 5 items for their Princess and have reached the end of the path, they can meet up with their prince by getting the correct color on the spinner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Monopoly: Major League Baseball Collector's Edition
description:
From USAopoly.com:

Batter up!

What fan hasn’t dreamed of owning and running a Major League Baseball team? Now you can buy, sell and trade all 30 American League and National League teams in a quest to own them all. Major League Baseball and the MONOPOLY game have teamed up to put an exciting new spin on America’s favorite board game. Put on your game face and get ready to wheel and deal!
Includes six collectible tokens: Batter, Catcher’s Mask, Ball in Glove, Hot Dog, Pitcher and World Series Trophy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Muna: Ägget
description:
From the box:

"The egg shakes and bursts in laughter in your hands - and you are out of the game.

20 subjects and the wheel of fortune determines the first letter. Start the egg and circle it from one player to another. But you can pass it on only after giving a correct word.

The remaining players continue until there is only one left. A new subject, a new letter, start the egg and continue playing. 5 different variants. Also good for on the road."

Muna is Finnish and Ägget Swedish for "The Egg". The game is basically board and timer driven variant of the "Ship Comes Loaded" game.

name: Monopoly: Θεσσαλονίκη
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of the city of Thessalonica in Greece.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: QuizWit
description: The game is a standard trivia game where players take turns answering trivia questions in one of three formats: 1) Multiple Choice 2) True/False 3) standard Question and Answer. Correct answers allow you to move forward with the first player reaching the finish line being declared the winner. Contents: Game Board, 800 questions on 200 cards, 6 Pawns, and Rules.

name: Whatzit? Junior
description:
Children Edition of Whatzit!

The object is to solve rebus-like puzzles. (PLAY PLAY might be "double play") The roll of a die determines if you play solo, against everyone, or challenge a specific opponent. The winner moves the roll of a d6.
First to the top of the board wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Cubex Playing Cards
description:
Cubex consists of 9 cubes, with each side representing a playing card, so you get 54 sides (1 deck + 2 jokers).
The play is rather interesting. First you take the cubes out of the box, then, in turn order, each player selects a cube and places it back into the box. Once all 9 cubes are back in the box, the second phase begins. The starting player takes any cube from the four corners and starts to form a 3 x 3 wall of 'bricks'. The next selected cube must be taken from the space adjacent to the first cube, in clockwise order. Remember, when you choose a cube and place it, the opposite side of the cube will be facing your opponent, so you need to help yourself whilst also giving non-attractive 'cards' to your opponent.
The main game is one where you try to get the best Brag (a form of Poker but only three cards count) hand facing you. There are other games suggested, with a form of Patience being the best.

name: Canada Quiz
description:
Canada Quiz is a trivia that integrates tactical elements.

The goal of the game is to be the first player (or team) to get the Canada flag by answering properly the questions.

The board has four playing track (one per player or team), leading to the flag in the centre of the board. Each player (or team) has four markers. The dice is rolled to bring a marker in play and or to move it along the track; however, a marker can be moved only if the question asked is properly answered. When a player answers without a "hint" (without asking which are the multiple choices listed on the card), that player can have an other question, so an other opportunity to move forward. Under some conditions, the questions may also be used to perform a "power-play", which could force an other player to move backward. The first player to reach the flag and to answer properly the question wins the game.

Canada Quiz has 250 question cards, with four questions (with multiple answers) on each, for a total of 1000 questions. The trivia game is based on early the history of Canada, mainly covering the historical period from the very beginnings up to the Confederation. Canada Quiz has been published in English and in French.

name: Jahreszeiten
description:
Four beautiful game on "Seasons", where children get to know the year it expires. The game helps them with the lovingly crafted images, they also find in their own environment . Four funny put, place and dice games running around the year in one box.

1. Schau, wie lang ist ein Jahr! (Look, how long is a year!)
- Color-match game, where the players have to put the 12 month together. The first who has all 12 month in the correct order wins the game
2. Gemeinsam durch das Jahr! (Together through the year!)
- the same as game 1, but as an coperative game with a figure and a dice to go through the month tiles.
3. Kunterbunt durch das Jahr! (Motley through the year!)
- a game while all the month-tiles mixed in a circle. the boy and the girl starts on a choosen tile and by rolling the color die the player try to reach the next color-matching tile. Who is first back at the starting point wins the game.
4. Von Januar bis Juni und weiter! (From January to June, and more!)
- One player starts on the January tile the other on the June. They try to find the next month after there starting tile, (small memory game). The player who first reaches the tile of the other player wins the game.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dino-Duell
description:
In Dino-Duell two players each control 12 dinosaurs, with four dinosaurs each of three different types.

The dinosaurs start the game in the back rows of a 6x7 game board, and on a turn, a player moves a dinosaur horizontally, vertically or diagonally to a free field or to a field with an opponent's dinosaur; this last move is possible, however, only if prior to the move those two dinosaurs are separated by exactly one dinosaur that belongs to the capturing player and if all three dinosaurs involved in the capture are of different types. Landing on an opponent's dinosaur this way removes that token from the board.

The first player to place four of his dinosaurs adjacent in the river that runs through the middle of the game board wins.

name: Chimp & Zee: Pesky Pirates
description: Pirate-themed children's game in which 2-4 players move around an island collecting gold to place inside their treasure chest. The game utilizes a spinner which will either indicate the number of spaces to move, or will cause another player to lose gold. When all the gold is collected, the game ends with the player having the most gold in their treasure chest being declared the winner.

name: Drinking Roulette
description: The Drinking Roulette contains 16 glasses for vodka which have their place around the roulette. Some of the glasses should be filled with vodka, some with water. Players bet red or black and those players who bet correctly drink one glass of vodka or water (they don't know). If a player bet 0 and guess, he/she drinks all the glasses. After drinking each player is allowed to leave the game. The last player in the game is declared the winner.

name: Zombie Smarts: Clear Your Mind
description:
From the publisher:

ZombieSmarts is the infectious question-and-answer game that features grisly facts about the histories, habits, and hungers of the living dead. Choose a card and learn how to combat a zombie invasion: What should you do if a zombie bites one of your friends? Can table salts reverse the effects of "zombification"? What is smarter—a zombie or a dog? True/False and multiple-choice cards offer macabre information on zombie films, Voodoo, re-killing, undead encounters, and many other gruesome topics.

name: Mighty Morphin Supplement (fan expansion for Last Night on Earth)
description:
'Mighty Morphin' supplement is a fan created print and play for 'Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game' featuring 7 classic Mighty Morphin Power Ranger Zords and Villains character game cards.

These are made for fans to print and use in the game. They work just like normal Hero Cards in the game. NO profit is being made. Copyright to all respected parties.

Character Cards:
Megazord
Dragonzord
Goldar
Lord Zedd
Rita Repulsa
Rito Revolto
Squat & Babboo
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mijn eerste verkeersspel
description: “Mijn eerste verkeersspel” (=My first road game) is a dice game for kids. The players have to walk from home to a particular purpose (e.g. school) on the other side of the road. The rules for pedestrian traffic have to be followed. Cars on the road can be moved by die roll. The game ends when all players have arrived at the goal. The main issue is finishing, although the player who finishes first wins. The game can be played with different rule variations.

name: Hämeen Härkätie
description: Finland was part of Swedish kingdom for many centuries. Finnish provincial capital city was Turku. This game is about road from Turku to Hämeenlinna. This road was called Hämeen Härkätie (Oxroad of Häme). In the game players visit 26 notable places along this particular road. If you'll happen stop in any of these locations, there might be tasks for you to accomplish. The main goal of the game is to learn local history and it's offered for schools as a tool for teaching. The basic mechanic of the game is just simple roll and move. The winner of the game is the first player to reach Hämeenlinna.

name: Fill in the Blank
description:
Fill in the blank, is a word association card game that is as family friendly as you want it to be. The game centers around story cards and each player attempting to figure out which of 3 options the active player picked.

As players take turns reading story cards, and matching answers, players collect Fruit Cards until a single player has collected six different fruit and is declared the winner. Of course there are plenty of ways to make sure that your opponent doesn't have an easy time of that, and a group of cheesy bad guys want those Fruit Cards for themselves.

Players take turns drawing a story card, and reading it aloud. This is where your "Naughty or Nice" decision comes into play - because YOU get to decide what fills in that blank. You also draw a Fruit Card, which will indicate whether the other players need to match the choice of the Story Card reader, or not match it. For instance if a Apple card had been drawn, the other players would need to decide which of the three "blank" options was NOT choosen. We do that with... Letter Cards! After you've read your Story Card aloud all players, including the Story Card reader, play one of their Letter Cards indicating which of the three Story Card options they're choosing this turn. Of course hidden throughout the Fruit Card deck are action cards, and pesky fruit thieves. These cards are resolved immediately.

name: Horse Racing
description: Each player controls 2 horses. Use luck for total distance, and skill to split your movement points between your two horses while avoiding obstacles. Be the first to complete a lap with both horses to win.

name: Jumpy
description: Turn the card and try to locate the right animal character on the game board - if there is one! You receive a card for each victory and the player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Reuhurinne Reuhupeli
description: Spin away and move on the game board, performing different physical or intellectual tasks depending on the spaces you land on. Successful tasks will give you candy points, which can be traded for your own puzzle pieces. Whoever finishes their puzzle first is the winner!

name: Når var det?
description: A simple trivia game about the history of the Nordic countries.

name: Deckarspelet
description:
480 questions about prominent whodunit books, TV series, movies and real events.

Categories are chosen by a toss of the dice and the first player to 15 points wins the game.

name: Ortuga
description:
A family board game for pirates.

in Ortuga, players roll and move around the board, similar to backgammon. Players collect and transport gold, with the goal of depositing the gold on an island. In order to remove your markers, you must collect a set of 3 cards, declare "Game Exit" and meet your gold reserve.

To win the game, collect your set of cards and get all your counter off the board.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Assano spel
description:
"Assano" is a name under which several editions of Uno have been published in Europe, and also the name of this simplified Uno version given away by Quaker Oats to promote cereal products Havrefras and Rågfras.

The deck consists of 54 cards plus two rules cards. Compared to a regular Uno deck, this is missing zeroes and duplicates of suited cards, while the four +4 joker cards have been replaced with two +2 joker cards.

The rules are fairly short and ambiguous but can be interpreted to be largely consistent with regular Uno. Players are each dealt five cards and then try to empty their hands by making legal plays to the discard pile. There is no scoring: the goal is simply to shed your hand.

name: Headspace
description:
Description from the publisher:

Beware! This game will drive you mental! The name of this game is using your brain. Answer lateral thinking questions that challenge your own brain whilst trying to beat your friends. Players try to make their way across a board by answering lateral thinking puzzles correctly. Or, if you're the curious type, just browse through the fascinating conumdrums solo! A great family game for 2 to 4 players.

name: MasterChef Junior
description:
The official board game of MasterChef Junior TV Show.
You can play the kids or the family version.
KIDS
Play 5 challenges with the ingredient cards and tiles: the challenges are based on pattern recognition, fast catch, memory and deductive skills.
FAMILY
Create a dish using some ingredient cards drawn from the deck.
The players vote the best and the more original dish, and score points accordingly.

The player with the most points will win and can wear the chef hat!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Seikkailujen saari
description:
A simple roll and move game of collecting a set of four tokens from the board. The key is in the cards: in order to collect a token, you must read a card and act what the card says.

The cards are about emotions and feelings, recognising and expressing them. The game is educational and aimed to teach the kids to express their feelings.

This is a slightly simplified and a much smaller version of Ihmevekotin (2009). The board is the same, but with less cardboard decorations and in smaller size. The tokens are slightly different. The cards are very similar.

name: Paw Patrol: Sports Day Challenge Path Game
description: Players choose one of three pups (Chase, Marshall, or Skye) and take turns racing along a path. A spinner determines the distance moved. Certain squares along the path earn the player trophies (points), or send a player backwards a short distance. Along the way, players choose to take a longer and safer path, or a shorter path that risks giving their trophies to the player with the least amount. Players that reach the finish line earn an additional trophy on their turn. The game ends when the last pup crosses the finish line.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: WTF  Did You Say?!?
description:
Description from the publisher:

How it goes down.
Each player starts with 10 white cards in their hand. Whomever masturbated most recently is named the first ROC or Reader of Cards. After a thorough hand washing, this person draws and reads a red card out loud. Each player (not the reader) then passes their “funniest” white card face down to the ROC. Once all white cards are received the ROC reads each white card out loud in context of the red card.

The ROC chooses which card they believe to be “funniest” and gives the red card to the player that played that card. Play moves around in a circle until: abs are wrecked from laughing, someone passes out, or the majority pusses out. Person with the most red cards at the end of the game wins.

name: Paulchen Pups
description: Children's game. Spin a spinner to see how many pumpings of air you can use. After a certain amount of them, the air pressure will make the dog poop a foamy ball. The player whose turn it is will score a point. Most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Bratz: C.I.Y. Shoppe Merch Master Game
description:
Express your Bratz spirit with the "C.I.Y. Shoppe Merch Master". In this Super-Fab game, explore your inner-merchandising diva. Play 3 exciting mini-games: Charades, The Rathers and Trend Zone to collect everything you need to open up your C.I.Y. Shoppe.

—description from the publisher

In this roll-n-move game you collect items and money as you move your Bratz around the board, sometimes encountering mini-games that help you meet the requirements of your hidden goal.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Rondella
description: The pawns have to move from the middle of the board into the round-about. Movement is determined by a die. The round-about is placed at the end of any one of the four lanes, but can be moved to any other lane by a player rolling a 1. Thus the situation keeps changing. The first player who gets all his 4 pawns into the round-about wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Raeapteegi Lauamang
description: A board game which shares the history of a pharmacy in Estonia which pre-dates Columbus' arrival in the Americas. Players take turns rolling a die and moving their pawn, stopping on various spaces to learn more about the history of the pharmacy. Some spots will race you ahead, some will set you back. The first player to land exactly on the finish spot is the winner.

name: Color Addict 2 player promo
description:
This promo consists of 9 cards that were given out at gaming events to encourage players to buy the main game. These were sealed in plastic rather than boxed.

The main game dynamic is the same: color names are written but not necessarily the color of the card background. The object is to get rid of cards by matching the written word of the color with the color on card's background on the table.
publishers: ASS Altenburger Spielkarten, Cartamundi, France Cartes

name: Vandringen till Lyran
description:
Vandringen till Lyran (also in Finnish, Vaellus lyyran saantiin) is a roll and move game, where players race in 25 steps to be the first to get accepted into university. Each square either gives or takes money from the players, or pushes them forward or backward. First player to reach the final square then gains all game money in the bank and is the winner.

—user summary

name: Jan-Ken-Po
description:
Jan-Ken-Po (a Hawaiian name for Rock-Scissors-Paper) is a collectible card game with eighty cards in total, of which each box contains a random and poorly collated fifty. It is possible to get five of the same weapon in one set.
The game is set on Krone II (according to the box) or Pangea (according to the rulebook), where a centuries-old war has created three clans: the Paper Clan (yellow), the Scissors Clan (magenta) and the Stone Clan (blue). Most cards show badly drawn members of each clan and their weapons.

Players simultaneously reveal the top card on their deck, and stone cards beats scissors cards, scissors beat paper, and paper beats stone. With the exception of resolving ties and a 3-player version, that's the rules. Except there are rare monsters that beat all the clan cards, the wizard Jan-Ken-Po who beats everything, and a 'You Lose!' card ('the Herb of Destruction'), which must be played on yourself and makes you lose.

An attempt to cash in on the CCG boom of the mid 1990s, the game is noted for its low production values, amateurish art that is often printed sideways on the cards, a backstory that makes no sense, and gameplay that takes Rock-Scissors-Paper and removes all the skill and tactics.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction

name: Imaginary Destination
description:
Imaginary Destination is a board game for all ages based on a fun cruise ship journey across the sea. The board game provides a unique 8-day cruise ship experience.

Imaginary Destination is all about the cruising experience. Players pick Terminal and cruise Ports of Call cards and move their cruise ship pawns across the Caribbean Islands. The winner needs to complete the 8-day itinerary first.

name: Improper Nouns
description:
SUMMARY

What's in a name? The choice is yours!

Improper Nouns is a card-based party game for generally fun humans and proper word nerds.

Discover more about your friends, share some laughs, and reveal new inside jokes. With more than 100,000 potential combinations, it's a new game every time. You’ll never see words the same way!

BASIC GAMEPLAY

1) The judge draws an Adjective card and a Noun card and puts them together. Ex. Lucky Stranger

2) Choose a Description card from your hand that best "fits" the combination. You can be literal, creative, or crazy!

3) The judge picks a winner from all players entries.

CURVEBALLS

Swap 1 --- Swap 3 --- Split

These cards might show up when the Judge draws a Noun card. They’re hidden in the Noun deck and mix up the gameplay!

BONUS CARDS

Each round, check to see if the Adjective + Noun pair is notable in any of these ways. If it is, the winner earns a Bonus, too! (Note, if someone else wins a future hand, they TAKE your bonus card!)

RHYME TIME -- ADJ. + N. RHYME
LETTER LOVE -- ADJ. + N. START WITH THE SAME LETTER
SAME SAME BUT DIFFERENT -- ADJ. + N. SHARE THE SAME ROOT WORD
AN ACTUAL THING -- ADJ. + N. FORM A "REAL" PROPER NOUN

GOAL

Win the game by winning 7 rounds and collecting the Adjective and Noun cards. Note: Bonus cards count the same as winning a round!

—description from the designer

name: Code van Coppens
description:
Exciting challenges and awesome stunts. That's how we know the Coppens brothers from TV. With Coppens Code they created special rooms full of scientific puzzles, tests and assignments that you have to complete.

Solve riddles and collect useful items to escape. Can you crack the Coppens Code? The time starts now ...

Coppens Code is a unique escape room game to play at home. Just like in a 'real' escape room, the replayability is limited.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Le Trésor des Templiers
description:
900 ans après la création de l'ordre en 1129, un carnet retrouvé en Ecosse, dans le Midlothian, rédigé par l'un des derniers chevaliers, met les joueurs sur la piste du trésor des Templiers.

900 years after the creation of the order in 1129, a notebook found in Scotland, in the Midlothian, written by one of the last knights, puts the players on the trail of the Templar treasure.

The players have to solve puzzles to find the treasure of the Knights Templar.

name: Linnanmäki
description:
This is a promotional game for "Lintsi", ie. Linnanmäki, the main amusement park of Helsinki since 1950. In this vaguely Monopoly-like roll-and-move game, the players first need to divide the various rides and attractions between themselves, using their starting cash in a small sub-game. The main game includes touring Linnanmäki for a pre-agreed number of rounds for each player (a minimum of five is recommended), collecting cash when passing Go, taking event cards as instructed, and visiting the various attractions and paying for a ticket to their owners - or possibly even buying the attraction from the bank if the previous owner already went bankrupt and is out of the game, and the attraction has thus become available in the open market again. The player with the most wealth in all collected assets - cash and attractions - at the end of the game wins.

Based on the Linnanmäki attractions included, the game is probably from 1975 at the latest.
mechanics: Income, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Risk: Peaky Blinders
description:
Peaky Blinders RISK Strategic Board Game, Conquer it all with Thomas Shelby, Accept missions from Arthur, Lizzie, Oswald Mosley and Jessie Eden, 2-5 players.

The Game of Strategic Conquest gets a brand new look, by order of the Peaky Blinders!

Accept missions from Arthur, Lizzie, Oswald Mosley and Jessie Eden as you choose your side, deploy your armies and do battle

Bespoke game board with key locations for you to conquer across England, Scotland Wales and Northern Ireland

Features beautifully crafted game pieces: bare-knuckle fighters, horseback fighters and classic vehicle reinforcements.

Conquer it all with this stunning new Brummie edition of Hasbro’s RISK.

Components:
1x Gameboard, 1x Instruction Booklet, 5x dices, 62x card decks, 5 armies x 62pcs each armies (Style 1 - 8pcs; Style 2 - 12pcs; Style 3 - 42pcs), 1xThe British Crown piece.
categories: Mafia, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Suuri Kahvisafari
description:
Alarm in Helsinki! The "Great Coffee Safari" is about to begin! A revolutionary new coffee recipe developed by professor T.C. Papu has been stolen by one of the competitor's industrial spies. The thief has escaped abroad and now it's up to the players to follow, trying to find the stolen recipe and collecting four bags of different varieties of coffee beans from around the world (Medellin, Mysore, Kenia, Santos), all of which are required for the coffee mix. There are also several copies of the recipe around; these are worthless however, but only until the original recipe is found, at which point they become just as good for victory purposes.

Once anyone finds the original coffee recipe, a race back to Helsinki begins, and the player who first returns there with either the original recipe or a copy of it and the required four bags of beans, wins the game.

The game is quite clearly inspired by the most popular Finnish boardgame ever, Afrikan tähti, and plays very much like it, with copies of the recipe taking the place of the horseshoe token at the end of the game, for example. Major differences are the deck of event/trivia cards in this game, the lack of "jewels" or similar of lesser value than the Afrikan Tähti (=coffee recipe), and the small set collection element of acquiring the coffee beans.

This game is likely from the 1980's as it's produced by Nelostuote Ky.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bunco
description:
This is an old card game that has nothing to do with the modern dice game. The deck consists of 10 Bunco Cards, 5 Stop Cards and 10 series of cards, each from 1-10. Players are dealt 10 cards face up into a Bunco pile and another 5 cards to form their hand. The object of the game is to get rid of your Bunco pile.

On your turn you must first play any #1 cards in your hand or Bunco pile. These are placed in the center of the table to form the piles that you play your cards on. You then play cards from your hand or Bunco pile in numerical sequence onto the table piles; 2s go on 1s, 3s go on 2s etc. Bunco cards are wild and can be used for any number. If you run out of cards in your hand, you draw a new hand of 5 cards. When you can no longer play a card, your turn ends and the next player goes. If you have a Stop Card, you may play it at any time during another player's turn and take the turn to play. The first player to play all the cards in their Bunco pile wins.

name: Adal en Inguesu Landia
description: Spanish language version. The object is to be the richest player at the end of the game. Board consists of a track winding through a small town with a school, carnival, airport, volcano and other sites. Spinner is on one corner of the board. Players use bribes, cards, vocabulary and other things to achieve their goal. A sand timer is also involved.
categories: Economic, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ubåtsjakten
description:
"A Russian game in the archipelago"

A humorous game based on the series of submarine scares/incidents in the Swedish territorial waters during the Cold War, especially in the 1980's. In the game, U-boat Admiral Ragolin would like to throw a party in his home town of Kaliningrad - but all the caviar has been exported. Ragolin finds out that the Operakällaren (a famous restaurant in Stockholm) sells caviar so he orders up to 4 of his submarine captains (the players) to park their submarines outside the Stockholm archipelago and send a mini-sub each to get the caviar from Operakällaren.

Each mini-sub advances on their own track towards Stockholm. Each track has a "handelsboden" (shop) and an anchored Russian "cargo" ship, where the players may get sent to by the event cards, as well as yellow event spaces. There are 2 decks of event cards; red "Soviet" cards are messages and orders from Kaliningrad (Ragolin, the Politbyro, etc.) and blue "Swedish" cards are events happening in the archipelago, where the indomitable U-boat hunter Captain Skeppström and his Sea Scouts are ever watchful (every monday to friday from 08:00 to 17:00) with their special weapon, the Swedish delicacy surströmming.

First player to reach Operakällaren is the winner and gets invited to the Admiral's party, while the rest can look forward to service in the arctic icebreaking fleet for the next 15 years.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Desperate Housewives Dirty Laundry Game
description: This game is based on the Desperate Housewives television series. Players, assuming the role of one of the 6 desperate housewives, move around the board visiting the houses on Wisteria Lane and answering trivia questions about the show. As an added twist, each player receives a Dirty Little Secret card. During the game, you try to deduce what the other player's secrets are. The last player whose dirty little secret hasn't been "outed" is the winner.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: The Stock Exchange Game
description: The Stock Exchange Game is another Monopoly clone share dealing game. Roll the die, move round the track, trade shares in UK companies booming in the 80s (The Body Shop, British Airways, Filofax etc). A plastic jigsaw board holds the cards, including Option cards and the usual Hazard cards (mostly unbridled profits!). Collect £250 when you pass the Start, collect £500 when you land on Start. What a brilliant innovation.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: The Rocky Horror Trivia Game
description:
This trivia game is based on 20th Century Fox movie, The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Recommended for Ages 17 and up.

From the box:

It's just a jump to the left...to play the Rocky Horror Trivia Game. Pick one of over 1,200 questions about your favorite transsexual movie and its stars. "It's astounding!"

And then a step to the right...to roll the custom die and earn 5,000 Rocky points to win the game, which "is simply a figment of your imagination."

Put your hands on your hips...and do the pelvic thrust. Drive your opponents insane as you relive this sinful experience and immerse yourself into the twisted world of Rocky Horror to earn bonus points.

The true fans, not virgins, of this horrific, sci-fi, B-movie, are invited to celebrate the 30th Anniversary of one of the most exciting and entertaining films of all time. Test your knowledge..."Hot Patootie, bless my - _____." Act out your favorite character in Wild And Untamed Thing. Dance The Time Warp, and enjoy erotic trivia game fun..."guaranteed to thrill you, chill you and fulfill you!"

Contains: 250 trivia cards, 1,231 Questions, score pad, oversized die, and rules.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Trivia

name: Princess Charming
description:
This game is intended for ages three and up.

The eleven game boards are stacked and the princess pawn is placed at the start of the top board. The players then take turns moving the princess until she reaches the hole in the board, causing the active player to earn a token and allowing the top board to be removed and movement to continue on the next board. The game ends when the end of the last board is reached and the players count their tokens to see who has the most.

name: London: The Board Game
description:
This is a game developed with The Museum of London which takes 2-6 players around a timeline of 2000 years of London's history. It starts with the Romans and ends with The Olympics.
Players throw dice to visit landmarks in the city and each landmark gives the opportunity to collect cards featuring famous people and events. These in turn drive the movement along the time track.

name: We Didn't Playtest This Village at All!
description:
Your village once had bananas. Now it has none. Clearly, werewolves...er...banana thieves are to blame! And there's no way you're a banana thief. You're an honest, hardworking villager.

In We Didn't Playtest This Village at All!, each player is dealt one secret We Didn't Playtest style card, which has both an action and a note telling you whether you are a Nice Villager or a Banana Thief. The village gets one action to deal with the banana crisis, and they must vote on who gets to play their one card! That lone card will determine the fate of the villagers and banana thieves, possibly sending some of them to Banana Jail.

The game lasts 1-10 minutes, depending on how long people talk before the vote.

name: Mama Mammut
description: A game played with colored dice. Players are mother mammoths going into the forest to take their babies back to home. The color of dice dictates which of the mamas goes forward.

name: Martinetti
description:
Martinetti is a type of simple traditional dice game of "climbing" up and down using the results of die rolls. According to game designer and aficionado Dan Glimne it is reputed to date back to Roman times; be that as it may, it could be a precursor to number matching dice games such as Shut the Box

Two or more players can participate, each one writing down a progression of numbers from 1 to 12 and then from 12 back down to 1. On their turn, a player rolls three dice and then crosses off as many numbers as possible, typically in order, by matching them to the numbers on the dice or sums that these add up to. E.g. a first-turn roll of 6-1-1 would allow crossing off the numbers 1 and 2, and a lucky roll of 4-2-1 would mean crossing off every number from 1 to 7. Rerolls may be allowed as long as at least one number was crossed out on the previous roll, except after scoring the first 12.

The first player to reach the end of their sequence, 1 to 12 to 1, is the winner.

Variations concern for instance restrictions on the order in which numbers may be crossed out; restrictions on the use of dice; whether there are two 12 spaces or just one; and whether and how re-rolls are used. If numbers can only be crossed out in strict order, player advancement can be recorded using individual tokens on a single path of numbered spaces.

Similar games include Everest, Mount Everest, Roll and Score Dice Derby Game, and Tolvan

name: I've Never... Bar Cards
description:
I've Never... Bar Cards are great for those times when you can't break out a board game... like when you're at the bar! I've Never... Bar Cards pack all the outrageous fun of the original board game into a pocket sized package. It comes with 104 wild questions and outrageous activities! Includes 10 make up your own questions. In addition, the Bar Cards Game can be added to the Board Game and work as a Booster Pack - thus giving you more questions.

Integrates with:


I've Never... The Outrageous Game of Truth

name: Olympiska spelet
description: A Swedish game about the Olympic games. It claims to be developed in cooperation with Swedish TV sports commentator Lars-Gunnar Björklund.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schwein gehabt!
description:
Before the game starts each player gets four bet markers, one of each color (red, orange, purple and blue), Each pig is made up of eight pieces and these are all placed in the bank.
When it's a players turn he spins the spinner on the game board. The game board consists of a purple field in the middle and 12 other fields around it. The 12 other fields are 6 orange, 3 blue and 3 red - all marked with a number from one to three. While the spinner spins all players put down a marker that match the color of the field they believe the spinner will stop on.

The players who guessed the right color receives from the bank one, two or three pieces of the pig - the number of pieces being determined by the number marked on the actual field the spinner stopped on.

The winner is the player who first gets a whole pig, i.e. gets all 8 pieces.

name: Shatranj Diwana Shah
description:
This game originated in India and it is played on a Chess board using a full set of black Chess pieces, representing the Sepoys, against a single white piece, the Maharajah. The Sepoy player's goal is to checkmate the Maharajah, while the Maharajah player seeks to checkmate the Sepoy's king.

The black pieces begin the game in the same positions as in a standard game of Chess. Pawn promotion and castling are not permitted. The Maharajah starts on any square in the first three rows, and is moved like a knight or queen.

name: RNtertainment: An Nclex Review Board Game
description:
See if you have what it takes to be a Nurse. Roll the dice and the color you land on determines what kind of question you are asked. Beware of "Code Black and Blue" cards that set you back. Move forward faster with "Healthy Rewards" cards. The "healthiest player" (first one to the finish) wins.

Contents:

Game board
Die
6 player pieces
25 Healthy Rewards cards
25 Code Black & Blue cards
75 Medication cards
75 Disease Process/Anatomy & Physiology cards
75 Patient Care cards
75 Diagnostic Testing cards
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Richard Osman's House of Games
description:
Family party game based on the BBC TV game show. Features 10 trivia games from the TV show including the iconic Answer Smash game.

Players play rounds both as individuals and as teams trying to answer various categories of trivia questions.

The player who answers the most questions, wins.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Original Bruce Lee Martial Arts Game
description:
"Can you train to gain the Strength, Knowledge, and Dexterity to be a Real Martial Artist? Will you Master the many Art Forms or attain Black Belt status? Will you be able to Defeat the Opponents Challenging you, be they in Tournaments or in the Deadly Labyrinth (the final stage)? Do you have the Stealth and Ability to eliminate your fellow players? Only these questions can be answered when you test The Original Bruce Lee Martial Arts Game."

Object of the game:
Players must acquire points - strength, dexterity, knowledge - and achieve Black Belt level. Once this is done, to win the game a player has to fight his way through the Labyrinth. (The Final Task). The first player to complete this final task is the Grand Master and the winner of the game.

name: Spiel des Lebens: Star-Edition
description:
A game in a travel box that attempts to simulate the life of a star. The goal is to collect the most fame and fortune.

Each player has a career (like pop star or director) and spins the wheel to see how many spaces one has to move forward or backward. On each space something happens: Pay or gain a fortune, gain fame, choose a new career. The player who is first on the last space, “superstar!”, gets three additional fame.

name: Peikkovuori
description:
The game is played as two teams, both trying to escape from troll mountain. First players have to collect enough cards to repair the route, and then move through the route to safety. But beware, the troll might catch you. Then you will have to start your escape from the beginning again. The first team to get all their figures to safety is the winner.

—user summary

name: Alien Encounter
description:
Aliens Attack!Will you be strong enough to prevent their attack or will they consume the entire galaxy?
This game is a re-themed version of Pente with a small twist.

It consists of 80 counters (40 red and 40 silver) and an 8X8 battle grid that represent space.
Each player takes 40 counters.
One player represents the Aliens that are attacking the galaxy and the other is the defending force.
There are several starting positions that players can choose from in order to start a game.
Each starting possition presents players different chalenges.
The goal of this game is to manage to control the enemy territory and try to avoid losing your base.
Players add counters in turns to the board in order to block enemy counters and create lines of their counters.
Once a counters has been put to the board it can not be moved.
The aim is to align counters of the same colour in vertical hirizontal or diagonal lines.In order to capture your opponents counters you must flank in pairs your opponents counters in any same direction.
The winner is the player who at the end of the game has captured more enemy counters or the player who has captured 5 enemy counters in a row.

name: Sammy The White House Mouse
description:
The object of Sammy The White House Mouseis to be the first mouse to the White House.
Game Rules

Contents:

4 Colored mice
7 Star cards
4 Cheese cards
6 Golden Horns
7 Blind Man Glasses
Game Board


PREPARATION:
Carefully separate cards from box platform.  Mix cards and place face down, on spot marked CARDS.
RULES:
1.  Pick your color mouse to move throughout the game.
2.  Place all mice at START.
3.  All players draw cards from CARD pile until one player draws the Golden Horn.  That player goes first.  Other players follow in turn, clockwise.  Collect cards drawn, mix again and replace cards on board.
4.  Player going first draws one card, then moves mouse forward to next space on the board which has the same picture as card drawn.  Player then places this card in a discard pile.
5.  All players follow in turn.
6.  Another player landing on the same space as you, sends you backwards to the next matching space on the board.  Example:  If you are on the cheese, you must go back tot he previous cheese space.
7.  When cards are used, mix discards and use over again.
8.  Be first to the White House and WIN!

name: The Wild Rumpus
description:
This is a deck of 48 large cards in 4 different colored suits with artwork from Maurice Sendak's "Where the Wild Things Are." These cards can be used to play 3 different games described on the instructions.


Wild Rumpus is a game for 4 or more. Each player gets an hand of 6 cards. Each turn, each player will pass one card to the player to the left. The first player to end up with a hand of just one color calls "Wild Rumpus" and wins.



In Old Jenny, 3-6 players are trying not to get stuck with the card of Max's dog Jenny when the game ends. In each turn, the player will take a card at random from the player on the left. If the player then has a pair of cards, they are played on the table. Once all of the pairs are made, one player will be left with Jenny and loses.



Steal the Deck is a game for 2-4 players who try to collect the most cards by the time the game ends. Each player gets 4 cards and 4 cards are played face up to the middle of the table. Each player can play a card from the hand that matches one of the cards in the center. this pair is then placed face up in a stack front of the player.
