Further pairs are placed on the top of this stack. Players can also take another player's stack if a card in the hand matches the top card of the other player's stack. If a player cannot match wither a center card or another player's top stack card, a card must be discarded to the center. Hands are replenished when everyone runs out of cards to play. the game ends when no more plays can be made. The player with the most cards wins.

name: Bionicle: Mask of Light Board Game
description: From the box back: From the island of Mata Nui comes the latest chapter in the Bionicle legend. A young hero named Takua discovers the Mask of Light and begins an adventure that will determine the fate of their world and fulfill the ancient prophecies. But the evil Makuta lies in wait, unleashing powerful Rahski to search for Takua and destroy everything in their path. Now you can join Takua in this epic thrill ride filled with good and evil, darkness and light, heroes and villains. Based on the new direct to video movie. Bionicle: Mask of Light. You can recreate Takua's heroic quest. Join with the siz Toa, battle the Rahkshi, and become the hero who will confront Makuta and restore balance to Mata Nui.

name: Let's Play Baseball
description: Let's Play Baseball is a simple board game rendition of the game of baseball that uses a custom 52 card deck to drive play. Both sides start on an even footing, and no use of player stats whatsoever is attempted.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Batman Forever: Audio Game
description:
This game uses an audio tape to instruct and guide the players through the game. The game board has two sides for two different scenarios. Side A of the tape is used for the Gotham City side of the board. Side B is used for the Claw Island scenario.

In the Pre-Battle Phase, you draw cards, take cards and give cards to other players as instructed by the tape. You may also flip the Battle Coin to determine if you win or lose cards. During the Battle Phase, the tape will tell you when to put Thug cards and Two-Face and The Riddler face down onto the board. When you control Batman and Robin, you will turn over cards one at a time. If you defeat the villain, you turn over another card and continue to battle. If you lose, you pass Batman and Robin to the next player. The first player to defeat Two-Face wins the Gotham City scenario. The first player to turn over (rescue) the Dr. Chase Meridian and Robin cards wins the Claw Island scenario.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Expanse
description: A globe-trotting game of fun and fortune. The game board is a map of the world showing the multi-colored routes followed by the players. The object is for each player to increase the number and value of his Cargo Certificates while making a tour of the world.

name: Mamanachos!  Tactical Warfare in Spain 1936-39
description: This is a unique game and the only one on the wargame market covering the tactical battles of the Spanish Civil War. The design emphasis is on the weapons used and their tactical value. The armor and air components are used in every scenario. This game received stellar reviews from Paper Wars and is an accurate portrayal of this war at the tactical level. The game comes with one 11x17" map, 280 counters and 25 page rulebook.

name: Monopoly: Leipzig
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Leipzig, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Battle for the Falklands
description:
The Battle for the Falklands is a game of modern naval and air warfare covering the conflict between Britain and Argentina over the Falkland Islands in 1982.

In this two player game players must act quickly to achieve their goals and secure military control over the desolate Falkland Islands. As Argentina you must act quickly to size the islands and use your limited fleet to fortify the Falklands before the British navy can arrive in force to force your navy back into port.

As Britain you must mobilize the British navy quickly to prevent Argentina from fortifying the Falklands with an occupation force too large to contend with. If you can accomplish that, the British navy must brave the Exocet missiles from the Argentinian airforce and secure the waterways around the Falklands in preparation for a landing assault to retake the island.

Both players must manage diplomatic relations with the United States and other nations to influence the fate of world trade and Argentina's ability to purchase additional Exocet missiles to utilize against the superior British navy.

—description from the publisher

name: Super Plug
description:
"You don't know the power of the plug!"

Cards and rules in an envelope, following the Cheapass design philosophy. The premise is that the players are trying to get the landlord's attention by plugging up the toilet in their apartment with anything they can find on the theory that, while the toilet is being fixed all the other things wrong with the apartment will be fixed also. Having lived in off-campus apartments during college, I can relate.

Each player is given a playing mat with a picture of a toilet on it and is dealt one card. On each player's turn they may draw from 0-2 cards and play one card, either on their own toilet or another player's. The winner is the first person to exactly reach a predetermined level of points worth of stuff in their toilet (20 points for a two player game, 18 for three, etc.) Some cards are worth negative points and are played on opponents. That person must then remove that many points worth of stuff from their toilet. If they don't have any cards small enough (say a -2 card was played, for instance) they must discard a larger card (Baby Brother [+5] for instance) and accept the greater loss--no making change allowed. There are also Pet cards. While a player has a Pet card next to their toilet they cannot win even if their toilet is full to the required score--the landlord doesn't allow pets. They may discard the Pet card, but this counts as their entire action for the turn and they may not draw or play any other cards.

Each copy of Super Plug also comes with 5 blank cards. Players are encouraged to create cards of their own.

name: Crazy Casino
description:
From the box:

You never win at gambling? Then you always win at Crazy Casino. Crazy Casino is a gambling game which you can learn to play in five minutes. The aim is to lose all your money as quickly as possible. "It's fun, it's exciting and very entertaining. Try your luck at Crazy Casino".

name: EAV Die Nummer 1
description:
Players are musical agents trying to build a rock band that can top the charts.

Contents:

52 Action cards
46 Musician cards
11 Prize cards

name: It's a Dog's Life
description:
From the web page:

"It's A Dog's Life" is the first game ever designed using the unique features of real dog faces.

From the box:

The exciting, fast paced game where teams compete in four distinctive games of word association.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mississauga on Board
description:
With a population of over 600,000, Mississauga is Canada's 7th largest city, the safest city in Canada to live, work and play. Mississauga is where you will find Canada's busiest airport - Lester B. Pearson, some of Ontario's best shopping centers - Square One, Canada's first interactive entertainment center - Playdium, and some of the best salmon fishing in the world.

With the greatest concentration of major highways in the country, Mississauga is easy to get to - in fact, 29 of Canada's Top 500 corporations are headquartered here.

Now, how would you like to own it? Mississauga On Board is a unique real estate trading game that celebrates our city, as well as the businesses, attractions and people that make it exceptional. Roll the dice, move your game piece around the board, and buy any property that catches your eye.

The city is yours for the taking...one property at a time!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: To Grandma's House We Go!
description:
From the box:
"A Game designed especially for children to play with their grandparents!"

From the instruction sheet:
"Make your way over the river and through the woods. If you are the first player to reach Grandma's House, you win!"

In this game for children age 3 and up, players take turns drawing cards then following the instructions on the cards to move their cars forward along the board to Grandma's House. Cards consist of two types:

Color/shape cards - Move the car forward to the first space matching the color and shape on the card.

Word cards - Kids draw the card, an adult reads it aloud, then the kid follows the instruction or answers the question on the card (things like smile or give another player a hug or answer "What's your middle name?", "Who's your best friend?", etc.) The card then instructs the player to move the car or draw another card.

The first player to reach the end of the board (Grandma's House) wins.

Components:
1 Instruction Sheet
1 Gameboard
4 Plastic Cars
6 Cardboard Kid Figures for the Cars
1 Grandma's House
66 Cards

name: Monopoly: Boston Celtics Collector's Edition
description:
From Publisher's Site:

Do you have the instinctive genius of Larry Bird? School your opponents in this Boston Celtics Collector’s Edition of America’s favorite board game, MONOPOLY. Buy, sell, and trade the all-time greatest Celtics including Bill Russell, Larry Bird, Bob Cousy, Paul Pierce, Ryan Gomes, and Delonte West. Own timeless moments of Celtics history like the 1968-1969 NBA Championship when the team clinched their 11th title in 13 years. In addition to owning the greatest assets of the most storied franchise in NBA history, this special edition includes six collectible pewter tokens, featuring the Celtics clover, Basketball Hoop, NBA basketball, NBA Championship Trophy, player shooting, and defensive player.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Vegas Nite Bingo
description: Vegas Nite Bingo is played with a 56 card deck. Each card has a bingo letter and three numbers. The object is to play cards in front of you that spell BINGO. All players are dealt five cards. One player begins as the caller and turns over the top card in the deck. She then choses one of the three numbers on that card and "calls" that number. For instance O-43. Any players who have cards that match that number can play them in front of them and draw a new card. The caller does have a hand and can choose the number to call based on their cards. Play proceeds until a FREE card is drawn. When this happens the caller plays it as her own and any other FREE card is discarded, the deck then moves to the player on the left and they become the caller.
publishers: International Games, Nilco S.A., Oy Lollipop Ab

name: The Comical Game of Mother Hubbard
description: Based on the nursery rhyme. Be the first player to fill your cupboard with each of four items: grapes, bread, fish, and a bone!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dora Bingo
description:
"The classic game of Bingo has a new twist with Dora and all of her friends. Kids and adults will enjoy this Bingo Adventure!"

Dora Bingo is classic bingo, but without the numbers and letters. Instead, colors and pictures of the Dora characters identify each spot, and a spinner is used to call out the spaces. Red Swiper, blue Boots, orange Dora, etc. Simple enough for four-year-olds. Game includes four cards and a spinner, and can be stretched to five players if one calls out the spots while the other four play.

Note that this game includes small plastic disks to cover the spaces, which could pose a choking hazard to very small children -- clearly marked on the package.

Ages 4 and up

name: Perfect Wedding
description: "The Game of Planning Your Fantasy Wedding." Players take turns rolling and moving clockwise around the board, trying to collect one each of eight components for a wedding, plus two different kinds of shower gifts. Once the 10 items are obtained, players must continue to the "Aisle" space and go down the aisle track to win the game.

name: 24 Card Game
description:
From the publisher:

"A terrorist has infiltrated the CTU - and it's up to you to save the day! As Agents, you have to uncover which player is the terrorist, using your keen powers of observation and the latest advances in technology. Meanwhile, the covert Terrorist will be trying to collect contraband tech to thwart detection by Jack and the CTU team.

The clock is ticking...can you identify the terrorist in time?"

The players are dealt eight cards. During this initial deal, one player is assigned the role of terrorist. There are twenty-four rounds of gameplay. Each round tells the players which suit must be played in order to win the trick. The Jack Bauer Card is wild and wins any trick. A player who wins a trick must either draw and keep two cards or draw and follow the instructions from the top card of the Action Deck.

The terrorist wins the game by not being eliminated and having the most points or by eliminating all the other players. Any other player can win by eliminating the terrorist or by having the most points.


Note: This is essentially the same game as 24 Countdown Game, except that it uses a sleeved card for the timer, instead of a board.



Buy Microbadge - 24 fan

Buy Microbadge - Kiefer Sutherland is a character Jack Bauer plays when he's not saving the world.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Beeline
description: Turn over the beehive, and let the marbles fall in a new order each time. Players race to lay out their bee cards in a 'beeline' to match the order of the marbles and buzz the buzzer first.

name: The Chaps from Amsterdam
description:
The Chaps from Amsterdam has been formulated through years of hard work, in bedrooms, front rooms, pubs, clubs, raves, festivals, police cells and prison cells. Over the past decade we have taken an idea and given it life, transforming it into the product that we are proud to show to you today. Hard Impact Board Games is a street orientated company that has created a game that is not only realistic but also enjoyable to play.

The game can be played by a maximum of 6 players, with 6 characters to choose from, Billy, Bob, Sid, Charlie, Eedid and Grief. Their aim after leaving Amsterdam is to take to the streets and off load their SPACE...Making as much money as possible.

Keep your wits about you! Trust nobody and never be to flash with your cash as like in real life the police, courts and informers are waiting for you around each and every corner!

This is a game and is not a promotion for illegal activities, all information contained within the game is for educational, recreational and historical purposes ,it is not our intention to incite the use of controlled or illegal substances.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mein kleines Pony: Das Traumschloss-Spiel
description:
What it is: A very simple, "My little Pony"-themed racing game for children.

Aim: Be the first to reach the dream castle.

How it is played: The game board shows a race course consisting of horseshoes in five different colours. To move their pony-shaped player piece, players take turns drawing cards from a stack of 32 cards. If the card shows a horseshoe, the player moves his/her pony to the next horseshoe of the same colour on the board. If the card shows two horseshoes, the pony is moved to the next but one horseshoe of that colour. If the card shows a pony, the player moves his/her pony to the corresponding picture on the board. If a pony lands on the space directly in front of one of the two shortcuts, it takes the shortcut. If it lands on a flag field, it can only move on after the player has drawn another horseshoe card of the same colour.
The player whose pony is first to reach the castle wins the game.
publishers: MB peli, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley, Nilco S.A.

name: The Mother Goose Game
description: The Mother Goose Game brings everyone’s favorite nursery rhymes to life with colorful characters, a unique Mother Goose spinner and a fun egg-collecting race! Travel around the board, trying to land on your character’s matching picture to collect eggs, or hope the Mother Goose cards will award you with eggs instead of making you give one back! Children will love the exciting play and the warm connection with their favorite rhymes. Love the book, now live the game!

name: Pohjantähti
description:
Pohjantähti is a Finnish literary game based on the Tällä pohjantähden alla novel by Väinö Linna. The game loosely follows the events of the book by having the players visit the places and people from the novel.

The game mechanic is simple, players roll the dice, advance and pick random cards from the deck to collect the property set required to purchase their own lands from the land owners. Random events from the cards and special tiles on the board mix the game up, but it is a race among the players.

name: Space Dice
description: This is a press your luck style dice game with a space theme in which players score by rolling planets capable of sustaining life. Players take turns rolling a number of 12-sided die trying to roll suns and planets (which create planets capable of sustaining life) while avoiding any black holes or super novas which prevent planets from being scored and causing you to lose points.

name: Rabat
description:
Trade gems in Rabat: a fast-paced, frantic and loud card game. You need to react fast and try not to loose track.

5 Gem cards and 3 mission cards are displayed in the middle of the table.

All players play simultaneously trade single gem cards with the displayed cards on the table or other players as fast as they can. The first to have the exact match for a mission card shouts "rabat," discards his cards and gets the mission card, then draws 5 new gem cards and reveals a new mission card to trade gems for.

Each mission card is worth points. When there are no more mission cards left the game ends and the player with the most points wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Arabian, Card Game, Negotiation, Real-time

name: El Señor de los Anillos: Las Dos Torres
description:
Lord Of The Rings board game published exclusively in Spain by Dinova.

It's a very simple strategy game.

The board is a map of Middle Earth and Mordor, where the mighty ring must be destroyed.

________________________________

Juego del Señor de los Anillos publicado en exclusiva en España por Dinova.

Es un juego sencillo de estrategia.

El tablero representa un mapa de la Tierra Media y Mordor, donde el poderoso anillo debe ser destruído.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: KONTER
description:
KONTER ("Counter") is a dice-handball game with tactics, fast pace and team spirit – for 2 dice-handball game players, 10 years and up.

The sport of (European) handball is characterized by quick moves and a lot of goals. KONTER has been inspired by this; with its specific game course, it creates a similar feel of play.


On his turn, the active player rolls two dice at the same time – for himself and for his opponent (passive player). Now the active player chooses one die for the passive player and puts the die on its tray. If he uses his Tactics cards, the active player may change the number rolled on his die.
After that, he immediately carries out an action; e.g., he can substitute a playing figure with a "3" and strengthen his own defense, or he can try to start an offense to get a chance of throwing a goal. Then, with his die, the passive player has a consequent reaction, e.g., guarding opposing offense spaces with a "1," or fine-tuning his own tactics.
Both players try to use their "all-rounder" (a playing figure with special abilities) tactically and cleverly; there are different kinds of throws, fouls with 2-minute penalties, yellow cards and just one "Super Glove"; for reinforcement, the "Team Spirit" comes into play…


The player who has "thrown" the most goals by the end of the game wins. And who else does? Of course, the player with the best tactics, the fastest pace, and with the Team Spirit as the eighth player on his side.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Take That

name: Klappe!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Who has quick-witted answers to the really important questions in life and can make their fellow players laugh in reaction to their profound but absurd answers? You'll find out in Klappe!, but if you overdo it, you can quickly talk yourself into trouble...

name: Fina Fisken
description: The game contains 36 fishes in mixed colours and two dice. From the beginning, all but three of these are upside down. On your turn, one die is rolled and show your action. Either you are allowed to fish, everyone are allowed to fish, you can turn one fish around or you miss your turn. If you are allowed to fish, the second die is used showing which colour you are allowed to take. The same goes when everyone are allowed to fish. The players then compete to grab the fishes with the correct colour. The game ends when all fishes are taken and the player with the most fishes wins.

name: Bamse: Fånga bollarna
description: A Swedish children´s game in with the players takes turns rolling the die to attempt to throw their ball to Bamse. The color rolled on the die tells the player with ball to get rid of from their player board. The player that first has gotten rid of all of the five balls wins the game. It is a game for the young child and fits as a first game.

name: Money Buns
description:
It’s a gluten free-for all! — Trade zealously, collect piles of pastries, win big!

Money Buns is carb-themed card game for 3-7 players that takes under 10 minutes to learn and plays in about 30 to 45 rowdy minutes.

As the carb-loving owner of a small bakery, you yearn to make it big selling piles of pastries. But while you collect carbs in front of you, the real action in Money Buns happens above the table between the players. Trade zealously or you might get stuck taking your buns out of the oven before they are ready!

Buns come off your conveyor belt every turn whether you want them or not so even the most timid players will be trading away with enthusiasm.

Players each start off with a hand of carbs and are working to build up collections of the same carb on the table in front of them. The more copies of a carb in a batch, the more money the baker makes when they sell. Some carbs are rarer than others, and as such, they will earn a baker more money per card.

The catch is that players only have 3 ovens to bake carbs in, and you can't put your ginger snaps in with your challah bread, so when new carbs come off a player's conveyor belt, they might have to toss out a batch before it can be sold for profit. To avoid this fate, players can trade with each other during their turn, often bluffing or hiding info about the most valuable carbs they may have to offer.

Each turn the active player adds carbs from their hand into their ovens, adds new carbs into the mix from the draw deck, and optionally trades with other players. If desired, the player may also cash in their batches for money to make room for a new carb collection in that oven and to inch closer to victory.

The goal of the game is to be the player with the most money after three rounds of play.

-description from designer

name: Monkey See, Monkey Poo Game
description:
The concept is simple: Fill the launcher with banana-scented poo! Fling poo! Collect bananas! Climb!

Start by choosing your monkey (P.U. Stink, Gassy George, Harry Dingle, or Tootsie) then spin the spinner to see how many flings you get. Lift the Monkey Flinger’s tail and load the Dough into the opening on his back. Push down on the tail until all the dough is in the Monkey’s hands. Pinch and shape poo before launching! Place one hand on the Monkey Flinger’s base to keep it steady and your other hand over the launcher. Aim at the vertical tree that is the game board and let the poop fly! After flinging a poo, collect a Banana Token for each Banana Bunch you knocked over. Continue flinging poo the number of times shown on the spinner. When a player collects 3 Banana Tokens, it’s time to trade them in and climb to the next level on the Tree! If you knock over the entire Tree, it’s a “BANANA BLOWOUT!” Collect 1 Banana Token and your turn ends. It’s now the next player’s turn. Trade in enough Bananas Tokens to climb to the top and be TOP BANANA!

—description from the publisher

name: Neurodyssée
description:
After a long voyage in space, they are back at the doorstep of our planet. The funny aliens are here to learn more about the European Union.

Though they are outstandingly intelligent, they suffer from a big concentration problem. If they have to think for too long, their brains explode. That's why they record all their knowledge on memory cards. These cards are precious to them, and our alien friends have no intention of sharing them !

27 member states of the European Union, 27 memory cards to win ! Which one of them will bring the most of them back to his mother planet ?

Neurodyssée is a Trivia game where players take the role of aliens who want to learn more about the European Union.

On each turn, the players alternate taking one of the three roles:

One player is the "Candidate": he must answer a question correctly to win "memory" cards. The number of cards he may win depends on the difficulty level he chooses.
One player is the "Game Master": after the debate led by the "Disturbers" (see next bullet), he reads the question from the question card and the three answers.
All other players are "Disturbers": each of them choses one of the answers from a randomly drawn question card and try to convince the "Candidate" to choose that answer, before the "Candidate" even knowns what the question is. Once the "Game Master" decides he had enough of the debate, he reads the question and all possible answers aloud and the "Candidate" chooses one answer.


Each player has a character card representing an alien with a second card that is shifted above the first to indicate the alien's brain size.

If the "Candidate's" chose the wrong answer, his brain grows the number of levels equal to the difficulty level he chose. He also loses one of his memory cards to each "Disturber" who defended that answer, if any.

If the candidate chose the right answer, the "Disturbers" who defended that answer lower their brain size by one level. The "Disturbers" who defended a wrong answer raise their brain size by one level.

If a player's brain "explodes", he draws one question card and reads all four questions. He loses memory cards to the first player who gives a correct answer to each question. The number of cards lost depends on the question's difficulty level. The player may loose up to 10 cards in this process (1+2+3+4).

Once the memory card pile is empty, the player with the most memory cards wins the game.

name: Vegas Nite Roulette
description:
Object of the game: To be the last player in the game with cards.

Vegas Nite Roulette plays like Roulette. Players take turns "calling". First, all players (except the "caller") place their "bets" by placing their card(s) face down on the table. The "caller" draws a card and calls out a number. Players with the matching number on their betting cards win.

name: Old Spider & The Fly
description:
Summer is here and so are the bugs inside my cabin room. But so is the Old Spider. We help him deploy his webs around the room to catch those pesky pests. Each player sets the web, rolls the dice and sees which bugs are caught. It's not as easy as it sounds, because the pests keep buzzing around and can wriggle free from a web. We and the Old Spider will have to help each other make some clever choices.

Contents:
1 game board
2 bug dice
6 bug tokens
2 spider webs
rules

name: My Pharaoh
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

The players compete, as Ramses I and Ramses II, to become the most well known and pious pharaoh of the ages. Using a limited supply of "build points", the players build pyramids, obelisks, statues and temples in and around Egypt. The Ramses II player also has the opportunity to denounce or deface the monuments of his predecessor. After the players have exhausted their build points, they determine when and if each monument is discovered (by die roll for the years 1880, 1912, and 2006). Points are scored based on the piety value of the buildings and the grandeur of buildings discovered in the future, bestowing each player's pharaoh with titles ranging from "The Great" to "The Weak."

name: Rat Race
description:
From the box:

Travel around the Nordic and Baltic countries and try to find hidden cheese bits. At the same time you'll learn new things about your neighbouring countries. Rat Race is a fun and educational game for all.

Player tokens are mice from the publisher's (Finnish insurance company) ads. That's why you search cheese bits!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: MiYu the Game
description:
With this game players will try to look into their future.

The game is placed in the center of the table. Each turn the player swings the pendulum above the board. The place where the pendulum lands decides wether a player has to use the 'moodring'.
The 'moodring' at the end of the pendulum changes its color when it's put on the player's finger. The player takes the corresponding assignment card and has to fulfill the assignment.
The game also contents 'magic stones'. These stones are needed with some of the assignments.

The object of the game is to learn more about yourself, your friends or about your future.

name: Fallen City of Karez: Port of Karez
description: The Fallen City of Karez: Port of Karez is a 6th player expansion for Fallen City of Karez.

name: Escape Room: Kluftinger in Gefahr
description:
There is a mole in commissar Kluftinger's department, and only you can find him! This is done by solving classic Escape room style puzzles.

Unlike other Escape room games, this one does not have a hard time limit, instead some events put the game clock forward, thus limiting your actions. If you fail, you have to start over again.
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Dow Jones
description:
Dow Jones is a new version of Nicht geheuer im Gemäuer with a stock market theme. It contains a game board, 14 pawns (2 each in 7 colours), 1 'hausse' marker, 21 'baisse' sticks, 20 cards (stock certificates), 3 dice (one six-sided, one 12-sided, and one 20-sided).

The game board is a grid of 12 by 20 squares. Each player receives 2 pawns and 3 'baisse' sticks. The stock certificates are ordered by value and placed face up next to the board, with the lowest value on top. One player rolls the special (1 12 sided, and 1 20 sided) dice and places the 'hausse' marker on the corresponding space on the grid. Players now roll the 6-sided dice to move one of their pawns onto the square with the hausse marker. If a player's pawn reaches the marker, that player receives the top stock certificate. The hausse marker is then placed on the game board by rolling the special dice as described above.

In addition, if a player hands in one of their 'baisse' sticks, they can immediately roll the special dice to move the marker (on their turn or on another player's turn).

The game ends when a player receives the last stock certificate. Each unused baisse stick is worth $50,000, and the player with the most money (stocks + unused baisse sticks) wins.

name: The Chicago Way
description: In The Chicago Way, players visit the various neighborhoods of Chicago to gain influence over the city's political bosses.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Gender Gap
description:
From the back of the box:

As you move your way around the board you'll test your "gender IQ" with questions from the intriguing "relationships" category. And your opponents will try to stump you from other categories such as family, home improvement, cooking and sports. Before you close in on the finish, you'll be challenged to "Bridge the Gap". Here, get ready to take on the most challenging gender question you'll face.

Contents:

The Gender Gap Game Board
800 Question Cards
24 "Take the Plunge" Cards
4 Category Cards
6 Game Pieces
2 "Gender" Dice

name: Dora the Explorer ABC Game
description:
From the Publisher:
Explore the alphabet with Dora! Match pictures with letters to earn tokens. Collect the most tokens and win the game! No reading required to play.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Utterly Outrageous Drinking Games
description:
A collection of drinking games in a tin, bottle shaped party set. In total there are 25 drinking games such as pucker up, drag queen, kingpin (beer pong), the probe, warthog and bump and grind.

The set includes a pencil and paper, 25 drinking game rule cards, instructions, 1 ribbon, playing cards, straws, dice and a beer pong ball.

Games start with a minimum of 2, 3 or 4 players depending on the card.

Play lasts as long as there are players.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Team-Based Game

name: Ox Blocks
description:
From the box: Ox Blocks is a game for 2 players. The object is to make a straight line of X's or O's horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

One player elects to play X's, the other O's. Either player may start by rolling any one of the Ox Blocks. If a player throws his own symbol (X or O) he may place it on the board in any position he wishes. If he throws his opponent's symbol, he must still place it on the board. In this case he will try to help his opponent as little as possible.

If either player throws a Block with the open face upwards, he may remove one of his opponent's Blocks from the board. If his opponent has no Blocks on the board, he must remove one of his own Blocks.

Players take it in turns to throw the Blocks until one player makes a complete line.

name: Mastergame
description:
CONTENTS
Colorful shiny Boardgame
2x 8 playing pieces

OBJECT
To make a line of 4 pieces on touching squares

PLAY
From the starting line, players move one of their pieces one vacant square only in any direction.
A piece must never be moved onto a square having the same symbol as on the piece.
A piece can not be part of a winning line unless it has made at least one move.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Overlords
description:
The W.H.A.T.: Overlords Fantasy Battlescape Wargame is billed as "A Titan Variant" by the publisher but is really a derivative game.

Players assume the role of Overlords who must compete for world domination by recruiting armies of creatures and using them to wage war on the other players. Build your army carefully, as you will need certain creatures to help you recruit other creatures. Split your forces with care as your Overlords quests for new creatures to add to the army, as your opponents might slip past you and attack your Keep. Unique pull-out Battlescape zones (like Titan's Battlelands) make the battle for each hex zone a uniquely different tactical confrontation.

The map is closer to a traditional wargame map, showing a Divine-Right-like land divided in hexes. The game comes with a 17"x22" full color mounted game board, 189 plastic playing tokens (to which 189 stickers must be applied!), 20 Overlords cards, 7 Pull-Out Terrain Battlescapes, dice and a rule book.

There is also an introductory 2-player boxed set which can be used as an expansion of the main set (11"x17" full color map, 63 playing tokens, 10 Overlords cards, rule book and 5 Pull-Out Terrain Battlescapes), and four Creature Expansion Packs (each contains 21 playing tokens and 5 Overlords cards).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Mary Poppins Carousel Game
description:
This is a children's race game that matches portions of the Mary Poppins movie.

It is a simple roll and move game that is pure luck with no player choices to make. There is a spinner built into the board that is used only at the end when a player at the final space spins to match their color/player token. If the spinner does not land on their color, they wait and try again next turn.

This is NOT the Mary Poppins game that has a 3-D carousel, although it was produced around the same time.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Yo-Si-No
description:
Aim of the game:
Achieve the maximum number of jackpots and smiles by bluffing.

Rules of the game:
Place the cards face down in a pile in the centre of the table. The youngest player starts (A). Take the first 3 cards from the pile, look at them, count the elements and announce a score lower or equal to 9. Depending on the player's strategy, they can be telling the truth or bluffing.

There are now two possibilities:

The next player (B) can believe this and takes the cards from player (A). Player (A) wins a smile. Player (B) takes one of the 3 cards, placing it face down beside the pile and swaps it for the top card on the pile.


The player now announces a score, higher than that of player (A) but always less or equal to 9. If player (C) believes it, they take the 3 cards from player (B) who wins a smile card. And so on.

Player B does not believe player (A) and refuses to take the cards. If player (A) is telling the truth, they show the cards and place them at the bottom of the pile and then take a smile. Player (B) misses a turn. If player (A) is in fact bluffing, they place their cards at the bottom of the pile and do not get a smile. Now it is Player (B) who takes the 3 cards and begins again.

name: Rhyme Time
description: At the start of each round one player draws a card, selects one of the ten words on the card (words like Troth, Underlay or Trapeze) and reads it aloud. Each player then announces how many words they think they can come up with that rhyme with the selected word. The player with the highest "bid" wins and is the rhymer for that round. The rhymer then has one minute (on a sand timer) to write down all of the rhymes they can. If they are able to write the correct number of words then they win a number of points equal to their bid. If they fail to write the correct number, they lose that many points. The first player to reach 500 points wins. In the case of a dispute, the game comes with an official rhyme dictionary for all of the words.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Presidential Campaign
description:
This is a game for people who love rolling dice.

Players roll dice to move around an outer (primaries) track, then an inner (election) track toward the final election space. A player who lands on an election space rolls 2d6 three times and collects a card if he gets 8+ twice. Land on Campaign, Power or Delegate and take a corresponding card. On a Power or Roll-Off square, the player can challenge an opponent for 1-2 matching cards; highest on 2D6 wins; defender wins ties.

To move up to the Election track, the player must turn in 2 Election cards, 4 Campaign cards and 4 matching delegates (same party, all four regions). The player turns them all in and starts collecting again on the inner track.

With another full set (delegates must be from the same party as before), the player gets to roll some more: he and the player with the most Delegate cards roll off 2D6 five times. If the player trying to get elected wins 3/5 rolls (opponent winning ties), he wins the game. Otherwise, he loses all his cards, stays on the Election track and starts collecting again.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sensations
description:
A sensuous game for lovers!

How can a game awaken all five senses?
Sensations puts everything together to ensure that the mood is set for soft caresses, quivers of sensual delight, communication, passion and humor!All your senses will come alive!

Sensations entertains while leading you through an entire range of emotions. The game is an exciting and stimulating prelude and you may make discoveries about each other you never imagined!

Goal of the game:
You must meet challenges and accumulate as many favor coupons as possible! You will experience as many thrills playing Sensations as you will when redeeming your favors later!


The game includes:2 tokens
1 die
1 hourglass
1 blindfold
1 board
2 spinners
1 notepad and 2 pencils
30 challenge cards
30 favor coupons
1 stimulator (AA battery not included)
1 bottle of massage oil
1 instruction booklet


Prepare to experience memorable and thrilling Sensations!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Exiled
description:
Exiled: It's dangerous in the desert...

From the back of the game box:

Should you choose to accept this mission, you will be thrown into a race against your opponents, traveling through the ancient lands of the Old Testament. Adventures and excitement are certain as you successfully work to complete your journeys!

Maintain a successful roll of the die, listen, and respond strategically in order to reach your goal. Exercise caution at all times! You may be faced with challenging and exciting obstacles that can only be overcome if you have listened to the details given to you by your opponents or provided to you on your destination cards. Beware! One cunning move on the part of your opponent can send you into exile, delaying the completion of your mission!

name: Magnetic Jack Straws
description:
An early variant of Jack Straws dated 1920. This version uses a thin horseshoe shaped magnet to pick up various garden tools (Axes, rakes, etc.) The garden tools have metal handles.

The game is played by taking all of the garden tools at once and dropping them 2 inches above a table so that they will fall into a random pile.

The objective is to remove a garden tool one at a time without disturbing (moving) any of the other pieces. The player continues to go until he/she inadvertently moves a piece other than the one they were attempting to retrieve, in which case it is the next players turn to go.

Various garden tools have different points:

- Plain straws .... 1
- Bent straws ..... 3
- Square Mauls .... 5
- Mallets ......... 7
- Rakes ........... 10
- Picks ........... 15
- Cooper's Adze ... 17

name: Menschen, Würfel, Temperamente
description: Menschen, Würfel, Temperamente is a german game, inspired by Pachisi. Each pawn has a different temperament. The sanguine type is allowed to jump over other pawns. The apathetic pawn can move backwords. The choleric beats every pawn in every field he passes by. The melancholic just behaves like a standard Pachisi-pawn. Although it's primarily a dice rolling game, the different types of pawns/temperaments add some tactical elements to it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Terrytoons Mighty Mouse Game
description:
Thirteen cards are placed on designated areas on the game board’s track. Each player, in turn, rolls the die and moves one’s pawn along the track. Whenever a player’s pawn lands on a card, the player takes the card. Most cards have a value of 1, 2, 3 or 4. The object of the game is to collect cards totaling twelve. Cards that have a drawing of Mighty Mouse, of which there are eight, allow a player to move backwards.

This is seemingly a different game from Mighty Mouse Game
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pecos Bill
description:
Pecos Bill is a card game played with a slightly customized deck of cards, although it could be played with a standard deck too. However, special deck helps players to remember various things - e.g. which cards are valuable.

Playing the game is very similar to Casino. Players try to capture cards from the board with their hand cards by a similar mechanic.

There are many ways to score points. E.g. when player manages to clear a table, he's awarded with a Pecos, which equals one point at the end of the round. Getting a Pecos Bill card and all four flags is worth 50 points.

The game is played over multiple rounds. At the end of each round, players receive points according to the cards they managed to get. The player who first reaches exactly 301 points is the winner. Going over is penalized.

There's no signs that the game is published outside Finland.
categories: American West, Card Game, Mythology, Novel-based

name: Dungeon Escape
description:
Be the first to collect all the treasures and escape from the dungeon.

Dungeon Escape is a roll and move, dungeon crawl themed game for children ages 7 and up. Move your two children through the maze while avoiding the guards, who will send a player's piece back to the keep. Before a player's piece can exit the dungeon it must land on each of the four marked treasure spaces - Sword, Jewel, Book of Spells, and Key - and collect the corresponding treasures.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Missionary Game 1: Simon kalastajan ihmeelliset seikkailut
description:
"The Amazing Adventures of Simon the Fisherman" (aka apostle Peter)

This is a religious trivia/party game with roll-and-move mechanics and a deck of trivia/task/event cards.

The game board is a map of Palestine in 33 AD, where the game is set. Each player assumes the role of Simon (Peter) in travelling through the Holy Land in search of three Keys to the Kingdom of Heaven.
By rolling a 6-sided die, the players move through land, mountain, and water routes. Each city on the map has a face-down counter; these counters represent events and items, including the Keys. When a player lands on a city, they must roll the die to determine whether they must a) turn the counter immediately, b) answer a trivia question, or c) perform a task. The biblical trivia questions are multi-choice (3) and on a correct answer the counter can be turned. The tasks are pantomimes such as "sewing", "smoke getting into eyes" etc. If another player guesses the task correctly, the counter can be turned, and the guesser also gets an extra roll on her turn.

A negative result in the trivia or task finishes the player's turn, but she can remain in the space and try again on the next turn.

If a player lands on a violet space, an event takes place; these are also included in the trivia cards.

The first player to collect three Keys and proceed to the finish ("ship bound for Rome") wins the game.

name: Snooker Quiz Game
description:
Matchroom
Snooker Quiz Game
The general knowledge quiz that scores like snooker.
Ages 8 and up
2 - 4 Players

Players answer questions of varying degrees of difficult
Red = easiest
Black = hardest
When a question is answered correctly the player may pocket a ball on the mini snooker table and then choose another color to answer.
Points for each ball are the same as in the game of snooker

name: Smart Girls Trivia
description:
Have fun with your cool friends while playing this action packed internet board game. Answer questions about the things that interest girls the most – fashion, make-up, movies, music, sport and much more. Dare you share your innermost secrets with your friends – if not then pay the penalty! Have fun whilst acting out the craziest of charades or play the word chase game. Land on the internet square and log in to play the game with your friends on the internet. Publish your own trivia questions on the internet for other game players to share.

Online play available.

name: Little Einsteins Dominoes
description:
The classic game of dominoes is much more fun when starring the Little Einsteins characters or 5 other interchangeable pads. A great way for kids to practice problem solving, logical thinking, counting and matching. Ages 3 and up

6 ways to play...
1. Magical Instrument
2. Counting Rockets
3. Little Einsteins Friends
4. Exploration
5. Counting Insects
6. Picture Background
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Scooby-Doo: Escape from the Vortex
description:
Scooby Doo and the gang are trapped in the spinning vortex and things are looking a bit grim. You must try to help them find a way out of the network without being caught by the evil robots. Beware ... the vortex actually spins, so don't get trapped yourself!

A game for 2-5 players Ages 6 and up.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Achtung Hexe!
description:
48 cards contain 6 parts of a gingerbread house, 1 witch and 41 cards with different amounts of gingerbread.
The players take turns drawing cards. Gingerbread house cards are added to the house "puzzle", gingerbread cards can be kept - but when a player draws the witch, he or she has to shuffle it back into the pile - with all the gingerbread cards he or she had collected so far. When the house is completed, the player with most gingerbread is the winner.

The players do not make any choices during the game, so the result is decided by the shuffle(s) alone.

name: Tee Skoori
description:
From the designer website:
"Tee Skoori" is a basketball simulation that lasts about 30 minutes. For playing you use two dice for deciding an attack. Throwing one dice you decide if you go below the basket, or the player may run after one pass into the fast attack. Also you have many chances to get the long distance throw. For very lucky shots you can earn extra free throws as well. Using these two dice you decide the success of the free throws and fast attacks. Attack cards can be used to avoid ball loss and the get more chances to get a score.

For the game play changing the players have attack and defense cards. Defense cards help to defend against opponent attacks and force the ball lost. Attack cards can be used to avid ball loss and the get more changes to get a score.

Like in real life, when one teams dominates over another, it can happen here as well. You can get the rush after the right moment and can gain a lot of points in a short while. So you should always play until the end of the game, because things may change fast.

name: Tornado Card Game
description:
From the publishers site:
Card game with 110 card full of tornados, some crazier than others. Each player is the chaser of the tornados and try get the best pictures of tornados.
To get great pictures you must interrupt others in their way and play stronger tornados to swallow their small tornados or change the wind and push it near to you.

Be the one with the best tornado in the end and win the game.

name: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
description:
TV related trivia game.

Players travel round the board and get to answer questions. Correct answers gains you Ads tiles. Each tile features a generic product you might see on a television advert and the value of that item (Examples: Make-Up 10 pounds, Lether Sofa 750 pounds). You keep these values secret.

At some stage someone will think they have won with a total value of all their tiles better than any other player. That player's tiles are revealed and if they were not correct at this point, they are eliminated from the game and the game continues until someone else thinks they have won and the same procedure is followed.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Matkailupeli
description: Simple "roll and move" game, where players travel around Europe and learn geography and history. First part of game consists traveling through Europe and second part is a trivia of a geography learned when traveling.

name: Orc Office Party
description:
Orc Office Party is a quick card game for 2-4 players per deck with games lasting an average of 15-30 minutes wherein players compete to survive in an office environment managed by dastardly orc supervisors.
In this card game, players take on the role of an employee scrambling to survive the most hostile work environment, a company run entirely by orcs! Along with surviving the dangerous traps and time consuming assignments, players compete to see who can slack off the most and still remain employed at the end of the work week. Players begin with timecards, each one representing an hour they can slack off and still get paid.

The game plays 2 to 4 players with the base deck. It only takes about 5 minutes to learn, and only about 15 minutes for a single game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Joker Cup
description:
In the Joker Cup, players will ride a jumping horses through the course with different obstacles. The dice indicates the speed of the horse but it is important to land on the right box to jump flawlessly.
But players may also use cards for helping the horses.
Who finds the shortest route to end is the winner.

name: Return of Israel
description:
MISSION OF THE GAME
Your task is to take the 12 tribes of Israel out of the slavery of Egypt and lead them with Moses into the Promised Land. During their journey the people of Israel meet many difficulties, which can affect their morale. The task of Moses (the player) is to keep their morale high enough, otherwise traveling will stop. God is with Israel in the pillars of cloud and fire. God helps his people to reach the destination by giving manna from Heaven and water from the rock. Sometimes stubborn people stir up the wrath of God and they have to sacrifice sin offerings in order to reconcile their deeds and get blessings. God rewards the obedience of people by letting them carry the Ark of the Covenant. The winner is the one who reaches the goal and offers first a Sacrifice of Thanksgiving.

The players will advance in pre-determined path in the game by throwing a dice and will have to keep their moral points above 2 by getting maximum of one for free or paying three/five silver coins. The players can also bog each other down by bribing the enemy causing the other to pay to progress or get slowed down. Leading the race after Mount of Sinai is also important, the leader will have the Ark of the Covenant giving him the choice to make additional step.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: ConSEXuate Diverso
description:
ConSEXuate Diverso is a game of affective Sex Education with focus on Diversity, a trivia of questions divided into the following categories: Love and Eroticism, Prevention, Debate, Body, Gender, plus an instruction manual with their respective answers.

The cards are shuffled and the deck is placed in the center, a randomly designated participant will start the game by taking a card from the deck and reading the question or trigger aloud. At your convenience you can choose a partner to help you with an answer. Once the player answers correctly (the answer does not have to be textual), he keeps the card and we go to the next player, so on, the course of the game will continue. In case of not answering correctly, you must leave the card under the deck, the answers are found in this manual, so it should be kept throughout the game.

The cards are divided into colors according to their category. When drawing a YELLOW card, the group must answer together, creating a single answer among all. The player who touched this card must draw a new one for the individual response.

The game ends when the agreed session time is over. Whoever has the most number of cards is the one who knew the most to answer about sexuality. We all win by learning!!!
categories: Card Game, Educational, Mature / Adult, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Line Drawing, Set Collection

name: Likes
description:
A party game where you and your friends will create fake online dating profiles.

Each round, one of the players is the judge and chooses a profile picture from the deck. Each other player then selects a card from their hand to create a memorable, intriguing, or hilarious dating profile.

The judge chooses their favorite and rewards the creator of the profile with a "Like".
At the end of the game, players choose the "best" profile and use their "Likes" to vote on which player is most likely to date them. Whether that makes you the "winner" depends on the profile you decided was best.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Mini Zitternix
description: Wooden dowels of the same thickness are placed within a wooden ring and then twisted so they balance on the table. Players roll a colored die which determines which dowel they must remove from the ring (colors are green, orange, and blue). Each dowel is worth 1 point. The player with the most points when the structure collapses (when the ring hits the table) is the winner.

name: Tango
description:
The party reaches its climax: the band strikes up the tango. The dance floor immediately fills up with enthusiastic dancers moving spiritedly to the rhythmic sounds. More and more dancers press onto the parquet. The room becomes tighter and tighter, everyone is jostling and shoving. Only the craftiest tactician manages to keep the beat and safely and skillfully lead his dance pair across the dance floor...

Goal
The winner is the player who first gets his dance pair to the opposite corner of the dance floor.

name: Silly Sandwiches
description:
Players have to memorize which ingredients are between slices of toast and in which order. When a player remembers wrongly he helps his opponents, but when he remembers correctly he gets the toasts for himself. The player having the most ingredient cards in the end is the winner.

From the back of the box:

The craziest memory game ever! You much remember all the unusual ingredients used in the sandwich, in the correct order, to score points. The thicker the sandwich, the more points you get!
publishers: Alary Games, Seven Towns Ltd., Tactic

name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe – The Liberation of Narnia
description:
The Liberation of Narnia uses 52 shield-shaped cards printed with photos of various characters from The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe movie. Each player arranges his 26 cards in four rows of six, face down, with the Lion and the Witch cards in a separate seventh row. Players throw the die and try to pick a card whose picture matches the symbol on the die. If the die and the card match the card is removed. The player thus tries to carve a path to uncover the Lion and win the game.

The game also contains alternate rules for Quartett/Happy Families.

There is a limited edition of this game too.
The cards are a better quality and the die is bigger and gold coloured.
All the contents are in a metal case.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Squander
description:
Squander -- the game that allows you to live like a millionaire! Start with a million Squanderbucks. Buy hotels, gold mines -- be a tycoon on the stock market -- take impossible chances at Roulette, Monte Carlo, "21" and at the Horse Races. Spend as recklessly as you wish. The first player to Squander his million wins the game!"

Technically the game is titled "$QUANDER", as a dollar sign is used in place of the "S" in the title on the box cover and in the rules.

name: Office Boy
description: The players start as Office Boys. They travel around a spiral track that uses hexagonal shaped spaces. Some spaces direct a piece to advance or go back. The first player to reach the center space becomes Head of the Firm and wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wordinoes
description: Dominoes... but with Words! Wordinoes is the word equivalent of the classic parlour game. Instead of matching numbers, players match their Wordinoes by making new words or phrases, word association, pairing opposites or using rhyme.

name: Batman: The Game
description: This is a game based in the 1989 movie starring Jack Nicholson and Michael Keaton, whose images feature in the graphics of the gameboard. Players can choose to be either a "Batman" or a "Joker", which determines their starting places and objectives. Batman must travel from Wayne Manor to the Batcave, and Joker must travel from Grissom's Apartment to Axis Chemical. Upon arrival, a Destination card is chosen, and the first player to reach their destination wins. There are cards drawn on various spaces (power, direction, and battle) that give advantages and players can battle an opposite character type with a die roll-vs-die roll contest to gain extra moves and cards.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Quest For Power
description:
Quest for Power is billed as a "Game Masterless Role-Playing System". In actuality, it is a fantasy-themed board game where the board is constructed each play session from randomly dealt cards. It has all the trappings of a role-playing game: character generation, multiple races and professions, skills, spells, weapons, etc. But the actual game play is very much a board game: move along the board, turn over unexplored cards, and deal with the situation given on them. Players can compete against one another, or work cooperatively. Like any good multiplayer game, there are alliances and treacherous betrayals among the players. In the end, in order to defeat the evil lord in his castle (the main objective of the game) at least some of the players will need to team up because the castle lord is more powerful than any one character can handle.

Evidently the publisher had visions of making a whole series of games based on the R.A.G.G.S. (Random Adventure Game Generating System). The sub-title for the game is "Darkness in the Light" and it is called a "Starter Set for Character Levels 1 - 3", presumably because other scenarios and rules for higher level characters were planned. As far as I know, no expansions for the game were ever produced and Infinite Imagination, Inc. is no more.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Battlechrome: Fire & Steel
description:
Included in Competitive Edge (Formerly 'Gamefix') Magazine #12

2-player futuristic game of armored vehicle combat reminiscent of 'Battletech'.

Components include:
(4) pages of rules
(1) 11x17" mapsheet
(1) sheet of counters.

name: UNO Bingo
description:
Bingo. With an UNO twist.

Roll the dice, place the chips, and try for a BINGO.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Skeleton Warriors
description:
Based on the TV cartoon Skeleton Warriors.

The back of the box reads..

THEY'RE BAD TO THE BONE!
And they're going to control the Planet of Luminaire - unless you can capture Baron Dark and his hideous Skeleton Legion. You are the last line of defense in this war of good versus evil.

Choose your favorite hero and set out on your mission. Challenge opponents to a die-rolling battle to capture a Skeleton Warrior. Gain control of the Lightstar Crystal and increase your chances of winning battles. But beware of Baddog! His surprise attacks can stop you in your tracks!

Collect 4 Skeleton Warriors(tm) Cards, and you're ready for the final battle with Baron Dark! Will you be the hero who saves Luminaire from destruction?
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bolibompa: Pling plong-spelet
description: Bolibompa Pling Plong is a children's game based on a popular Swedish TV-show. You try to collect a jigsaw puzzle depicting your character and get back to your start square before your opponents.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

name: Monopoly: Baden-Württemberg
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Baden-Württenberg, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Schleswig-Holstein
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Schleswig-Holstein, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Ruhrgebiet
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ruhrgebiet, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Wild Lapland Adventure Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"This game takes you on an adventure in northern Scandinavia. You will also learn interesting details about the region's history and present state of affairs."

Fairly simple roll and move game in the 1980's style, sold in tourist shops in Lapland. The game contains some background information of the area and comes in eight languages (Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian, German, English, French, Russian and Japanese).

name: Saved by the Bell Game
description:
Time warp yourself back to the fun and friends of Bayside High with this Saved by the Bell board game.

Zack and Kelly reveal the "who", "what" and "where" of your date.

Maybe they're the romantic type and you go to a scary movie and then out for a picnic...

...Or maybe your date is athletic and you go to a baseball game and have pizza. You may even get to change a date so that it's everything you want it to be!

(From the back of the box)

OBJECT: Play three "pranks" on other players, then go out on a special date to win.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pass the Blame: The Party Game For Irresponsible Adults
description:
This is a game of concocting the best excuse to get out of unfortunate situations. Players are presented with a Situation card, for example:

There’s a giant slice missing from the birthday cake, and the party hasn’t even started.
There are muddy footprints all over the new white carpet.
Your friend’s collection of vintage action figures was mistakenly donated to the holiday toy drive.


The player must then write down who is to blame and why. Then the answers are scored based on best and worst excuse.

name: Pi
description:
The Board Game & App for Tech Geeks

Each playing card has five words or phrases and the players must describe them to their team, as quickly as possible. The teams move round the board based on the number of words or phrases guessed correctly and the number of general knowledge questions they answer correctly.

The general knowledge questions are designed to trip the teams up and slow them down (or get them drunk). The game requires quick, lateral thinking and the ability to describe what a player sees on a card, really fast.

Each round lasts 30 seconds and the topics include:

People (VCs/CEOs and other tech business leaders)
Technology (Software, Hardware, Mobile, etc)
Media (TV, Newspapers, Blogs, etc)
Companies (Start-ups, Unicorns, Multi-Nationals)
Tech Miscellany (Cool random tech stuff)


The object of the game is to move round the board and reach the end before the other team.

Pi bridges the physical and digital worlds and can be played as a board game or app or a mix of both and IMPORTANTLY it’s really easy to learn to play.

name: Pölkkypäät
description: There are always nine heads on the board. Each turn one pf the players switches the places of two heads while other players are not looking. Afterwards the others try to memorize which two heads have changed places.

name: Star Wars: Episode I – Jar Jar Binks 3-D Adventure Game
description:
Jar Jar Binks and his sidekick - you - are racing home to Otoh Gunga in a 3-D adventure filled with action, danger, and excitement.
Keep an eye on the bumbling Binks every step of the way, for fearsome foes and moving traps lurk everywhere. Race through the swamp and avoid the droid. Wander over the plains and don't let the Kaadu buck you off. Travel underwater and don't let the sea creature swallow you.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Spas-mager
description: Roll the dice and move on a board, but on the way to the finish line you will have to draw "acting card" that tells you what to do in order to proceed.

name: Cricket Dice
description:
The player takes the five coloured dice (red, black, blue, green, yellow).
The red dice is your bowling dice. "No Ball" scores one run for the batting team. "Wide" means bowl again. "Bowled" signifies next man in, "Bowling on Wicket" means moving onto the batting dice (black).
The black dice is the batting dice. "Defensive Stroke" means bowl again. "Bat and Run" moves you to the blue dice for run scoring. "Appeal" moves you to the green dice.
The blue dice has the sides "1 Run", "2 Runs", "4 Runs" and "6 Runs".
The green dice is the appeal dice. The batsman can be either "Out LBW" or "Missed Stumping" (go back to bowling dice) or "Not Out LBW" (again back to bowling dice), "Caught At Long Leg", "Stumped" or "Not Run Out" (again back to the red dice".
The final dice, colored yellow, ascertains the state of play and conditions and this dice is thrown every ten overs to decide whether the game should be continued or not. This dice has "Rain Stops Play", "Tea Break", "Bad Light", "Lunch break" or "End Of Play".

House rules are easily formulated.

name: Treason in the Tower
description:
Treason in the Tower is a game of strategy and deceit. Outwit your opponents and be the first to break into the TOWER OF LONDON and steal the crown.

How to Play:
First you must get a key to get in the front gate. Then you must get a combination of equipment that allows you to steal the Crown Jewels, either by going to locations on the board, or from the Questions & Chance cards. Once you have the jewels, you must escape to the outer walls through designated passageways, and then finally scale the wall at certain spots to get to reach one of the three safe areas on the board, all while evading other players who are trying to duel with you to steal your equipment, weapons, or even the jewels.

Contents:
Game board
Weapons & Equipment cards
Questions & Chance cards
Gate Key cards
Tower cards
6 exclusive pewter playing tokens
1 gold plated CROWN
1 velvet pouch
1 d6
Instructions
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Clobber!
description:
Each player starts with three pawns on his home space. To move a pawn out to the home space's exit space, a 1 or 6 must be rolled. On each die throw, a single pawn is moved. Upon landing on a starred space, you roll again; on a 1 or 6, you move to the central circle from whence you may exit to any starred space on a later turn. You clobber enemy pawns by landing on them --they're sent back to their home space.

The winner is the first player to place his pawns on their arrival spaces (by exact count).

(The board consists of a three-lobed track; it touches the central star circle at its three innermost points. The player home/start spaces are arrayed around the outside of the track, whilst the ending circles are inside the track (but each uses an outer circle's exit space as its entry space). The inner circles are all made up of three different-coloured arrival spaces; the distribution is such that each player must reach the last three circles of a full circuit to win.

A member of the Parcheesi family of board games.

name: Pooh Honey Pot Hunt Game
description: A path with spaces of assorted colors is assembled by color matching the edges of large cards. The players then take turns moving a single pooh figure with a color-coded spinner. If Pooh is on a space with a printed honey pot, the player takes a cardboard honey pot counter. When Pooh reaches the end of the path, the player with the most counters is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Paparazzi
description: This game is a little bit like Scotland Yard. But now you are looking for stars you can make pictures from. One of the players is the one who defines the spot with the stars. The other players have to find out where this spot is.

name: Kaos
description: Kaos is in old Swedish children’s game. In the game you have to drive your car from a start tile to the end tile. You do this by drawing and placing tiles with roads and traffic sign on them. You have to follow the road on the tile and you also have to abide by the traffic signs on the tile so you can block other players with a one way road and so on. You can use other player’s roads when driving so you’ll have to be careful not to make it too easy for the other players when building your own road. All players start with two joker tiles that can be placed on top of other tiles or as a normal tile. These tiles have no traffic signs on them and have exits on all four sides so they are very useful.

name: Margie: The Game of Whoopee!
description:
Margie - "As seen on ABC TV!"

Set in the Roaring Twenties, Margie lives with her parents and her aunt Phoebe. Her best friend, Maybelle Jackson, is a flapper, and Heywood and Johnny are the two boys fighting for her affection. To add to the period flavor of the show, there were mixed-in movie slides from silent movies that told audience members "Please Pay Attention," "The Plot Thickens," etc. at critical points in the show.

Players keep traveling around the board from Madison High to Crawford's Ice Cream Parlor and back again. They obtain "Slogan" cards and "Word" cards. The "Slogans" (familiar expressions of the 1920's) are worth points for score when a player collects the right words to complete the "slogan". A player may also try to get all the letters to spell out or "make" the "Whoopee" card.

The object of the game is to score 10 or more points by completing "Slogans" or to "Make Whoopee."
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: The Mask 3-D Board Game
description:
This track game is based on the Jim Carrey film "The Mask". From the rulebook:

"Stanley Ipkiss just tried on an eerie old mask he found in the river--and started to spin 'round like a whirlwind until he was transformed into ... The Mask! During all the commotion, Stanley's Pajamas, Clock, and faithful dog Milo whirled right out the window, and they've landed all around the city. Plus, The Mask did something bad: he went out and robbed a bank! Stanley better hurry up and collect his stuff--and get that money back to the bank!"

On your turn, you roll the die and move the number of spaces indicated. If you land on a space with a chip, you turn it over, and if its an item of your color you keep it. If you land on The Mask space, you place the mask piece over your playing piece (like a hood) and become The Mask. This gives you special powers including: the ability to ignore the die and move to the space you want, and ability to land on opponent's starting space and return a color chip back to the track. As soon as another player lands on the mask space, you have to remove the mask from your mover and give it to your opponent. The first player to collect and return all 4 missing items of his or her color wins.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Playoff Football
description: Using four dice (kick die, run die, pass die, and return die) players attempt to score points by the normal rules of football. A peg in the small wood board indicates the ball position in 10 yard increments. A small plastic container holds the rules, wood board, 4 dice, and 1 peg.

name: Dear World
description: The first player to complete a Secret Mission on Earth and return to the space station wins the game. To complete the Secret Mission, players use the Knowledge, Co-Operation, and Money points to solve a problem in each of three countries. Players make up their own solutions, then orbit the Earth to collect the points they need. They then travel to these countries to deliver their solutions.

name: Rayatso
description: A two-player card game where the idea is to build chains from the same colored cards. The winner is the player who is able to build a continuous chain from the edge of the playing field to the other edge.

name: Who Did It...?
description:
Sharpen your pencils and prepare to test your wits. In a roller coaster ride aboard the Oriental Express a crime has been committed which only you can solve! Play the role of a famous detective - you could be Sheerluck Homes or Ivan Inkling! It's a hectic race from carriage to carriage as you seek clues and try to fit the missing pieces of the puzzle together.
Instant family fun, this captivating board game will thrill and entertain you as you rush to reveal who it was that dun the dastardly deed!

Contents : 5 foot lay out of a steam train game board, counters, pencils, mystery card deck, score pad, die, rules

name: Chuck E Cheese's Skytubes
