description: Play the game based on the Skytubes at Chuck E. Cheese. Spin the spinner and move your piece toward the treasure chest at the finish line The first player to reach the treasure chest wins. Teaches counting and encourages taking turns. For ages 3 years and up

name: Trollskatten
description: Trollskatten (English, The Troll Treasure) is a Swedish children's game. The object of the game is to find the key to the treasure chest containing the troll's gold, while avoiding the evil troll and his traps. The first player to reach the gold wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pinocchio
description:
Game consists of 45 cards, divided into 5 sets of 9, each set depicting various scenes from the movie film of the time and additional one of the letters of the characters name (Pinocchio).

Object of the game is to get rid of the cards in hand as fast as possible.
To reach this goal cards have to be laid out in a certain pattern, letter cards "N" acting as special jokers.

First player to get rid of his cards scores according to the cards left in the other players hands.

Game ends after several rounds when a player has scored 250 or more points.

Thick cardboard cards with linen finish and top printing quality add to the fun to play this fast paced, light card game.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Operazione Trionfo
description:
The game consists in a series of practical tests and theory of light music, Italian and foreigner whose overcoming, or not it, determines a classification among the players.

Unforeseen event and strokes of luck intervene for modifying and to upset the classification, and to determine the exclusions of the occupying competitors the last positions in classification.

The purpose of the game is not to be excluded by the classification of "Operazione Trionfo": the winner will be the only competitor remained in game.

Based on the Italian's TV show of the same name.

name: Bob the Builder: Stapel-Türmchen
description:
Help Bob and his friends to build a tower! How can you do it? Easy: With the coloured die and a little luck! Because of it's simple set of rules, the game is suitable for kids from 3 years up and is even fun playing it alone!

The goal of the game is to move Bob onward from field to field and to build the highest tower.

When it is your turn, you roll the coloured die and when you roll the colour of the next field, or you roll the Bob face, you move Bob to the next field and get one building block for your tower. The game ends, when all tower pieces are used up.

Very simple die rolling game for young kids.

name: Fact or Crap Dare
description:
Fast-paced trivia where you answer if the statement is 'fact' or 'crap. Be the first to answer correctly and you earn bonus chips. If you answer incorrectly you must then open your chip to reveal either a truth or dare you must then perform.

Re-implements

Fact or Crap

name: De Gorgels: het ondergrondse avontuur
description:
An adventurous board game, based on the children's books 'De Gorgels', by Dutch author Jochem Myjer.

Save your sick friend in an underground cavern system by preventing the dangerous 'Grootbekbrutelaar' (or Brutelaar) from reaching him.

During a turn, a player rolls a die to determine if he can take a step on the game board, or if the Brutelaar will advance towards the sick friend.
The Brutelaar will come across yellow spots on his track, which allows the player to move stones out of the way. You can place them in front of other players to limit their/block their movements.

If you reach your sick friend first you will win, but if the Brutelaar does, everybody loses!

This game can be played solo. There are 5 normal player tokens. With a six-player count, one person can take on the role of the evil Brutelaar.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Frozen II: Rumbling Rock
description:
Dodge falling boulders and escape the Earth Giant's anger with this Spin Master Frozen II Rumbling Rock board game. The variety of risks and opportunities add some suspense to the game play. This Spin Master Frozen II Rumbling Rock board game comes with a scenic 3-D insert, so you can do a realistic reenactment of scenes from the Frozen II movie.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Betcha Can't!
description:
Could ya? Would ya?

Betcha Can't!

The Game of One-Upping

Can you name more flavors of ice cream than your friends? How about the most dance moves? Put your knowledge to the test with Betcha Can't! In this game of bets and brags, players bet on how many things they THINK they know. From dog breeds to smoothie flavors, place bets on how many you can name in the given amount of time. But beware - if you have the highest bet, you may be told "Betch Can't!" Prove yourself and name the number you bet to win the card. Fail the challenge, and you'll end up in Time Out - but you can try to break out by one-upping the winner of a round! The first player to collect five cards wins and is named the Better Bettor!

—description from the publisher

name: Komockarspelet
description:
Children's games where it is important to have luck and a good memory. Help the farmer clean Rosa's paddock. The one who fills his wheelbarrow with the most cow dung wins! Rosa loves food and it is important to remember where your favorite food is. Without food - no cow dung in the wheelbarrow.

—user summary
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Barnyard Stampede
description:
From the publisher:
"Barnyard Stampede is a fast and furious racing card game where farm animals compete to see who can race to the barn first. Set the barn box in the center of the table. Each player chooses an animal and flips a card face up on the start line. The rest of the cards are then dealt out to each player face down. Ready, Set, MOOO-VE IT! Players flip cards over from their hand one at a time searching for a card that matches their animal. If a match is made, you play the card in front of the start line – taking a step towards the barn. The first to tag the barn wins the race! Excellent game for young children!"
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Racing

name: Skippy Game
description:
Be the first player to race through Waratah National Park from the Old Bush Road to Ranger Headquarters.

Along the way, players have chances to Ask Skippy or Ask Sonny how much they'll move using the merry-go-round selector.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, World Games Company

name: Tamagotchi: The Game
description:
From the back of the box:

Everybody wants a TAMAGOTCHI toy, but not everyone has the devotion to raise one properly. Here's a perfect solution: The TAMAGOTCHI Game. Play this game with your friends, (with or without the TAMAGOTCHI toy.) Just keep your pet well-fed, happy, healthy, clean, well-trained and amused...before you know it you'll have a full-grown, fully nurtured pet!

Everything you need is here: 4 TAMAGOTCHI moving pieces, 72 nurturing cards, 4 growth meter and an exciting game board. The TAMAGOTCHI Game is a terrific way to enjoy some real interactive quality time with family, friends, and of course, your favorite pet!

name: Juego de la Batalla de Vitoria: Gasteizko Batailaren Multzoa
description:
This is a very rare and strange wargame, if we call it so. It was published in order to sell it at the provincial Armory Museum and printed by the diputación (local government). Published in three languages, Spanish, Basque and English, it is a simple and bad wargame, but includes the full order of battle that can be used in order to recreate the last big battle of the Peninsular War.

The counters are made in cardboard with printed cut-yourself Napoleonic toy soldiers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Square Grid

name: Bedstemor med slaw i
description: A childrens card game with 40 cards in four different colours numbered from one to ten. The players simultaneously flip their top card. Whenever a pair of the same number is flipped you knock on the table. Whoever does this first wins the cards.

name: Bottoms Up
description:
The object of BOTTOMS UP is to be the first player to accumulate 30 credits, thereby completing one year of college. This game was produced by COLT 45 MALT LIQUOR and was designed for adults. A few of the ground rules listed in the game.
A. A drink of Colt 45 means you BOTTOMS UP one glass of Colt 45. With this in mind it might be best to start with 4 or 6 ounce glasses.
B. Of course if you are not of legal drinking age then it means a glass of milk, prune juice or similar beverage,
C. The minimum length of time for a kiss should be agreed upon, at least 10 seconds for a start.

Some of the action cards that you were required to do:
Smoke two cigarettes simultaneously
Obey any wish or request of the player on your right
Put an article of your clothes on backwards
Do a Jack Benny imitation for 30 seconds
Explain to other players why you think that sex before marriage is a necessity.

Well I guess you get the picture.

Perhaps a high school or college student with more than a few brews in you might find this entertaining.

name: Negotiator
description:
Negotiator is a stock market game in which players has four tokens to move around the board to buy and sell stocks, and participate in auctions. Players are encouraged to negotiate with other players and form partnerships.

Shares basically have fixed buying and selling prices, although they can be changed somewhat through event cards ('Bulletin' and 'Bonus'). Shares in a company can only be sold when a player or partnership of players sell all the stocks.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Booktastic!
description:
Booktastic! presents itself as "The first board game for book lovers, their friends, and families!".

Players walk around a small town by rolling a die. When stopping by a bookstore, players can buy (and in some places, sell) books to try improve their collection or earn money.

Each round a player also gets a question to answer. There are three levels of questions to choose from: Casual reader, avid reader, and collector. The more difficult level is answered, the more money the answer is worth.

At the start, each player gets a card with four "noteworthy books" from one year. Their task is to wander around the different bookstores trying to find these books. Meanwhile, money can be made by buying and selling other books. However, getting the right books does not necessarily win the game, but it does give a bonus. At the end, the player with the most money and most valuable book collection wins.

Contents:
- Game board
- Rules
- Six-sided die
- 10 "Noteworthy book" cards
- 40 book cards
- 300 question cards (each with three questions)
- 4 pawns
- A stack of money

name: Bible Brainstorm
description:
Combining five of your favorite games into one, Bible Brainstorm is never boring and always outrageous! Players move around the board using at least one of their God-given talents to win the game.

Categories include music, word puzzles, drawing, trivia and charades. The ultimate in level playing fields, so anyone can win!

name: Doctor Who Micro-Universe
description:
A very simple collectible miniatures game that plays like Top Trumps with a die. Each figure has a number of characteristics with a numerical value. Choose a characteristic, roll the spinner (a die replacement shaped like the TARDIS console) and add the result to the characteristic's value. Your opponent rolls and adds the same characteristic from his figure and the highest wins that combat. No movement rules included despite this being a miniatures game.

Sold in semi random starters of 7 figures and boosters of 3 figures. 26 in the main set and 6 special packs that contain 1 ship (not to scale with the rest of the figures) and one special figure not available in the starters or boosters.
categories: Collectible Components, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: The Worst Case Scenario Survival Game: The Office
description: Based on the best-selling book series, The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game: The Office challenges players to use their survival instincts in the office to conquer the boardroom. In The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game: The Office, each On the Job question has three possible answers. Get it right, you move ahead. Get it wrong and you move back - one chair farther from your goal of Chief Executive Officer.You will need to multi-task in this corporate game of survival of the fittest. Players also need strong listening skills to win Office Bingo and to out-politic others by updating their corporate clipboard. The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game: The Office will prepare you for your next job, keep your current position, or just have a great time at the next big party!For 2 or more players, ages 14 and up.Contents: 1 game board, 4 playing pieces, 150 Corporate Communications Cards, 150 On the Job Cards, 4 wipe-off clipboards, 4 dry erase markers, 6 Office Bingo Cards, Bingo Chips, 1 die and instructions.

name: Harry Potter: Quidditch Tryouts
description: Quidditch Tryouts! Match colours and slam your Quaffle cards on the Goalpost cards. You’ll need to think fast and score faster to win! The player with the highest score when all Goalpost cards run out becomes the new Gryffindor player. Double the fun: catch the snitch first when he comes by and score extra points for your team.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Sports

name: Repair the Mill
description:
Pre-school children's game, from the Rupert Fun book.

Rules:
To play the game, make a spinning wheel with six sides, as shown in the diagram. Make a hole in the centre of the wheel and push a stump of pencil through it.

The two players are allowed to choose three squares each. One player might choose cement, nails and bricks, another might choose screws, glass and wood.

Take turns to spin the wheel, which is shaped in such a way that one of its names will lie on the table when it stops. If this name is one of the squares that the player has chosen, then he scores a point. Otherwise he does not score

First to reach a pre-agreed total number of points, wins.

name: Spongebob Squarepants: Deep Sea Duel
description:
Spongebob Squarepants makes his inevitable, though short-lived, entry into the world of collectible card games. Deep Sea Duel is the name of the entry-level starter deck for the game and at least one expansion was released to expand the game. In the game, players attempt to talk customers in different locations into trying a nice Krusty Krab Krabby Patty. You win the game either by "katching" 4 customers each from different locations, 4 customers from the same location, or a mixture of both.

Play begins by drawing a hand of 5 cards, taking a card from the separate Location deck, and placing it in one of 4 slots in the middle. The "potential katcher" (active player) may then play a "Katcher" from their hand under a location to attempt to katch it. (They may play up to 2 Katchers under two separate locations, but both are played at the same time.) The opposing player can attempt to stop the katch by playing a strategy card from their hand, or playing a Katcher of their own from their hand. Players go back and forth in this "Showdown" until one does not want to, or cannot, respond.

The last Katcher played by each player is compared, and the one with the highest "Patty Pouch" wins. If the potential katcher won, they take the Location card. If the opposing player wins, they have stopped the katch and the Location card remains on the board. Once a turn is over, both players may discard up to 2 cards if they wish, and then both draw until they have 5 cards in hand each.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Himalaya Expedition
description: You go hiking in the Himalayas. It is a race by dice. You roll up to 3 dice. How many you roll depends on your actual height. You can take a break that gives you more power- you can move the double on your next turn. There is a calendar with weather information. The weather changes every day and that has influence on your traveling. The weather changes each round.

name: Are You... Over The Hill
description:
OVER THE HILL is a Poker variant with a trivia element thrown in.

The game contains a pack of playing cards with 12 cards of each value from 1 to 6. The first player is dealt a hand of 5 cards which he looks at before declaring the value of his hand (hands are valued in the same way as for Poker Dice - Four of a kind beats a Full House, beats a Straight etc). The player must declare at least a pair. This declaration can be true or false.

Following the declaration all the other players get the opportunity, in turn, to challenge the declaration. If no-one challenges then the hand is passed to the player on the left. This player may replace up to three cards by drawing from the deck, and then declares the value of his hand. This new declaration must be higher in value than the previous declaration. Play continues like this until there is a challenge.

When challenged the player holding the cards must expose his hand for all to see:
- If the player holding the cards was telling the truth then the player that challenged must answer a question from the "Over the Hill" deck of trivia cards.
- If the player holding the cards lied then he must attempt to answer an "Over the Hill" question.

The question cards come in six categories (Body, Fashion & Beauty, Health, Money, People and Leisure)- the subject being selected through the roll of a die.

Successful answering of the question results in no penalties being incurred, but if the question is not answered correctly then the card is retained by the person who answered incorrectly as a penalty.

The aim of the game is to avoid going "Over the Hill" - you are considered to be Over the Hill when you have collected four different question cards (i.e. from four different subjects) as a result of answering questions incorrectly.
publishers: BV Leisure Ltd, Olga International, The Game Works, Inc.

name: Symbol Simon
description:
From the box:
"This fast-thinking game challenges players to decipher everyday words and phrases using clues from creative SYMBOL SIMON(TM) picture puzzles. It's a fun challenging game for two or more players or for teams!"

name: Thomas Tic Tac Toe Game
description:
From the publisher:

Thomas, Percy, Mavis and James are racing to see who can make three in a row! Rules for different skill-levels of play.

Contents: Game board, 20 engine tiles, instruction sheet for different skill-levels of play
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Trains

name: A Voyage Through the Clouds
description:
A roll-and-move race game portraying an airship journey across seven countries. The players face 13 different hazards along the way, such as:

"Ship caught in a storm and a man gets pitched out of the gondola. The balloon sinks and rapidly and can only save itself by rapid flight. The player who throws six can play on, otherwise he must miss three turns."

[The ghoulish picture for this particular space shows the figure falling from the airship!]

There is also a space depicting an airship on fire. If you are unlucky enough to land on it (a mere 5 spaces from victory) you are out of the game.
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Transportation, Travel

name: Camp Runamuck
description: Game includes 4 colored movers, a spinner, 3 step rulers (Baby Step, Grown Up Step, and Giant Step. The object of the game is to find and round up all 7 of the campers of your color group. You use the step rulers to try and land on the spaces occupied by your campers, by exact count. When you do you have capture that particular camper. Get all 7 and win the game.

name: Black Pete
description:
This is a variant of Old Maid (Schwarzer Peter in German), thematically set in the Black Stories family.

Additionally, it also contains 15 Black Stories.

From the webshop of the publisher:

Der "Schwarze Peter" kann einpacken! Hier kommt sein nach Blut dürstender Nachfolger "black Pete": Der Kartenspiel-Klassiker "Schwarzer Peter" in der
rabenschwarzen black stories-Variante. Inklusive 15 original black stories für rabenschwarzen Rätsel-Spaß!
für Jugendliche und Erwachsene, ab 12 Jahren
33 Karten in einer Stülpschachtel
9,9 cm x 13,1 cm
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Captive Princess
description:
The game of Captive Princess includes 6 wooden round discs with images of Knights applied to the face. The background color of each piece matches one side of the accompanying colored cube.
Captive Princess is a race game to the center of the board.
The roll of the colored cube determines the movement of players onto the matching colored squares of the board.
The objective for Captive Princess is to be the first ‘Knight’ to reach and rescue the Princess, the player who manages this is the winner.

name: Captain Marvel's Own Game SHAZAM!
description:
Captain Marvel's Own Game, SHAZAM! (1946)

Here's a good, clean, wholesome game for the whole family. Wonderful for entertaining your guests and friends. It's the progressive building type of game, featuring CAPTAIN MARVEL and BILLY BATSON, in which each player turns the spinner to determine the extent of his progress. First player to complete the building subject repeats the magic word "SHAZAM" to declare himself the winner. Exciting! Entertaining!

-

Captain Marvel memorabilia is extremely rare and highly sought by golden age comic fans, but other than collectors, people don't know this game exits.

There have been questions pertaining to the publication date. Out of curiosity, we paged through all the Captain Marvel Adventures comic books from 1944 to 1946. We spotted the first ad for this game in issue 56. March 15, 1946.

name: Banemaster
description:
Collectible card game designed by Alexander Duncan, with roleplaying elements sold in starters and boosters. Artwork by Jamie Grant.

In 'Banemaster one of the players draws from the green deck and plays the evil Banemaster, the other players draw from the red deck and are sworn to fight the evil in the Banemaster's Castle.

During play, each player draws 8 cards from their respective decks: The Banemaster sets the location for his round and describes the setting. The other players go questing to defeat the Banemaster and his horde of monsters, while also trying to evade traps, collect treasure and score points. At the end of the round the Banemaster role rotates to the next player, and the game continues.

name: Bajsspelet: Ett skitroligt spel
description:
Swedish, roughly translates into "The Poop Game - a game funny as shit"

Children's game that is meant to give a positive relationship to something completely natural according to the publisher.

Roll and move. Each player plays a "turd" on its way to the toilet. If you land on a yellow box you get to make a "pee sound", if you land on brown you get to do a "fart sound". Red boxes forces you to take one step back. The first player to reach the toilet wins.

name: Die Ketchup-Vampire
description:
Simple children's board game in which the so called Die Ketchup Vampiere struggle against the evil "Blutwurst Vampiere" to regain the lost book from the woods in the centre of the board.

Every player draws a card which either shows a garlic or a tomato. The player has to guess what of these two it will be. If he guessed right he may move his vampire according to the number printed on the card. If he guessed wrong he must move one of the two Blutwurst-Vampiere.

Both parties race towards the forest in the center of the board, where the lost book is hidden.

name: Knock Knock Game
description:
From the rulebook:

You and your opponents each move two pawns around the gameboard along the path of colored doors. When you land on a colored door assigned to an opponent, challenge that player to answer a Knock Knock joke. If the challenged player knows the answer to the Knock Knock joke, you are penalized ...your turn is over and your pawn does not advance; if the challenged player does not know the answer to the Knock Knock joke, he or she is penalized and must move a pawn backward along the path and you win another spin. As you can see, if you can answer a Knock Knock joke by knowing "Who's There", you have a good chance of staying in the lead. Be the first player to bring both your pawns home and you'll win the game.

name: Bernard & Bianca
description: Based on the Disney cartoon of the same name. In this game you race around a track and encounter characters from the movie.

name: Curbstone
description:
In Curbstone, players first try to get the best starting position. After that, the real race starts. The winner will be the first player to complete three full laps of the circuit.

The race cars move by answering Formula-1 trivia, these are questions about drivers, circuits, etc, up to season 2000 in Formula-1. The car's speed depends on the chosen gear and the racing line. Use tactics, good cornering and slipstreaming to be victorious.

name: Coronation Scot
description:
A railway game celebrating the famous London to Glasgow train. The game has four metal playing pieces modeled on the train, and a dice, the aim is to be the first to complete the journey from Euston to Glasgow.

A straight forward dice race game with bonuses and penalties on the route.

The game is from the 1930's - early 1940's from Harlesden Games England.

A retro-looking reprint with somewhat different components (all-wood locomotives, dice cup, dice) was published by Retro Range in 2009.
publishers: Harlesden Games, Retro Range Toys and Games

name: Lapsentekopeli: Tror du på storken
description:
"The Child Making Game: Do you believe in the stork?"

From the back of the box:

The Child Making Game, intended for the 7th to 9th graders(* of the elementary school, is a fun teaching tool for the health and reproductive biology classes. The game has also been used a lot in youth work.

The game can lessen prejudices about pregnancy and add positive knowledge about pregnancy, childbirth and relationships. The effects of smoking, alcohol and unhealthy habits to the foetus and the expecting mother are informed about precisely and in a matter-of-fact manner.

The Child Making Game has been in use in schools for more than a decade, and has gained plenty of positive feedback from both teachers and pupils.

---


) 13-16 year olds.

name: Multiplication Bingo
description: Multiplication Bingo is an educational children's version of Bingo, designed to teach children multiplication, while retaining the flavor of Bingo.

name: Catch Me If You Can
description: Each player selects a set of 1 Ghost and 3 Runners of a color and places them at the GO position. Players take turns to pop the dice and move their ghost and runners. Only the Ghost may send Runners back to Go. The first player to get all 3 Runners to the destination position is the winner.

name: Szare Szeregi
description:
Szare Szeregi (Grey Ranks) is a card game about the Warsaw Uprising of 1944.

The board depicts 12 regions of Warsaw and players launch multiple attack on the different regions with cards from hand that represent various unit that took part in the conflict. The attacker can field multiple units from hand while the defender can call for support from neighbouring provinces, and the high value wins. When both players' decks run out the winner is the player with more valuable units in the regions he controls.

name: MiYu Magic Card Game
description:
A card game based on the popular game MiYu.

Players collect elements of a magic circles by discarding sets of 3 cards. A set is made of 1 (out of 4) element, a Zodiac sign associated to that element and the corresponding stone.

The game includes joker cards that, when rubbed by a player, reveal a message as by magic!

name: Ran Sat.1 Fussball
description:
Card game tied in to a German TV channel most associated with showing televised football matches.

52 cards with various football terms on them (along with stylish artwork). Each player gets a hand of ten cards (if up to 5 play. The player to the left of the dealer must play an Anstoß (Kick-Off) card if he has one. If not, next to the left gets the chance. Eventually someone will have one to play. The next player in clockwise order now plays any other card in his hand but he must give a logical answer to the action on the card. Say 'Header' (in German 'Kopfball')for instance, then a logical answer might be Leap, Jump, Score and so on. If everyone is satisfied that the answer given is correct, the next player plays a card, and so on. The first player to play all their cards, wins
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Twilight: the Movie Card Game
description:
Theme:
Relive the Romance. Enter the world of "Twilight". Discover how much you know about "Twilight" and how much you know about your friends.
Game-play:
On your turn roll 1D6, then the player to your left draws a Twilight card and reads you one of the challenges.
- If the roll is an even number then read the white
- If the roll is odd then read the red
If the player is successful in answering the question then they take the card.
Goal:
First player to collect 8 cards wins.

name: Jactus
description:
This is a commercial game inspired by the dice games played by the ancient Romans.

From the box:

Six sided dice, known as tesserae, were thrown with the highest throw being known as the Jactus Venerus (the Venus Throw). The lowest throw was called the Jactus Canicula (the little dog). In JACTVS, players throw dice in an attempt to be the first to win an image of Venus, the goddess of love; an image of the little dog and a Roman coin.

Contents:

4 replica Roman coins
3 images of Venus
9 images of a dog
5 dice marked I, II, III, IV, V and VI


by PAST TIMES, Oxford, England
MADE IN ENGLAND
Devised and created by Oxford Games Ltd.

The back of the rules contain historical information about Roman coins as well as the emperors Hadrian, Antoninus Pius, Septimius Severus and Carausius.
publishers: (Public Domain), Historical Collections Group plc, Oxford Games, Ltd.

name: Mind's I
description:
From International Playthings:

Questions about words, numbers, pictures, music, movement and memory will challenge players as they move along the game board. Fast Track cards allow for hints when the questions get tough, so players don't get frustrated as they play.

Re-implemented by:

Mind's I: Junior Edition

name: Batalha Territorial
description:
From the box (in portuguese):
"Você terá apoio do seu exército para enfrentar os adversários nesta disputa. Vence quem for o melhor.
Uma grande parte do planeta Terra esteve imersa por milhares de anos. Este novo mundo emergiu e se tornou alvo de muitas nações que irão batalhar ardorosamente para conquistá-lo"

In English:
"A big part of Earth planet was emmersed for thousand years. This new continent has emerged and became target of too many nations, that will fight to conquest it".

In "Batalha Territorial", you command a civilization that must conquest different types of territory (water, ore, earth and forest), with pawn placement (soldiers).
Lucky factor is high, due to dice and card draw. The cards are the essence of game. For the player, the only decision made is where to put the pawns (soldiers), and depends on the card taken.
The dice rolling only happens in the end of each round (the game has only 2 rounds). The result is summed up to the player's total points.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Mestarietsivä Basil Hiiri
description:
Mestarietsivä Basil Hiiri (Fin.) / Mästerdetektiven Basil Mus (Swe.) (English: "The Master-Detective Basil Mouse") is a board game based on the Walt Disney movie Basil the Great Mouse Detective. Players follow the footsteps of the great mouse detective through the streets of London as he chases Professor Ratigan and his gang.

In the game players use numbered cards to travel from one corner of the board to another via roads and rotating crossroads. Crossroads can be used to hinder other players. The goal of the game is to get into Big Ben (Clock Tower / now: Elizabeth Tower) when the clock hits twelve o'clock.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My First Lotto
description:
Four different games, two of which are matching games, develop vocabulary, visual, problem-solving and memory skills.

Sturdy tiles are matched to boards that have photographs on one side and drawings on the other. Solitary or group play.

name: PuzzleWar
description:
Each player has 112 jigsaw puzzle pieces (identically shaped, but with unique pattens on them). The pieces are played on the board to score points. There are also special action cards (to exchange pieces, etc).

Rules provided in English, German, and Danish.

The game board measures about 50cm X 50cm on table and about 25cm X 25 folded up. It has 15 X 15 fields giving a total of 225 fields.

Official game webpage:
http://moxibox.eu/index.php?pid=1&;lang=2&game=7

name: Rapelli
description: Flexible caterpillars with different colored accents hide in the natural bamboo cylinder and are enticed out during the game as the 2-6 players take turns with two different dice -- one for color and one for direction. Can't Stop with worms?

name: You're Bugging Me!
description:
From the Press Release:

In this fun color recognition game, players spin the spinner in the hopes of shooing their color coordinated critters to another player's sleeve or back to their home in the "garden". The first player to send all of his or her bugs flying is the winner.

An educational game that helps early learners follow directions, including the difference between left and right and teaches color matching.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Soccer Dice Game
description:
Game includes four oversized white dice (offensive) and one black die (defensive) in a plastic tube with small instruction booklet. In place of the one pip on each die is a Soccer ball.

Players get three dice rolls per half. The player on offense is attempting to get a sequence of 2,3,4 to pass ball upfield and take a shot on goal. A shot on goal of one automatically succeeds; otherwise the opponent gets to make a save attempt with the black die.

name: Monopoly: Hameln (Hamelin)
description:
The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Hameln, in Lower Saxony/Germany.
remarks:
well known by The Pied Piper of Hamelin
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kinderen voor kinderen Muziekspel
description:
Description on the box:

A game of music for kids! Packed with action!

You won't be able to stay seated on your chair!

Do you like music and can you sing along all Kinderen voor Kinderen songs? Then this is your chance: Earn five stars, win the game an upload your picture to kinderenvoorkinderen.nl! The square you land on, determines your question or assignment. If you answer correctly, you will earn the associated star! The player who has earned all five of the stars is the winner of the game!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Zock
description:
from the translation

Object of the game:
Move your own figures forward and line them up with the profit turntable to win money from the bank and at the same time move your opponent’s pawns back to their exit spaces to take their money away.

The richest player after a predetermined time limit wins.

name: Go! Doggy Go!
description: Go, Doggy, Go is a simple race game where your dog can get longer and shorter as the game progresses. A dog wins the race when their hind legs reach the goal; so you need more steps if your dog is longer.

name: Clifford the Big Red Dog Happy Birthday Game
description: A roll-and-move game based on the idea of getting to Clifford's birthday party with the highest value bones. Bones are found by collecting gifts (found by landing on certain spaces), each of which has a different number. Once everyone arrives at the party, count the number of bones on each person's gifts to see who has the most. So ultimately the game is meant to teach children the ideas of more and less.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Number

name: Autolino
description: The goblins are going on vacation. Can you help them collect everything they need for the trip? Players take turns using a spinner to move their goblin around the board, but they must stop at certain points to wait for other players to arrive and help them acquire the necessary provisions. First goblin to the car wins.

name: The Wizard of Oz Game
description:
In this spin-and-move children's game based on The Wizard of Oz movie by MGM, players race for Home. The key to winning, however, is to arrive Home with a Magic Card in hand. The board depicts colorful characters and places in Oz "from the MGM movie, an annual television favorite" to recreate Dorothy's magical trip through Oz.

Setup: give each player a pawn and set the 4 Magic Cards on Home.

Play is simple. Youngest player goes first. On his or her turn, the player spins the spinner. If the spinner points to a number, he or she moves her pawn that many spaces along the track:


If the space his or her pawn lands on is unoccupied and has instructions for continuing the move such as to go ahead or move back a certain number of spaces, follow those instructions immediately.
If the space his or her pawn lands on is unoccupied and has an M on it, the player receives a Magic card if he or she doesn't already have one, or returns his or her magic to the pile at Home if she does.
If the space he or she lands on is already occupied (except Home - only Home may be occupied by more than one pawn), he or she must move her pawn back until she reaches an unoccupied space. When a player has to move back like this, any instructions on the space he or she moves back to are ignored.


If the spinner arrow points to Magic Card instead of a number, the player takes a Magic Card if he or she doesn't have one, or returns his or her Magic Card if he or she already has one.

Play continues until someone reaches Home with a Magic Card. If a player reaches Home, but does not have a Magic Card, he or she can stay there, taking his or her turn as usual until he or she spins a Magic Card or another player reaches Home with a Magic Card (or without and spins one first).
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Risky Dice
description: Risky Dice has simple rules: Roll the dice to score as many points as possible during a turn. As long as you score points on a roll, you can roll again, but as soon as a roll is worthless, your turn ends and you score nothing.

name: Kiezkönig
description:
Kiezkönig is a roll-and-move game for 3-6 players age 16 and up. The players attempt to dominate an area to become 'Kiezkönig' (King of the Red Light district). To do so, the players have to collect the 9 cards of a colour, which represent both legal and underworld business (the latter represented by power and capital) in that area.

The game board has two tracks, the inner, "legal business" one, and the outer, "underworld" one. There are also event spaces, where players draw event cards, and combat spaces, where players can challenge other players. Players can change tracks via taxi spaces.

name: Armour Quest: Quæstro
description:
A "Talisman-like" game, which target is to get all the six artifacts which are spread out "outdoors" (in the middle of the game board). Meanwhile becomes the characters better on fighting and defending themselves against monsters, guardians and opponents.
You play two different fractions and with more than two you play co-operative. According to the rules one player should be an "administrator" if you are 3 or 5 players! Probably it's best to play with 2 players.
The combat system is pretty complicated, with a lot of dice rolls.
There's an expansion (expert game) with some more monster quest cards, money tokens, but most important character dial-boards with all statistics about the characters, so you don't need to use paper and pen for this.

name: The Amazing Spider-Man Game
description:
Spider-man roams New York fighting Dr Octopus, Hobgoblin and Venom and must rescue Aunt May and Mary Jane. Roll dice, use action cards and so on. Rules done as a comic strip.

Not to be confused with The Amazing Spider Man Game with the Fantastic Four!.

name: War of Masters
description:
Simple Chess-style game played on a 9x9 board and using a single die. Each side has nine short cylinders, eight large cylinders and one "master" large cylinder.

The object of the game is to capture your opponents MASTER.(That is a wooden token). You do this by rolling the dice and move your counters the given numbers of squares according to the movement rules. Players take turns to roll the die and move one piece the number of squares shown, or a six may be used to move two pieces a total of six squares. The small counters move and capture in only one direction - straight ahead. Whenever a small counter reaches its opponent's back row, it is exchanged for a large one. The large counters, including the MASTER, move and capture in any direction.
publishers: Arxon, Invicta Games, Jensen, N.P.T. A/S: Oslo

name: Battlewagon Salvo
description:
Similar to Battleship, but with more complicated rules.

Each player deploys ships in secret on their copy of the mapsheet. Then they try to find all of the enemy ships and destroy them.

The basic rules allow for simple movement and firing. The advanced rules cover submerging of submarines, reload time, torpedoes, and depth charges.

Ship movement is always announced in terms of direction but not location.

Two different mapsheets are included. One for basic play and another for advanced.

name: World 7
description:
WORLD 7 the Help! Where's the Rest of the World?! game plays with the fun and ease of the old-fashioned rummy-type card games--but, there is much more than rummy in this fast "Trip of Cards" across the 7 continents of the world. Players race to be the first to connect all their cards in a continuous chain of connecting countries. But, WATCH OUT! There are many "kickers" along the way!
Can be played as singles or partners.
Parents' Choice Foundation Award Winning Game!
By the makers of USA Trip 50.

name: The Politicians Game
description:
Politics may be a dirty game, but just like a pig in a poke, it's a heck of a lot of fun when you're the one wiggling and jumping in that expensive and exclusive mud! Rub shoulders with the rich, famous and powerful people who shape the future of countries; you also get to take part in the great Political Debate. Dirty work, but somebody's got to do it!

The Politicians Game attempts to faithfully recreate the arena of politics, so your "political potential" can be put to the poll. Of course no experience in necessary, nor any knowledge of the topics you will be required to cover in this hilarious game of "sound bite cynicism".

name: Odysseus: Role Play for the Homeric Age, Legendry & Mythology
description: Players create their own characters and fight it out! Detailed rules for on ships and weapons are included. There is even a pop quiz called the "Rules Check" to make sure you have correctly understood everything. Should be of interest to anyone specializing in the Homeric period. Includes 32-page rules booklet, character reference sheet, 36 cards and 2 ship plans.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants Card Expansion #1: Frozen in Time
description:
First card-pack expansion for the "World of Heroes and Tyrants" board game. Consists of a new character (Froll, starts in Flint, IN 4 FT 8 ST 4 DX 5 HP 50 SB 11, advantage is to start the game with five slaves) and forty Encounter Cards (fifteen gray, fifteen yellow, and ten red).

This expansion's designer is uncredited but is presumably Bruce P. Dowrie, designer of the main game.

Expands:

Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Rumors: An Adult Conversation Game
description:
Rumors is an adult conversation game for three or more players. (though it can be played with two, via special rules) The object of the game is to spread light-hearted rumors that lead to explanations about the life experiences and beliefs of the players.

Players take turns spreading rumors about the other players. In response to each rumor, players must use knowledge, judgment, and intuition to guess whether there is any "truth" to the rumor. Points are scored based on the players' abilities to guess correctly--and their willingness to select HOT rumors and elaborate on their responses. The first player (or team) to score 40 points wins.

name: Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants: Hell
description:
An 11"x17" add-on board for Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants (WHAT). It adds 14 new areas, 4 new characters, plus new quests, encounter cards and more

Expands:

Worlds of Heroes & Tyrants

name: Maremba
description:
«A tactical game of skill and strategy»

The board is 10x10 (1 inch squares), with the inner 4x4 squares replaced by a 10x10 grid of smaller squares. The whole thing is in the middle of an octagon, with the edges used for storage of the 80 colored pegs.

Each player starts with ten pegs of a color. Each player places a peg in turn in the inner grid. You are eliminated if: a) you have two pegs (of your color) in the same row, column or diagonal; b) you take more than a minute to place a peg; or c) you seek help from a non-player! Once the inner grid is complete, play continues/repeats with the outer grid (you remove a peg from the inner grid and place it in the outer).

Optionally, the last player can try to finish placing all 80 pegs whilst respecting the exclusion rule.

Note that the outer grid is actually harder to solve because of the 4x4 hole in its middle.

name: Eskimemo
description:
Memory game with plastic igloos, cardboard Inuit, and a die.

The first player to hide all of their Inuit in the igloos wins.

Each player rolls a die and then puts as many igloos on his or her Inuit as the number on the die. Because the igloos are so small, you can only fit one Inuk in every igloo. And, of course, there are never enough igloos to go around. Luckily, you can "steal" already occupied igloos from the other players once your igloos are full.

If a player rolls a special symbol on the die, they can switch two igloos around -- just to confuse everybody.

name: Quick Cross
description:
Billed on the box simply "A Game of Strategy"

Players alternate placing disks onto a 4x4 grid, orienting the pieces either vertically or horizontally. On his turn a player may enter a piece in either direction, or the player may change the orientation of a piece already on the board.

You win by getting 4 disks in a row with the same orientation.

All the disks are identical, and the players draw from the pool of disks which starts at 16.

name: The Old Pacific
description:
Part of the American Adventure series.

1903 automobile race from San Francisco to New York.

Players move a space and then spin to see what happens to them.

Intended for Ages 8 and up.

name: Tightline
description:
This is a fishing game. The winner is the player who first casts for a pike and 4 other different fish from a total of 5 kinds. Previous to the actual casting you need to collect the appropriate cards featuring:
BAIT, PERMIT (for 5 different fish), TACKLE.
Basically you need to collect the matching permits and bait for a certain type of fish.

When you are ready with your cards, you go fishing around the lake (is a big board, colorful). Some fish can only be cast on certain parts of the lake while others can be cast from any edge of the lake.
Casting involves:
a)to role the fishing rod, this is type of dice similar to a pencil with the names of the different fish. If the right fish is baiting, then b)
b)striking, rolling a normal die. If you are successful then
c) weigh-in, rolling the die again not to get a 6!

if you successfully complete a, b and c, the fish is yours.. ..but watch out for the opportunity cards of your opponents, they could steal one of your fish!!!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wacky Wizard Game
description:
Wacky Wizard is a game in which players assume the roles of unfortunate victims of a looney wizard. Changed into one of six types of animals (bats, spiders, snakes, etc), the players must gather the ingredients necessary to break the spell over them.

Taking turns to play, players move their pieces on the board based on the flicking of a spinner. Ingredient discs are placed at the edges of the board and a player's piece must land exactly on the spaces to collect the items. To break the spell over them, the creatures need to collect two different ingredients with their own symbols (e.g. a Turtle would require an Eye of Newt and a Fingernail of Newt). If the spinner lands on the Wacky Wizard symbol, the player draws a Wizard Spell Card, which will turn his or her playing piece into another creature (and thereby changing his or her winning conditions).

The first player to break the enchantment over his or her piece wins and ends the game.
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Wine Game
description: The Wine Game is a trip through the famous wine producing countries of the world - France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and the U.s. With a role of the dice and some entrepreneurial skill, you can own vineyards in California, a wine estate in Italy or most of the great wines in France. The Wine Game has the thrills, excitement and speculation of the real wine world. It involves buying and selling great vineyards, bidding in rare wine auctions and risking your fortune on a chance to become the wine baron of the world. The Wine Game is fun to play. But it isn't just a game - it's an education!

name: The Champions of Soccer
description:
From the Box:

'The Champions of Soccer - Based on league football, this exciting new family game for 2 to 6 players Ages 8 and up invites you to build and manage your very own football team. An absolute must for all football enthusiasts.

name: Wordmania
description: From the box: Wordmania - you have just joined the frenzy of Wordmania, the thrilling new crossword puzzle game. You race against time trying to place words on the crossword play board. Letters are facing in all directions as the seconds run out. You challenge another player to guess the word you have hidden. But beware - your challenge could turn against you!

name: Tucson in a box
description:
Are you looking for a fun way to play Tucson? VOILA! Behold, here it is!

As a take off on Monopoly, the game is full of cacti, shootouts, rodeo's, roadrunners, and scorpions. So choose your token and roll the dice. Who knows? You may become the proud owner of Saguaro National Park or pass the Roadrunner and end up in Tombstone! Buy property, build a skyline, trade the skyline for a key to the city. It sounds easy enough - but add a traffice jam, property taxes, car fines, and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
categories: City Building, Dice, Economic, Math, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The Time Tunnel Game
description:
The Time Tunnel Game is based upon the television show of the same name.

Players spin a spinner to move their pieces through four time periods: Prehistoric, Medieval, Present, and Future. Cards drawn by landing on an hourglass space may be used for additional movement or an extra turn.

The first player to complete voyages through all four time periods wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Endurance: The Fitness Game
description:
Endurance - The Fitness Game is designed to combine the fun of a board game with physical fitness and good nutritional information.

Players roll a die, move around a track and perform fitness execises for points to rid themselves of a pre-dealt set of cards. The first person to get rid of all of his cards is the winner.

During the game cards may be gained or lost depending on certain players actions. Coloured cards must be matched to the gray fitness cards before an exercise can be performed and the card discarded.

Endurance - The Fitness Game is a fun and interesting way to stay healthy.

name: Kipp
description:
The game "board" is a set of six small hexagonal prisms mounted on a spindle so they can rotate. Each face has an indentation that holds a small plastic sphere - on your turn you rotate a hexagon and then place a sphere in an indentation on a matching face (the spheres and faces are in six colors).

The object is to get rid of all your spheres - of course, when a hexagon is rotated too far, the spheres fall out.

Although boxes exist that give the title as "Kugel-Kipp" and "Kugel-Kipp-Spiel," based on KD-Spiele advertising the final name was simply Kipp.

name: Aura Battler Dunbine: Byston Well
description:
Complexity rating 5 on Tsukuda's 1-6 scale (1=easiest).

Not an expansion to any other Aura Battler game, this game is completely stand-alone.

2 player strategic wargame. 3-fold out mounted maps combine to make one big map.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Havic: The Bothering
description:
A direct parody/rip-off of Magic: The Gathering. Fairly rare to find a package that isn't opened.

From the Rules Card:

Welcome to Havic! You are a student battling others in a strange, mysterious world. You and your opponent each have 21 points of sanity. Once a player's sanity has been reduced to zero, he loses.

To reduce your opponent's sanity, you will need to recruit peons, create effects, and use articles in any way possible to destroy your opponent before he destroys you. Your deck is your weapon against your worthy foe. It must contain exactly sixty cards.

After thoroughly shuffling your deck, each player draws eight cards from the top of the deck. A die is rolled. The player who rolls the highest number goes first.

When it is your turn, a player first drops a property card. When whacked, or turned sideways, this card, if this card is a brewery yields one unit of alcohol: a convenience store yields one unit of cigarettes. You can now use this unit to recruit peons, create effects, and articles as you see fit.

Each Peon, article, and effect has a creation cost. It is denoted on the top right hand corner of the card. For each beer bottle, or cigarette shown on a card, one and of the same type must be whacked.

In the case of peons, the first number in the bottom right hand corner denotes the amount of damage this peon can do to your opponent, or other peons. The second number denotes the amount of damage that it will take to send this peon to the hospital.

When a peon first comes into play, he is hung over and can't attack, but he can block if he is not whacked. Your peons can attack only on your turn, and only if it is not hung over or whacked. To attack, you must first announce the attack phase, and then whack the peons that are attacking. The opponent then decides which of your peons his peons will block, or he can opt to take the damage himself, reducing his sanity (though only a peon with stealth can block another peon with stealth).

Unlike a peon, once an effect is cast, it goes directly to the hospital. An article also does not work during the turn it comes into play. and like a peon, it must be whacked to have it's effect. Once you are done attacking, it is your opponent's turn. At the beginning of your next turn, all whacked cards, unless otherwise specified, become unwhacked. Good luck!


DO NOT HAVE EACH PLAYER:


construct "their own library of a predetermined number of game components by examining and selecting [the] game components from [a] reservoir of game components" or you may infringe on U.S. Patent No. 5,662,332 to Garfield.

name: Escalation
description:
From the box: "Escalation is a game of war. Begin the game by positioning your forces consisting of battle pieces and mobile missile launchers within your Home Country. Then maneuver them to areas throughout the world as permitted by the dice roll in order to attack an opponent.

During the game you can use airbases and ports to achieve a rapid and strategic deployment of forces. Build and strengthen your forces by capturing countries, liberating POW camps, using the "Draft" and reaping the military benefits from Reinforcement cards and Mobile Missile Launcher cards."

Although the game appears to be self-published, the packaging and components are first rate, featuring a mounted board, coated cards, and plastic pieces.

name: Tiddlycroquet
description:
Tiddlycroquet is played to rules similar to outdoor croquet. The only changes are to allow you to use counters rather than balls.

The object of Tiddlycroquet is to be the first to get your small counters through all the hoops in the correct order and direction and then hit them onto the peg.

The hoops are set out on a table or other hard surface in a set pattern (or create your own).

Two to four people can play, or with 2 or 4, play with all counters or as partners, choosing which of the two counters to flick on your side's turn.

When your counter hits any other counter, called a 'roquet', you place your counter on top of the counter it hit, and flick the two together, called 'taking croquet'. You then flick your counter once more. If you flick either counter off the table your turn ends.

If you flick your counter through a hoop, you get another turn--and more chances to 'roquet' the other counters.

name: Käp'tän Buddel
description:
Käp'tän Buddel features a 6x6 grid of large dice, which represent a treasure-filled island. Players use the rolls of regular dice to place pirates on the island, move them around, and dig (by turning the island dice to higher numbers). Digging far enough gets you treasure chips and the object is to be the first to get chips valued at 15 gold.

There is a "tactical" variant in which players get action points to spend each turn instead of rolling dice.

The game was originally published in 1989 under the slightly different title of Käp'ten Buddel (in a limited edition of 100 copies), and then re-released in 1992 in Abacus' white-box series. In the later version the treasure chips are pulled from a bag, in the earlier version they are picked up with a magnet on a stick (the chip colors are also a bit different).

name: Cutlass of Fire
description:
Seven jewels have been stolen from the eyes of seven skulls [they must have been cyclops skulls, eh? - though I suppose it's easier than having three and a half skulls lying around...]. You have been given the challenge of returning them.

Points are scored by delivering gems and by defeating monsters. Your character assigns points between Sword, Mace and Axe talents but also Earth, Water and Fire spells (no Air?!). The dungeon is made up from the face-down hexagonal tiles at the outset. When explored, you get to orient the hex tile.

A tile may have nothing, a chest, a monster or a skull on it. Combat with monsters is a simple dicing affair. The chest rules are unclear; it seems they're used to store stuff (since your hand of cards is normally limited to three).

Really crude components that you must assemble yourself.
mechanics: Role Playing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Penumbra
description: Abstract racing game where each player attempts to be the first to move five Scorers to the top of the pyramid of the Sun. A player uses three Eclipsers and two Captors to hinder the opponent.

name: Deluxe Fighter Pilot
description:
"These rules are designed to give the players the feel of air-to-air combat in the early years of World War II. All the basic maneuvers used in fighter combat are included, and such variables as pilot experience and aircraft maneuverability and firepower are also taken into account . . . An ideal game would begin with 6 to 8 players."

Fighter Pilot was a set of World War II air combat rules for miniatures originally published by The Little Soldier in 1976. This "Deluxe" set converted the rules to a boardgame format and added some additional rules. Each hex is 100 feet across and each turn is approximately 1 second. Counters represent individual aircraft. The game includes 25 American, British, German, and Japanese fighters.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Magnetic Poetry The Game for Kids
description:
Be the first player to make it from the vegetable crisper to the freezer by win four poem-writing rounds.

One player is the judge, who spins a spinner to select the poem category (gross, sad, mad, pretty, silly, happy, gross) The remaining players write poems, based on a subject selected from their hand of subject cards, and using magnetic word tiles selected from the word board arrange them on their play board to form their poem befitting the category and subject. At the end of the three minute timer period, the judge selects the poem that is the best match of subject and category and declares the round winner, whose playing piece moves up one space towards the freezer on the score track. The judgeship passes to the left and play continues until one player wins their fourth poem round.
categories: Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Elmer Wheeler's The Fat Boy's Game
description:
Players are given a CALORIE CARD at the start of the game and then travel a course beginning at BREAKFAST, through to LUNCHEON and ending at DINNER TIME.

Along the way, players are tempted with Mid-morning and Afternoon Snacks.

Collecting calories all through the day...

WINNER is the player whose score most closely matches the number of calories shown on his CALORIE CARD.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Changing Seasons
description:
A game of fast action and hilarious fun. Players race to complete their puzzle first. Face the challenge! All pieces are mixed and divided evenly. Players strategically trade for the pieces they need as they assemble their puzzles behind a partition.

A great game for all seasons!


Game Summary
- Use 1 puzzle and matching photo per player, returning the unused one(s) to the box.
- Take apart all puzzles, shuffle the pieces, and divide evenly amongst players
- Shuffle the photos and deal randomly to each player, who will mount it on the inside of their screen.
- Players play simultaneously, trying to assemble their puzzle.
- Exchanges
... At any time, a player may select a set of 1-3 pieces and offer to trade them; must exchange those pieces with the first player to accept the offer (trade for an equal number of pieces)
... Up to 3 times/game, a player may force everyone to trade 1-3 pieces to left/right/across (no 'across' in a 3er, of course!)
... The 'Advanced' Rule: once each (I think), players may force a shuffling and redistribution of the puzzle photos! I must admit that we didn't try this -- it just seems ridiculously chaotic and random.
- The first player to complete their puzzle wins!
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Deflect 5
description:
Free your five discs from the frame to win...

The game consists of a plastic frame and some discs - a sort of cross between Connect 4 and Downfall. Slide sections of the frame left or right to make the discs drop down a level.

name: Trucks, Trains, Boats and Planes game
description: A pursuit type game similar to Candyland for little boys produced in 1963. Game was released with 3 other children's games by the publisher in the hopes of volumes of sales and profit in the children's game market in an eleventh hour effort to stave off bankruptcy. The 4 games released were not good sellers and in late 1963 the company went bankrupt, only to reappear in 1964 under new management and the company prospered in the market. Game uses a wooden die with faces of six different colors, a roll of the die shows the color space that the moving player advances to. Some spaces call for a return to the beginning or a move backward. The first player to the end of the track wins. The board is marked with the themes of transportation by, well, trucks, trains, boats and planes! The youngest player moves first, and the game can be played solitaire where the player tries to move the length of the track within an alloted number of rolls of the die. Game stock number was 101 and original 1963 price was $.98 A similar pursuit game for little girls was called The Doll House game, and the two other 1963 children's titles were Imagination and What Time Is It?

name: Blitz
description:
The gameboard is a map of the Eastern Hemisphere with the land masses divided into forty-eight territories. Each player will place units on the gameboard until the gameboard is filled. Each player then chooses one territory claimed as headquarters.

On a turn, a player may either fortify established territories or attack an opponent. In an attack both players roll a die and the player who rolls the lower number must remove a number of units which is the difference between the two dice.

The object is to eliminate all the opponents by taking over their headquarters.

name: EXO-Squad Game
description:
Based on the popular Cartoon Series, game components consist of the following: 15-by-15 inches Mounted Colorful Map Board; RULES sheet folded in half; a Set of Color Markers; 4-Mover Stands; 4-DICE-(2-Mover, 2-Battle); 2-Colorful "Shields"; a Set of Stickers to apply to the DICE and Mover Stands; a Set of EXO-Squad Character Cards.
After assembling the necessary components, the youngest player will begin by selecting a Color and Set of matching Chips, then Roll a Mover DIE and proceed clockwise around the board. Where you land will determine your action for your turn. During play you could land on a space that allows you to do one of the following: RECRUIT; EXCHANGE Cards; TAKE a Card from either a Player or the deck; ROLL AGAIN; or BATTLE on either VENUS, EARTH, or MARS. The object is to collect 1 of each different EXO-Squad members Cards, have a CHIP on each Planet, and defeat PHAETON in a final Battle. Very nice production value for devotees of the genre.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tri-Zany Magnetic Marble Game
description: Each player tries to place a Magnetic Marble on top of one of the tees without disturbing another . . . and the Magnetic Marbles make this a mesmerizing manual challenge! Players combine their strategic skills and memory with a little bit of luck to keep all of the Magnetic Marbles on the game board each turn. The winner is the first to form a straight line or a triangle with 3 Magnetic Marbles of his color. Includes triangular game board and 6 Magnetic Marbles.

name: Route 66: Explorer Abenteuer Spiel
description:
Merchandise game from Ford Germany.

3-6 players travel along the famous route 66 from Illinois to California. On their way they have to decide whether they travel alone or in a group - both has some advantages - and discover the beauties of the nature during their trip.

name: The Official New York World's Fair Panorama Game 1964-1965
description:
This contains 64 cards (58 Exhibit cards and 6 Unisphere cards). 4 Cards of punch out color disks one color for each player. Several unused score cards, and a large fold out game sheet with 9 full color scenes of the fair 1964-1965.

Players play exhibit cards (Federal and State, International, Transportation and Travel, Industrial, Religious, and Lake Area) placing their colored token on the area with the matching number on the exhibit card. "Unisphere" cards can be used for any area. If an opponent's token occupies an area, it is replaced by the new token and the opponent's token is returned. Players score points for having an unbroken line of at least 3 tokens. The game is won in one of two ways: by being the first to reach 50 points or if a player manages to have his tokens on all 8 areas at the same time.

name: Get Ready for Shabbos
description:
From the box: "A challenging game for children, and a bingo game for adults." The rest of the rules are in Hebrew.

It appears that there are cards illustrating Jewish values, objects, and practices. It looks like these cards have to be matched up in some way.

name: The Gumby Game
description: Help Gumby, Pokey, Prickle and Goo find their Groobee friends. Collect the most Groobee cards as you race to the finish space.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bathtub Love
description:
Bathtub Love: a bathtub / hot tub game for lovers

Rub-a-dub-dub, make love in the tub! From the package:

"Bathtub Love is an erotic foreplay game that allows lovers to explore the sensuality of sharing a nice warm tub. Each bubble [plastic capsules like those from vending machines] is filled with four actions that vary from playful to naughty. Place the bubbles into the tub; then pick up one of the bubbles. Randomly select a romantic action from the bubble and perform it on your lover. After performing the action, set it aside, re-seal the bubble, and return the bubble to the tub. Your lover then takes the next turn and play continues until all entries are carried out or until foreplay has turned into something more. Both players win by sharing a fun and romantic time together."

Note: the listed thematic and mechanical attributes should be interpreted loosely.

name: Hospital Hilarity
description: The object of the game is to accumulate educational health tips while attempting to be the first player to get your patient safely home first. It is an educational way of learning about your health while having some fun along the way. The game board displays a humorous side of hospital life and the questions are unique and informative
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Free Willy Game
description:
Rockland Stone is using his high-tech vessel to try to capture Willy and his friends. Can they reach the open sea before his sonar detects them? Play and find out.
Be the first player to reach the Finish space.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Diamond Head Game
description:
Based on the short-lived 1975 game show taped on location in Hawaii. The last contestant remaining moved to the Money Volcano. This was a wind tunnel in which the contestant had 15 seconds to grab as many paper slips as possible and place them in a pouch placed around their waist. Paper slips represented prizes, cash or $1 bills. When time expired, the host pulled out up to 10 paper slips from the pouch. There was a significant "push your luck" element as the player could stop at any time, but lost everything if the host drew a $1 bill.

The game is played in three rounds. The player who wins each round gets the greatest reward and the reward for finishing decreases the further behind a player finishes.

Round one: Players answer multiple choice trivia questions to advance on the gameboard. The person who gives the correct response acts as quizmaster for the following question.

Round two: After hearing a list of items of a given category, the players must recall item from the list. Players alternate taking turns until one fails to call out a yet unnamed item. The other players advance when one fails to respond.

Round three: Players get the prize discs earned in the previous rounds. The player who earned the most in cash and prizes is the winner.

name: German Chatter
description:
Players compete to collect word tiles to complete a phrase in German. Chatter has two aims: first to produce a winner (the player who collects the most word-tiles) and second, to allow the players to understand and remember foreign words and phrases.

The contents of this game are: 40 illustrated phrase-cards, 4 sets of color coded word tiles, 6 phrase cards and word tile holders, 1 game bag, 1 translation master key and 1 set of rules.

name: Spider Attack
description:
Players try to maneuver their flies along the spider web to safety; but from time to time, the spider will descend, plucking some of the flies into his arms. Then it takes a special dice roll to rescue your flies and begin again.

Source: Phil Vettel, Chicago Tribune

From the box:
As you race to get off the web, this spider hangs by a thread, swaying back and forth over you. Then slowly but surely, with one little jiggle, it starts to inch down, then another little jiggle, lower and lower, then another jiggle, closer and closer to the web, until Swoosh. It pounces and snatches up any little flies underfoot. The only way to safety is to get all your flies off the web, before it strikes again.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gone With the Wind
description:
Gone with the Wind the Game consists of eight separate board, card and trivia games: Gone with the Wind trivia game, Atlanta, Carpetbagger, Frankly My Dear, Pay or Play, Rhett, Scarlett and Tara.

This particular game is a trivia board-game with a small twist. In addition to drawing cards and answering questions in your quest to win, this game includes two complete decks of playing cards. These form the 104 question cards, but can be used as regular playing cards as well. Instead of spades, hearts, clubs and diamonds, we have Scarletts, Rhetts, Mammies and Ashleys. There appears to be no correlation between the picture on the card, the subject matter of the questions, or the suit, but I'm sure I'm just not looking hard enough. The pictures are repeated on some cards, and not with regularity, so there must be something going on. Playing card collectors will like these decks.
In addition to the game itself, there are also rules for playing other games with only the cards, including variations on rummy and go fish, as well as other games that make use of the trivia questions.

The two large decks of question cards can also be used as regular playing cards. Standard suits have been replaced by Scarletts, Rhetts, Mammies and Ashleys. The art depicted on the cards is independent from questions. The rules for card games include variations on Rummy and Go Fish.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: French Chatter
description:
Players compete to collect word tiles to complete a phrase in French. Chatter has two aims: first to produce a winner (the player who collects the most word-tiles) and second, to allow the players to understand and remember foreign words and phrases.

The contents of this game are: 40 illustrated phrase-cards, 4 sets of colour coded word tiles, 6 phrase cards and word tile holders, 1 game bag, 1 translation master key and 1 set of rules.

Intellect released four "Chatter" games - Italian, Spanish, German & French.

name: Spanish Chatter
description:
Players compete to collect word tiles to complete a phrase in Spanish. Chatter has two aims: first to produce a winner (the player who collects the most word-tiles) and second, to allow the players to understand and remember foreign words and phrases.

The contents of this game are: 40 illustrated phrase-cards, 4 sets of color coded word tiles, 6 phrase cards and word tile holders, 1 game bag, 1 translation master key and 1 set of rules.

Intellect released four "Chatter" games - Italian, Spanish, German & French.

name: Play and Defend Bridge
description: Pre-determined Hands are quickly dealt out to the four players. Each hand is given a Goren Bidding and Response Aid which indicates the Dealer and Vulnerability for each hand. These Aids can also be used by the less experienced player as guides in Bidding and Responding. The hands are bid in the normal way. Then bidding can be compared to Goren’s suggested bids as indicated on the back of each player’s aid. The hands are then played according to Goren’s Contract. The cards are kept separated in designated spaces on the Game Sheet so they can be re-played and compared to Goren’s Analysis. Score can be kept to show each partnership’s efforts against the suggested Contract.

name: Sexual Trivia Strikes Again
description: The object of the game is to be the first player to score 100 orgasms (points) by moving around the board and answering questions correctly.
mechanics: Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Secret Telegram
description: Secret Telegram is competitive cryptograms. Each player sets up a cryptographic alphabet using supplied symbols, writes a "telegram" of agreed-upon length in the symbols, and gives it to the other player. In turn players can then either guess what individual symbols mean or make Mastermind-mind style guesses by providing test words of the same lengths as the telegram words and being told how many letters match.

name: F*ck This! (Sex, Drugs and Rock & Roll)
description:
First supplement for the F*ck This! card game. Twenty-nine cards with a common theme of sex, drugs and rock & roll. May be added to main game or used to substitute for existing cards. Download also includes the free 10 card supplement, Expansion #0.

Expansion #1 of F*ck This!.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Word Game

name: Dark Portals
description:
A card-based story-telling game set in a haunted house. Cards define characters, general situations and challenges the player faces while exploring the “Weird Family Mansion”.
Creating the story is the important part and everybody wins. www.io.com/~hamster

name: Times Table Snap
description: Time's Table Snap uses a unique deck of cards to teach children multiplication concepts through games of pairs and snaps. Great for children practicing their multiplication tables. Ages 6 and up

name: Yesteryear: The Nostalgia Trivia Game
description: A trivia game for all those who enjoy waxing nostalgic. Question categories include radio, tv, movies, sports, and misc. Players may also create their own customized categories and questions for their friends and family.

name: The Anniversary Game
description: Players divide into 2-4 teams, then make their way around a gameboard while answering trivia questions, drawing (in the air) objects, whistling tunes, and "profiling" questions.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company
